entries.title: A Minute in the Park
entries.description:
You have 1 minute in the park.
There are beautiful geese flying by.
For some reason you are carrying a shotgun.
What happens next is up to you!

entries.title: Build-a-Bandit
entries.description:
Adjust your villainous mustache, eyes and hat to defeat the sheriff in a shoot-out!

12/31/12 - Thanks for all the feedback, everyone!
I added the source file, made in Python with Pygame. It's messy, but feel free to take a look. Run it from the command line by typing "python main.py" if you're able to run python files.

I wrote a post-mortem here:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/30/build-a-bandit-post-mortem/

The money is just for high-score purposes, which get totalled up at the end of the game. Can you beat my highscore of $34270?

TIP: Each stereotypical villain attribute will affect your prowess in battle in some way. One extreme will rob you of the benefits of the other side of the scale, so depending on your opponent, balanced physical features might be better than comical extremes. Try different hat sizes to see the most obvious effect. For example, my favourite bandit has a very short hat, a very thick mustache, and moderately squinty eyes, but that's not very appropriate for the Sheriff of Goatsville, Speedy Jim. What combination would work better?

entries.title: Citizen Shame
entries.description:
Warning: This game is not finished.

Citizen Shame is about a guy who hates people, so he went to a shopping mall and decided to eat everyone. 

This game is endless.

Use the arrow keys to move.

entries.title: Cruel World Of Business
entries.description:
Those kids are stealing all of your customers... Show them who's really in charge of the lemonade business and how cruel life can be sometimes when you are dealing with a villain.

This is the first time we entered Ludum Dare. This is not a big game. We all managed to complete it in 2-3 tries.

You can control the character with keyboard arrows. You need to jump on a kid to get rid of him. To go to the next level, you need to get rid of all the kids and their lemonade stands.
Pressing down while jumping will get rid of more than one kid. You can dodge kid's attack by jumping on solid objects.

Have fun!

entries.title: Dark World
entries.description:
My game is a twist on the classic platforming formula from the enemies perspective.  Basically I tried to create a crude copy of super mario bros where the player is forced into being the villain.

I also wanted to experiment with mixing normal mapping and shadows with pixel art.  The platforming mechanics themselves are pretty rough but that isn't really the point.  Also it will automatically save at points along the way and its a pretty short level though there are a few difficulty peaks.  

Use WASD to control your character.  Mouse aims the light.  After you get the hat you can shoot by pressing left mouse.  You can toggle fullscreen with alt-enter.  XBox 360 controllers and snes style gamepads are also supported.

If you want to play around a little with the engine you can bring up the debug console with ~ or toggle edit mode with F4.

Textures made using GIMP.
Sound effects were are all done with SFXR.
Music was generated with wolfram tones and tweaked a bit.

I put up a link to a enhanced post-compo version with some bug fixes, visual tweaks, and overall improved gameplay for those who aren't judging or if you are struggling with some gameplay issues in the 48 hour version.

If you get a missing DLL message try updating DirectX.

entries.title: Erfos
entries.description:
ERFOS - Evil Robots From Outer Space

entries.title: Extinct : Humankind fade in the mist
entries.description:
This is my little puzzle game I hope you will like it :)

GOAL :
You have to drag and drop traps on the road of the human tribe so they can never reach the meat.
Humans always find the best solution to reach meat, so you have to find a way to build an unbeatable puzzle.

HUMANS TRICKS:
- Masked warrior can take 3 damage before dying
- Fire holder can use his fire to scare animals or to solve some traps
- Masked warrior sometime hold a spear. It can be used to solve trap or against animals to have a first strike. With fire, spear deal twice more damages.

HINT :
If you are stuck at first level, here's an HINT for you : The god statue must be placed a the first position...

entries.title: Fight the Power
entries.description:
Story:
In the near future, technology has soared far beyond what we in the 21st century expected. Leading the charge, the world wide web has grown even more expansive, encompassing almost all fields in the future era and becoming the centerpiece for development. In the process, Piracy has advanced and created an arms race between publishers and hackers as each strive to one up in the other in an effort to further their agendas. This is but one small struggle between the two, as a common pirate fights the security system for access to free goods, ask yourself, who is the hero here? A woman who enjoys the tears and labors of another without just compensation, or the greedy publisher who seeks to bleed the customers dry with draconic, inane systems within the market?

Game:
This game is a shoot 'em up that changes based on the music you load in. Included is one song but try it out with any mp3, ogg, etc that you have on your computer. Dodge the bullets for the entire song and win. Key to note is that the hitbox, as in most shoot 'em ups, is much smaller than the character sprite. It only takes up the small red circle on the center of her body.

Controls:
Mouse- Movement
LMB- Select

entries.title: IWKTP
entries.description:
This game is about you, the typical villain, trying to face the entier hero-world and keeping your princesses away from 'em.

Use arrows to move and clic to shoot, beware of the recoil or you'll maybe get out of the screen.

Beeing the villain for me means beeing alone facing the entier society, trying to keep what you get away from them, protecting it. The villain never wins, a survival where you have to stupidly shoot at everything was, for me, the best choice. Even if this game and way to use the theme is a bit classic, i hope you'll enjoy it.

Music is a bit of a surprise but i have to say the credits goes to Wagner ( yeah i know, its a spoiler 3:)



advice for any player that (i'd be happy) would like to play the game more :
I was unable to make the score feedbacks so here's how it works :
get 1 princess you'll get x2
get 2 princesses you'll have x5 and enter fever mode
if you continue on fever mode, the number of heros (ennemies) will greatly increase.
and this until you get hit and get your score multiplicator back to 1

entries.title: Kingpin
entries.description:
*Note: The download looks a lot nicer, and if you're lagging somehow you can lower the settings through that.

Oh boy! So much more I wanted to do... I may consider working on it later!

Description:
Go from Meth peddler to kingpin, all while avoiding the police and DEA in this top-down simulation game.

Controls:
Click to select (and center on) a tile. Use WASD to rotate camera if you wish. (Up and down are sticky for some reason).

Hints:
Meth Labs can only be placed in empty tiles, and they are your main supply of meth, which you sell to the neighborhood tiles and the city(cube) tiles. 

The more drug dealers you have on a tile, the more meth you can sell to the people in that tile, and the more suspicious the police will get.

Enforcers can be sent to clean up evidence and suspicion, and have a lower chance of being arrested by the police.

Let me know if you enjoy it, and if there's anything you wish I did differently!

entries.title: Prison Escape
entries.description:
Official Walkthrough: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WnmgcEGvRfM

Story:
You have been found guilty of destroying an entire planet.  They have locked you in a maximum 
security prison deep in space.  The day before your scheduled execution, you receive a cake
from an unknown "friend".  As you mutter that the cake really isn't a lie, you bite into something
and drop the cake.

A red key card falls out of the cake and you realize this is the key to your door.  If you
are ever going to survive, you must escape now.  However, the high tech security system detects
the key and goes into lock down.  The artificial gravity is immediately disabled and you now 
have 60 seconds before all of the air is pumped from each floor.  You must descend the tower 
and reach the exit!


Controls:
-In Menu
  - UP/DOWN to move the selection up and down
  - ENTER to select an option
-In Game
 - SPACE to grab a wall
 - Release SPACE to push off toward the mouse cursor
 - Once you have the jetpack, the left mouse button is thrust
 - ESCAPE to pause the game.


Tips:
 - Use the SPACE bar a lot to grab walls and control your flight.
 - Be sure to aim straight down hallways and thrust constantly to gain lots of speed.
 - You can bounce off the back wall and thrust the opposite direction to turn around quickly.


Requirements:
 - Windows Only
 - Requires XNA 4.0 available at: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914
 - Resolution of 800x600 or higher


Engines Used:
 - Farseer Physics

entries.title: PrisonBreak
entries.description:
EDIT:  For those of you stuck on level two, there are two doors on level one.  Make sure to try both!  *hint hint*

PrisonBreak is a game my sister, Lola Wegman, and I (Atlas Wegman) created for the LD25 Jam.  After shuffling through a few ideas we stumbled upon this one, a prison break.  You are criminal who opens his cell door, and must escape prison.  If caught by the guards you are sent straight back to your cell.  There are no checkpoints, there is no saving.  This game is the real deal...sort of.  

Gameplay is relatively intuitive.  Arrow keys to move, mouse to look around.  Your goal is to dodge all guards and make it to the green doorway.  Some levels have to doors, be carful which one you chose.  Guards have a sort of "sixth sense" and can sense you even when you are not directly in their line of sight.  Be careful, and good luck!

My sister and I worked nonstop to put out this game, complete with audio, multiple levels, and a couple tiers of gameplay elements.  As such, the file size is not small (~15mb).  If you are playing on a web browser, please be patient.  It's worth it!

I hope you enjoy PrisonBreak, I think it came out better then expected :)

entries.title: Project Sproing - Bytt Strikes Back!
entries.description:
Welp, this is what happens when I make an unofficial sequel to a game I haven't started, but oh well...

Also, yay, my first Ludum Dare!

Alright, you move with the arrow keys, spawn enemies with the space bar, and cycle though enemies with z and x (sadly, there are only two enemies due to time constraints...). When the timer runs out, Sproing will come out and proceed through the level, so make sure you have all your enemies set up! If you get done before time runs out, then hit the enter key (hit it twice to skip the level scrolling back to the start). This currently features 2 full stages and a third shorter stage (its supposed to be a bonus level).

Hope you enjoy! (Cause if you do, I'm totally adding voice clips and extra levels and submitting to the jam...)

EDIT: (I know I should have done this earlier but...) If you liked this game be sure to check out my [url="http://www.facebook.com/pages/Gravity-Games-Interactive/316874718339304"]Facebook[/url], [url="https://twitter.com/Gravity_Games"]Twitter[/url], and [url="https://plus.google.com/101806403236029728997/posts"Google+[/url]! It helps me out a lot and I try to post updates on my projects at least semi-regularly!

entries.title: Save the princess
entries.description:
The evil king kidnapped the princess!
You, as a great knight, must save her!
...
Or must you?
Do you know what drove the evil king to kidnapp her?
Perhaps this story isn't as simple as it seems...

There are 6 possibles endings, depending on your actions (they are very simple, though....)

Sorry, didn't have time for sounds/music... >_<

Instructions on the game...
Anyway:
Move with the arrow keys.
Attack with X and C.
Switch weapons clicking on it's icon.

If you aren't sure how to get all the endings, perhaps the "useless" staff has some use, afterall...

In fact, you are not even player of the game (corrolary: you are not the one that inserts a coin to continue). You are there to amuse the player and the player is amused when he wins.

entries.title: Villain

entries.title: You are the Hero

entries.title: Crobal and friends
entries.description:
Crobal and friends is a story about a friendly monster who wants to play with people from the village. Unfortunately his big feet and slow mind get in the way of his friend-making, and the villagers often think he's just being a bully.

----

Due to some unforeseen issues, I'm having trouble getting the applet to work. In the mean time you can download the all systems pack and run the game from there.

Bugfixes for these issues are incoming.

---

Windows and Mac users, can you please tell me in the comments below if you can get the game running or not?

A Mac user reported having problems running the .app and some Linux and Windows user reported bugs with their respective executables and even the .jar files.
I don't know what's causing this issue, it's my first time deploying a Java application, and I'm not sure what I can do to fix this, especially since I don't have a faulty machine to test on.
if anyone has some bright ideas, I'm all ears!

---

Post-compo bugfixes:
- Fixed an issue where the game would end prematurely

entries.title: Evil Autorunner
entries.description:
My original idea (Random Battle Manager 2013) turned out to be wayyy to big a project, so I whipped this up in the past 5 hours.

As such, it's buggy if you spam the space bar. 
There's not really any goal either, but it's something I made and something I want to build upon, so it's not all bad.

Plus I still have Random Battle Manager to work on in my spare time!

entries.title: Evil Engineering
entries.description:
Evil Engineering is my entry for Ludum Dare 25. It's a four player game, where the goal is to build the best Doominator(tm) and be the one to destroy the world. You take turns to collect resources or to use resources. Create clones to get more turns.

Sadly, the game is not finished - I ran out of time, so no end condition is ever reached. The game is supposed to finish at round 40, at which point scores would be calculated.

entries.title: EXTREME BURGLARY
entries.description:
A stealth based game where you have to steal from various places and avoid the cops!

Controls: WASD to move, QE to rotate the camera

You can also right click and drag the mouse left/right to rotate the camera, but it's a bit buggy. It works best if you just hold down the right click and never release

Goal: Find the buildings with yellow circles, stand in the circle to rob the place. Rob the required amount of places and then run back to the start. Avoid the cops!


Created using Unity Pro (Thanks for the extended trial!)
Total time spent: Around 15 hours.
Music created with http://www.inudge.net/
SFX/Music edited with Audacity

entries.title: Fire Simulator Returns: 2012 HD
entries.description:
Play as a weather system spreading fire into the world!
-Blowing at clouds pushes them, makes them smaller, and can even destroy them! Sometimes they even drop goodies!
-You can't make fire jump over streets right away, even if you use your full first bar of power. But try picking up a powerup halfway through your blow...
-There's no 'win condition,' play for high score!
-Make sure you're tapping LMB to fan smaller flames, especially in the beginning - but save up all your points to unleash at once if you're trying to get the sparks to spread.
-Don't click randomly, plan out using the dropped powerups to spread your fire the maximum amount.
-Don't underestimate the power of killing clouds early.
-The grass is fireproof.
-Stay near the edge of the firestorm in order to spread it, otherwise you're just blowing sparks around.
-ESC brings you back to the main menu.

So, this is not just my first Ludum Dare game, but my first game ever. I started teaching myself a few months ago, and this is the first time I've created a fairly complete project - so this is a HUGE milestone for me! Thanks for playing and I hope you enjoy!

entries.title: Gnomer
entries.description:
NOTE: press F1 at any point to bring up the controls and information screen.  A and D to move sideways, W to jump, S to use a door once you've collected the level's key, H to bring up any hints available, and the left mouse button to fire and retract your grappling hook.  If you get "stuck" in the floor and are unable to jump, you should be able to free yourself with the grappling hook.

You are Gnomer, a car-key gnome in training.  Tired of being called lazy and unambitious, you have set out to learn the trade of your people-- hiding the car keys of humans to irritate them.  Armed with only a Grappling Hook 3000, you must traverse the treacherous pathways your civilization has built to find those keys!

entries.title: Grim's Christmas List
entries.description:
My Wife, Octopi, and I worked as a team - Arcade Badgers!
With Octopi taking over Art and Design duties, and myself dealing with Audio and Programming.

We present to you Grim's Christmas List, where you control the Grim Reaper, as he is a bit miffed that he's been crossed off Santa's list for so long that he decides to do something about it.

Unfortunately for Grim, every action has a consequence as he is about to discover.

Controls are: left/right arrow keys, X to jump, and C to use the Scythe.
Collect the presents, smack the enemies, and get through 14 levels of madness!
You'll pass each level once you collect all the presents - though be warned that some of the bigger enemies release more presents to collect!

We hope you enjoy it :)

-- update 5th January --
Just in case you're stuck, there is a level skip by pressing "T"
I've also redirected the link from Dropbox to stuckieGAMEZ where it'll have a more permanent home.
The Source is now pointing towards Github as well.

entries.title: Monologuer
entries.description:
SUPER-USEFUL HINT: Move your villain to the phone on the left wall to convert Infamy into money!

Maximise your monologuing time before Green Man's rescuers shut down your operation! Multi-task between talking at your victim, and activating your array of spike traps to defend your lair. Just remember: only monologuing increases your score!

Controls:
Mouse - click the phone, Green Man and the control panel to move your villain to them. When at the control panel, click on ceilings to place traps; click traps to activate them.
M - turn off music loop (recommended for extended play)
S - turn off sound effects
P - pause
R - restart once game has been lost

Tips:
- Once you've scored some kills, you'll have some Infamy (shown in the Infamy bar in the left of the villain's chamber); click the phone (below the Infamy bar) to move the villain to it; while he's there, he'll make phonecalls to trade Infamy for $$$.
- Spread your traps all around your lair; that way, you can thin out lots of enemies every time you use the control panel.
- Don't panic if you let a couple of those pesky invaders through; your villain has a gun with 6 shots, sealing the fate of the first 6 rescuers to reach him.

Thanks to ChevyRay and everyone behind FlashPunk, Matt Tuttle (and co?) for porting it to Haxe to make HaxePunk, increpare and co. for Bfxr, and DrPetter for musagi (even if I didn't use it very well!).

P.S. If you want to feel you've 'completed' the game, get the villain to run out of dialogue. If he isn't cut off mid-speech too much, this only takes 2-3 minutes of monologuing. Of course, you'll have to deal with the invaders in between all that...

entries.title: ON THE RUN
entries.description:
ON THE RUN (made in 48 hours - Ludum Dare 25)
======================================================
You just robbed a bank but your buddy with the car was 
too stupid to find you. Suddenly the police appears - 
and you are ON THE RUN! And your buddy with the money 
just drops it in his great haste. Go collect it - ALL 
of the money! And dont get busted by the police!
======================================================
Have Fun & Thank You for Playing!

/EDIT: I tried to fix the starting issues (with the 
help of webglhelper.js). I updated the Files. 

http://chocobyte.com/ld25_ontherun-fixed/ (new)
http://chocobyte.com/files/LD25_ONTHERUN_FIXED.zip (new)
http://chocobyte.com/ld25_ontherun/ (old)
http://chocobyte.com/files/LD25_ONTHERUN.zip (old)

~TROUBLESHOOTING~

CHECK if your Browser supports WebGL
http://get.webgl.org/

INTERNET EXPLORER 10 
- well, It's Complicated. The IEWebGL Plugin ( http://iewebgl.com/Download.aspx )
  may work. For me it was very slow and unplayable. :(
 
FIREFOX 17.0.1
- about:config
  webgl.force-enabled = true

CHROME 23
- locally: start "chrome.exe" -allow-file-access-from-files
  to give Chrome access to the textures.

F.A.Q
------------------------------------------------------
1. To run the game just open "index.html".

2. Gamecontrols are:
"W": up
"A": left
"S": down
"D": right
"SPACE": restart

3. I bet you cant get all dat money! :-)

4. Technical Stuff:
 - just had "simple quad with texture renderer" - framework ready 
   and wrote rest of engine in contest - excuse me for bad 
   performance(!) - it needs some work...
 - used photoshop and paint.net for textures
 - sfxr for sounds

5. I want to make a Developers' Cut Edition with great performance,
   fair gameplay (... fair hitboxes ^_^ ...), a nice intro and
   music would be cool ... stay tuned ;)

entries.title: Super Generic Princess Saver
entries.description:
Why do villains capture princesses ? Why do we "save" them back ? My game orbits around this idea: Are villains conscious of what they're really doing ?

I express it quite awkwardly with flashing screens, but give it a try :)

Keys : Space + Directions

entries.title: Unsave the Princess
entries.description:
Play as an evil wizard attempting to escape from a knight seeking revenge.

Didn't really get a chance to flesh out the game as much as I'd have liked but learned lots and had lots of fun!. There's one or two bugs, but they shouldn't cause too many problems.

Thanks for looking!
Any feedback would be greatly appreciated, would love to develop this game further.

Controls
Press 1,2 & 3 to cycle through your active spell
1 - Fireball
2 - Summon Block
3 - Teleport
Left click to use active spell
WASD to move
esc to quit

edit: found a small bug which occurs on some graphics cards (there's small gaps between the tiles), I'll upload a fixed version post-compo.

entries.title: You're the Boss!
entries.description:
NOTE!!!!! When you lose all your health, the game closes. I apologize but there wasn't time to put in a "You Lose" menu / text. The game isn't crashing, it's just closing out when you lose. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience. It only really struck me after the deadline that programmers will see this as a bug.


You're the Boss!
    By Claite and Rebekah
The true villain of the every day working (wo)man! You want to put as much stress on your workers without getting reported to your superiors!

Game Goal:
Reach the required points to move on to the next level! Try to get the best time! To get the most points, make sure all your works are at the highest work load (red)! Be careful! If they have too little, they'll start complimenting you.

How to play:
W - up
A - left
S - down
D - right
J - Give work.
  Giving work to a worker increases their work load. This gives you more points! But be careful, too much work and they get angry, and they'll report you!
K - Shout!
  Shout at workers that are slacking off! (Spinning). But be careful, shouting at someone that isn't slacking off makes them angry, and they report you!



Good luck!

entries.title: Bombardier
entries.description:
*Bugfix/porting(post-48hours): The game now runs in firefox, although it still seems to work best in chrome. Also a small bug fix so the game doesn't get stuck on level 15.*

You're a villain dropping bombs on cities. Killing people awards you money for upgrades. You get bonus money for killing multiple people with the same bomb. Super Goat is trying to rescue the people of the cities, so you should kill them before he gets to them.

(I didn't have time to include a help page in the game but it should be pretty straight forward)

-Click to drop bombs.
-Click the icon at the center of the bottom bar to access the upgrade menu.

Upgrades:

-Explosion Radius: Increases the size of the explosion. Killing all who are hit by it.
-Shockwave Radius: Increases the size of the shockwave.
shockwaves can be used to push people around and possibly set up good combos.
-Bomb Speed: Increases the speed of the bomb. It will take less time to hit the ground.
-Fire Duration: increases explosion duration. Lingering explosive clouds continue to kill anyone who wanders (or is pushed) into them.
-Reload Speed: Reduces time to reload bombs.
-Bomb Capacity: Increases amount of bombs that can be fired before reloading.


I didn't have time to add a level cap either, so basically, when you can kill everything on the screen in one click, you've beaten the game.

entries.title: Curse You!
entries.description: Run! Don't get caught but also don't let the detective down!

entries.title: Fagin
entries.description:
Erm, more of a prototype than a game... ran out of time.

Probably not that obvious what you do.
You can hide in the gaps between buildings. (Use up arrow)
Then steal from gentleman (hold the down arrow), but don't do it too long or they will notice! Try and find the sweet spot (orange bar).

entries.title: Fisticuffs
entries.description:
'Fisticuffs' is an ICE HOCKEY brawl game for 2 Players!

First serve first comes? | Is the luck on your side? | Who knows the winner?

Fisticuffs is not a real game, but rather a simulation where you can bet for the winning team. Fisticuffs is a so called Meta-Game.

Pussies are working as team, where dicks are lone wolfs. Dicks are proactive, where pussies are reactive.

The only thing you can control is the spawning time of your team members. So take care!

1st Gamemode
------------
If you choose to play on keyboard, all team members spawn at their team location.

2nd Gamemode (advanced mode)
----------------------------
If you choose to play with mouses, you need to connect a second one to your Computer. Players can place thier team members directly on the ice hockey field. Only use your Teams Mouse Button!!!

Controls
--------
TEAMS

PUSSIES: 'left-alt' or 'space' or left mouse button

DICKS: 'rshift' or 'return/enter' or right mouse button

f - fullscreen

esc - quit

--------
Developed with Love2D, Love2D-Webplayer ( HTML5 / WebGL / Chrome / Firefox / Opera ).

entries.title: Friend of Tokyo
entries.description: This is a JavaScript-based browser game. It has been tested in Firefox and Chrome, and on a few iOS and Android devices. I hope you like it!

entries.title: Green Grump
entries.description: Very very basic. Arrows to move and jump. 'P' to pause. No sound or fireballs:(

entries.title: Heist!
entries.description:
Heist!: a game wherein you steal valuables from a museum in the dead of night, right under the nose of a vigilant security guard. Or a game wherein you're caught, embarrassingly, fifteen seconds into your first theft, and go to jail for life. It's up to you!

Instructions: hold down the left mouse button to move towards the treasure, but don't let the security guard see you! when you let go of the mouse, you'll be instantly disguised, so just don't move while she's looking at you. there are five things for you to steal, but your time is running out! good luck, and have fun :)

entries.title: Interfection
entries.description:
There are some in-game instructions.

~~ Basically the goal is ~~
Prevent people from being happy by distracting them with "evil" people beacons. But leave them uncertain and insecure, don't make them too sad. When the overall "mood" of the people is in this "uncertain middle area" your evil power will raise. Win the level by filling your power bar. Lose the game by losing all your power.

Unfortunately, even after hours of trying and testing, balancing is still quite off.
Sorry, no non-Windows version for now as there are some "interesting" problems with MyGUI.

Gameplay video: http://youtu.be/s6cn6a5i28c

entries.title: JASPrincess
entries.description:
Do you feel like a villain today?
Why won't you kidnap a princess? Be careful, there are a lot of guards. Any misstep and they will raise an alarm and beat you to death. If you are lucky, you will find some helpful items on your way.

Oh, you already got to the princess? Well, you need to get back to the entrance. Princess won't walk there by herself.

You think you will be bored from visiting same palace and kidnapping same princess over and over again? Now today. You'll never see the same one. Just pick some random palace and pay it a visit.

P.S. All the true villains already installed .NET and XNA. Don't wait for it.

entries.title: O TUTT'I CAVI LESI
entries.description:
I made this game in 9 hours. And it's the best I could have done in this time.
In the map there are 3 different challenges: one in stonehenge and one in the house with two doors. The third is on the top of the volcano and become playable only if the previous two are completed.

-mouse: skip scene.

Features:

-paper

-one eye

-a goat

entries.title: Outcast (DEMO)
entries.description:
Game Description:

In this game you're a girl who is awoken by a spirit claiming to be her deceased father. In order to be one with him she must gather the five essences and use them in a sacred ritual...

How to play:
Arrow keys to move, Z key for actions

As per request here are the steps to complete the game:

1. Exit the house.
2. Go the the graveyard located to the north.
3. Approach the gravestone.
4.Exit the house.
5.Go to the house to the south east end.
6.Approach the sleeping man.
7.Collect all 5 essence fragments in the maze.

Commentary:

For our jam entry we decided to take the "villain" role in a more demented direction than what we deemed cliche. The game was originally supposed to be about 5 missions long but given our time slot and the amount of work we put into the look and feel of the game, we decided to create one full level and looped it back around. Many of the scenes and features are missing from the game or had to be cut due to time constraints.



Credits:
Kaylin Norman [Design, Music, and Programming]
Ben Millar [Art, Music, Testing]

**KNOWN BUGS**
--On one of the dialog scenes the player appears for some reason
--sometimes on the mind scene the player may appear in walls or appear to walk through walls[fixed]

--The web version seems to function a lot differently than

entries.title: Robbie's Revenge
entries.description:
Robbie stayed calm for a long time, but one day he had enough.

Warning : this game contains a GOATZILLA.

entries.title: Super Space Goat Thief Standoff!!
entries.description:
Pilot a rogue ship in order to steal the space police's noble goat king! Rebound bullets off ships for combo bonus and the highest score!

- Controls -

Left/Right: Turn Ship

entries.title: Super'Bad'Man
entries.description:
I have to sorry you all. This is not what I hoped for. When theme was announced I was very exited. Of course first idea is making GTA, Dungeon Keeper, or some sort of adventure game, but I wanted to make something a bit original. I spend 2 hours planing, and I couldn't make most of ideas because of art. :( Finally I came up with that idea. And after night of work I realized that my game was just unplayable. And yes, I still have more than a day to make something, but I've got no ideas what to do. Sorry.
Now I am sending this only to help reach 5000 games.

This game is for 1/2 players, goal is to kill more things, and controls are WSAD and Arrows.

entries.title: The Evil Reveal
entries.description:
So this is my first Ludum Dare entry. I hope you all enjoy playing it!

The inspiration for this game came from this Mitchell and Webb sketch about an evil super villain revealing his plans for world domination to a board of company investors:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VgX6JFoV0TM&feature=youtu.be&t=5m2s

You play the evil genius running the presentation... of course the people at the table will eventually become terrified of your insanely criminal plans and they try to run away.

You have to kill and maim them before they get away to tell the police. But be wary... the longer they stay at the table, the more time you have to siphon valuable money from their accounts!

(I was originally doing this for the 48 Hour Compo, but due to the use of non-original sound effects I've moved over to the jam!)

Yeah the plant pots are really OP, I'm afraid I didn't have time to balance them properly before I submitted my final version! Sorry guys!

entries.title: The Little White Rabbit and the Goat Goatee
entries.description:
In this family-crafted game based on a Portuguese folk story our grandmother likes to tell, you control a goat who must devour everything in a rabbit's home while avoiding his friends who are trying to stop your glutunous rampage.

We weren't able to get the sounds in there in time, but I did manage to add a voice-over of the story. Also, there were some issues with the collisions at the very end and now the ducks don't come out of the left side of the screen. Other than that, it's enjoyable.

UPDATE: The entry was made in Game Maker 8.1. If anyone owns Game Maker Studio and is willing to try and export it for Mac OS, we'd be more than glad to add it to the submission. I've been trying it myself, but now it keeps crashing.

entries.title: THE PRINCESS IS MINE
entries.description:
::::::::Story::::::::

You are the most evil villain and king of the goblins named Grakkor. Just a few hours ago you kidnapped the princess. Too bad that the King knows you very well ... and where your dungeon is located

He has send 9 Armies to bring his daughter safely back.

And that is exactly what you have to prevent. I mean it's YOUR princess, right? Exactly! 

You have 3 loyal minions that will fight for you until the end. Defeat all 9 Armies and the princess will be yours. You lose the princess if the knights can free her or if all your minions are dead. Good luck!




::::::::Game Instructions:::::::::

(Hint: There is a instruction menu on the titlescreen)
- Select a minion by clicking on it
- Move the minion by clicking on the destination
- Fight your opponents by standing next to them
- Pick up upgrades by standing next to them
- The princess is located at the center of the map, protect her!

IMPORTANT: You don't have to intercept the enemies. They have a 2 tile wide radius. If your minion is within that radius they will automaticly attack you. You could say that they have the ability to attract them.

Update:
Since someone was asking what the upgrades do: The "shield" upgrade increases your maximum health. The "sword" upgrade increases your damage. The hearts just heal you :)




::::::::Development Info::::::::

The tools i've used:
- Language: Java
- OS: Linux (Ubuntu)
- IDE: Eclipse
- Libraries: Libgdx, libgdx-contribs
- Audio: as3sfxr, Sunvox, Audacity
- Graphics: Gimp, Google Web Fonts

- Total time spent (break, sleeping included): ~ 43 hours

- This was my 4th Ludum Dare Compo


Thanks for playing :D




::::::::UPDATE:::::::::

Added new platforms Web (Java Applet) and Android (.apk). If you want to play it as intended use the desktop version (first link). You can maximize the window and that makes it easier to play.

Timelapse now available! :)

entries.title: Two Souls
entries.description:
Two Souls is a hybrid platformer and puzzler (maybe?), where you control your character as well as your own enemies.
Reach the end of a level to get warped to the next, but don't let an enemy touch it!

***EDIT***
Just after submitting, I was able to find a way around the wall jump glitch. I then waited a bit for more critics about the game to upload a fixed postcompo version which you can play it here:
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/74880983/Two%20Souls%20-%20Fixed/index.html

It has also more solid speed (feels less slippery) and two fixed bounding boxes (Spike and Portal, both were twice as big as they meant to be ._.)


Make sure to rate the actual entry please, though.

entries.title: You Are The Villain - Planet Eater

See the readme file for details.
Windows only
Download and extract the zip then run the exe

entries.title: Castle of Doom
entries.description:
You play as the castle attempting to stop heroic knights from rescuing the princess held within your walls. 

Controls:
Mouse: select active enemy
Space: use enemy ability
R: Restart level
To retry a level after failing or proceed to the next level, just click.

Source is included in the windows download. Made in MMF2 (and not commented), so be prepared for that I guess.

Postmortem: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/16/first-ld-castle-of-doom-a-post-mortem/

entries.title: Crazy Dr. Banana's Pursuit of The Goat of Good
entries.description:
Dr Banana is bent of destroying the universe,
and has been hunting The Goat of Good for decades.
You must whistle or play ocarina to control the ship,
and weapons are fired by shouting "PCHEW!".

The theme didn't really align well with my original partial 
idea, and I was pretty uninspired. So, I just went a little bit
silly with the theme. Hope it's interesting to some either way!

entries.title: Clowns Vs. Bunnies
entries.description:
It's all JavaScript so it should run in your browser. I haven't tested it in every browser (cause I've got less than 5 minutes left :) 
I planned on having more than two levels but, I ran out of time.
You click on the clown to buy him, and then you can drag him where you want. 
Enjoy!! :)

**added note** apparently not everyone shares my inherent fear of clowns. I picked clowns because clowns are evil!! and bunnies are so cute and innocent. I would make a terrible real life villain.

entries.title: Crowd Control
entries.description:
I managed to finish, though the game is a bit lacking... I now officially hate my alarm clock.

Instructions:

You are Cthulhu. Some pesky humans have decided to wake you up from a nice nap and the only fitting punishment is death and madness.

By being in close proximity to you, humans will go mad. When  humans reach a certain level of insanity, they will start attacking each other, and the most insane of them all will join a cult worshipping you.

Your goal is to drive everyone insane in the shortest time possible.

I had planned to include two skills which would vary the gameplay a bit, but a bug that refused to go away when I had 20 minutes left stopped me from doing so, unfortunately. You can see what I had planned in the Instructions menu.

Also, I didn't have time to animate the sprites. Just pretend that Cthulhu is taking large, earth-shattering steps . ;)

(Use the arrow keys to navigate the menu.)

entries.title: Earth Destroyer
entries.description:
!!! Kongregate version is most updated. A lot of controls and optimization improvements there. We recommend to play that one !!!

!!! FOR WEB-VERSION CLICK RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON AND CHOOSE <GO FULLSCREEN> OTHER WAY YOU CANT ROTATE WITH RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON INSIDE THE GAME !!!

Name: Earth Destroyer

Genre: Puzzle

Team: Interbellum team

   Graphics, Game design - Ivan taranenko (Parhelion)
   Programming - Andrey Mikhaylenko (Multirezonator)
   VFX, Level design - Kirill Mikhaylenko (Xatab)
   SFX - http://www.freesfx.co.uk

Our web-site: http://interbellum.ru/index_eng.html

Description:
   Quiet simple puzzle game. Alien invasion happens and player controls alien general. Main task is to destroy humans cities (in honor of alien Queen). Gameplay builds on smart money spending. You have set of weapons, every with its features and cost. Your goal is to destroy all buildings.

Development process:
   I`ll be brief, cause i`m tired and my english f..cking ridiculous. So we are small team of three man and this is our first LD. Friend of mine tell me about and we decide to join. By the way we are from Ukraine.
   From 12 final themes that one was worst for us. For other we have better ideas, but shit happens. Anyway for that one we also have simple idea. We decide to not write a journal cause lack of time.
   Whole game was done from zero in about 36 hours. We don't work at night-times. I believe overwork is inefficient. Also we use Unity3d engine cause its well-known for us and works pretty fine. We made a simple plan (how many levels, graphic assets and features we need) and start to work. For destruction we use simple mesh and combined from pieces variant. Producing this combined stuff takes a lot of time and was hard routine for me =(. Although plan gives us a vision how to run developing processes in parallels. So nobody sitting without a work and waiting for others.
   Don't know what else to say if any question please ask here or you can find our contacts on web-site - http://interbellum.ru/index_eng.html  Although you can find there information about our current "big" project - Bravada.

   Hope you`d like our game. Please vote for us!

entries.title: Earth Eater
entries.description:
My second Ludum Dare! 

You're trying to survive across the cosmos, so you visit different planets across the galaxy. The world(s) revolve around you. 

Click to move, touch resources to pick them up, get enough to go to another planet. 

Follow on twitter @_Teejay5. Also follow @smario00. He's cool. 
https://twitter.com/_Teejay5


Bonus points if you see and catch the goat!

entries.title: Gnome Alone
entries.description:
You are McCullough, a Gnome Janitor who maintains the grounds of an evil Warlock's lair. The Warlock is off on business so it's up to you to keep out the pesky mob of Hero Do-gooders!

----Instructions----
Click the sign-posts to reroute the heroes path. Rusty sign-posts can only be changed once before they lock into place.

If there are spike walls on the bottom of the screen, click one to select it, move it to where you want (can only go on brown areas) and click it again to place it. Click it once more to delete it.

Press Esc to restart a level.
-----------------------

Runs on XNA

entries.title: HenchManager
entries.description:
Windows / 64bit linux / source will be added later.

You are a master criminal in possession of a nuclear device. The information got out that you have it, so now the good guys are trying to get it back. You decide to detonate it from a remote location. All that remains is managing your stupid henchman so they can fend of the good guys for long enough.

Some notes:
 - The good guys enter through certain doors every 10 seconds.
 - You have 10 seconds to prepare before the first one.
 - Some of your henchman (the blue ones) are technicians who can repair broken doors.
 - If you lose health there are some medpaks around that you can use.

Controls:
 - Drag a square over the henchman you want to control.
 - Click on an object to have a henchman interact with it.
 - WASD to control a single henchman at a time.

entries.title: Hitler Claus is Coming to Town
entries.description: First LD entry, hope you enjoy. Written in Java.

entries.title: Kill Ville
entries.description:
Our second team entry on LD25. Your job is to watch over a tiny peaceful city and find the person behind a series of murders.
Once you've found the culprit you'll have to point your finger at him and yell "YOU ARE THE VILLAIN!"


NOTE: If the web version is running to slow and you are using Chrome, try going to chrome://plugins and click on "[+] Details". Check the flash plugin you are using. If you have more than one, and one of them is "PepperFlash" try disabling that one, and run the game again.

entries.title: Laser Unicorns
entries.description: I'm pretty sure I put everything that would go in here in the game

entries.title: Misadventures of Dr. Bardo

This is the Misadventures of Dr. Bardo,
A Ludum Dare 25 game made in 72 hours by:
Jellonator, programming.

and MKSTAR26, music.

entries.title: Moon Domination
entries.description:
Like all the best Villains, you own a Moon Base! With a Shrink Laser!

Use your shrink laser on Planet Earth's cities to stop them from being built.

However, watch out for Planet Earth's intergalactic retaliation via missiles!

Idea, Programming and 3D Modelling by Andy Touch. 
Art Style/Direction and GUIs by Jon Ginn.

entries.title: MortVille
entries.description:
Help Morty the evil wizard wreak havoc on the village folk. Turn them into minions and use them to take out heroes sent to stop you.

NOTE: There is no installer, just an EXE to run.

Instructions:
- Avoid HEROES (BLUE GUYS), one touch and you're dead

Team members: 
Dave Tran - Art
Tamas Szathmary - Programming and some art


EDIT: I fixed a bug where the difficulty was not being reset upon restarting. Re-uploaded the zip file.

entries.title: Paradise Island
entries.description:
Paradise island: a perfect utopia, free from war and strife. Until now. Play as the evil Dark Lord, and conquer Paradise island. Loot the island, and use that money to build defenses to hold off the Knights of Light.

Controls:
Click - Move
1 - Buy and place spike trap at cursor. These deal a lot of damage, but nearby rogues will warn people before they step on them.
2 - Buy and place flame pedestal at cursor. These fire homing fireballs.
3 - Buy and place dark crystal at cursor. These reduce your cooldowns by 15% for each one active.
4 - Buy and drink health potion. This restores you to full health over 8 seconds.
Q - Cast firebolt at cursor. Deals high damage to a single target.
W - Cast ice bolt volley at cursor. Sends out five heavy chunks of ice that knock enemies back.
E - Cast gate. Teleports you to your cursor instantly.
R - Extort Villagers. Gets money from nearby villagers that have a gold piece floating over their heads.

Defeat each wave, and kill all enemies to win.

Enemy Types:
- Knight: Deals damage, but only in melee. Tough to kill.
- Rogue: Throws knives, but has less health than knights. Warns nearby allies of traps, making them useless if rogues are present.
- Cleric: Heals allies and villagers.

Note: The game is about 5MB, and make take some time to load, especially over slower connections. While it is loading there will be a blank white box where it will appear.

Tips:
- If an enemy collides with a flame pedestal or a dark crystal, they will smash it in one hit, although they will not go out of their way to do this.
- Keep the villagers alive, they're your only source of income and they don't respawn.
- If the game doesn't fit in the window, press F11 (at least in Firefox/Chrome) to go full screen.

entries.title: Planets? Yummy!
entries.description:
A game about celestial bodies and glutonny.

INSTRUCTIONS :
- Use the arrow keys to move.
- Click towards an enemy to grab it.
- With enemy grabbed, slide-click to throw'em away or click on yourself to eat and regain life.
- Once in a while, you can use your super telekinetic blob power with CTRL.

have fun !
(And i sincerely apologize for the absence of goat in this game)

entries.title: Princess Rush
entries.description:
Plot:
You must turn the princess into a deadly monster with an ancient ritual...
Don't let these pathetic heroes interfere!

Tools:
Flash CS5
FlashDevelop


Update: 
2012/12/19 : The website is up again!

entries.title: The Fall of Mr. Wily
entries.description:
Welcome to The Fall of Mr. Wily.

This was made from scratch in 72 hours (save a GUI library).

There are 2 goats to be found... one is quite subtle, see if you can find them both!

Our team was:
Ryan Nohr - Programming
Jon Rasmussen - Art
Nick Amlag - Art
Akash Thakkar - Sound/Music

It loads a bit slow on web, so there are PC and Mac versions as well!.

NOTE: Today I realized it was possible to put the game into fullscreen mode, which shouldn't be possible. I blame Unity, because I can. At any rate, the game was designed around a 16:9 aspect ratio, so I'd reccommend against putting it into fullscreen for the best experience.
--Ryan--

entries.title: The Princess Killer
entries.description:
You are in love with a beautiful princess... But she does not love you. Infact, she is gonna marry someone named.. Bob?

So what are you going to do about it?

entries.title: Troll Bridge
entries.description:
In Troll Bridge you are the Troll that lives under the Bridge! Defend your domain by booting all who try to cross.

Controls:
Start Game: ENTER
Move: arrow keys
Kick: SPACE

Thanks for playing! I had a great time building this game for the enjoyment of all!

Oh, And Goat +1!

entries.title: U.F-WOAH!
entries.description:
two player ufo shootemup deathmatchy kinda thing.

I wanted to make a racing game, but ran out of time. I wanted it to be something else than this really but failed miserably. Really not proud of this game but play it anyway!

How does it fit the theme? I have no idea! I hate this game now.

player 1 controls:
arrow keys to move, right alt to fire.

Player 2 controls:
wasd to move, left shift to fire.

Was built with xbox controllers in mind, shoddily converted the controls to keyboard last minute.

entries.title: White Wizard Tower For Sale
entries.description:
==How to play==
- The 3 spheres above the towerdoor is your spell buffer.
- Drag and release anywhere next to the tower to to cast the left most spell in the spell buffer.
- Refill the buffer with spells by gesturing over the 9 orbs floating over the tower.
- For example the gesture for the fireball spell is left-middle-bottomright-right-topright-middle.
- The size of the glow behind the 9 orbs indicate how much mana you have.
- Refresh the browser when the wizard dies.

==Story==
The white wizard finds a fine white wizard tower for sale. He buys the tower for a bargain price from a shady figure. That night after a rainy night the white wizard wakes up to noise outside of his window. The white chalk has washed off the tower revealing a black evil tower. And if that isn't enough human knights joined by bunnies, unicorns and goats prepare to siege the tower. The white wizard has no other choice than to eradicate the gathered army. You are the villain now! (So yeah, not much of this has ended up in the game :))

entries.title: ASMOSNOS
entries.description:
My first jam/LD entry.

It's a futuristic story of betrayal, planetary annihilation, and dancing crazy.

The post-jam version has about 3x as much content and some fun new controls (flying!), so check it out.

CONTROLS:
Spacebar to jump, E to use stuff. F to fly. The Jam version uses WASD for movement, the Post-Jam version uses the arrow keys.

What went right:
-Epic doodads.

entries.title: Black Sheep
entries.description:
Here's a tale...

I'm posting as a Jam entry because I asked PoussinKaki to help me with the ideas and graphics. Thanks to her!

entries.title: Children : Reverse Slender
entries.description:
This is a parody on the game Slender, except you play as the villain: Slenderman. ;)

Made this in Java with LWJGL. Hopefully it doesn't have any compatibility problems, I've only tested on Windows 7 machines.

More info on the page, along with source code.

entries.title: City Sucker
entries.description:
You are now a villainous vampire, bent on sucking the blood of as many innocent city-dwellers as possible in a limited amount of time! Test your reflexes by swooping into windows.

There are two things I wish I had done differently, but I ran out of time:
1. When you run out of time in the game, everything stops - you have to press 'r' to play again (unfortunately it's not very clear.)
2. The blood meter is longer than it needs to be - the actual max score you can get is 170.

Unless you have a Mac, you will have to download LOVE to play. Downloading LOVE is probably worth your time since a lot of LD games use it!

(+1 goat)

entries.title: Cruel Cruel Dastard
entries.description:
CONTROLS: With the "track" item selected, hold down the mouse to lay new tracks or re-route existing tracks. You can re-route existing tracks without spending money. Just drag your mouse over the existing track in the path you want it to take. 

Cruel Cruel Dastard is a game about using the fortunes of your railway empire to rid the earth of damsels. Play by re-routing the train tracks to use your trains for villainy.

entries.title: Fugitive X
entries.description:
Fugitive X is a turn-based stealth game.  

Escape the dark metropolis without getting caught...

Objectives
- Avoid the robot police.  They move whenever you move.
- They shoot one turn after spotting you.
- Sneak through alleyways, where robots cannot follow.
- Robots never shoot through innocent bystanders.
- Lead robots into the explosive crates.

Controls
- Move: WASD or Arrows
- Wait: Space
- Enter: Freeze robots once per level

Scoring:
- Each move: -1
- Die: -100
- Win: +1000
- Complete level without using a Freeze: +100

Created with:
- Code: Snax (haXe)
- Sounds: sfxr
- Music: FL Studio
- Graphics: Photoshop

entries.title: HA!HA!HA!
entries.description:
You are villain. Blow up all buildings in the city.
You have 10 agents who can bomb buildings. But only one building at turn. You can send a group of agents to make bombing faster.
Solders will try to destroy your aerostat and demine buildings you had bombed.
Explosions can kill your agents.

entries.title: Kill the Hero
Leave My Dungeon Alone !
entries.description:
Look at this little-cute-evil-witch-demon ! She just wants to rule her dungeon in peace ! And what did she get ? KNIGHTS !! BLOODY KNIGHTS EVERYWHERE !! 

Ok... Very well. Let's the chaos begin... And then, maybe, she can go to the tea party with her friends ! IN PEACE !

Code : Daylz / Graphics : Kalumis

entries.title: Lens - The Prologue
entries.description:
This is a first person interactive short story. I wanted to use it as a prologue to a larger game I'm working on, called Lens, which is very different than this. Some may argue that this isn't a "game" (similar to Dear Esther), but either way, it's an interactive experience. It's something I've wanted to do for a while, so I went for it!

The character thinks he's doing something good, but it turns out his actions were villain-ness, causing loss for everyone, even himself. 

The game tells the story of the shattering of the Lens, an artifact that allows two worlds to interact with each other. The character of the story, seeks to shatter the Lens, forever sealing off the worlds from each other, returning to more peaceful times. However, this action had dire consequences, and it turns out... He was the villain after all.

The controls are easy, WASD to move, and mouse to look around.

Thank you for playing!

*All assets were created by myself, are open source, or from the Unity Asset store.

Background Music - Tom Fahy - "Your Own Private Ghost"
http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Tom_Fahy/Rambler_The_Chronicles_of_Woodlawn_House/07_Your_Own_Private_Ghost

Lens Opening Sound
http://www.freesound.org/people/themfish/sounds/34202/

Lens Shattering Sound
http://www.freesound.org/people/themfish/sounds/34202/

Lens Altar, Starting Room, and floating Islands modeled by myself.

All other assets are from the Unity Asset Store for free.

entries.title: Minion's Defense
entries.description:
Build a town and defend it from the knight that's come to clear you out.

Remember to use walls to defend your huts!

entries.title: Licence to play
entries.description:
The player is a violent video game. He tries to contaminate children with the virus of violent video games. But the institutes of SERB & PIG won't leave him alone !

-> Spread the virus of violent video gaming.
- Avoid being caught by SERB & PIG.
- Infect shops and hospitals to spread chaos and madness !
- Survive the longest time possible to score high.

We were 8 student in video games and had a lot of fun doing our first one ! The craziness of these 3 days can be seen in the assets i think :p

This game was made to be ironic, we hope you'll have as much pleasure playing it as we had creating it !

entries.title: Muffin the Destroyer
entries.description: Extremely short.  Please at least play through to the first stage, even if it seems horrible and crappy.

entries.title: Oh No My Earl
entries.description:
We had high ambitions, which probably kept the game overly complicated. We had to jettison a lot of features, but we're still proud of the end product. 

You are Earl of Large bent on destroying the world. With the Time Disruptor completed, now you must charge it up. But the Heroine  Mop Soppings has heard of your dastardly plans and intends to raid your clocktower hideout. Happily, no hero can resist smashing a pot. Delay Mop Soppings with your minions and alluring pottery long enough for the Time Disruptor to charge  and the world will be yours! 

Keep Mop Soppings from reaching the top of the tower. You have 4 minute until the Time Disruptor is fully charged. 

You have around 20 seconds before Mop appears on the first floor. 

Use pots to keep Mop occupied. To delay her even longer, summon a Slime minion. 

It's unfitting for the final boss to appear before the final level. So when Mop Soppings appear on the same level as you, you will instantly teleport to the level above. 


Controls:
WASD: Movement
Space: Smash an unwanted pot
Tab: Toggle Hero Camera
M:  Floor Elevator menu

**In the lower left corner, you can click on either the pot or slime icon to aid you in your maniacal meddlings.

entries.title: Pandemic Simulator
entries.description: This is the alpha build, the game is basically playable as it is right now, but i'll be polishing it up and adding a few features here and there in the coming hours. The goal is simple, create your disease and attempt to exterminate the whole world. DNA Points are aquired when infecting or killing people, and can be spent on upgrading your disease. The game should pretty much explain itself, but if you're lost, you can always see your current objective at the top of the screen!

entries.title: Park to Park
entries.description:
Surround areas with tape to pave them over, but don't let the goats and hippies get near the tape! For more points, pave over large areas at once, and try to trap the pests.

A browser game written in CoffeeScript using HTML5 canvas, audio and local storage. A recent browser is required. The game works best in Chrome, but also works well in Firefox, Safari and even Internet Explorer. Opera users may experience problems, sorry!

Very rarely, a goat or hippie will walk off the screen to get a bite to eat. This is totally a feature. All this running around in a park makes them hungry, you know.

entries.title: Phaedra
entries.description:
Description: 

You are the evil overlord of a dungeon fortress and adventuring parties are raiding your dungeon for treasures and ultimately are attempting to slaughter you in the name of their king! To keep yourself safe while your army die horribly for you (as any good villain would), you stay in the luxurious heart of your fortress, watching over the battle with your seer's magic. You decide that without your brilliant command, the battle will be lost, so you use your magic to control your minions from afar and control the tide of the battle against the onslaught of heroes. 

Running: 

On Windows you can simply download the .zip file labeled Windows and run the executable inside. 

For Mac OSX and Linux users, unfortunately due to packaging issues, you will first need to install love2d (http://love2d.org) either through your package manager or the website. Download the link labeled Linux or OSX and run the shell script run.sh to launch the game. If you need more information, see here: https://github.com/centhra/ld25/blob/master/README.md

If you are on ArchLinux you are in luck, because we have an AUR entry here: https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/phaedra which will install the game with a .desktop entry which you can find through your desktop environment or run it directly in a terminal by typing "phaedra".

Gameplay:

The game blends the action and strategy genres by allowing you to control a minion directly with the WASD keys and attack, or select a group of minions using left click and drag and then right click to direct them towards enemies.  
  
The aim of the game is to prevent all of your minions from dieing, as they are the only thing stopping the heroes from getting to the heart of the dungeon, slaying you and stealing all of your treasure. The top left of the HUD shows a progress bar, which at the start of the game has a red bar and a blue bar which are of equal length. The red bar represents how close the minions are to killing all heroes (i.e. how close you are to winning) and the blue bar represents how close the heroes are to winning (i.e. how close you are to losing). There are four waves of heroes (the next wave starts after you kill all the alive heroes, an exclamation mark is shown on the minimap where the new wave spawn is). If you kill all four waves of the heroes and have minions left, you win and get to keep all your treasures and life!

Controls:

left mouse - clicking on a minion (your evil servants fighting the invading heroes) will select it 
left mouse + drag - select a group of minions and then right click somewhere to direct them towards it 
right mouse - direct your selected minions to move to a position 
w, a, s, d - movement when a minion is under control, otherwise moves the camera 
shift - faster camera movement 
space - attack in the current direction when a minion is under control 
arrow keys - move the camera 
escape - stop controlling any minions 

Issues:

We felt that game was moderately polished but there were definitely things we wanted to add but couldn't due to lack of time:

* Attack animations
* Cosmetics, such as fading in after the loading GUI, fading out on death, fading into red and out on damage instead of flashing, etc.
* Stairs for where heroes spawn
* Cooler dungeon decorations (we had torches, tables, roast food, etc. that we ran out of time to add to the generator)
* No tutorial / instructions in-game

There are also definitely some bugs here and there but nothing urgent; weird flipping in animations and such.

Development Notes: 

This was Centhra's fourth attempt at the Ludum Dare jam and first 2D game submission. As always, we have learned a lot from participating in the competition. Many of us feel that it was our best yet and we look forward to participating in the next one! 

Github: https://github.com/centhra/ld25 

We will be continuing to develop this game after the competition so watch the repository if you're interested in more updates. 

Contributors: 

- Billy "Trinick" Fallon (Code - Characters) 
- Christopher "Dr. Calamity" Hall (Sound) 
- Devon "Kheyre" Chenard (Art - Roof Tile, Concept Critique) 
- Johnny "Trigun" Patterson <http://centhra.com> (Code - AI) 
- Shadowbeing (Dev Party Host) 
- SolarFlare (Art - 2D) 
- Zack "z0w0" Corr (Code - Level Generation)

entries.title: Sisyphus
entries.description:
SISYPHUS AND THE CURSED DIAMONDS
made in France, by Manu & Wan
________________________________

This platformer is about heroes, greed and repentance... and most of all, it's about wondering: Who is the villain, you or you?

________________________________

- CONTROLS : You'll figure them out... Except ENTER, that you can hold to skip cutscenes.
- KNOWN ISSUES (only in the Jam version) : Selecting traps sometimes fails. It also has a few glitches, otherwise it should work as intended.
- TECH : Made in HTML5 with CraftyJS and some other cool libraries.

________________________________

* 13/05/2016: This recommended version saw its levels and balancing reworked from the ground up. Most bugs and quirks are also fixed. The game is still hard, but more fun to play!
** 26/04/2014: Note that the original 2012 sources don't work anymore in modern browsers. This version is mostly the same, except we polished some details, and especially upgraded the engine... introducing a few glitches.

entries.title: SITH JUST GOT SERIOUS
entries.description:
Huh. Submitted our first ludum dare entry two seconds before the deadline!

Really short summary:

You're Darth Vader, you need to kill everybody.

If you don't have it already, you will need to install XNA redist to be able to play:
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

and also .NET Framework 4.0:
http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851
:(

Made by two people in 2 days.

Used XNA and Photoshop.

Have fun!

Browser version and sound effects are coming soon... :)

entries.title: Splonet
entries.description:
This is my fourth (third finished) Ludum Dare game. It's called Splonet. (Planet + (ex)splosion, get it? I know, the pun is cheap)

It's about you, the villain, observing a planet as it is formed around a golden core. Then you have to blast your way through the planet to reach and STEAL THE CORE. Because you're the villain. As you blast pieces of the planet into the air you have to hurry because they will fall back down and fill the holes you've spent so much time digging.

The game is also frustrating if you don't find a cheap easy winning technique (that's unintentional, but let's just say it symbolizes unfair play many villains make use of). And playing with sound on is highly recommended, as it is quite impossible without.

Controls: use mouse to move the camera and mouse1 to shoot in the middle of the screen. You have to shoot the golden core to win, exposing it is not enough (at least in this version).

Made by me in Unity (actually this is my first released Unity game ever). Music and sound effects by Crudelis Diabolus (@Golden_Sin). Name by Dash Zanger (@DashZanger).

I hope you like it :)

entries.title: Stop Him Now!
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare entry/participation!

SUMMARY
The notorious bird army of the evil Blackbird is being attacked by goody two shoes James Birdhunter. Command the bird army and make sure he doesn't win this game!

Fixed
- Fixed a minor graphical mistake
- Fixed the boss spawn
- Fixed the sound looping wrong

Post Compo :

- Shortened max playtime
- Removed rocks
- Added two new birds
- Added option to pause by pressing 'P'
- Changed control scheme so that holding 'X' 
  is no longer needed
- Changed the action key from 'Z' to spacebar

Instructions in-game.

WARNING: LOTS OF FLASHING LIGHTS AND SHAKING

entries.title: Collateral Damage
entries.description: Awesome arcade flight game: Be an evil jet pilot and level a whole city on your own, defended by deadly ground-to-air missile launchers.

entries.title: Double Tap
entries.description:
Only you can save the world from terror!

Drag with left mouse button to move camera.
Drag with right mouse button to zoom.
Spacebar to fire when prompted.

Also apologies if you find the message a bit heavy handed. But I figure I'd rather have a slightly awkward voice then be silent.

entries.title: Earth Beast
entries.description:
My entry for "Your are the villain" is: Earth Beast

After suffering at the hands of humans for many years, the Earth Mother has summoned a creature from the depths to destroy humanity.

You play as this creature who emerges from a sewer into a modern city looking to wipeout the human parasite from the world!

Created using flixel, the dragon is homage to the many retro-amiga dragons in the past that I really adored. In particular the one from First Samurai! I did some stuff to make his back arcing for various gameplay reasons but I'm pretty happy with the end result.

There is also night and day cycle, something which I thought I'd add after it appeared on the potential theme list.

Its arcadey gameply and features leveling up with progression by making your dragon bigger each time. But watch out for those pesky humans and their weapons!

Note: damage is only taken on the HEAD of the dragon so you can evade effectively for the most part.

I look forward to comments, the art in particular was very difficult for me :) Would love to see peoples scores and levels too.

My aim was also to make a subjective villain, are you on the side of humans or the earth? Has the earth gone too far by summoning a monster? You decide!

This is my first submission so I hope I have used dropbox correctly too (please let me know otherwise). All art is mine except for the Flixel default font and basic shapes (rectangular health bar for example).

EDIT: I have Goats in the game too! They give more points if you kill'em :)

entries.title: G.O.A.T.
entries.description:
Okay, real description this time.

You are evil.  Drop the anvils on the widdle innocent goats.  The end.

Move by pressing LEFT and RIGHT, and drop an anvil with SPACEBAR.  That's all there is to it.

This game was actually a much more advanced concept involving police, super heroes, and an army attempting to storm your evil person stronghold, but I didn't have the time to implement all of that.

So I recycled the sprites I doodled up on Friday night, plus the logo for your evil organization as the title screen, and shoved this steaming pile out fresh just for you in three hours!  Aren't you lucky!

G.O.A.T. stands for Goal Of Absolute Terror, BTW.

Destroy. every. hero.

(Only one level, simple tuto, bonuses, gold, lot of units...)

For a lumberjack, destroying the forest is the rule. This is not different for Joe, the bad jack! Help him to destroy a forest facing the resistance of indians, what can be more evil than that?!

Control with arrows or WASD, attack with space.

The game is HTML5, built with CraftyJS. Tested on Chrome and Firefox, but probably works with Safari as well.

entries.title: Lasers against Humanity
entries.description:
Left / Right arrows to move

Use your Laser (space) to destroy buildings. Use your shield (shift) to destroy incoming missiles. There are two building types: 

- government buildings, worth more points
- missile silos, worth fewer points, but you'll want to try and get rid of them so you aren't harassed by too many missiles


Note: for running on Linux/OSX, you must have Love2D installed (https://love2d.org/), and execute 

love /path/to/game.love

entries.title: Pissin' You Off!
entries.description:
Here's my LD25 entry...Pissin' you off!
It's about a very villainous dog, the only thing he can do is pissing off his owner and piss everywhere just for fun!

It's very simple, just run around the house, piss inside the red circles and try to avoid the humans!

It was very hard for me to finish this, it's reeeally unbalanced and not too good but it's my first time using Haxeflixel for a game so I'm kinda satisfied with the result!

You play as a contractor hired out by walmart to
destroy hospitals and orphanages for 'developing'.
Use your wit and skill with angles to guid your 
missiles to blow those buildings into the sky!

The instructions are in the txt file - but this video shows it better.

entries.title: Small Theft Auto
entries.description:
In Small Theft Auto you play a REAL villain : attack people to steal their money, take part in drug deals, kill people and loose your humanity.

Controls : WASD/Arrows to move. Space for Action, 1-3 to change actions (need upgrades)

entries.title: Split 'Em Up
entries.description:
I didn't have time to finish it or properly test it. I hope it's playable. Sorry for the absence of instructions and sound. There was supposed to be another kind of trap in the mansion but it was so glitchy that I decided to remove it in the last minute...

============
How to play:
============

Your goal is to scare those meddling kids away from your mansion. 

If they are sticking together, they won't be scared so easily and it will be a hard task to make them run away.

But if you manage to split them up and make each of them wander alone in the mansion, their courage gauges will slowly deplete by themselves.

Click on the traps to make them run in different directions or fall through floors.

Making the kids flee through windows will grant you some extra points.

============

Thanks a lot to Helo (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-25/?action=preview&uid=18165), Picchi and Preto for the company and support during this weekend :)

entries.title: the BRINK
entries.description:
the Brink.
arrow keys to move
x - weak attack 
c - strong attack
v - dash

break the orbs to progress~
watch out for that doctor! 

Team RADMARS: 
Brendo - level design / level painting
Adhesion - programming / music / sfx
emarcotte - programmin'

tokken - art

entries.title: The Maze of Evil
entries.description:
The Maze of Evil

Once a great hero got hit by a rock from the skys. 'The Light has choosen me!' - he thought, I'm not kidding! This sucker went and find his destination, your hidden maze. Being a good host you have immediately started the elimination operation.

RULES:
You have your XP flowing. Whit that, you can buy traps and monsters from the bottom right corner of the screen by clicking on the green bars under the item you whis for. Select the item by clicking on it in the red area.
Once the item is selected - and you have at least one of the kind then you can place it in the maze.
While time flies sometimes potions appear in the maze - this is why you have built it in the first place. The hero can pick those up and use them to fully heal him self. You don't know how many he got because you don't see in his pocket ofcourse.
Your monsters are start wandering as soon as they are placed and can wander into your traps - be wise. Traps are disarmed as soon as something walks into them. Multiple enemies can attack the hero at once and they can overpower him while he only can attack one at once.
You can estimate the heroes health by the amount of red on him.

Now you know everything. Kill that intruder!


P.s.: There is a goat and a unicorn reference in there somewhere. Who finds them first?

P.p.s: I've only 20 hours work in this project so sorry for no proper gfx. If you like the idea I consider finishing and expading it.

entries.title: The Shadow Inside Of Me
entries.description:
Your aim is to find your soul and return home.

Controls:

Right and left arrows - move
Up - jump
Down - shield or form change
Z - special action (cancel growing and teleport)
Esc - exit;

entries.title: The Torture Chamber

entries.title: Withdrawal
entries.description:
TASK: Get to the safe.

CONTROL:
Aim: Mouse
Move: W,A,S,D
Shoot: Left Mouse
Knife: Right Mouse
Restart: R

NOTE:
Destroy crates with your knife or shoot on them to get money & ammo.

*Fixed* Lags \o/
