entries.title: An Barun Rua
entries.description:
What kind of villain would you be if you'd never made a rooftop escape?
Inspired by Canabalt, but with what I think is a pretty unique art style - everything is in shades of red!
The title is in Irish, and means "The Red Baron". The rest of the game is in Irish too :3 I'll upload a post-compo version in English so you can understand the story. I'll add goats to the post-compo version too.
This was kind of a warmup for my Irish Indie Challenge 2013. You can join in that too! http://iandioch.wordpress.com/challenge/

So, enjoy! My second Ludum Dare, twas a blast, see you all in the new year for some more jamming madness!

entries.title: bad dudes v. bad dude
entries.description:
A game of many ideas, few of them complete. Run an evil empire as a dumb movie bad guy: threaten evil deeds and have the world pay you to not do them. Buy evil lairs for the hero to stomp all over. Fill them with henchmen that can't kill the hero and can only die. Something of a defense game. Kind of.

Featuring:
- State-of-the-art sympathy engine - when someone dies, you'll know what the world has lost.
- 4 unique tilesets for randomly generated levels.
- Crates! Every evil lair needs crates, right?
- Brain-dead AI! But at least the hero is smarter than the henchmen...

Instructions are in the game; just be sure to make all the demands you can every day. As you get more money and buy more property, you get more evil. More evilness allows more evil demands, which net you more cash.

entries.title: Black Was Sad
entries.description:
Black was sad.

Black lived in Dora's paintbox. And Dora loved to paint. In the five years, two months and sixteen days of her life, Dora had painted three hundred eighty-five and three-quarter rainbows. But not once had she used Black.

So Black got angry.

In his anger, Black started to shoot colors at his former friends in the paintbox. By mixing them with parts of himself he tried to turn them into black, too. If he couldn't be part of Dora's rainbows, nobody else should be!

Black knew, that if he could outnumber the other colors, he would win. But he also was aware that he only had a limited number of shots to achieve his evil goal before he would have to surrender.

And thus the fight began.



How to play:

Billiard meets minigolf meets color mixing! Click on any instance of Black, drag and release to shoot a primary color (Red, Yellow or Blue) in the indicated direction. Press key "1" to select Red, "2" to select Yellow or "3" to select Blue.

If the color you shoot hits another color, the hit color will be blended with the shot color (e.g. hitting Red with Yellow will turn Red into Orange).

You'll win if -- by clever color mixing -- you have more Black objects in the game than Colored ones. You'll lose if you have no more shots left.

entries.title: Catvillain
entries.description:
This game is about Cat who just wanted to become a little more villainy. The goal is to do your business and avoid being catched by a man.

This game was made by participants of GDG in Omsk:
Alexey Korovyansky
Andrey Krivko
Serik Beisenov

entries.title: DV
entries.description:
DV is a roguelike game where you are a villain who has been taken captive by the white knights; your backstory behind your capture is randomly generated each time you start a new game.

Your aim is to escape by exploring the randomly generated dungeon system and making it to the staircase.

Utilise the use of killing the white knights to gain drops which can help you on your way to the end; just make sure you don't die!





We're a group of four, Year 11 students who enjoy making games. This is our second Ludum Dare, after we made Dig Dig Dig! last December.

The theme was a but more tough than 'Alone' but we pushed through this one, with our fried noodles, CAT animes and sleeping shifts.

We didn't get the time to add in the skill trees and the randged/mage weapons we were hoping for. We were also looking to add in some special rooms where you could spend you gold in certain ways, be it a small back room gambling game with corrupt guards or buying some new weapons and potions.

What we did manage to add in is just as we expected. Sounds we made were crisp and the graphics are in place. Coding ended coming out smooth. You'll just have to check it out for yourself. We enjoy it, so we hope you do too!


Thanks for checking out our entry,
Have a nice day!





P.S. If the game does not run properly, you will have to install the .NET framework we provided in the download, or run the installer. 
We apologise for the inconvenience. If anyone can teach us how to package the game better, please leave a comment and we'll get in touch, thanks!

entries.title: Eater
entries.description:
Made in C++ with SFML.
The source code is pretty bad, partly do to my laziness and partly due to my inexperience with making games.

WASD to Move.

You are a big monster that just wants to eat stuff. So eat stuff.

This was my first Ludum Dare and I managed to make this crappy game. I'm not upset though, since this was one of my first games, so in fact I'm even kind of proud.

NOTE: The source should work when compiled on any system and the according to a comment it works well with Wine.
(Thanks to zenmumbler for Mac version.)

entries.title: Enemy of the State
entries.description:
WASD to move, F to interact, ESC to exit. Dont forget that last bit. [ESC] TO EXIT.

Unzip, then Run the .bat, not the .jar! Be sure to read the readme as well so you get some more info. Comment if it doesn't work! I've never distributed before, so I can only hope it does.

Edit -

This game may not run properly on monitors that arent 1920x1080 - Some of the screens draw things to stretch based on that resolution, my apologies, it is too late to go back and fix that. Though it would not require much work.

entries.title: Hat
entries.description:
D to move. E to interact.

I didn't have much time this weekend so I decided to make an artgame because I didn't think it'd take a lot of effort. It didn't really take a lot of programming, most of my time was spent animating and placing the pieces of enviornment. I think it turned out pretty well.

I'm good at the actual programming and making of a game, but I have absolutely no clue what I'm doing when it comes to exporting and sharing it. Currently it'll only work on Windows 64-bit computers, sorry!

Follow me on twitter! @N427Games

Sorry for the lack of goats. :c

EDIT:

Spoiler warning, this paragraph is for after you've played the game. The purpose of the continuous childish rambling, even through adulthood, was to convey a sense of innocence and a lack of understanding of right and wrong. That's why I wrote 'alot' instead of 'a lot', along with some other improper grammar, to add to the childishness. And that's also why I let some of the narration not fit entirely on the screen, to make it feel more like rambling.

entries.title: Lord Of Corruption
entries.description:
Requires Java 6 or higher

ATTENTION:
There have been a few comments saying it is too hard/they don't know how to win the level. If you are really stuck, read Spoilers.txt and have another go. Also there should be some info in the comments. To win a level, get 250 orbs and take them to the chaos portal (the pink thing at the end of the level, then the corrupt skill will turn gold, allowing you to use it.

Story:

You are the new Lord of Corruption. Your ultimate goal is too devastate worlds with your chaotic powers. You have come to Planet Erth* where your master meet his doom at the hands of the Paladin's Order. Your mission is to find the Chaos Portals he left behind, and to use their power, along with the strange Blue Orbs dropped by dead Paladins, to corrupt/kill all living things, and block out light forever. Fortunately, the Paladins are still guarding the portals, so finding the blue orbs will be easy. Getting to the portal alive is the hard part. So you pick up your cursed sword, put on your chaotic armour, and step through the warp portal onto
Erth.

*Not a typo. I have creative names :P
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Controls:

Arrow Keys - Move/Jump
SPACE - Attack. Make sure you hold it down. DON'T press it rapidly and then complain it doesn't work. This is a feature, not a bug.
WASD - Special skills that consume Orbs.
Down Arrow - Special skill that has a cooldown.
P - Pause
F12 - Screenshot
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How to win:

You goal is to corrupt the entire world. To do this, you must collect 250 orbs from the Paladin's Order who were sent to stop you, find the chaos portal, and use the corruption power (the S key). Once this is done, you will move to the next level. At the end of the last level, the screen fades to black forever. Don't complain that it stopped working. If you want, copy the levels from /res/levels/bonus into the /res/levels directory, and then it will move on to the bonus levels when you finish.

If you get stuck at any point, look at "Spoilers.txt" and see if that helps. ONLY IF YOU'RE STUCK.

If you want to make your own levels, see "How to Make Your Own Levels.txt" and have fun messing around.

If you want to mod it, or find out how something works, download the source and start hacking away at it (Hopefully you have the JDK and some Java IDE).

--------------------------

Binary released for Max OSX Snow Leopard or newer. For other OSX's and for Linux it should be super straightforward to download the source and compile. For Windows, it should be possible, but I can't promise it's easy. (Let me know if you succeed in getting it to work on Windows; I'd like to support that and any info helps.)

entries.title: Amongst Shadows
entries.description:
Description taken from the game's page on my website:

Amongst Shadows is a stealth game, relying heavily on light and shadows; for example, enemies can't see you in the dark. There's little plot other than this: you are infiltrating some underground base to obtain something for a mysterious organisation.

It isn't actually clear whether the main character, and the organisation he's working for, are good or bad. They appear bad, but the subject of what they do isn't delved into. On a more philosophical note, the identity of the villain is generally a matter of who you ask. You are the villain to the guards, but not to yourself.

The game is a bit short, containing only six levels. I didn't have to patience, nor time, to create more. It's also a bit rough around the edges; the AI can be rather stupid, and the lighting looks weird at times. I would have liked to have done more, but there's only so much one can do in two days.

entries.title: Waldo
entries.description:
Waldo is a game about a contract killer.

At the beginning of each level you get to see your targets' appearance. After starting the stage, you have to find them in a crowd of people and shoot them. If you kill all of your targets, you get to the next level. The game is endless, the levels get progressively harder by introducing bigger crowds and more targets.
After you fire your first shot in a level, the police sets out to hunt you down. You have to finish the job before they find you, otherwise it's game over. Their progress is indicated by the progress bar on the top of the screen.

My goal this LD was to make the game as simple as possible, to make the coding easy, so that I can spend time on the graphics and sounds. I succeeded, I could practice my pixel skills a lot which means a lot to me, even if the time I wasted on drawing will lead to low scores due to the game's simplicity.
Fortunately - unlike last time - I had time to make some simple sound effects. I still can't make music, though.

To play this game, you will need a PC with Windows XP/Vista/7/8, a DirectX 9 GPU that supports Shader Model 2.0 and these frameworks:
- .NET 4.0:
  http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851
- XNA 4.0:
  http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

Thanks for checking out my game!

entries.title: Anta Gogen

In Anta Gogen you play a general that has run out of conventional weaponry.

As a last resort you use the only material your country has in vast supply. Toxic waste that turns human to zombie, and cows!

Basic controls are:

Buttons on the left: Switch between bomb type

I worked until the last minute on it, so I did not have time to test everything or add all the sounds I wanted. But I guess that is part of LD ;). If you do find a bug, or want to get in touch:

entries.title: Balloon Bandit!

You are the Balloon Bandit in an exciting side scrolling shooter game.

entries.title: Feed the Towers

In most Tower Defense games you place towers and kill stuff. Feed the Towers is basically the reverse of that!

Spawn enemies from the left-hand side to increase your income so you can spawn better enemies. Lower cost enemies will give you a better gold>income ratio but those enemies are much weaker and will likely not make it very far before they're killed. :)

entries.title: Final Fight
entries.description: You are the final boss. Your objective is to defeat all heroes that want you dead.

entries.title: Happiness
entries.description:
Happiness:

You are a super intelligent artificial intelligence with one goal. To maximise happiness in the universe! Create as many 10kg units =) of happiness as possible.


System View:
Here you can control your ship with WASD, Q and E strafes. Mouse wheel zooms. Left click fires active guns towards mouse cursor. (WARNING: You need to add guns and engines at the build screen before you can do either of these things. Control tiles MUST be connected to the ship core by hollow tiles which have life support (solid sections must block them from space to keep the air in!) Click on a tile to check it's status. 

Jump View:
Here you can jump to other systems or fix the system you are currently in. Click on a system to jump/fix it. WASD moves around.

Build View:
Here you can design your ship with available energy. The following block types are available:

Hollow: Hollow tiles form rooms in ships. All control tiles must be connected to the central core. 

Solid: Solid tiles form walls, all hollow tiles must not be in contact with space to function!

Door: Connects hollow sections but otherwise acts as a wall. 

Control: Required to place "GunRound" on the gun deck above this tile. MUST BE connected to central core AND have life support(air) to function. 

Engine: Required to move around! Click on tile to rotate facing of engine. Engine will NOT function if blocked by other tiles.

Warp: Use less energy to jump to other systems.

EnergyStorage: Store more energy after processing each system.

GunAccelerator: Place in line in direction of "GunRound" to make projectile fire faster.

GunRound: Required to shoot MUST be placed on top of "Control" tile, if 2 or more gunRounds are connected then gun cannot rotate but you get a slight bonus to fire rate. 

ClearBlock: Remove block and receive 50% refund.

Material Types: Material types have varying strength, substrate gives you more score, having larger open spaces also gives you a bonus to your score.

Notes:
XNA (windows only) sorry! Controls are kinda screwy since I tried to make the physics as realistic as possible (It calculates center of mass, moment of inertia, and all that fun stuff).

entries.title: Infection Market
entries.description: Infection Market is a Newsgame developed by students from the CEJLL - NAVE Highschool, in Rio de Janeiro (Brazil), which tells the story of a villain developer who decided to contaminate the Google Play with lots of contaminated apps, making copies of already known apps. Your objective is to create the asked number of infected copies before the time is over.

z-ax

entries.title: Maniac: Total Darkness
entries.description:
Ever wanted money?
Well, here is your chance to get some!

In Maniac: Total Darkness, you get to kill people and sell their body parts in the "Evil Shop". With the money you're getting you can then buy new weapons to kill more people!

How to run the game:

1. Extract zip file.
2. Run "run.bat" if you're on Windows, otherwise if you're on Linux or Mac you may run the "ManiacTotalDarkness.jar".

Controls:

SPACE to stab (If holding a weapon),
E to open bag, and get into shop,
the rest is explained in game.

entries.title: Mad Princess
entries.description:
---STORY---

There is a story of a beautiful princess trapped in the castle of a horrible demon. Many brave warriors have fallen 
trying to face the dangerous traps of the castle to save the princess!

The truth, however, is much more darker: The master of the castle is no one but the princess herself! 
She uses terrible dark magic to set traps for the hapless heroes who invade the castle, 
and then uses their blood to create more deadly traps for new heroes who dare to set their foot in the castle!

Mad Princess is a tower defence type of game. You control the princess, 
who uses blood as currency, to set up different traps from spiky floors to 
crossbow sentries to kill the invading heroes! 
The heroes travel in sideway 2D view in the halls of the castle, 
trying to reach the princess. If that happens, she is forcefully saved and probably married, or worse, taken to some mental care institution


---CONTROLS---
Use mouse to play, select different traps by picking their icons from the top screen and then place them down in the battlefield.

Press R to restart current Stage and Esc to return to main menu. Note that this will restart the whole game.

Press P to pause and unpause
Use + and - to adjust volume and 0 to mute/unmute.

---TRAPS---
First trap is the Bombs, you can spawn them pretty much anywhere by just clicking empty space. They are cheap and pretty powerful, but be careful though, because they start rolling around easily and will blow up your traps if they happen to collide.

Second trap is the Spike Carpet, it falls on the ground and will sap the health of anyone who steps on it except Agile enemies. The invading heroes cannot attack it, but be careful when placing it, because it breaks if it touches other traps.

The third trap is the Wall, well, it is not really a trap, but a strong brick wall, that will halt the travel of the heroes until they manage the break it. Agile enemies can run through it with no harm though. The Wall will break any traps that collide with it.

The fourth trap is the Crossbow, it's an automatic sentry that will shoot arrows at the invaders. It's also a bit like the Wall, and will halt the heroes, but only briefly, because it's not as sturdy as the Wall. Agile enemies can also pass through it with no harm but they can still be hit with arrows.

The fifth and final trap is the Chain Ball, it spins in place in a round arc. It's very powerful, but it will destroy any traps it happens to smash into so be careful when placing it.

entries.title: Mothertrucking knights
entries.description:
You are a troll and are getting annoyed with all the knights coming into your lair to steal back the queen.

You can use the arrow keys to do everything.

Sorry it's so short.

entries.title: Ninox the Nightbringer
entries.description:
You are Ninox, the bringer of Darkness!
In this puzzle game, your job is to black out the world, one level at a time. You have to use the switches for this, but beware of the spikes - the darkness can be treacherous!

Use the arrow keys for movement, F for fullscreen and Escape to exit fullscreen. 

28-12-12: We added a Windows executable! Please comment if you have problems with it.

08-02-14: Ported to javascript some time ago, available under the web link now.

Alternatively, you can run the source. You'll need python 2.x (works on 2.7, not on 3.x) and pygame to play, README is included.

There are 15 levels, and it includes a goat. ;) Please leave a comment!

links.label: Source (Linux, Windows, OSX, requires python 2.x & pygame)

entries.title: Noble Weapon
entries.description:
You play as an evil knight, fixated on kidnapping princesses. The objective is to see how many of them you can successfully store in your lair. Numerous heroes are out to stop you, and your only way of fending them off are the noble weapons: the princesses.

Each type of princess has a unique ability that you can use while carrying them. However, taking damage from a hero will cause you to drop the princesses you're currently carrying, so you have to toss them into your lair eventually!

Unfortunately I couldn't get around to making background music for the game, but I'm satisfied with how the art and gameplay turned out.

This is my fourth time entering the Ludum Dare competition. I had trouble coming up with a concrete idea for this theme, jumping back and forth between concepts in my head for the first 26 hours or so. I'm glad I managed to finish it with the time I had left, with sufficient time to polish it. :)

Details on how to play are in-game, but just for redundancy:

-----
Controls
-----
<Left arrow> - Run left
<Right arrow> - Run right
<Z-key> - Jump
<X-key> - Princess' ability
<Space> - Unload princesses into lair entrance

-----
Additional controls
-----
M - Toggle muting sound effects
R - Quick restart mid-game


- Meep

entries.title: Psycho Santa
entries.description:
*Really sorry about the hosting problem, though it should be fixed now. I wish I had at least gotten some notification that the download limit was exceeded. Thanks to whoever downloaded the source to play and rate.

Read instructions first: http://pastebin.com/KwAcUppT

entries.title: Skeletal Archer Archie
entries.description:
You play Archie, a sympathetic skeletal archer in his quest to make contact with a nearby human village. Things don't always go so easy.

A real time unit micromanagement game.

entries.title: Sunday
entries.description:
Hello guys,

it was sadly impossible for me to stay the complete weekend at the ludum dare event. I had only a few hours. Hopefully you will have some fun with my endless and little game. :-)

I gave my game a small touch from the end of the world. It was impossible for me to ignore this. xD

I have only used the "JQuery" framework.

Game:
You have to burn down all the trees and houses to get some points. The game is endless and has now end. Try to get the highest score.

kindly regards
Cy4n1d

entries.title: A Chistmas Rebel
entries.description:
A Shoot 'Em Up platformer where you play an elf wanting to ruin Christmas by killing all the reindeer's.  This is my second Ludum Dare and I am a 14 year old game developer.

REQUIRES JAVA

entries.title: A Villain Monster
entries.description:
Control the Villain Monster, catch humans with your tongue and eat them to survive.

---

The game has been implemented in CSS & HTML Canvas (Javascript) with the help of these libraries: jQuery, Backbone.js (+Underscore.js), Illuminated.js.

I wish I had more time to finish it, I wanted to port the basic collision system to a proper physic engine (using Box2d) and also to make the tongue behave like a "string" so it can be more realistic and fun.

My main achievement in this project was to make the graphics with Inkscape (not being a designer, I'm proud of my top-down walk sprites :-)).

This was my initial draft: https://twitter.com/greweb/status/279884502220812288

The game source code is available on Github  http://github.com/gre/ld25 .

And is online on http://gre.github.com/ld25

entries.title: Angry Purple Monster
entries.description:
Help the angry purple monster escape the army!

Controls:
ctrl -> shoot
arrow keys -> moviment

Game made with the Blender Game Engine using only logic Bricks!

3D graphics and logic bricks: Blender
2D graphics: Gimp
Sounds: sfxr
Music: Otomata (Music Gerenator) and edited with Reaper

entries.title: Bertie the Butcher
entries.description:
"Bertie the Butcher is a serial killer in training. Guide him through ten levels taking out targets, avoiding the fuzz, and cleaning up after himself."

Due to a combination of lacking the ability to 'art' and wanting to try out something different, I kept (for the most part) within the constraints of the Gameboy: 160x144 resolution, 4 color palette and 8x8 sprites.

The general idea of the game is to take out all the targets in the level (cops are optional, but be careful because they will shoot you on sight if panic is high, and recognise you if you get too close). Any time a target sees blood or a murder, the panic level will increase. If the panic level gets too high, the targets will avoid you and the cops will chase and shoot you.


Controls:
WASD/cursor keys to move
SPACE to attack
SHIFT to clean

entries.title: Escape
entries.description:
My game is about four villains, who stole 10 000 from bank.
Game full of adventures)
Controlls:
WASD - move;
Mouse left button - shoot (at out of car scenes)
Arrows - controll in menu.
That's all. Enjoy playing!)


PS: My english is worse, and i will be very appreciate, if you will correct mistakes in in-game messages. Thanks!!

UPD: Some common problems is crashing when OpenAL is not installed, or OpenGL driver is old. Please update videocard driver or install OpenAL.

entries.title: Evil Wall
entries.description:
This is my first ludum dare entry, it may not be the best game in the world :) but it is something.
Controls with arrow keys or WASD, and space. Try to block the good guys' ways to help the bad guy catch them!

entries.title: Fearless
entries.description:
In the deep of a dungeon there is a magical treasure box.
You have to defeat the mysterious villain to obtain it!

Controls: Arrow keys to move, C to close eyes.

* There are more than one endings.
* In the later level, maybe you will find out that the screen is complete dark. It's NOT a bug. It's something you did earlier cause that happen. Just go STRAIGHT and you are able to see ending#1. And you are able to try again...in another play style?
* If you find a door, push it!

Engine: cocos2d-html5
Art: GraphicsGale FreeEdition
Other tools: Tiled, Zwoptex

Update: Uploaded the post combo version, only change the text in ending#1.

entries.title: Final Plan
entries.description:
My first ludum dare was a success. Here is my game "Final Plan".
You are just about to destroy the world, but then the heroes arrive! Defeat the heroes and continue your malicious plan.

The jar file should work with linux and mac too.

There is a little bug with the web version. When you go to next level it should show a text "Heroes loaded the game".

If the game dosen't work update your Java.

entries.title: Grand Wreck Auto
entries.description:
You are a thug, who like violence and to vandalize things punching them. Your aim is to destroy all cars on the screen avoiding cops.
Try to destroy cars when cops are far enough. If a cop see you vandalizing a car, he run to you and hit your face with a club!
I'm sorry for the bugs. I'll try to remove them soon.
Enjoy the game and leave me a comment.

Controls:
Arrow keys = move
Z = throw a punch

UPDATE: I uploaded a post-jam version of the game, where I solved some bugs and activated all menus. The game is also a bit more easy to complete since I improved collision detection.
There is also available a jam version for OSX.

Gameplay video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cBP8YEpjIuU

entries.title: Hairy Scary Wolf
entries.description:
My first jam!  What a whirlwind few days it's been.  I enjoyed flexing my coding muscles and look forward to some practice weekends in the future.

I figure I'd turn the fairytale dynamic on its head.  In Hairy Scary Wolf, you must hunt and eat forest critters and lost children, as you feed on both their blood and their fear.  Witches may offer assistance as well.

More later, must upload!

entries.title: In good heart
entries.description:
Ports may or may not be coming.

===

Level 3: if you lose when you think you have won, (without giving too much away) you probably pushed it to cause the 'victory' yourself, which signifies to the overlord that you are immediately a traitor.

Everything explained in game!

It may seem confusing! Read the level 1 tutorial (under 'help' on the menu) very carefully, as it explains everything you need to do to complete that level and how the game works in general. It's intended to be partially a puzzle game, so no tutorials for the other levels.

===

If you died and you don't know why, one of these happened:
-The suspicion bar grew to maximum
-You died
-You killed the player (big blue thing)
-You did something which signified immediate treachery (such as blowing up the person you need to protect)

entries.title: Jesus, The crocidile
entries.description: W,A,S,D to move and you must get as much elephants as possible withen 50 sec, avoid the hunters though or you will die and get your points reduced by 5 increments. Have fun!i used stencyl so theres just crocidle.stencyl or what ever.

entries.title: Kidnap
entries.description:
You are the villain - Click to fire at the other ships, once destroyed drag a selection to kidnap the crew. Collecting green numbers provides additional time, but beware of the red penalties. The objective is to capture as many people as possible. Good Luck!

Extract all files from the zip before attempting to run.

Requires .NET Framework 4.5 on Windows, Should also work on other OS's using Mono (untested)

Press M to mute/unmute sounds if they get too annoying

For the adventurous types amongst you the ship designs are saved as xml files. There are separate files for the player ship and enemy ships ;)

entries.title: Kidnap the princess
entries.description: WASD to move. You need to kidnap the princess.

entries.title: Kill Butterflies
entries.description:
So, I was planning on this Ludum Dare for weeks, but had also been planning on going to a debate tournament the same weekend. I know both of them were coming up I just for some reason didn't associate in my mind that they were the same weekend.

It was too late to back out of the debate tournament, so I went begrudgingly and, huzzah, took first place. I had just enough time left in my busy weekend to cobble together this game in about 3-4 hours to submit to the Jam. I know it may be a meager offering but I am totally thrilled to have finished and submitted something to my FIRST LUDUM DARE! It was a great experience, although obviously next time I will make sure I have the weekend free.

I made the game in XNA.

Controls:
WASD to move, arrows to shoot. Hit as many green things as you can and don't get hit by any blue things.

entries.title: London Bridges
entries.description:
In London Bridges, you play as a bridge near the end of its life. People are trying to cross your bridge, but you decide it's best for you if you throw them off so they fall to their death in the whirl pool below.

All sounds (even the goats and birds) were me, and all the music is played on one of two baroque recorders.

For platforms other than Windows, go to http://love2d.org/ and download the appropriate installation. Download the "LOVE2D" download from here and pass it as an argument to the application you installed earlier.

entries.title: Path to Death
entries.description:
Path to Death is a turn based tower defense game written in XNA and based on an own framework (GB2D). You need the .NET 4.0 [0] and the XNA 4.0 [1] framework to play my game. It's (sadly) Windows-only.

The good forces start on the left and after each round, they progress from location to location. You are the tyrant's saboteur which travels to the locations and manipulates them.

Collect your skillpoints, invest them in the location's skilltree and defend the throne on the right!

All gameplay relevant information is presented as tooltips within the game. The buttons are on the screen's bottom. You just need the mouse (cursor) and the left mouse button.

I hope you enjoy my art and the skilltree as the gameplay focus.


[0] http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851
[1] http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Revenge of Dr. Green
entries.description:
It's a wrap! My first entry in Ludum Dare. It's been tough, but fun :)

Tools:
- HaxePunk
- Sublime Text 2
- Tiled

- Photoshop
- GraphicsGale

- FL Studio
- AS3Sfxr

- Git (thank you god)

Hope you enjoy it! :D

entries.title: Scary Chicken
entries.description:
"A fox has got to eat! Collect all the eggs to fill your belly, but beware the scary chicken."

The fox sprite was created by Desto:
http://scratch.mit.edu/users/Desto

entries.title: Steve vs the Internet
entries.description: Steve doesn't like cats - evidently. One day he goes on the Internet, which pushes him a little too far so he goes on a murderous rampage, vowing to run over all the cats he can until his car explodes. Use the arrow keys or WASD keys to control the cars' speed. Sorry about the 'moony' physics, I had it set to fixed frame rate whilst I was developing and changed it to a dynamic frame rate before release.

entries.title: Super Paper Monster Smasher
entries.description:
Welcome to Super Paper Monster Smasher. Have the Super Paper Monster attack by pressing the left or right side of the screen with your mouse or finger (on touch screen devices). Make sure to smash all of your opponents. Avoid flying arrows and boulders while trying to eat goats to heal yourself.

This game was built using ImpactJS and requires a modern browser capable of supporting Canvas and Audio such as IE 9+, Chrome, Firefox and Safari. Also optimized to run on mobile phones and tablets (without sound).

entries.title: They're In Our Base!
entries.description: A number of spies have broken into your base. Attempt to stop them from reaching you!

entries.title: Twisted Minion
entries.description:
Find out what its like to be the minion! Prevent the hero from getting your treasure. As the adventurer moves from room to room you get a new chance to kill him. Good luck.

Controls:
Attack - X
Move - Arrow Keys

To play: Unzip to anywhere, run TwistedMinion.exe

coding, music - Taylor O'Brien
coding, art - Justin Kibbe

UPDATE: The game was meant to have more levels and the adventurer health had reflected that making it impossible to win (without exploiting a known bug). His health has been reduced to allow people to win with the levels we have.

entries.title: You Are The Level Designer!
entries.description:
This is what I could do in 48 hours with a concept that I'd really like to expand upon. It's got 8 levels, weak graphics, and my own first attempts at puzzle/level design... but I'll write about that strange situation another time.

In this game, you modify a platformer level in real-time to make sure that it's able to be completed by this goofy little person who runs around it automatically!

Created using Processing.

I'm trying to get a ProcessingJS version to a playable state. In the meantime, there is an applet version. It runs terribly on certain configurations, and I disabled the sound because it wasn't working correctly! Sorry!

I'd really appreciate feedback! If you like the game, let me know so I have a reason to develop this concept further! All suggestions are welcome!

entries.title: Baboom:The Villain
entries.description:
You are big creature and you hate cities.
Your target: to travel given distance as fast as possible.
Controls: Mouse left button
   - click to start sliding
   - click and hold to open your mouth

Eat Humans to get small extra speed and eat GOATS to get extra time for opened mouth.
Use shop and spend your money to upgrade.

entries.title: Clarion Call
entries.description:
!! IMPORTANT !! 
XNA 4.0 redist: 
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=a88c6dec-aeae-42cd-a108-d35c013c3b97 
.NET 4.0 web installer: 
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/en/details.aspx?FamilyID=9CFB2D51-5FF4-4491-B0E5-B386F32C0992 

If you are missing either of these, the game will crash. 

== How to play ==
WASD moves, space shoots. What else can you ask for?

The three bars on the right are: Energy, Shield, and Armor respectively. Higher tech modules and ships are unlocked as you needlessly murder ships.

Watch the stats on higher tech modules carefully, some scale better or differently than others.

== Fitting and you ==
There are three damage types:
Explosive, which is caused by missiles.
Energy, which is cased by plasma weapons.
Physical, which is caused by bullets. There are resist modules for each damage type, so fit carefully.

The size difference between the starter ship and the highest tech battleship is very large! The battleships can tank a lot more damage natively, where the frigates need to duck and weave. Plan your damage patterns accordingly, as some projectiles are easier to dodge than others.

Some ships also have different native shield and armor stats. Tinker around with regeneration levels until you find something you like! Also keep in mind that if you have at least 1 shield HP it will absorb the entire impact, so small fast regenerating shield mods can be useful in different ways.

Windows 8 users: If you have trouble with this let me know.

entries.title: Elevator Evil
entries.description:
You are an evil elevator! Your goal is drop the mans of at the wrong floor so they get stressed out and eventually explode!When the mans realise that they're on the wrong floor they will be damaged by stress. The more stressed out they are, the more damage they take. This is indicated by the number over their head. The further away from the correct floor they are, the more stress they take. If you drop them at the correct floor though, the will be relieved and lose stress.

Made in C# and XNA. Other programs used were Photoshop, Sonar, Audacity, Paint.net and Visual Studio 2010.

This has been my first publicly released game. I hope you enjoy.


SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS

PC running Windows XP/Vista/7/8
DirectX 9 GPU that supports at least shader model 2.0

Additional frameworks:
- .NET 4.0:
  http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=17851
- XNA 4.0:
  http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Evil Cat
entries.description:
Evil Cat is as cute as dangerous and it's here to bring chaos and destruction to your home. 

The objective is easy, destroy everything in the house. Push, scratch and jump on everything. The more objects you destroy the stronger the cat gets. There are 7 cat power levels and the strongest object is the washing machine.

Controls are easy, use the cursor keys to move left, move right and jump.

The game has been developed using Flash and Box2D.

Inspired by my cats.

entries.title: Evil Rover
entries.description:
You are the curiosity rover who has suddenly find a life on Mars. But you don't wat to contact with them, you just want to kill them.
Warning: I don't recommend to play it on FF because it drain your ram.

entries.title: FRAKKER
entries.description:
Its a twisted clone of the game frogger, but with all the difficulty of the original. Essentially, you play as one of the many Car Drivers who run over the small animals (cats, dogs, FROGS!!!) trying to cross the road (humans too) Enjoy!!! 

P.S   This game is really difficult, just try to get 10,000 points, you'll see what I mean.

entries.title: Goat Hate Jug Band
entries.description:
===============
java required
===============
Some notes:

Obviously I have included a goat.
Sound is very important is this game, so don't play it without. 
I already knew upfront I would only have one day, and this is my first Ludum Dare, but I am actually very satisfied with what I produced and very excited to find out how other people like it.


==============================================

Goat Hate Jug Band

Every night on Nedreck Farm three farmers come together. Billy (washboard), Bobby (banjo) and Buck (jug) play the best Jug Band music in the whole area. Every living creature enjoys a good Jug Band, except for one. You are Goat. Goat Hate Jug Band. So every time the sun sets on Nedreck Farm Goat shows op with only one goal: to get Billy, Bobby and Buck to stop before it's dark so he can get rest. 



Help:
Before Goat can bleat he needs air. Breathe by holding SPACE. But don't breathe in for too long or Goat will choke. The more breath the more disturbing the sound. Bleating is only disturbing on the beginning of a bar.

entries.title: Greater of Two Evils
entries.description:
Hooray for board games!

UPDATE: rewrote some of the rules for clarity. Added "acknowledgements" section. Thanks to Alan Hazelden (@draknek) for valuable feedback leading to this update.

You are a villainous mastermind, able to leech life from the surroundings at your slightest whim. You take pleasure ruining the natural beauty of the world and the bountiful resources available to ordinary men. And yet -- you are not alone in your despicable cravings! During your travels, you encounter a rival, bent on the same unearthly desires as your own. Unable to agree on how best to divy up the land, you resort to tearing through and consuming all before your opponent can.

Claim your place as the most cunning, ruthless, and unfeeling villain this insignificant part of the world has ever known!

You will probably have to print this out and find a friend to play with, if you want to really experience the game.


NOTE: Contains goats.

entries.title: Hopesington
entries.description:
Make your mark.

Made from haxe, nme, nape and bfxr.

entries.title: Invasion!
entries.description:
EDIT: The "Non-ascii characters" bug should be fixed now.

Long has humanity longed for a game that would quench their bloodlust. Their thirst for pure mayhem.

Instead, they got this.

You play as the captain of the invading alien mothership, attacking the pitiful hu-mans and robbing them of thier valuable scrap metal.

Instructions:

WASD to move
Click to fire the lazor
IOP to upgrade ship with scrap
H to repair ship with scrap while not firing the laser.

Scrap is accumulated by killing enemies.
Each upgrade costs 100 scrap multiplied by your current level.

There is a hidden goat in the game, see if you can find it(Protip: check the source).

entries.title: Kill the hero with fast swarms of bats!
entries.description:
I wish i could have accomplished more, just got busy with other things. Either way I'm happy I was able to learn some new stuff, and create a game :D. This might work on linux, i just haven't tested it. It's using libgdx with lwjgl, so the native packaging is pretty good. Download anyone of the links to try it.

Note that when you beat the hero, the game will just auto close, Wasn't able to implement an end screen or reset button in time :).

entries.title: MidBoss
entries.description:
In MiniBoss you play the weakest demon in the dungeon, an imp with no talent at all aside from the ability to possess defeated foes. Defeat the other denizens of the dungeon, learn their secrets, and rise to become the new end boss!

Please note that hitting 'L' several times will resize the combat log to various sizes so you can pick whichever is most comfortable to you, unlike what the game says it's not an on/off thing. This let's you know what's going on better.

Windows is a binary package without dependencies. Any other platform can download the source and run the game through MidBoss.py, requires Python 2.7 and Pygame

EDIT: Fixed a bunch of crashing bugs, if anyone downloaded this before, I suggest redownloading it now.

UPDATE: If you like the game, please keep an eye on my Twitter or this page for a post compo polished release which will hopefully address a lot of issues people are having and include some new extra features.

entries.title: Nefertiti
entries.description:
You are Nefertiti a mutated spider from auter space!! Get to Nasa, grab the next shuttle to outer space and maybe eat some humans in the way. Beware some humans are so unhealthy that they'll make you sick!


known bugs:
   -none

Goats added!!

entries.title: Mr Toothy
entries.description:
I created this using ShiVa, UVUnwrap Pro, Lightwave, Corel, GIMP, GlueIT, GarageBand, and used a PC and a MAC.

You are the villain - a very hungry shark. Turn left and right by clicking left or right of the shark.  Click up high to go fast (chews up food) or on the shark to slow down. 

Use the triangles to locate humans to feed on.  Gain the highest score before your food runs out. 

If you get stuck you have either hit a rock or the edge of the level.  Turn 180 and tap up at the top of the screen to move away.  Enjoy!

I wanted to make so much more.  Perhaps I'll flesh it out into a bigger game later.  Hope you enjoy it.

CHANGELOG: (v1.1) 19/12/2012 - fixed bug so that turning and moving scaled depending on frame rate of players machine to make the shark move at the same speed on everyones computer.  (30 second change to rotation * dt and translation * dt)

CHANGELOG: (v1.2) 21/12/2012 - converted controls to use left / right arrows to turn and up to speed up.  Added some 3d cartoony rocks and encircled area with an atoll to keep player inside.  You don't stop on rocks but they slow you right down, making for smoother game-play.  You also stop completely to munch on humans before moving on.  Please try out the new build but don't vote on that one obviously.

entries.title: POW MIA
entries.description: Tested on Google Chrome

entries.title: Rise of the Ancients
entries.description:
Built in Haxe using HaxeFlixel.

Joey on the Art.
Adam with the Sound and background music.

Myself with the programming


You are the ancient mayan alien race, heading back to earth to erect your tower to the gods. You must build a tower and reach the gold coin before being destroyed by the humans.

entries.title: Space Lord
entries.description: Create enemy ships with the mouse. Try to keep things fun for the "player"!

entries.title: Storm the Castle
entries.description:
The concept of this game is a reverse tower defence game where you play the units. Send out waves of units to storm the castle!

One thing that I wanted to implement yet didn't have time to was dynamic level generation. I most likely will continue to work on this project and release it as a full game separate to the LD competition.

The fourth level should be impossible to beat since I didn't get the dynamic level generation working. Can you pass it?

You can check http://youtube.com/user/designsbyzephyr or http://vanZeben.ca for information :D

entries.title: Super Natural Habitat Destroyer
entries.description:
Super Natural Habitat Destroyer is a game in which you control an angry lumberjack who is trying to gather as much wood as possible. However there are some beavers that live in the forest, and they won't let you destroy their habitat without a fight.

Controls:
The whole game is mouse controlled. Hold your mouse to move the character, move over enemies or trees to chop them.

Chopping down trees gives you logs, which can be used to upgrade your character. Beware though, chopping down trees will also spawn beavers at the beaver den.

The purpose of each level is destroying the beaver den. Levels ramp up in difficulty quick, so you might want to 'farm' and redo some levels to get stronger with upgrades.

3 days wasn't enough to finish the game, but it makes a nice prototype.

Art by Ziryf, Programming by Rilem


spacebar haz magic

entries.title: The Good Doctor
entries.description:
Story:
In the 14th century, the bubonic plague wiped out over a third of the European population. Entire villages are being decimated, and you've been separated from your children. Your goal is to reunite with them and leave the village.

Controls:
WASD or Arrow Keys to move.

Confession:
Sorry for the absence of real gameplay. I tried a few new things this time around (hand-drawn artwork, music, etc), all of which took far longer than I had anticipated to implement, and so I had no time left to add more depth. Also, you might notice there are no side walls on any of the buildings and that everything looks rather plain. This is due to my having at the last minute to scrap the 3D effect I had worked so hard on for the walls. While the effect looked good initially, once it was applied to the full map, the framerate dropped way down and I just didn't have enough time to make it efficient enough to be playable. In the end, I decided scrapping the effect altogether was the best decision.

Bug fix:
(12/16/2012 8:35PM CST) Fixed the ending screen so that it doesn't fade out immediately upon becoming visible. Now, you should actually be able to see it properly.

Post-Compo Version:
For those that are curious, I have finally optimized and fixed the 3D effect that was originally planned for the game and included it with the Post-Compo version. The gameplay is still the same (which is to say virtually nonexistent), but I may decide to expand on it at some point if I feel I have any really good ideas for it.

entries.title: Trip of Doom
entries.description:
The citizens are fed up with their boring lives. While they're all on a cruse, you want to do them a favor and destroy their homes, which would give them the joy of variety. Unfortunately the military doesn't like change, so they'll shoot you with their artillery as soon as they notice your wonderful plan.

Controls:

Movement: WASD
Fire you laser: Left mouse button / CTRL
Jump: Space

(of course you can configure that yourself)

Sometimes jumping doesn't work... I have no idea why this happens, but lets just say it is totally intentional.


Additional Gameplay Info:
Although I'm quite sure you will sooner or later notice that stuff yourself, but here are some background infos for the gameplay:

If you destroy stuff the robot will become faster, but it will also cause more artillery shots. If you stop destroying things you will become slower again, but the artillery shots will continue.
On top of being faster you will only do more damage, including the laser.

The green light indicates that you can jump again.
The red light gives you a rough measurement of your current "rage" level.

Nearly everything can be destroyed. (including the skyscrapers, but not the walls.. they are the boundary of the map)


Here is a link to the build folder. I didn't have place for all the build options... unity is awesome!

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/amocst9g4e21usq/jOOne7jZXN/Trip%20of%20Doom

entries.title: Evil Inc.
entries.description:
Mad Scientist:
When equipped to a lab scientists work to research upgrades to your building and personel. These upgrades are then added to your purchase menu

Thief:
When equipped to a warehouse thieves will go stealing and add stolen goods to that warehouse.

Hired Muscle:
Hired muscles can be assigned to either labs or warehouses. They defend it by fighting invaders. They lose  if the cumulative power of the muscle on the floor is less than the invading hero.

Policeman:
Policemen go to a random warehouse floor. If they are successful they will arrest all criminals on that floor and empty it of loot.

Superhero
Superheroes go to a random laboratory floor. If they are successful they will arrest all criminals on that floor and disable the floor.

The Yard:
The yard is where new random recruits come and wait. You may assign them to a floor from here. If you don't they will eventually wander off. Heroes will go through here so you will be able to know what kind of hero is coming.

Warehouse:
Theives add loot to your warehouse when equipped. This accumulates and at any point you may cash it in by fencing the goods. However while fencing goods your thieves can't steal and any thieves out stealing will return to help.

Laboratory:
You equip scientists to labs where they research upgrades to your buildings. When their research is finished it is added to your store where you can purchase it.

Game designed and created by David Wallin and Wasif Zaman.

entries.title: Local Mastermind
entries.description:
!!! WARNING !!!
This is not a game! 
This is a self-maintaining simulation!
Move around the town and watch people doing things, but you can not interject!

=============================================
I wanted to generate a little town and let the player hire thugs to collect protection money, beat up civilians and steal from stores.

You would have to manage your thugs and get rid of the ones that don't collect you enough money, or raise too much police suspicion.

You would also have to organize heists, synchronizing everybody's schedule and distracting the police.


Sadly I only managed it to get the simulation-part done.
There are some ui buttons, but they are all not working.

You can click on People to see what they are doing.

=============================================
Here are some ai examples:

Thugs go to a node and wait for other people to arrive, once they arrive the thug stops them and harasses them until he gets 5$. After some time they move to another node.

NEETs commute between the library and the park to relax on both places.

Workers go to work until they are tired.
Each worker has a job in a dedicated building.

Every person has a dedicated home.
Everybody returns home when they are tired.
Everybody eats when they are at home and hungry.
If there is no food at home they go to the store and bring new food home.
Every action increases sleepiness and hunger.

entries.title: Lunar Frenzy
entries.description:
I wasn't be available for the last ~15 hours or so of the competition, which forced me to reduce the scope for my project quite a bit. However, here's my submission, of which I'm very proud: Lunar Frenzy!

"After years of living under the shadow of puny planets, an oversized moon goes rogue, in a revenge-fueled trip across the universe with one goal only: smash all those planets into tiny little pieces. Will it succeed? Or will it fall to the many space-mines that litter the galaxy?"

The game was made with touch controls in mind, so I strongly suggest you play the Android version if you have the chance. All comments are extremely appreciated! And don't forget to post your highscore!

Greetings from Costa Rica!

entries.title: Villain Idol
entries.description:
This project was done in 48 hours. The idea of the concept is here but we lack seriously of polish.

Our pitch: "Imagine a reality tv-show where the goal is to enter in the villains hall of fame".

All the sounds and music are original creations done in the weekend. Same for design and conception of the game. Some graphics are originals and the others were used for the cliches.

I'll be honest. The point of this game is to challenge you to learn hidden patterns in space and time and to think nonlinearly. That's not an easy task. Many people don't get it. That is ok. You won't get it after one play. You won't get it after 10. After 50 times, 100, then you're probably getting somewhere. 

Why is 6 afraid of 7? Because 789. Now, all the 9's are gone. So the 6's are in trouble. Lucky for you, you get to be the 7. But watch out, your other 7's have it out for you! How many 6's can you eat?

Left/Right arrow keys to move. Tap Left/Right touch screen to move on tablet. Open your mind.

789 is an HTML5 game. The game is written using javascript engine CreateJS. The graphics were created using Artboard. The game is simple, and limited to a single level high score challenge. I have a lot of stuff going on this weekend, so I could only spend a couple hours on this. I've tested it on multiple modern browsers on PC, Mac, iPad, and iPhone.

Twitter: @rumachine
Email: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Blog: www.rumachine.com

In response to some comments, I am adding a hint description:

Just imagine the the 7 is a boat in the ocean, and that that there is a weird current that makes it float in a different direction depending on where it is in the screen. Also, imagine that when you press right it accelerates it in one direction (not necessarily right), and when you press left it accelerates in the opposite direction. Only, you don't get to see the current and you don't get shown what direction the control pushes it! 

Also, I made it even more difficult by making the direction of the current  in the background random for each new game :) and also making the current time varying. So, that means that each time you play, you have to learn a little about how it will respond to your L/R (touch screen) input and then try and catch 6's.

Hint: At the beginning, the hidden current will be either right or left above the vertical center line, and the opposite direction below. Pressing R will accelerate the 7 either up or down, and L will accelerate it in the opposite direction. Hope this helps!

The whole process of learning how the 7 moves in response to your inputs (in space and time) is the main point of the game. It's not supposed to be easy! It's really, really hard!

It's a slow frustration at first, then an anxious addiction. Wagner helps both. Also, if this is too much for you, or just enough for you, sigsys for iOS (my first game ever) may be your cup of tea.

entries.title: A day in the life of a MINI BOSS
entries.description:
NOTE: No Audio.

"what are mini bosses doing before the player gets there". This was the question I asked, to get the full perspective of our villains.  So I set out to make a goofy little game that answers this, where you spend a little while actually waiting for the guy to show up before you engage in battle. I didn't actually finish it as I didn't get to devote as much of the weekend as I'd wanted to the game jam. Right now you can't actually win, there's just some avoidance AI for the hero. Hopefully you'll get a general idea and maybe think it's funny.  There's a lot of work to do yet, but the core is in there somewhere.  Thanks for checking it out!

entries.title: Feline Homicide
entries.description:
Lawrence Krume was a man who didn't take half measures. 
Perfect attendance. Exemplary work. Never took a sick day. Lawrence did everything as well as he could.

"Listen, Lawrence. This isn't easy for me.  Your work is first rate, and you seem like a nice guy, but you know 
how it is. Cutbacks, and so on. As of 5 o'clock today, you need to be out of here."

Lawerence sat in his cubicle, pencil in one hand. Tap-tap-tap-tap. Pencil against paper.

Lawrence couldn't drive home. He couldn't face the ramshackle apartment, the one-bedroom 
hellhole he couldn't even afford anymore.  He needed an answer. A burlap bag on the side of the road. 
A head popped out. He saw the answer in its beady eyes.

He pulled up to the lake. Well, more like a pond. Bag in one hand, he got out and closed the door 
carefully behind him. Walked up to the shore. Stuck his hand in the bag. Pulled out a cat. Threw it in. 
That feels good.

Confused, the cat swam toward shore. Toward Lawrence. Stupid cat. Lawrence walked forward 
and kicked it back in.  He threw in another cat. Still feels good.

Lawrence knew why he was here. Lawrence would keep doing what felt good 
until he didn't feel anything anymore.



Goal: 
Reduce the pond's beauty (the score) while keeping your pleasure (left side gauge) above zero.

Throwing cats increases your pleasure, but the thrill is less every time. 
If a cat escapes, Lawrence gets stressed. 

You can keep the cats at bay by kicking them. 
Cats drown if they spend too long in the water.

Controls:
'wasd' or arrows to move
left ctrl or left click to throw 
space to kick

entries.title: Mothership: The Sequel
entries.description:
Due to the incredible popularity of Mothership: The Original, the developers at TDG! Studios were obliged (undoubtedly by gun point) to create a sequel. There was just one problem: everyone died in the first game when the Sun exploded, annihilating everyone the the solar system.

In a desperate attempt, one designer asked the question: "Can't we just make the same game from the Mothership's perspective?" And that is how Mothership: The Sequel came to be.

Controls are simple: The purple ship on the right is the Mothership. The green circles on the Mothership are your minions. Click on a minion and drag toward the Hero ship (left) and release. Continue doing this until the Hero is dead. Collect the health boxes in-between rounds by flinging Minions at them. Repeat until game is beaten.

Thanks for playing!
