entries.title: The Fall and Rise of Rome: Patient 0 A.D.
entries.description:
A known bug where when an enemy player dies, but have his animation interrupted so he is standing up instead of being dead. bad animation/timing engine.

Please don't run anything CPU intensive while playing. As far as I can tell, that affects the gameplay. Another issue arising from the timing issues with my framework. Just bad coding hahaha.

Mac version's Box2D runs slightly sluggish and character movement depends on those functions.

Linux Notes
I've heard the game captures all keyboard events. You might not be able to alt-tab or take a screenshot because of this. It's just leftovers from the framework I was working on last year.

It might run faster than normal.

entries.title: The Rise and Fall of Professor Moriarty
entries.description:
The Rise and Fall of Professor Moriarty is a real-time strategy rogue-like in which you create a vast criminal network throughout a foggy ancient London.  Moriarty, the infamous mastermind from Sherlock Holmes, must balance his greed with his ambition as he stretches his web of vice throughout the city.  You will eventual fall, but the rise is its own reward. 

HOW TO PLAY
- Hover over a lair to bring up the build menu.
- Drag out a thief next to a source of gold (orange circles) to steal gold. 
- If you are being attacked by the police, drag out a thug.  Thugs will destroy police and wreck nearby buildings. 
- If you wish to expand your criminal network, build out a lair.  Lairs can build new lairs, thieves and thugs. 
- Use '+' and '-' to adjust sound. 

STRATEGY
- When gold runs out, your criminal network dissolves.  
- The size of each node shows you its loyalty. 
- To increase loyalty, acquire more gold.  

WINNING
- You earn 1 point for each lair in your network. 
- Get the highest score possible. 

Team: 
- Fedor Jutte (@fejuto)
- Benjamin de Jager (@M0rph3v5)
- Daniel Cook (@danctheduck)
- Music from Andrew Riley at Lucky Lion Studios (@luckylionstudio)
- Special thanks to Brian Carter who jumped in with graphic design awesomeness & advice

TOOLS
Language: Haxe (http://haxe.org/)
Libs: NME (http://www.haxenme.org/), HaxeFlixel (http://www.haxeflixel.com/), Actuate (https://github.com/jgranick/actuate)
Editor: FDT (http://fdt.powerflasher.com/)
Graphical tool: Adobe Illustrator (http://www.adobe.com/products/illustrator.html)

So much still to do, but thank you for playing.  Appreciate any feedback.

entries.title: The Vault
entries.description: This is "The Vault", a stealth bank heist game.

entries.title: Villingen
entries.description:
You are playing Willy Willhelm, a Villain who causes mayhem and destruction in the city of Villingen. As to why he is doing so is unclear. 

The goal as a player is to maximise the destruction done to the city. Willy Willhelm is a bad boy hacker and therefor has gained access to the city's air traffic control system. By manipulating flight directions he cause crashes with  physical impact on the cities infrastructure.

You can drag the planes with your mouse after starting the game.

The Windows Version is bundled with a Java Runtime and a launcher executable, other platforms need Java installed to run this game.

entries.title: You Are The Virus
entries.description:
This is a game where you are a virus. Your job is to kill all plant/animal cells in your host. As you progress the cells in your host become more resistant and more and more antibodies and white blood cells appear to try to kill you. There are 10 fast-paced levels with the tenth level containing the goat cell boss.

Controls:
Left to pivot to the left
Right to pivot to the right
Forward to make your virus go the direction it is facing
Back to make your virus go the opposite way that it is facing.
Spacebar to attack
Esc to pause the game

Your Enemies:
White Blood Cells: White Blood Cells are fast and do quite a bit of damage but they will only charge at you when you are attacking an animal or plant cell. Hurts you if one touches you.
Anti-Bodies: Anti-Bodies are slightly slower and weaker than White Blood Cells but they will constantly follow you. Hurts you if one touches you.
Plant Cells: Plant Cells are stationary green rectangles that you must destroy to advance.
Animal Cells: Animal Cells are red circular moving cells that you must destroy to advance.

Attacking:
You attack by pressing the Spacebar. You can not move when you are attacking but you are able to pivot. If you are over a plant or animal cell you will start to do damage to it.

Note:
Sorry about not having any sound. I tried to implement some but I couldn't get it to work.

entries.title: Your Mind Hates You
entries.description:
"Your Mind Hates You" is a text-based game where you're playing as your own brain; specifically, the part of your brain that is purely negative and loves to berate you.  Your goal is to demoralize and beat down yourself until breaking point.

Lower your health to zero, and you'll be able to take an action that finishes the scenario.

NOTE: If you want to leave a scene in the middle of it, just type "exit".

entries.title: badass
entries.description: badass is a side scrolling action puzzle game where you are an agent and student of the school of badass(SOB). You must now set out to do some dubious deeds in order for you to graduate. You hack through computers and steal sensitive data while staying clear of death dealing blades to overzealous turrets.

entries.title: Bank Robber2.5D
entries.description:
So, unfortunately due to the nature of this compo i didn't get time to fix to rather serious bugs in my code. The first one is ridiculously noticeable, SPRITES RENDER THROUGH WALLS??? To be honest i don't know why but thats how it is. The second is if you touch the wall on this one angle it crashes the engine, so just don't run the player right up against the wall and you should be fine. 
CONTROLS:
Arrow keys:move/rotate
Spacebar:shoot

The idea was that your a bank robber trying to rob a bank, and the evil/good guard rats(huh?) are trying to stop you. Find the chest to win

P.S I did all the code on Linux and haven't tested on windows or mac but,it should be good.

entries.title: Bomb Time!
entries.description:
Bomb Time!

You play Alfred the evil bug who doesn't like they happy integrated circuits. Alfred is intent on killing them all using his special logic bombs, but he can't get too close, so he has to deliver them using the natural route, which passes antivirus protection and other obstacles.

Remember you're the villain! Help Alfred rid the computer world of these pesky happy chips!

I didn't have time to make a lot of levels, but if you do get stuck, just hit 'b' to skip a level.

entries.title: Cinders
entries.description:
Cinders the Bear likes to burn things. With a flamethrower. Rampage through the forests as you hunt down humans to cook for dinner!

Remember, only YOU can start forest fires.

Notes:
 - If you want to play with the source you'll need Python 2.7 and PyGame.
 - This game is Stephen Colbert's nightmare.
 - We use the Tiled level editor which you can download from www.mapeditor.org. I'll be making a video on making levels for this game in case anyone wants to try crafting their own levels to burn.

entries.title: Corruption
entries.description:
At last, here is our Ludum Dare entry. We were two, a programmer and a designer and we are really surprised that it was done in time but proud of what we have accomplished.

The idea: You are Lucifer and have been cast out of heaven and now free to walk the earth, spreading sin wherever you go. Watch out for God's army of angel who have been sent to end Lucifer's time on Earth.
How long will you survive God's wrath? Which sin will you corrupt the world with?

Hope you enjoy. :)

entries.title: Greed
entries.description:
***********************

Greed is a social experiment. I wanted to take a different approach on the theme, by not making you play a villain, but instead by making YOU the villain.

I've put 50$ at stake. In one month, on January 13th, I'll give those 50 bucks to someone. 

You break blocks, you earn points. You can keep those points, or give them to a charity. The more points you have, the more likely to be selected at the end you are. Easy maths.

I plan to post some statistics on the experiment after it ends.

Made with a fine blend of FlashPunk/Adobe Flash. Source coming shortly, sorry for the delay. 


***********************

entries.title: I Hate Christmas
entries.description:
This is my first time using GameMaker, so I tried to keep the scope small.  I hope everyone hates the holidays as much as I do. I know the hit detection is a little janky, but it would be too easy if it wasnt.  

(+goat)

Tools:
GameMaker Standard
LMMS
Audacity
Paint.NET

entries.title: Journey Of Evil
entries.description:
To become truly EVIL you have to learn to harm those who are really kind.

Evilness will grow upon destroying the kindness and consuming their soul.

But kindness and charm can hurt the EVIL inside you...

----------------------------------------------------

Since I had an really unfinished version of the game in the Compo submission I am updating this to a Jam Entry to submit another unfinished but updated version of the game..

The game doesn't have an "endgame" so if you reach the maximum level it doesn't have any more content (you can still walk around and slaughter). Originally I planned a bossfight but there was just no time for it.

-----------------------------------------------------

Missing Features:
- Princess model
- Boss
- Endgame / End sequence
- A rotating Goat Statue at the Center :(

Feel free to comment/critique/ask. ;)

**NOTE
- To attack an NPC get really close and leftclick until he starts run away. Catch them and rightclick to consume when close to him.

Controls:
WASD -> Move
Space -> Jump
Left Mouse -> Attack
Right Mouse -> Consume
I -> Invers Mouse Look on Y-Axis

entries.title: Kroc Le Vilain
entries.description:
Here is our entry for the Ludum Dare 25 Jam : Kroc le Vilain !

Pitch :
"Kroc was an evil final Boss, but no hero came up to him
 Then one day he decided to help the hero to finally kill him with his own fangs"

Gameplay :
It's kind of a rhythm game. You'll have to scare you're minions at the right time, in order to let the hero go further.

All of our work has been done during the jam (we started saturday afternoon).
Geraud de Courreges : Game design & programming
Antoine Druaux : Art, music & game design

Hope you'll enjoy it !

entries.title: Le Chasseur
entries.description:
You are the Hunter, you crave for blood and hunt the people of the city to feed your hunger.

The instructions are handed to you at the beginning of the game, that's all you need to play. The game is highly skill based and takes some time to get used to, you also have to manage your money carefull in order not to die due to lack of a vest or spare ammo.

MAKE SURE YOU PUT BOTH THE JAR AND THE NATIVES FOLDER IN THE SAME DIRECTORY WITHOUT RENAMING EITHER. POST CONSOLE OUTPUT IF IT DOESN'T OPEN AT ALL.

entries.title: Mr Wizard VS The World
entries.description:
This game isn't the most user-friendly, and for that I apologize.

You play as Mr Wizard, spawning monsters to fight those pesky heroes in this turn-based arena fighter!

Every turn, your mana increases. If you can't cast anything for any reason, press Enter to go on with the turn. If a hero attacks and you have no monsters spawned, you will lose HP and gain mana.

If nothing seems to happen on a turn, the monster(s) or hero(s) missed.

Controls are explained in-game, but I was unable to put some details in, such as the mana cost of each monster.

Here are the stats of every monster:

Slime:
HP: 2
STR: 1
DEF: 1
SPD: 1
COST 2

Skeleton:
HP: 2
STR: 1
DEF: 2
SPD: 2
COST 3

Goat:
HP: 3
STR: 2
DEF: 2
SPD: 2
COST 6

Cat:
HP: 3
STR: 3
DEF: 2
SPD: 3
COST 7

'Monster' 5 is a heal spell, which heals all monsters by 1 HP, and costs 5 mana.

I'm excited about the potential (I think) this game has, and will continue to improve it, maybe to the point where I think it could sell.

This game was made with Haxe + NME + HaxePunk. A linux build should be up soon.

entries.title: Obliterate the City
entries.description: Hammer your left mouse button until the city is levelled. For various reasons that are explained during the game.

entries.title: PANIC BANK
entries.description:
PANIC BANK

	You are The Sassiopath, a street smart villian that oozes with wit. You want things, people can damn well give them to you - which is why you have come to the
Bank. In here you are hoping to get rich; you're not worried if people's lives must be wasted. They practically lie down and 
wait to be robbed! This time, though, the patrons of the bank seem to be learning, gaining courage. If you aren't careful, you 
could end up at the bottom of the heap!

	CONTROLS:
arrow keys to move/aim
Z to jump
X to shoot
SPACE to pause

	OBJECTIVE:
	Collect a lot of points! Points are awarded by killing an npc and collecting money pickups. When
you kill an npc, they will instantly respawn again, and each time they respawn they  will get more courageous. Courage will 
affect how they act around you, such as if they attack, when they run away, and how fast they move. You will get more points
for killing a more courageous npc.


GOLD: It is a bank after all! Money pickups, although rare, will give a major boost to your score.

	ENEMIES
Cheryl-receptionist: Inbibed with magic she picked up at night school, Cheryl shoots fierce bolts of energy when she gets enough courage. stay away!
Richard-patron: This sad fellow is down on his luck, and just came here for a loan. He got a bit more than he expected.
Rose-Grandma: Grandma Rose is a kindly old soul, however she will turn fierce and attack you with her cane. 
Jimmy-youngster: Opening his first bank account, Jimmy is a pint-sized trouble maker thats a bit out of his depth
Mr Prowers-head banker: The oldest out of all of the patrons, Mr Prowers built this bank to where it is now. Until you came along and destroyed it. Nice work


NOTE:
The game isn't really done, not to the level we had hoped for, we will probably update this in the near future, so if you enjoyed this game, follow our Tumblr Dev Blog! http://shugor.tumblr.com/

ALSO JUST NOTICED, score link on main menu isn't working, but we're cutting it so close and don't want to risk it so check out the blog for later updates.

entries.title: Rest in Pixels
entries.description: Not the best game ever. But good enough to our very firs game ever (yeah... this is every team member's first game)

entries.title: Sammich-Napper
entries.description:
You are the lowest of the low, you get your kicks taking sammiches from the poor people, and delivering them to The Nefarious Dr. Goat. Dr. Goat is very strict, and demands all of his sammiches on time, no questions asked. Can you keep up?

The game is 10 levels long, with a special ending... 
I realize it is a bit counter-intuitive to have the controls outlined in a menu that requires you to use them, sorry.
Keyboard:
Shift = Sprint
Space = Jump
WASD = Move
Arrow-Keys = Move

Xbox Controller:
Right-Trigger = Sprint
A = Jump
Left-Thumbstick = Move

I fixed the no-install version, turns out I accidentally commented out the call to the method to update the sammiches. How, I am unsure.

entries.title: Super Agent Run
entries.description:
NOTE: You have to lose to see the theme tie-in.  Hopefully that wasn't too subtle. :)

Anyway, YOU ARE Super Agent Man. You are sworn to protect the king and his castle from bad guys by being the early warning scout. 

Today there is a problem and you must warn the king fast or else! 

Left and right arrows to run, space to jump, down arrow to roll, and hold a directional arrow against a wall and hit space to wall jump equal in power to the horizontal momentum you hit the wall with. Keep hitting space to jump higher. 

Lose to see the theme connection. 

I finished just in time! WOOT.

Also, I was going for an NES theme.  I mostly used 16x16 tiles and a 16x32 character, used a screen size of 256x240, and used only the 56 colors of the NES color palette, and made some box art.

Since ImpactJS is not a free engine, I removed it from my source download.  All of my code is there though.

entries.title: SUPER Witch Hunter Pro
entries.description:
Super Witch Hunter Pro

Don the spiffy buckled hat of Hopkins - a Puritan novice witch hunter. Keep the crowds (and Father Horatio) appeased with a steady stream of heretical souls, cleansed by raging flame.
How will history judge your actions? The hero of today is oft the villain on the morrow...
Goal: 
-Burn as many Witches to death as possible on the Pyres placed throughout the village to earn Purification Points.
-If left long enough, Witches will escape. Escaped witches will reduce your Piety. If your Piety reaches zero, game over!


Controls & Tips:

-Use the arrow keys or W,A,S,D to move about the village.
-Use P to pause the game.
-Stand close to Pyres to start a fire and accelerate fire growth. The Pyre must have wood (and a Witch!) to start a fire.
-Witches cannot escape while the Pyre is burning. Fire will diminish over time if left unattended. 
-Burning a witch to death or letting her escape will consume all wood from a Pyre. Gather extra wood from convenient Wood Piles at several locations. 
-Make sure to keep each Pyre stocked with wood so you're ready to start each fire when the Witch appears.
-Righteous Speed power-up will help you cover more ground.
-Holy Fire power-up will increase all active fires, and light any valid Pyres.
-Chain together several completed Witch burnings to increase your Purification Point multiplier.
-Banish the Goat Warlock for bonus points!

entries.title: Terra Day Massacre
entries.description:
It a little under developed. 
Untested in the non windows environments.
Compiled with Java 1.6

Press Enter to start. 
Press Enter or ESC to pause.
Use the Left and Right arrows to move.
Use Up to Jump.
Use Down to kill yourself.

A description of the game:
You are a trash elemental that wants to leave the dump. The game's gimmick is that when you die you leave trash behind and you can walk over it. The game got cut a little(read a lot) short the on the final screen each body you left behind falls into the land fill. I meant to have a credit screen here but I didn't get to it in time. The theme is that your struggle to get out of the dump ends up making more pollution. 

I apologize if you fall through the platform It doesn't happen on my computer. 

Code by Cameron Harding
Art by Anton Thrall

entries.title: The Hunt
entries.description:
I think that this is the most stupid game I've created. Using your mouse, you have to shoot everything that moves. That's it. There are 5 levels. The idea may be stupid, but I hope you'll get at least some fun out of this pointless shooting. :)

MOUSE = shoot
P = Pause

Entered Jam because of real-life interruptions, the game had a very short total development time (much less than compo time). I used AS3+Flashpunk.

Get 25 kill points to advance.
You gain 1 point for every kill.
You lose 2 points every miss.
You lose 1 points if one escapes their fate.
You're defeated if you have -10 kill points.

entries.title: Trapped in Paradice
entries.description:
You are a robot trapped in a paradice which only live things can leave without dying. You're obviously jelous, so go kill some bunnies.

CONTROLS:
UP Arrow - JUMP
LEFT/RIGHT Arrows - Move
ESC - Quit
ENTER - Restart

Touch bunnies to commit attrocities!
Don't touch tigers if you value your life!

##NOTE##
the bat in the windows .zip may not work, the jar runs though so give it a go

entries.title: Trois
entries.description:
You control "Trois" to its captured prey, a (virtual) goat. You're already in your domain. But the path to each of your prey is kind da difficult to your clumsy move.

Just kick-butt it, next prey is awaiting.

- Control keys -
Q, W, E  -> Hold to keep pulling up individual leg of Trois (in y-axis only)
A, S, D -> Move individual leg to the right (in positive x-axis)
Z, X, C -> Same as A,S,D but in opposite direction
R -> If you hopeless, you will need this.

- Rules -
1. At least 1 foot must touch the ground in order to pull up another.
2. To move forward, you have to "pull" up target leg first, then while it's in the air you "move" it to the right or left.
3. From 2, that means we cannot just move forward without "pull" up legs.
4. Enjoy!

entries.title: Trouble in Kitten Town
entries.description: You're an evil cat that must destroy everyone in the town. Use the weapons at your disposal using the 1, 2 and 3 keys. There's goats included. Killer goats.

entries.title: TWIRL - THE HAIRY HEIST
entries.description:
The Twirl, a devious sentient moustache hell-bent on robbing the world's greatest financial institutions, is waiting outside his latest target. Can you help him break in and steal the goods?

FEATURES
+ Jump on people's faces to control them!
+ Explode them into bits when you're done!
+ SMOOCH PEOPLE

An unfinished Compo entry, alas - I was working on the final two rooms but ran out of time, and the key failure mechanic (being spotted by the guards) is bugged out - something weird in flixel-android's ray() function I think.

Might fix it up for the jam. Thanks for playing/downloading!

EDIT - I've had problems making zip files recently, so let me know if it won't unzip or is corrupted. Sometimes redownloading fixes.

entries.title: VillaPlat
entries.description:
Thank you for trying out my game.
It was my first time to use melonjs. I really like it!
Note: Hard is really Hard.
I used 
http://www.melonjs.org/ 
Blender - Modeled and Animated in Blender then Saved as Sprite
GIMP to make the Tiles Images
LMMS to make background Music

Since this is a web app you can just grab the js from the page source

entries.title: A Froggy Day in London Town
entries.description:
I had only 2 hours to make my game and this is it! Based on the theme I took the original game of Frogger and turned it on its head, so you play as the traffic trying to squash the frogs :)

Entered into the jam because it uses bits of art from an old Atari ST game, but the rest of it was created solo.

entries.title: Attractroids
entries.description:
An asteroids clone.

Random asteroids are circling around you. However, the cargo you just picked up attracts asteroids.  (Making your cargo the real villain that causes the trouble.)

This game is nowhere near what I wanted to make, but I still like the result :)

entries.title: Balloon Frenzy 4: Turbo Edition
entries.description:
Balloon Frenzy 4: Turbo Edition is a fun hardcore-casual game. Your character flies peacefully with his lovely balloon and want to get the farthest away from his annoyingly cheerful wife. BUT THE EVIL SADISTIC OTHMAR IS IN THE WAY!!! OH NO!!! GASP!!! HELL WE'RE DOOMED!!! DODGE THE BULLETS!!!

...But who's the villain?

entries.title: Barback
entries.description:
full write-up on my blog: http://www.blog.radiator.debacle.us/2012/12/new-game-barback-for-ludum-dare-25.html

CONTROLS =======
WASD and arrow keys.

THEME? =========
I didn't want to make a game about a blatant villain. Maybe that's why this game doesn't seem to fit the theme too well -- villainy *has* to be blatant, or else you're not a villain?

ABOUT ==========
I was playing Tapper the other day at Barcade and it occurred to me how bad the multiplayer was: basically, one person watches the other person do stuff, no simultaneous play. 

One of the reasons was probably because of the screen ratio / joysticks: the arcade cabinet has a very tall screen, which means they had to orient the bar counters horizontally to make room for all of the sprites. That meant a player needed two joysticks: 1 for movement, and 1 to pull-down to pour a beer. (For 2 player simultaneous play, the machine would need 4 joysticks!!)

The idea of a "downward motion" mapping to "pouring a beer" is very important. Fortunately, because 16:9 screen ratios are so common now, I can orient the counters vertically and now players just need 1 joystick each, and it still maps as "down = beer."

BUGS / REGRETS ============
- sometimes, 2+ patrons will take the same mug... essentially producing a net gain of mugs for you, actually
- patrons keep drinking even after the level is over
- typos and stuff, ergh
- I want to rewrite the script but didn't have time
- it's hard to find music

CREDITS =========
- all art by me, most of it handpainted within 48 hours
- Rokkitt font by someone else
- music by "Stormby" http://ccmixter.org/files/Stormby/39747
- lots of freesound.org samples
- some mechanics from "Tapper", but it's a very different game altogether with my rule changes

entries.title: Battle Bots!
entries.description: Battle Bots is a game written in Java. The object is to defeat your enemy in a dreaded Tug-Of-War style environment.

entries.title: Bloody Ninja Spider
entries.description:
You are the evil Ninja Spider and you must eat all the pretty fireflies of each levels.

Click to jump. Keep the button pressed to roll, release to stick to walls, but each material has special properties (avoid sand, water and slippery moss). The space key allows to control the view with the mouse. 

There is a jump counter, you may try to minimize this number, but that's just a suggested challenge. 'R' to retry the level. The last level (3rd, with 'The end'), has no exit.

Fixed a typo making it much harder than intended (progress lost when you die, which made level 2 virtually unbeatable)

entries.title: Crustacean Chaos
entries.description:
Here it is, Crustacean Chaos!

Important - I recommend you don't play on the web build, it really detracts from the experience.

You are some sort of crustacean creature, living among a colony of your people. As far as you all know, this is the largest of the few colonies that remain.
In order to survive, you rely on the so called "home blocks" to feed you energy and life.
But these blocks don't just sustain, they empower. You don't like that the power of the blocks is carefully rationed and limited, you want it all, and nobody can stop you from doing so. Right after you absorb all the energy remaining in your block...

Use your powers of gravitational manipulation to create chaos on your path to conquer the colony, and consume any who stand in your way.


I greatly regret being unable to add sound (time limitations), so I recommend you put on your favorite playlist and go nuts.

Files are all hosted via Google Drive, once you've selected which build you desire, go File -> Download (Google's "file" option, not your browsers "file" option)

*Update* Web build now links to actual playable site. However, your browser might tell you to "install unity web player" even when it's installed, in the top right of the URL bar there might be a little shield icon, click it and choose "run anyway".

Developed in Unity Free. Available on Windows 32/64, Mac OS, and web based. If demand is sufficient I'll release a Linux build as well.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Dr. Spackolo
entries.description:
I must admit: Writing a Dating Simulator was a stupid idea, especially because I neither can draw cute images nor can I express myself very well in english.

I finished it anyways. Or did I?

Sorry, Firefox/Chrome only!

entries.title: Greed
entries.description: This is my first ever game!  Very proud of it, even though it's basic in nature.  I had a game planned out for making you the enemy in the beginning, but my limitations in knowledge held back a lot of the features so it kind of turned into this.

entries.title: Lord Evil Von Angsty was alone...in a prison
entries.description:
controls:
 a = left
d = right
space = jump
w = boost

just some fun with unity =) Happy holidays!

entries.title: Miniman vs Dr. Malificius
entries.description:
Miniman vs Dr. Malificius, a.k.a how to do a reversed 2d platform game in 48 hours.

Story:
You are Dr. Malificius, an evil demon living in a huge castle.
One day, a little man wearing a blue outfit gets into your castle and starts running and shooting everywhere.
Don't let him go!

Controls:
WASD/arrows -> Move Dr. Malificius
Mouse left button -> Spawn minions
Mouse right button -> Kill a minion
Space -> Pause/resume the time
R -> Restart the level if you're stuck

entries.title: Murders at the Mansion
entries.description: The owner of the mansion has been murdered by someone, and now everyone is trying to figure out who it is. Of course, you know who the killer is: you! Kill everyone else and make your escape.

entries.title: Nefarious Space Pirate
entries.description:
Take control of the Nefarious Space Pirate as he wrecks stuff in space and tries to get away with it. Top down action game written in Unity by a team of 3 for the LD25 gamejam. Controls using the arrow keys (or wasd) and ctrl or mouse click to fire.  Evade police, destroy civilian vessels, try to max your notoriety!

Programming by Daniel "Doddler" McNeill and James "Strawmn" Ward, with art by Mike Paulson.

entries.title: Parkour Simulator 9001
entries.description:
You are a parkour schizophrenic who robs banks by accident.

Navigate your voxel man through the roof tops and bank. And watch out for the chess king police.

... We didn't really finish.

Controls:
W, A, S, D   - Movement
Space bar    - Jump
Mouse motion - Rotate camera
Mouse wheel  - Zoom

Credits:
Ashley Newson - Programming, Art, and Level Transcription
George Newson - Programming, Management, and Catering
David Owen - Programming, and Art Direction
Helen Owen - Art
Jonathan Coulthard - Level Design.

Coming soon: Director's Cut.

entries.title: Pet Mr. Snugglebutt
entries.description:
With all the villainous acts you've performed, its time to give a little attention to your favorite minion: Mr. Snugglebutt.  Nevermind that the entire British Secret Intelligence Service has broken into your secret hideout.  A mastermind must have his priorities in order.

- Pet the irresistibly adorable Mr. Snugglebutt
- Drop an endless supply of secret service members down to your dungeon.
- Coo or cackle: the choice is yours!

entries.title: Picker Pocketer
entries.description:
A game where you play as a pickpocket, whose name just happens to be called 'Picker Pocketer'.

Use the WASD keys to move around, and press space when you're behind them to start pickpocketing. Press the arrow keys in the correct sequence to successfully steal that person's money. If you make a mistake, or run out of time, the person will run away, and you may have the old bill on your tail.

Hold down SHIFT to sprint. Beware, you'll sprint slower if you've pickpocketed a load of people, and avoiding the coppers will be harder.

Tools used:
IDE: FlashDevelop
Framework: Flashpunk
Graphics: Paint.NET
Sounds: Bfxr

entries.title: Praelia Solus
entries.description:
EDIT: I've uploaded a build with no music. This should be considered my primary build as it is *exactly* the same as my original build, sans music.

Many thanks to __twc for music! (https://soundcloud.com/twc-3)

Source available at https://github.com/jeffjcheng/ld25

Tools used:
- Engine: Unity 4 Pro Trial
- Audio: Sfxr, Bfxr, Audacity
- Visual: MSPaint, GIMP

entries.title: Sheep Muncher
entries.description: You awake to find that the rest of your pack have gone into a deep sleep...hibernation. Now you realize that you, a chupacabra, have forgone scrounging for food in preparation to the winter months. You crawl out of your hole, find the nearest pasture, and begin to engorge yourself on the plump sheep. But be quick! You have not much time!

entries.title: SimShitty
entries.description:
You are the villain!
You are the evil one.

Convert people for more energy. The more energy you have, the harder the spells will be.

First: Choose how many People you want (depends on you cpu power)

Then: Convert people and destroy them! :>

entries.title: Skeleton's Revenge
entries.description:
Skeleton's Revenge is a 2D platformer where the standard platformer enemy and hero tropes are reversed. A hero and his goat have killed your master, and the only thing you have left is to get revenge! You're a skeleton that's immune to spikes and doesn't get knocked back when hit. Your enemies are platformer hero archetypes, and as such, spikes kill them in one hit, and they get knocked back when they take damage. Fans of old Nintendo Hard games know that it's not the damage that kills you, but it's the being knocked off a platform into spikes or a bottomless pit. Have fun turning the tables on 2D platform mechanics! The game only takes about 3 minutes to complete, but it gets pretty difficult!

Left/right, A/D, gamepad left/right - move
L, gamepad button 1/4 - jump
K, gamepad button 2/3 - throw bones

Renoise is awesome and I'm really happy with how the music turned out. The nice sound effects were generated with Bfxr and the graphics were all done in GIMP. I used Game Maker 7 because it's what I know, but sadly, it only compiles for Windows. If someone would like to port this to other platforms, drop me a line at bakamostudios.com

As before, I did a few blog posts, this time with playable versions of the game each step of the way. That's at http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/Dr.Mo/?category_name=ld-25-2

entries.title: TDMA
entries.description:
After almost an entire weekend of complete silence, my game, The Temple of Doom and the Miscellaneous Archaeologists can finally be called complete!

You basically play as the evil mastermind who set up dungeons and now has to defend them from explorers :D

entries.title: The Adventures of Tim Nottacrook
entries.description:
Very Unfinished. Programmed by me, Eric Rawlings, art designed by Olly Carhart (look up nominalmuffin), civilian sprites and support by Joshua Beresford-Davis.

WASD to move
left click to shoot
right click to pickup weapon
space to melee

cops drop weapons
civilians drop health

Fund raising has not gone well over the past days you've spent going round with a collection bucket (the skint gits won't donate) so you take to the streets to gather funds however possible. You must raise 50000 for charity to save a foreign country that has a spreading disease.

The idea here is that at the start the player was meant to go around with a bucket collecting donations when eventually the player would give up and just steal money off people, rob banks and kill hundreds of people for the fund raiser. And end up destroying the city for the money.

It kinda just became a basic shooty game, may continue work on this to try to get it the way it was intended to be.

Things we had no time to do:
-civilian variety
-better path-finding
-progressively more difficult waves (including the army showing up)
-art for some weapons and for more civilian variety (my art guy was busy)
-tanks and jackable vehicles
-an ammo counter
-bigger city with banks, hospitals and police departments (that you can raid for cash/health/weaponry)
-an intro
-an ending
-Lots of stuff

entries.title: War of the Drones
entries.description:
In an overcrowded world where human population grows wildly, Goverment has found a way to control it usin Drones. As a Drone AI, your mission is to find humans and kill them, flying over their insulting faces. But be careful, there are some human controlled artifacts that will chase you. Lucky you, they are slower simply because they are humans. And you can win Points, indeed!

You can find it in here ( http:manelvf.com/drones )

The code is pure Javascript and is on the web uncompressed. It uses the  amazing lightweight library Zepto.js and bits of code I found on the internets (nothing serious). I will add a Github link in the next days.

It was an amazingly amusing experience. I will repeat.

entries.title: Bad Ufo
entries.description:
This is a simple arcade high-score game, you as a bad ufo, and you have to destroy the crop-field, kidnap cows, and destroy enemy vehicles.

The score determines the bonus, or malus, every 1000 points a new enemy vehicles pop-out, at around 5000 points a new cow is created.

Kidnapping cows get you some cow juice, with cow juice you can erase a bigger crop-field area, and with 50% cow juice you can destroy enemy vehicles, both of these action consumes cow juice.

Try to get the highscore while avoiding enemy missiles, if you get hit three times you are out :(

Windows/Web/Linux/Osx
Arrow Keys -> move the UFO
Z-> Destroy crop, kidnap cows and destroy enemy vehicles

Android
Touch left part of the screen:
Move the ufo

Touch right part of the screen:
Toggle Destroy Crop/Kidnap cow/Destroy enemy vehicles

Linux & OSX version are not tested, I've built it with unity, so they should work, but I cannot guarantee that works as expected.

entries.title: IdentiThief
entries.description:
Run with 'python identithief.py' on Linux or (theoretically) Mac. Windows: EXE thanks to Spiridios (apparently needs to be ended by Task Manager), source is also available. 


Premise: You are an identity thief, sniffing packets on an unsecured wireless network. Sniffing four unique packets from a single computer will yield that computer's identity, allowing you to impersonate them. 
Goal: Isolate any one computer in the network by stealing the identities of all the others.
Caveats: 
-The packets are random, so sniffing one may not necessarily get you closer to stealing its owner's identity.
-If a packet containing a part of the owner's identity you have already sniffed reaches its target, that part of the identity is no longer valid to you, and must be sniffed again. Keep track of this by the pips on each computer screen - 3 means you only have one more unique packet to go!
-The users on the network will get suspicious if too many packets disappear without any arriving safely. This is measured by your 'dodginess' number. Keep this number below 5 by allowing some packets to reach their destination. Successfully stealing an identity will also reduce dodginess, as you are now impersonating that node of the network.

Time: 12 hours or so over Saturday night to Sunday night

Sounds: Twenty minutes' work in Bfxr and Nanoloop

Rules bent: I used a Pygame library I've been working on over the last few months for my final project at university. Although I plan to open-source it, it's not really ready for dispersal yet (hence my rulebreaking). The documentation isn't there, and I found a couple of design issues while making this game. However, I am including a one-file version of it here. No promises on usability yet, but if anybody is interested in where I'm going with it, feel free to contact me. 

Controls:
(Menu)
Left click - Start game
Right click - Quit game

(Game)
Left click - Capture packet
R (when in game over screen) - Restart
Escape - Quit to menu
P - Pause

links.label: Source (definitely works on Linux with Python 2.7)

entries.title: Makarun
entries.description:
* Please note that there is now a post-compo version with advanced controls and more (link above)
* If you like, read the post-mortem here: http://ld25postmortem.timtips.com
* VideoWalkthrough available here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gvBxP76p6MI

DESCRIPTION
------------------------------------------
You are the bad guy, making a run (makarun) for it. On your escape from jail you have to evade the good guys or take them down brutally. It's a stealth-action-game in 2d that makes extensive use of dynamic lights to visualize and check lines of sight. Also makes things much prettier ;)

CONTROL NOTES:
------------------------------------------
Use "W" to walk towards your mouse-cursor. 

In my opinion the easiest way to navigate is just to use w to move forward and determine the direction by using the mouse.

"A" and "D" also work but act a bit "strange" because they let you walk around the mouse cursor instead of strafing straight left/right. 

Stand close to "!" and "?"s and hover them with your mouse to get ingame instructions.

PERFORMANCE SETTINGS
------------------------------------------
Due to fixed timestepping and some sideffects of a too tight coupled render and logic loop it's desirable to have it running at ~60FPS. Use the options menu to adjust the performance settings to get as close to it as possible. The game will run fine on lower FPS but it might just not feel the way its intended.

BUGFIXES
------------------------------------------
I submitted a bugfixed version. It eliminates the following bugs:

* If you complete the standard mode, you will be thrown back to the main menu instead of directly restarting in higher difficulty. (Fixed)

* There is also a bug for some people that makes it impossible to move and aim at the same time.(Fixed)

You can still download my initially submitted version on http://timtips.com/ld25/makarun.jar and http://www.timtips.com/ld25/makarun-src.jar.


PERSONAL NOTES AND LIB CREDITS
------------------------------------------
This game is really far away from what I had in mind when I began. But it has an imaginery goat!

I used: 
* libGDX, box2d, box2dLights, and Artemis Entity System Framework for coding. 
* Cosmigo ProMotion, Gimp and TexturePacker for graphics
* Reaper, the free "Sonatina Symphonic Orchestra" sample-bank and my Korg-SP250 to compose the music and the one sound that made it into the game (it's a stealth game, so no more sounds :))
* TiledEditor for the map but also for various meta-data integration and object placement.

entries.title: Meteors: Look at them go
entries.description:
So here I have my first entry at a Ludum Dare compo.

I'm quite happy about it though I could not work on it and get much done on saturday.

This game has been made in Unity3D 4.0 in C# and JavaScript.
Sound effects with sfxr.
Graphics in Gimp.

I haven't done intro nor menu, so I'll have to explain what is the game about

/*** Introduction ***/

The game is about destroying the earth.
You have to guide the meteorites falling upon the blue planet and prevent them being destroyed by the human defenses.

Humans have developed a high technology laser cannon that orbits arround the globe at great speed, shooting at anything that dares to threaten the world's life.

Nuclear missiles from all the countries are being employed aswell to defense the earth.

The atmosphere is a great adversary aswell, so you need to keep your size to cause collateral damage.

Your goal is to cause as much destruction as possible. Not just by colliding the meteor you control yourself but by keeping the orbital cannon occupied while the others approach!


/***** Controls *****/

- LeftClick & Drag to move the camera arround
- WASD | Arrow keys to move the selected meteorite arround
- Space to impulse yout meteorite
- Double clicking on big enough meteorites makes the camera move to that meteorite


EDIT: Fixed not being able to move forward.

Thanks to VGAFIB.

entries.title: Misery is delicious!
entries.description:
Misery is delicious! is a top down villain simulator in which you slaughter, kill, crush, torture and clone the inhabitants of a small island city.

Use a vast selection of tools and ability's such as "Spring cleaning" which literally drops numerous items (including goats) upon the defenceless citizens and explosive diarrhoea which launches people into space on what I have names...poop elevators.

The game features a mission mode and a sandbox mode. It is highly recommended that you play sandbox because mission mode basicly sucks.

Have fun being evil!

EDIT: I just realised the source I am linking to is actually the source to my other games. I will fix this after work tomorrow or the day after.

entries.title: Namrednels
entries.description:
Namrednels(Slenderman backwards) Is a game about a man frantically running around in the dark to try to find 8 lost pages.Sound familiar? Except, this time you are slender!!

Run the man over with the stone balls to crush him and wake zombies to come and eat his brains, but whatever you do, don't let him get the pages!!

WASD or ARROW KEYS to move

Thanks for trying out my game, I know it's not very good, but this is my first official Ludum Dare. I was really happy with the original concept of this game but I don't think I really ended up with what i wanted in the end :(
Oh well, i had a bunch of fun doing it anyway :D

entries.title: Necrominously Evil

walk around using sound. I wish I did more on this game but I got the basics and stuff working.

Have fun!

entries.title: Shadow Possession
entries.description:
**Update** Check out the new Post-Comp version for new sounds, a few gameplay tweaks, and a re-designed last level. 

Man, rushed doesn't begin to describe this. This is the first game I've ever created and (sort of) finished.

Shadow Possession is a short platformer following a strange shadow-creature that takes over a person, and is hurt by light. There's 8 levels in total.

Submitted with about a minute left, I'm hoping no one encounters any game-breaking bugs. I hit a snag right in the last couple of hours before submission, so fixing that took a majority of my time.

Things I ran out of time for:

- Sounds (only got the footsteps in!)

 - A gradually increasing difficulty curve / more difficult levels (the hard parts were going to be in later levels, after there had been time to learn the mechanics).

 - NPCs that move around and/or follow the player (mobile lights).

 - A main menu.

 - More light objects.

Oh well. It's been a valuable learning experience, after all.

Updates:
12/17/2012 - 8:37 PM (CST):
Just fixed the crash bug right before the last room. Sorry about that! Believe it or not(sarcasm), the cause was something I added in at the last second. 

12/17/2012 - 10:12 PM (CST):
Fixed all the game-breaking bugs I'm aware of (with the aid of some very helpful play-testers). Unless another one pops, this should be the final build. 

Post Mortem:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/18/shadow-possession-post-mortem/

If you like this game, feel free to up-vote it at Reddit here:
http://redd.it/153zd7

Thanks!

entries.title: Tail Orbit

You have 60 seconds to destroy as many peaceful orbs as you can.... since they are peaceful, that makes you the villain :)

Important note: You have to hit the orbs with your TAIL ... not your head to get points :)

Use arrow keys to move, Z slows down, X speeds back up.

You must hit the orbs with your TAIL and not your HEAD to score points.  Your tail gets longer and harder to use the more orbs you hit with your head.

Have fun!!!

I can't enter the "compo" because some of the libraries I use are closed source, and I'm using a modified version of Mojo that ships with Monkey.

entries.title: Tinysoft 2

Activate thing using [SPACE]

entries.title: Twisted Neighborhood
entries.description:

Grow in power and smash bigger objects and structures.

entries.title: You Are The Goatman
entries.description:
***THIS GAME FEATURES GOATS***

Controls: WASD/Arrows
Objective: Protect goats and kill villagers

- Goats run towards you if you're close and will run away from villagers.
- Villagers run away from you and run towards goats.
- When any character bumps on obstacles, they are damaged.
- Watch out for spiky plants, they hurt on high speeds.
- You get points by killing villagers and lose them when goats die.
- To kill villagers, ram them the fastest you can. Take care not to die with the impact, though.
- You win if you're alive when the time ends
- If all goats die, you lose

17/12/2012 - 11:09 GMT-3: Added standalone ports for better performance.

entries.title: Boss Level
entries.description:
You are the Boss Monster of the level, and a army of heroes is coming for you!

Create the perfect level layout! Crush the heroes! Rule the kingdom!

Instructions: Just buy "Items" by clicking on them and place them on the valid areas in green, then press "Start"! Kill heroes to earn more gold and keep building your level.

entries.title: Captain Evil's Quest for Questionable Morals
entries.description:
Ooooooooh boy, this was awesome. I managed (in what time I had, technically only had 24 hours because of my job ;)) to make a platformer with preeettyy tight physics, alongside enemy types and damage upgrades.

The idea is to go through the levels (always going right :P), picking up health and damage bonuses until you get to the "Justice Computer", which you have to destroy. 

I will admit this here and now that the menu screens are damn ugly, and the ending could use some work, but all in all I feel it went very, VERY well.

Controls:
Space to jump
A to go left
D to go right
Shift to shoot
Control to drop bombs

You can jump off of walls when next to them, and can move in the air.

You CAN just run through the levels not killing anything, but you get a score at the end with how many guys you blew up.

As always, apologies for the programmer art, but this time it looks FAR better than any time before. Getting better, methinks ;)

entries.title: Chronotography
entries.description: Villain of the Past, Savior of the Future

entries.title: Dastardly Diver
entries.description:
You're a dastardly evil villain, so it's only natural that you would do dastardly things... right? You might say, that detonating a bomb is really evil. Detonating a bomb in a zoo - delightfully evil. But what could have even more impact?

Well, climbing into a submarine, going down to the very bottom of the Mariana Trench (which, coincidentally, houses an impressive collection of post-WW2 sea mines) and detonating a giant bomb, thus damaging the Earth's core and destroying the whole planet. Impact, I say.

Controls: arrows for moving, Shift for focused movement.
Press Escape anywhere to close the game.

For Linux users (64bit only), you probably need sufficient *.so files for SFML2 - grab them here: http://www.sfml-dev.org/download/2.0-rc/SFML-2.0-rc-linux-64.tar.bz2

Linux version was prepared by #sfml's iostream. Many thanks.

entries.title: Disturb the miners!

Enjoy and good luck!

entries.title: Heist
entries.description:
A networked cooperative heist game.

For Windows download the executable, for other operating systems download the love file.

Made by Finn Stokes, Harriet Lloyd, Myles Clark, and Saxon Douglass.

entries.title: Hero Beat ME!
entries.description:
Game Title: Hero Beat ME!
Author: Gianluca 'theGiallo' Alloisio
LudumDare #25 entry
Date: 17 December 2012

Platform: linux x86_64, Windows

Coded in C++ using OpenGL.

Windows and MAC OSx:
For non-linux users: I've tested it on a virtual machine with Ubuntu 12.10 (64bit) live CD and it ran well. You can download the iso and burn it or just make a virtual machine with VirtualBox and load it!
The source should compile under Windows, but I sadly had no time to try to port it, maybe I'll have time and I'll try to.

Description:

The games is multiplayer, 2 players on the same keyboard.
They control 2 guys (anybody is a colored cube),
they can move around, do things to other people and stun eachother.
Actions on other people make evilness increase, stun the rival makes it decrease.
There's a count down, at whitch end will come TheHero, to fight the evilest guy, the Villain, and purify anybody, then he will go away and come back after another period. The Villain gets a bouns, the evilness goes into points.
The more evil players are most points they get at the Hero arrival, but be careful, it's possible to become good people stunning too much the rival!

The game has no end. You could establish a number of Hero arrivals before start playing.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Actions:

There are 3 types of actions:
Throw a granny, steal a lollypop to a child or fart. Be careful because you could stun yourself farting all alone!


-----------------------------------------------------------------------
The Cubes are:

Gray: granny
Cyan: boy
Magenta: girl
Brown: man
Blue: woman

Red: player 1
Green: player 2

Gold: The Hero

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Commands:

Player 1

Movement WASD
Action Q
Stun E

Player 2

Movement IJKL
Action U
Stun O


-----------------------------------------------------------------------
How to run:
Linux:
open a terminal and launch the launcher!

Windows:
run HeroBeatME!.exe

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
!! IMPORTANT !!
For linux users:
If it tells you that cannot open some .so please tell me and I'll add it to the zip. 

Contact: @theGiallo on Twitter, and generally the Internet :)

entries.title: Jean Jaures Reloaded
entries.description:
Here it's on, this is my entry for this LD.

This is a game about Raoul Villain, the murderer of Jean Jaures, a famous french politician.
So the game bring you back to 1914, and you will have to kill him again, but this time, there will be a lot of target !

entries.title: Just kill Stuff
entries.description:
A very tongue in cheek entry done in a few hours. Have fun being the next best thing to Hitler!

[INSTRUCTIONS]
Click to drop bombs.

entries.title: Lack of Texture Adventure
entries.description:
This is a game where you, representative of the evil, get to kill all the "helpless" good guys. But be warned, some of them found guns and the rest comes at you and trys to hit you in your face!

Controlls: use left and right arrow key to move.
                use space or up to jump
                use s to shoot

For those that can't seem to win, don't jump down. try work your way from the left of the level to the right and from top to bottom... And stay near a platform if the ai trys to gang up on you.

Well, I surprisingly made it trough this Ludum Dare =D. As this was my first Ludum Dare (where I made it farther than day 1 anyway) and I chose an unfamiliar Development environment without any Librarys but slick_util and lwjgl I couldn't quite make this the Game I imagined at first. Never the less, it's done and I'm actually quite happy with how it turned out. Many unexpected bugs but, all in all FINISHED!!! My first truly finished Game :D + only made in 48 hours.

entries.title: Missile Rider
entries.description:
You are a ROCKET-SURFING KILLING MACHINE created by FROG. Destroy the NAVY. Or something along those lines.

<<CONTROLS>>
LEFT and RIGHT to <MOVE>
UP to <ROCKET FEET>
DOWN to <SWEET MISSILE GRAB>

<<INSTRUCTIONS>>
Get GENERIC YELLOW ORBS for <MULTIPLIER BONUS>
Destroy NAVY for <POINTS>

entries.title: Nebula Marauders
entries.description:
Aliens are attacking cities around the world. Inspired by a cross between two of the eighties style games but the roles are reversed as the high overlords will tolerate nothing short of human annihilation. Descend upon the citizenry with outer space might and level the planet down to ashes. 

Take on the role of intergalactic demolisher and clear out the planet for a extra terrestrial day spa to be built in its wake. Zap those human buildings out of the way.

entries.title: Otaku Night Out
entries.description:
Artist - Dan
Coders - Kyle + Eugene

entries.title: Pet Buster
entries.description:
Destroy all the animals for no good reason!
Features a randomly generated world filled with various items and power-ups.

entries.title: Princess Frenzy
entries.description:
A multiplayer game where you are the boss that has captured the princess. 

Defend her from other players and to claim victory !

entries.title: Rapture Capture
entries.description:
Choose which one of the four Horseman of the Apocalypse you want to side with in an online battle for the souls of Earth.

In Rapture Capture you pick a faction and control one of Death, War, Famine or Pestilence. Capture zones on the map by converting as many puny humans as you can, while other players all over the world are trying to do the same.

Who is the villain? Everyone is the villain.

Also, contains Goat of Justice!



Made using PlayCanvas (playcanvas.com), our collaborative HTML5 game development tool. We're in beta right now, come and try it out!

entries.title: Rogue Thief Stealer Person
entries.description:
My first entry.

Steal the loot while avoiding the guards.

entries.title: SCIENCE IS BAD FOR YOUR HEALTH
entries.description:
SCIENCE IS BAD FOR YOUR HEALTH is an unfinished LD48 entry which I thought I should enter anyway, as it is playable.

Realistically I would've rather done the Jam and spent longer working on the art (for example, this doesn't have textures (except AO baked in), nor does it have proper character models (red are the spies, blue is the evil scientist who is controlled).

As a result of the reduced amount of art, it is not clear what the context of this game is, so here it is:

You are the evil scientist, performing evil, evil experiments. You are the villain. The top secret spies have been sent from every major secret service in order to put a stop to your evil experiments! Dodge their bullets and stay alive for as long as you can! You did in in the name of science, sure, but as we now know, science is bad for your health!

--------------

PS. Thanks for playing!

entries.title: StarRunner
entries.description:
This game was made in C# with XNA 4.0.
Backstory:
Wanted in almost every galaxy ever, you play as a ruthless intergalactic theft. Having being caught by the police, he needs to fight them all off! Little does he know they never stop…
Everything necessary is in 
README.txt
Make sure you have XNA 4.0 Redist installed! (http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914)

entries.title: Super Mario Boss
entries.description:
Mario is chilling doing his biz, but who is the dashing turtle in the top hat, I wonder?

Use the arrow keys to move (Up to jump).


It's more a short homage, than an actual game, but hope you like it anyway.

entries.title: The Unseen
entries.description:
An exploration of the mind of a man lost in dark dreams ...

Please disregard the LD24 naming convention. One of us was entirely mistaken about the current LD's number. =P =P =P

System Requirements:
- Windows (not tested on versions other than 7)
- .NET CLR (Here is the standard option: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=8493)
- EDIT: You probably shouldn't need the OpenAL installer anymore because OpenAL is now included with the zip file.

You should just be able to unzip and run!
Let us know if you have any issues.

entries.title: Woodcut Ted
entries.description:
here's my entry for the competition:
Woodcut Ted

I made the game in about 8/10 hours (mostly today)

Its a simple game where you play as a woodcutter that has to cut as many trees as possible without getting arrested by a ranger.

CONTROLS:

ARROWS: MOVE
Z: CHOP TREES

entries.title: You Are The Virus
entries.description:
You have a nefarious plot for world destruction... But first, you'll need to hack into the Pentagon's systems and retrieve the missile launch codes! Play as the Virus, a state-of-the-art piece of malware capable of penetrating the toughest of security systems- with a little dexterity and quick-thinking, that is.
Turn the blue nodes (dots) red by moving over them- once all nodes are hacked, proceed to the uplink (large blue/red square) to move to the next level of security! How far can you get before you are detected?

entries.title: Zombie Escape
entries.description:
The zombie apocalypse came and went. The humans won, and are now hunting down the remaining zombies. You are a zombie leader, and your task is to safely guide escaping (but villainous...) zombies into their home under the abandoned quarry. But be careful! The Quarry is treacherous.

***How to Play***

- WASD to move around.
- Holding Left CTRL will freeze your view. 
- LMB to create a stopping zone. Click it again to remove.
- Basically, try to stop the zombies from walking into the stone slides, by creating these stopping zones.
- Getting hit by rocks will eventually kill you.
- The blue bar tells you how many zombies you've saved. You need that bar to go to the top of the screen to win.

entries.title: ALL EARTHLINGS MUST DIE!!!!!!
entries.description:
ALL EARTHLINGS MUST DIE!!!!


DESTROY THE PUNY EARTHLINGS!!


A note about the controls... They suck lol

S - pause is a toggle 

all your invaders need to be on the next line otherwise pressing left will move them right and reverse them back up to the top line they were on.

entries.title: And No, I Won't Tell You What It Is Yet
entries.description:
You are a goat. Eat clothes.

... uh. Escape actually DOESN'T toggle sound. OOPS! Enjoy the melodious tunes in the game!

entries.title: Another Day at Villain Inc.
entries.description:
So my idea was to make an beat em up platformer, with a cliche supervillain/superhero theme. I usually go for a much simpler graphics style so this time I wanted to go for something more detailed. It turned out decent, I think.

Basically you play as Dr. Goat, who works at Villain Inc. and follow him on his adventure to the store to get some coffee. Dr. Goat needs his coffee.

I got all the mechanics done, but only the first and last scene got finished. If I used my time better there would've been a section in the middle where you walk through the streets or traverse the rooftops, or something along those lines, while bringing rampage to the people of the city.

I learned a lot from this Ludum Dare, including how easy it is to make a simple AI. I wasted a lot of time on nothing, but who even cares. The game is done. Next time though, I will stick with a simpler graphics style and concept. Drawing everything is way too exhausting for me.

Goodnight

[Guide]
If you're having trouble winning, just remember to block only when he attacks, and keep hitting him whenever you can. Punches do more damage, but leaves you open, so punch him a few times right after he attacks and then pull back and shoot at him, so you're ready for his next attack. 
He can only attack once every 5 second (+/- about 2 seconds), but he will kill you in 4 hits if you don't block. 8 hits if you do.

entries.title: Bad Hat
entries.description: You are a hat, and you complete levels by "popping" humanoid creatures in this adventure arcade game. (keep the src with the executable please)

entries.title: BourbonBorn
entries.description:
The accidental villain themed web game prototype. A bit like Dizzy meets Skyrim and Deathspank. Unfortunately far from finished, but I like the premise enough to put a few more hours on it this week. 

Use arrow keys/WAD to control, E/F/Z/J to interact. 

Requires recent Flash Player plugin (11.3+). I used Starling, Nape and IntelliJ IDEA. Tested hardly at all...


EDIT: Yep, tree part is the end. Should have made it more obvious, sorry. Updated post compo version is coming in a few days!

entries.title: Cave Kappa
entries.description:
Some foolish adventurers have stumbled into your cave. Place traps to kill them all!

Goal: Kill all the humans in each level. Place traps to kill the humans, or even reorder how they come out. Once you are prepared, click play to see them march out to their death. If they somehow avoid your devious plans, hit stop and try again.

Trap Tab: X to delete traps. Click on a trap, then click in the field to place.
Hero Tab: See the "heros" that will arrive. Drag them to change their order.
Run Tab: Click play to start the hero's arrival. Press stop to reset the map to rearrange your traps.

Some levels are fairly challenging. The different types of humans have different AIs, so try to figure them out. Learning the physics of the game is important too.

Note: This was intended for the compo, but I wanted to add more levels.

entries.title: Dig for Me
entries.description:
As a demon whose power is fueled by gold, you need to raise enough to drive your world domination efforts.  10000 should so it.  And there should be enough buried beneath the old castle, but digging is HARD.

Fortunately, while the local towns have no desire to help you, they're chock-full of heroes who have heard about the opportunity to both vanquish you and score some treasure.  So they can do the digging for you.

All you have to do is make sure they don't leave with any of it.

CONTROLS:

[Arrows] to Move
[Shift] to Jump/Fly
[Ctrl] to Shoot Lightning,
[Ctrl+Arrows] (against a wall) to Dig
[Ctrl+Up] to Build a Ladder

[Space] Opens/Closes the Monster Menu
[Space+Arrows] (against a wall) Opens the Trap Menu

[Shift or Ctrl or Enter] Confirm Menu Selection

[Any unused key] Assign or Activate a Trap

entries.title: Dragon Wrath
entries.description:
Play as a massive flying dragon as you terrorise the innocent citizens of Korbin, over 16 squared kilometres of beautiful landscape and procedurally generated villages. Raid towns and villages, force them to pay tribute to you and upgrade your dragon.

Written in Unity, using Audacity, MSpaint, Gimp, sfxr, 3d canvas pro

Web link recommended (download and source provided at bottom of page)

Tips:
* Burn villages to gain money
* Terrorise villages to increase fear
* More fear results in more frequent tribute payments
* Some villages are easier than others
* Hover over a village in the map view to get more information
* Return to your lair to see your gold and upgrade

A lot of people have commented on the controls which I agree are a little hard to get the hang of at first. Here are some tips to help you:
* Holding just spacekey allows you to fly up, use this to hover.
* While holding space use the arrow keys (or WASD) to increase your speed in that direction.
* The dragon is handled by the physics engine so will 'bounce' and maintains it's momentum.
* To avoid arrows attempt to strafe and circle the villages (don't fall, the arrows fall under gravity as well).

entries.title: Dragons Flight
entries.description:
Here is the final version of our game Dragon Flight. We tried to focus on making a fun easy to pick up game that put you in the role of the villain. Our villain is a Dragon that goes around shooting fireballs at plants and builds as they roll over hills.

Controls: 

Mouse to move
Left mouse click or spacebar to shoot.

entries.title: Goat Mechanic
Grand Theft Crimbo
entries.description:
Team RobKat Presents Grand Theft Crimbo

Santa not nice to Elf, Santa not nice at all, Elf gonna get revenge. Steal the presents, Take presents to lair, Avoid Police.

Become the best Crimbo Wrecker.

entries.title: Happy Little Murder Friends
entries.description:
My second LD48 entry...
HAPPY LITTLE MURDER FRIENDS


Rampage through a list of towns with different ways to play, do you play the psycho gunman that unloads on crowds in the open?  Or a bruiser who beats his victims to a pulp melee weapons in the alleys?  An explosive expert who sets up the perfect explosion then ducks away? 

Choose between 5 serial killers, each with there own perks and an array of weapons and fetishes to help your rampage.  Get revenge.... Have fun.  In that order.




CONTROLS - [WASD to move, Left Mouse button to fire, Right Mouse button to use fetish] 



GOAL - Target kill highlighted victims in each town, reach the kill quota to unlock the next town.  Avoid murdering people who aren't your target as it will alert police.



TIPS- Shoot / Punch Dumpsters for a high chance of weapon drops.

Pick the right fetish for the right character, some combinations are better than others.

Avoid shooting if you have to, it alerts the crowd much quicker than melee attacks.

If you are wanted, you can hide in a house and eventually the law will give up.

Leave your targets inside houses until last, they make for easy pickings as there is only one path of escape.

entries.description:
Hi everyone,

Here is the small game I managed to do for my first LD: 

Highway Villain

The objective is simple: you must destroy as many cars as possible without letting 10 pass you.

I did not manage to tune it quite well and I think it lacks some "fun" material.

At least, I am happy that I did something "playable" on my own :)

entries.title: Human Eater
entries.description:
This is human eater !
Eat the humans from the inside and become even more bigger each time !

All the source and help are in the .rar, thanks for testing it ! Have fun !

DOWNLOADING AND OPENING THIS APPLICATION MAY LEAD TO ARRIVAL OF COPS AND LATER ARREST.

PLAY AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Post-compo version contains some bug fixes, and a few more little things.

rusalkamask

entries.title: Intergalactic Slave Wars
entries.description:
Ludem Dare 25
Theme: You are the Villain

Credits:
 
Trent Fealy
Vincent Villani
 

You play as a evil intergalactic slave master - use your slaves to build buildings, take over other planets and attack your enemy.


How to play

Building: You can build buildings on the planets you currently control (blue planets) by working slaves to death. There are two buildings - Attacking Building (allows you to attack a near by planet) and a Slave Building (generates
more slaves on that planet). 

Transferring: You can transfer slaves to neutral planets by selected how many slaves you want to transfer (the slider bar) and then selecting a neutral planet to transfer them too.

Attacking: You can attack an enemy planet by clicking on the attack option and then selecting a planet to attack


Controls: 

Left:mouse button: Select
Right mouse button: Deselect
Zoom: Mouse wheel
Pan: Hold down mouse button and drag
Escape button: Menu
Mute sound: M button
Restart game shortcut: R button (or through the Menu) 
 
 
There are probably bugs - sorry about that.
 
Enjoy!

punch the baby

you're a villain trying to punch a baby and a goat. You probably wont win.

entries.title: Sky Pirates
entries.description: Sky Pirates - conquer the skies in your airship! A PBBG made in 72 hours by CaptainLepidus and Bactopiad.

entries.title: The Launch
entries.description:
Don't Stop the launch pits you against an FPS hero trying to stop the missile launching at the free world.

The Hero will move from room to room in search of 3 objectives he needs before he can stop the launch. These are the Armory, the Server room and the Library, which are different colours to the standard rooms. After completing this he moves to the center room and disarms the missile.

It is your job to place traps and upgrade doors to stop the hero from completing his task before the countdown timer reaches zero. You first select the room you wish to trap by clicking on it on the right hand side, this will show buttons on the left hand side to either upgrade doors, add minions to the room or place a trap from the list.

The traps have a variety of functions, explained in more detail in the How to play page, but generally they can force the hero to change direction or scare him away from entering a room, and defeat the hero forcing him to respawn in the previous room.

The hero will always move to an objective if he is next to it, take a normal door over an upgraded blast door and pick a new room over one he has cleared (shown by the light going out).

Linux Notes:
We don't have anyone with Linux to test if the new Unity 4 build actually works, so any feedback would be great.

Some more detailed How to play information can be found here:http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/17/text-from-the-how-to-guide


PLEASE NOTE: The resolution is locked at 1366x768. 
People with a monitor of that resolution or smaller may have trouble seeing everything. Apologies for that, the downloadable version may work better than the Web.


Sound and music attributions:
Music: Made via Mixcraft 6.0 using included loops.

Sounds from freesound.org:

entries.title: The murder!
entries.description:
Game is not finished, obviously. I was going for a more subtle  approach to the theme; the dectective's catchphrase would've been "You are the villain!" 

This was my first entry into LD, and did reasonably well considering the RL time I had to take over the weekend.

Source is over here: https://github.com/nospoone/LD25

entries.title: The Villains' Empire
entries.description:
!! IMPORTANT !!
If you get stuck on a grey screen after the text intro, please wait a few seconds, music is still loading (it seems dropbox is experiencing some difficulties).

--

The villains' empire is threatened by the heroes. 
Using your ability to control spaceship telepathically, you are the last hope against the menace.

Be sure to avoid the destruction of the ship you are controlling. If you are not inside, it's ok. The empire can afford some material loss. 

Arrows to choose which ship to control,
space bar to shoot,
"m" key to mute sounds.

entries.title: Villain Warehouse
entries.description:
Villain Warehouse is a Wario Ware Style Game. You play Minigames repeatingly until all your lifes are gone.

You control the evil things in Games, the ones you hate, the ones that annoy you to death when they hit you.

My Game has 2 Minigames:
-A Super Mario Style Game where you control the evil villainous flower to kill the unsuspecting good guy
-A Mario Kart Thing where you control the evil villainous red shell to kill the unsuspecting good guy driver.


Post High Scores!


Created with LibGDX, ASESprite for Graphics, bfxr and inudge for sound
Browser Version tested in Chrome and Firefox. IE does NOT WORK.

Sadly I was not able to make more mini games. I had some more Ideas, but time is running out.

Other Ideas I had were:
-Castlevania, throw the good guy into a deep pit.
-Zelda, catch Link with the giant armless hand.

entries.title: Vixen
entries.description:
Just a quick little visual novel. There might be bugs as I had to make a lot of code fixes last minute :(

Girls are mean!

Made with Ren'Py

entries.title: 3vil kill3r r0b0tz
entries.description:
Press M to mute.
Place your mouse by the edge of the screen to move the camera.

entries.title: 4Goats1Hay
entries.description:
Don't expect much, as the game was made in 2 hours (I only function under extreme time pressure!)

The other goat want to eat your hay! Place mud puddles and starve them to death!

The tutorial is ingame!

(WARNING: May contain goats.)

entries.title: AnteChristmas
entries.description:
You play a Troll, maybe Santa-Cloth take you for a smart sprite... Your pleasure : breaking packed toys ! (no mercy for cute kids !)

Controls : Arrow keys LEFT, DOWN and RIGHT to move around the workshop
Press SHIFT to hold your Hammer, release to hit a package.

Warning ! Santa Clothes is watching you !

If you let too many packages, and the sled is pretty loaded for a trip, climb immediately on top-screen by pressing the arrow key UP.
Wield your hammer (SHIFT) and run down to the sleigh in the sky.

entries.title: BendoReflector X-25
entries.description: Multiplayer online game about school shootings in the future.

entries.title: Bullet Hell Reversed
entries.description:
*UPDATED DOWNLOAD LINK* My bad! The old Windows ver. download link a few hours ago didn't provide related DLLs, It's working now!

This is my first ever LD. :)  

I made a prototype bullet hell game, with playable side REVERSED, annnnnd.. I hope that's enough for explanation. :p 

Use z, x, c button and mouse to control, there are some info/hints on screen as well.

There's no sound, the art is crap, I just want to try out my idea :p  And encountered some programming issue... so time flies by. The current gameplay is somewhat playable, and the game is pretty short, so please try out and leave some comments, thanks :) 

Made with Love2D, windows executable included, .love source as well, but I don't have the executable for other platforms.

entries.title: Doomsday Defense
entries.description:
A tower defense style game. Highlight guns by moving the mouse over them. Press up, W, or 8 on the numpad to transfer energy from your fortress to the highlighted gun. Press down, S, or 2 on the numpad to transfer energy from your highlighted gun to your fortress. When the volcano is smoking left click to fire a bomb at that spot. The more energy your fortress has the quicker you win, but the more energy your guns have the faster they shoot.

Have had some people who couldn't get the game to load, the preloader was stuck at 0. If you have this problem try the Flash Basic version.

entries.title: Dr. Villano
entries.description:
Dr. Villano. Classic shooter game.
Destroy the world if you can...

If you want to use other screen resolution open settings.ini.

Game, Graphic, Sound and server for scoreboard made in 72h in C++ using ALLEGRO 5.0.8.

Coder: Davide Moriello
Artist / Sound: Daniel Hafner


Thank you all for playing, just hope it can give you fun!
Ah, and Goats!

entries.title: Entropy
entries.description: definitely not done, but I am going to post anyway! Give me some points for the idea. Try using SPACE, clicking on the screen, and wasd, the effects differ depending on your form. by the way, you are the god of chaos... how does it feel?

entries.title: Goods
entries.description:
'GOODS' puts you in the shoes of a shady street salesman, the kind that sells everything from "genuine" Ray-Ban sunglasses to Rod Steward bootleg tapes. "It fell off a truck" is your standard response if someone asks for the origin story of your fine wares. Business is good, but Alas, your prospering enterprise is in danger as Miami's most skilled undercover agents Sonny and Ricardo are on to you! How much green can you collect before the heat finally busts you? 

Use LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys to walk
Hold SPACE to trade. Release to abort the trade.

entries.title: Hell Guy Hells It Up
entries.description:
You are Hell Guy! Like any hell guy, you enjoy clubbing farmers over the head until they die and throwing their skulls and goats into portals to hell.

Have a good time! Get the princess!

This game was made in Unity 3.5 (sorry Linux users :(! ) and the models were made in Blender.

entries.title: Heroes are so Annoying!
entries.description:
Take control of an evil RPG villain and try to take down those pesky Heroes, by commanding an army of monsters.

The goal is to defeat the Heroes before they reach the end of the dungeon. Use the WASD keys to move the view around, and click to place a monster. Placing monsters requires Evil Points, as seen at the bottom right. You change the selected monster by clicking the icons at the bottom.
When the Hero comes into contact with a monster, a battle will commence!

WASD \ Arrow Keys- Move View or Cursor
X - Confirm
C - Cancel
Left Click - Place monster

entries.title: Home Massacre
entries.description:
A monster comes across a quiet ranch in the night...

The game is very short, maybe <5 mins or so. I hope you like it! For most part I was focusing on the overall feel and mood of the game so I hope I was able to do something there!

[EDIT] added edited build
