entries.title: Invasion2600
entries.description:
This game was made in more or less 12 hours

If you are old enough*, you will know what Missile Command is about.
Someone (I never found out who) is trying to destroy you precious bases.
And you have to shot missiles at incoming missiles.
In this simple clone, you will play the attacking side: your goal is to destroy someone's (which we don't know who) bases.
You enemy will score point for every missile it destroys, make sure he gets the least possible score points.


Controls:
You control the top blue / red crosshair, either by horizontal mouse movement or by left and right arrows.

You are ready to fire when your crosshair is red
Press 1-6 to shot at bases from when your crosshair is.
(eg. 2 will shot the second base)

When your crosshair becomes triple, you can fire a missile which later splits in 3.
Press QWERTY to shot it.
If have a QWERTZ layout, mostly like a German keyboard, you can use Z instead of Y.

P - Pauses the game
ESCAPE - While in menus: Back. While in pause: Back to home screen.
ENTER - While in menus: Confirm. 


Don't like Unity3D web player? You can find download links for Win/Mac/Linux apps at the bottom of Web entry page.

entries.title: Lil Assassin
entries.description:
*The wall jumps are not like they are in most games! This was intended!

Arrow keys to move, z to jump. Walk up to someone from behind to assassinate. Assassinate the king!

Jump while walking into a wall to wall run. Jump while wall running to wall jump.

It's a small but challenging game!

Jezzamon has brought to my attention the fact that you're not allowed to use free graphics in LD48. So I guess I didn't quite follow the rules, and I won't win (not that I was expecting to,) but hey! It was fun!

entries.title: Missile Mission
entries.description:
You're on a mission.. to blow up the world. Written with Cocos2d JS bindings using Cocos Builder. 

Fly your missile through the asteroid belt in order to destroy the planet, collecting warp rings to increase your speed (and give you points).

To control the missile, drag it across the screen.

Programmed by Nathan Trapp and art by Josh Miller.

iOS version will be posted shortly, you'll have to code-sign it manually to try it.

entries.title: Mordor Must Resist!
entries.description:
You are Sauron and you have to face the army of humans, hobbits, wizards and eagles that are coming to destroy you! Take careful aim and fire, let them explode in a cloud of blood! YOU ARE THE AWESOME VILLAIN!

[CONTROLS]
Navigate the menu - Arrows and Enter to confirm.
In the game - Aim with the mouse and shoot with the left mouse button.
----------------
[ADDED CONTROLS IN V2.0 - POSTCOMPO]
- Auto fire (no need to spam the left mouse button)
+ Highscore board implemented (Each player can challenge your friends at home or, as I do, work colleagues)
+ Spells: Added 4 spells: 3 unlockable to the score of 650/2000/4500.
- [D] Spell 1: Arrows (orc archers will shoot two arrows to hit the eagles coming from above)
- [F] Spell 2: Trolls (2 large trolls come out from the tower that will kill the first 10 enemy units that will be on their way)
- [G] Spell 3: Meteors (A meteor shower will wipe out a large number of incoming enemies)
- [H] Spell 4: Heal (The tower will regenerate 30% of his life)

Enjoy it!

entries.title: The Fix
entries.description:
In The Fix, you play a man down on his luck, who has to make money by fixing boxing matches and sabotaging your opponents.  Throw newspapers, bottles, and infernal goats at your opponents in your efforts to achieve glory and become the ultimate match fixer!  Use your earnings to buy newer weapons, and continue your climb to riches!

Once the fight starts, you don't control the fighters - but you can distract the opponent on the right, by throwing things.  Press A, B, G, and P to unlock and use weapons.  Winning earns you more cash, but puts you up against stronger opponents.

The newspaper will interrupt an attack, making you skip to the next turn
The banana damages enemy morale, making him more likely to use weaker attacks
The bottle does some HP damage
The HELL GOAT does a lot of HP damage, and sounds awesome.  It's totally OP.

All assets made by me, using Photoshop, Inkscape, SFXR, and GarageBand.  My first working game ever, and first ever LD entry.  And yes, there are goats.

entries.title: The rich get richer
entries.description:
Create grief and make people miserable through stock exchange. As I couldn't get the miserableness simulator working on time, the mission in this game is to influence companies to be less efficient and more annoying by increasing a 'chaos' meter.

As the level of accumulated chaos increases, you gain some slightly demonic abilities. The win condition is to raise the total level of chaos by influencing big companies to be Evil (or, at least, irritating). Have too little money on your pocket and you lose.

Made in java and tested in Windows and Linux.
Thank you for playing.

-----------Guidelines / Tutorial ----------
It seems I made this even more crytic that I at first thought, so my apologies to anyone who tried it and felt a bit lost.

Some guidelines:

- Clicking on a Company in the left side allows you to buy shares, up to as many as your current money allows.
- You lose the moment your money get too low (under 200) no matter what you own at the moment, so be careful when buying shares.
- Owning a chunk of a company gives you control over its chaos bar, the more you own the more control.
- A company low in chaos has more chances of growing and increasing its share values.
- The opposite is also true: high chaos makes the company shrink and lowers the value of its shares.
-The biggest a company is (size), the more it influences the total chaos.
- As total chaos increases, you unlock spells and, ultimatelly, win the game.
- The spells work as follows:
	-Charisma lets you move the chaos meter over the bounds you would normally have.
	-Fear allows you to buy cheaper shares.
	-Perception filter makes companies you own look better: companies with high chaos will grow as if it was lower while this spell is active.

Putting all this together, some viable strategies are:
- Buy shares of a company with a middle-high chaos value and lower it, wait and its value will go up.
- Increase the chaos value of a company before selling it, later on its value will go down and you can buy it again more cheaply.
- Try to keep chaos as high as posible while letting the company still grow, so the total chaos increases and you get access to useful spells.
- Buy while fear is active, change chaos while charisma if active, keep perception filter active if you own anything.

Hope it helps!

entries.title: The Villein
entries.description:
The Lord of the manor has offered a unique prize:

One piece of gold per day is hereby offered for any servant who demonstrates total focus and dedication to the task at hand. Your work deep in the mine, cutting lumber in the forest, carrying water, tending to the herd, working the farm, and repairing the castle will all be scrutinized. Perform these tasks in the order specified and perhaps someday you can buy your freedom.

Can you follow instructions better than your peers?  Lets find out!

A note on the theme:

After the unpleasantness of the last week I didn't want to spend all weekend on a game glorifying being a bad guy.  Didn't seem like fun to me.  Then it struck me, "You are the Villain"... the word Villain doesn't have to designate a scoundrel or criminal, it can refer to a Villein.  A villein is an unfree peasant with the same standing as a slave or serf to a feudal lord (but free in legal relations with respect to others).

*Update* Added a post-competition version using feedback from some of the reviewers.  Really appreciate the suggestions and feedback!

Also, before I forget, I used http://www.earslap.com/projectslab/otomata to generate the background music.  My 3-year old daughter Autumn helped me with the sound effects.

entries.title: Villain???

entries.title: Colorful
entries.description:
The post-compo version adds a save/load feature and a short tutorial. There are also a few minor bugfixes and small changes in the game rooms. Enemy behaviour is also randomized a little bit.

Based heavily on Hero Core, Colouful is a game where the player moves around a 2D world, fighting multiple enemies. With no gravity effects, all depends only on the player's speed. Collect the colour artifacts and bring them to your love!

Colourful tells the story of a man, who, not being able to cope with the depression of his beloved one, goes on a mission to make her world, once again... colorful.

Factsheet:
- language: Object Pascal
- compiler: Free Pascal Compiler
- IDE: Lazarus
- sound library: BASS
- event handling and gfx lib: SDL
- additional gfx lib: Sour
- graphics editor: GIMP, iDraw Chara Maker
- sound generator: sfxr
- map editor: vim

entries.title: Dungeon Warden: Rise of the Goatman
entries.description:
You are the Goatman, young Dungeon Warden. Your task is to build a dungeon complex and fill those with various deadly creatures. 

Heroes will try to save the kingdom from your evil plans. This is your test to become a Warden. Do you have what it takes to lead the hope out from people hearts?

Features:
- 5 different dungoes to build
- populate dungeons with various creatures
- watch heroes trying to reach your main dungeon and kill you
- 3 tiers of wizard and knights (heroes)
- pixelated graphics
- 8 bit sound effects

This is not Tower defense...
This is not RTS...
This is not Management game...
..
This is DUNGEON WARDEN: Rise of the Goatman!

------------------------------------------------------
There is also Post LD (more balanced gameplay with some graphic additions) version to download but if you are here to vote this game, download original version and play that first.

entries.title: Evil Lair

entries.title: Fortress Keeper
entries.description:
A defence game, where peasants attempt to overthrow you, the cruel, overtaxing lord of the fort.

Didn't have time for sound, traps or escalating difficulty, but the core game is there. Hope somebody can get some fun out of it.

entries.title: Fry Fleshlings Fast
entries.description:
Use lasers to fry fleshlings.

Click and drag to deploy a laser.

Lasers fry the aforementioned fleshlings, but also cut their walking path.

Try directing them towards the same location and them frying all of them at once.

PS.: There are two Android versions. One is small (800kb) and needs Adobe AIR installed. The other one is bigger (9.6mb) and doesn't need AIR installed because it's bundled. This bundled ("captive") version also requires an "Internet access" permission because the AIR packager forces that. It doesn't use Internet for anything. If you're unsure, check the source or download the standard version that needs AIR.

entries.title: Get Your Goat
entries.description:
You, the evil goat hating evil mastermind, have kidnapped the goat princess. Use your towers to fend off the angry masses trying to rescue her.

You have three different towers at your disposal to fend off the masses of three different types of enemies.
Towers:
Shoot Tower- Fires fast travelling bullets at one enemy
Slow Tower- Fires a snaring beam of frost that does no damage but splashes to targets within the area
Melee Tower- A short range tower that deals splash damage to all nearby targets

Enemies:
Goat Knights- Knights who have sworn their life to the crown of the goat king. Average in all respects.
Goats- Minions of the goat king, they move fast, but have little health.
"Goat Kings"- Okay, they're green blobs. But they have a crown. As if the Goat King would actually go after his daughter himself.

I ran out of time to fully debug, play test, and polish. However, this is a fully functional game. I will definitely be doing some more testing, balancing and polishing. Enjoy my rushed programmer art and minimal sounds!

entries.title: Goombah!
entries.description:

Used Flashpunk, Gimp, and bfxr.

Edit 12/16: Added background music generated using GreaseMonkey's awesome Autotracker-Bu.  Adjusted sound volumes because Ow, My Ears.

entries.title: Klause Pringle: Eco Terrorist

Controls are explained in-game; I'll type them up tomorrow. Shoot me a comment if you have any questions, comments, problems, bugs.

The game looks prettiest in Chrome, but works in all browsers with HTML5 support.

Team:
Dae in Cho (@haloflooder) - Programming, art, design
Mitchell Orcino (@mitch_orcino) - Art, design
Kyle Bradshaw (@TehSkull) - Design, art, sound
Seth White (@HerbivoreZombie) - Music

Keep your eye out for the goat. It's there. Finding it will give you a sneak preview at what little work we did on Level 2.
Edit: I feel like I should let you all know that the goat easter egg CAN be found after time runs out. Keep looking.

Edit 2: Merry Christmas to all. As our gift to you, we have a hint for the Goat easter egg, as no one seems to have found it. It's located in the bathroom.

Good luck.

Key terms;

I hope you enjoy this! Good luck to all the other LDers!

entries.title: Nibble
entries.description:

**Press "ENTER" to skip intro text**

Use the WASD keys to control your character. Avoid anything that flickers or moves, see below:

  ' = bad
  | = switch
  ? = terminal
  0 = break these
{{}} = fire

This is my first ludum dare. Hope you enjoy the game!

entries.title: Nightmare
entries.description:
A boy sleeps peacefully in bed, but you are the nightmare, come to make his dreams unhappy. Enter the towers that protect his dreams, and corrupt the core.

Defeating large enemies will grant you the power to take the form of that creature.

This is the Jam entry I made along with Chip Caramel.

The Windows version is now up, just unpack the exe and dll files somewhere and run. If you already have Love2D on you system, you may prefer to run the Love2D version, though, as it'll be a slightly smaller download.

Left/Right - Move
Left Shift (Hold) - Sprint
Up - Enter doorway/Corrupt core
Down - Crawl, Drop from ceiling
Space - Jump/Fly/Advance Intro and ending
C - Attack
X (hold) + Arrows - Transform
Ctrl+Q - Exit game
F2 - Change window size

We were tight on time here, so this hasn't been tested nearly enough. Probably lots of bugs left and right that I don't know about. I'll probably post a post-jam version later with fixes.

entries.title: The Button

And that was all it took."

Yup. That's him.

NOTE 12/18: The original version of this didn't work on slower computers. entries.title: Trina of The Depths
entries.description:
* *** TRINA OF THE DEPTHS *** *   
An underwater adventure          
May contain goats (although it probably doesn't)


GENRE: exploration, octopus simulation (will be metroidvania/RPG, when it's finished)

SOFTWARE USED: Photoshop, Flash, Construct 2, FL studio


::: Story :::

This is Trina.
She's an Octopus. She's also the daughter of the Dark King of the Seas. This is not her home, this is not the Depths.
What is she doing in this place? All she remembers is she woke up in this ridiculously colorful cave..
 
Why is the water so clear, why the fish so happy?
She just can't stand it! They will pay, and maybe, maybe she will find a way back home.


::: Controls :::

Cursor keys to move. Cephalopod muscles are a mixed blessing. On the one tentacle, they allow for amazing feats of strength. On the other 7, they require some coordination.
On your bottom left is the Octopus Muscle-meter. It gets tired the more you exert your muscles.
But you have to think like an octopus. Hold the cursor key(s) in the direction you want to go, and release. The longer you hold, the farther you go.

You will be rewarded with a feeble jump at first, but watch how gracefully Trina moves at the height of her villainous mollusc power. 

Shift to attack fish and things. Casually turning them into blackest ink. You can also try the same attack by quickly pressing left <- and right -> a few times in a row in succession.

The peddler crab is selling ink and agility upgrades. Stand in front of the upgrade and press shift. Provided, of course, you have the necessary gold coins.

The purple octopus pellets give you some muscle power back. Collecting them helps you stay afloat and go higher.


::: CONTROL SHEET :::

Hold down cursor key(s) : charge your thrust
Release cursor key(s)   : jump in that direction
Shift or <><> combo     : attack


Stay tuned for the timelapse video.

I hope you like it. I'll be happy to receive bug reports! I know it must be full of those. ^-^

Also, I will be finishing this. I've planned as far as a boss fight, some dialogue with NPCs and a dramatic cliffhanger ending. 72 hours just wasn't enough for all this, so I understand complaints of "this game doesn't fit the theme". I wanted the story to unfold inside the game, through narration and dialogue, but I had no time for a pretty implementation, and I made a decision that I should not cheapen the art with plain text. So your concerns are valid!

::: Strategy Guide / Hintsheet :::
Tip: always let the meter replenish as much as you can before making a second jump. After a while, it becomes second nature.

(Spoilers ahead)

1. Swim to the right collecting coins. Kill the fish. Continue right until you find the peddling crab. You should have enough coins to buy the small power-up. Trina will be much more maneuverable. <- From a game design point of view, this is what I thought would be a good tutorial, it's pretty much a straight line, and teaches you the basics.

2. Then, go to the left and up, using the purple octopus pellets to help you, and get a bunch of coins. Take in the sights. Trina can rest on anchors if you position her at the bottom T, use them.

3. You should have 49 coins when you get to the crab again. Get one more from the right, and buy the 50coin powerup. Now you're on turbo power

4. Go to the right and explore the final section of the dungeon. Kill the last thing you find. That's it, you've beat the game. Feel free to explore the previous areas, with your improved control. I think moving around as an octopus is the most enjoyable part of the game. Do you?


::: PS section :::

P.S. I forgot to tell you. See if you can find the easter eggs. I counted 4.

EDIT: after complaints about control, I managed to pinpoint a big bug that made the movement CPU-dependent. I edited, and it should feel more playable now, even on older systems.

entries.title: Villain from Nooblord band
entries.description:
Your task is just to reach the highest level. Knights are stronger in each lvl. You will die often, but this is not problem here, If you want be stronger try to collect eggs, you will find them in red barrels. You are bad guy who is killing good knights.

My first ludum dare and first game written in less than 2 days.

entries.description:

entries.title: 2012: Mayan Revenge
entries.description:
It's 2012 and the end of the Mayan calendar is here. It's your job to destroy the world!

Take out wave upon wave of troops, as the apocalypse takes place.

The game will fit inside your browser window. To make it run faster re-size your browser and refresh the page.

It runs faster on Chrome and Safari. Firefox will run slower, but without difficulty.

Internet Explorer 9+ works without sound.

(Now with added goat!)

EDIT: I've added a post deadline version, in which you can pause the game and mute the sounds. Other wise it's the same game. You should mark me on the first link.

entries.title: Abhorrent
entries.description:
So I had a few ideas. Ended up going with a platformer :D

I ended up spending most of my time on code for the cutscenes and the platformer state machines, and I didn't get to do the levels after the opening cutscene.  So it's just an opening cutscene where things don't go so good for you.

I think the platforming feels good, it's just a shame I didn't make any levels to really take advantage of it.

JawsJS was a trooper in the whole experience.  Highly recommended.

The source code can be found at:
https://github.com/themindoverall/abhorrent

entries.title: Alien Cow Kidnapper 2
entries.description:
You are the EVIL UFO invading peaceful land of cows and their cowherd. It's time to make you father proud.

HOWTO:

Finish ongoing task. Simply kill all "cowherds". Collect cows to restore health. Move over active electric orb to get
bigger LASER!

CONTROLS:

LASER: Use right stick to control the laser.
MOVING: Use WSAD to move around. 

Windows version will be xbox/ps3 pad friendly.

Flash version is very slow. Optimisations are comming along. Also there is a lot of room for improvements, especialy for AI.

We are aiming for mobile. Mobile version comming along ( iOS, Android, BlackBerry, Amazon, PS Vita )

TEAM:
Radek_ne
Michax

entries.title: Alien Invaders
entries.description:
You are the leader of an alien invasion commando unit. 
Your Task: Capture 1/500000th of the human population(1466 humans)

You have 1000 alien subordinates. You can use them to capture humans. You can enslave captured humans, but as slaves will plot your demise in their little free time, they will only work at 1/4 the rate of a normal human. To effectively use the humans, you have to persuade them to work for your cause. 
Research the humans to make your tasks even easier.


I hadn't much time to work on this. Overall this was done in around 10 hours if not less. I had to cut nearly all features to just have a somewhat playable game. Well it was a nice experience anyways.

entries.title: DR. MADDOC Takes Over The World and Kills 3D Forever
entries.description:
Become the Mad Scientist Dr.Maddoc. Take over the world and destroy 3D games forever! Enjoy this sneaking game!

First time I used Ogmo editor and made 2D lighting and shadows, so it was a fun challange!

Been very stressed up until the end! Will be coming out a jam version with everything a bit more polished soon! Should be better graphics, better AI, more maps and story!

Timelapse coming soon! Need a shower and some rest after this 35ish hours of coding

Cheers all! Please comment and rate! :D


### HOW TO PLAY ###
Use arrow keys to move around, space to go to next dialog, collect all chests on each level before going to the exit (marked by a ghost, usually back where you started)

There is a known bug where you miss a level at random, so if the story doesn't make sense, try another playthrough :)

entries.title: Evil kitten-kidnapping pirates - from SPACE
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move and space bar to fire cannon.
You collect money by kidnapping the floating kittens (do NOT shoot them). Use the money to upgrade your ship in the shop, which is floating around somewhere...

You can read my post mortem about the game here: http://salomonsson.se/games/ludum-dare-25-post-mortem

entries.title: Goat-Nappers
entries.description:
Goat-Nappers is a 3 player physical card game.  You'll need to print out 3 full-color sheets and cut them up to play it!  Tell me if you have fun :)  

-Phil

P.S. I drew the villains by hand without tracing.  The goats I traced, they are my goats, after all!

+1Goat 1Goat Goat Goats

entries.title: Grey Goo Turbo Challenge
entries.description: Arrow keys or WASD. Scientists were meddling with self-replicating nanobots when things got our of control and a huge rolling grey goo scenario escaped to the main road. They have tried to put a stop to it by spreading red sticky nanogoo all over the road, but due to a bug in the nanocode some of it has turned into beneficial (or is it) green goo instead.

entries.title: Hostile Hostels
entries.description:
***Bugfix Update (The source has been updated to reflect changes)***
*Fixed a potentially game breaking bug where the player would have to wait 100 seconds after the final wave before they would receive their win screen. It is now 10 seconds as intended

***Plays best in Chrome, Firefox, and later versions of IE***

***You do not need to click every bird; you can simply click and drag over them. You'll be wanting that extra finger endurance for the end game***

Welcome to Hostile Hostels!

The name of the game is shady Hotel Management.  Create hotels  on grave sites as a horrible way to stop brave adventures from getting to their destination.  Try your best to prevent the good guys from surviving the night.

This is my first Ludum Dare entry and my second game I've ever finished.

Enjoy,
Chaz Louviere (Crashbanito)

***Did you know? After awhile the game becomes so overloaded with enemies that they stop spawning. After a friend triggered this, I decided to create a win screen. Attach a screenshot if you can survive that long!***

[Tools]
Audio: Audacity
Development and Imagery: Game Maker Studio: Pro + Plus HTML5
Extra Editing: Notepad++

entries.title: Kollum: The Pressure Valve
entries.description:
You are Kollum the Destroyer!

Back in ye olden days you hath brought Death upon the ancient underground Cite of Ludarume.

You have but one precious little thing left in this dark world: The Pressure Valve

But you lost your precious, near the Surface, where some adventurer by the name of Tombo found it.

You want your precious back and you must stop Tombo in his quest.


Created in LOVE2d, downloads available for all the platforms. Music is created with MilkyTracker and the sounds with bfxr.

Follow the future development on IndieDB: 
http://www.indiedb.com/games/kollum-the-pressure-valve

entries.title: Mr. Sweets... DESTROYER OF WORLDS
entries.description:
the read me contains details!

Aim of the Game:

attack the enemy cities from your evil lair! 
each attack will grant you some money back.
each city destroyed will increase your income!

but watch out for enemy spies and counters ;)

use the upgrades to increase missile load times and city benefits

the aim is to kill all the cities!

thanks for playing my game!
<3 mule

entries.title: Prison Break
entries.description:
Seriously started running out of time at the end :(

Anyways, Prison Break is a beat-em up game where you have to help Carl make a successful escape from prison so he can go to the bar for a drink. Fight or avoid the cops the best you can, while beating up civilians to pay for your booze habit!

It's good clean fun for the whole family!

Edit:
This game requires the XNA Redistributable to be installed, available here: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Random Adventure
entries.description:
Art by me,
Model by me,
music by me (everything without effect adhssaihds)

Half way trough the end, i understand that i coudln't finish this... so i run the rest... 

too much stuff unused :(

Great fun though :)

I tried to stream that, without great results -.-


*Better experience with Headphones&Joypad

entries.title: Sinister Simon
entries.description:
Sinister Simon is a little game where you play as a crook called Simon and help him gather enough money to realize his dream trough some very sinister activities.

I wasn't expecting this theme and had 0 ideas for it when it was revealed, so I decided to do very simple design upon which I could expand if there were time.

The game contains 3 mini-games all of which contribute money towards the goal. Failing to complete a minigame will start the game all over again (NES flashback).

The minigames are:
 Bank Robbery - open a vault before cops show up
 Hack a Mac - gather sensitive data from a mac for blackmail
 Creditcard Fraud - use someone elses' credit card for money


I'm not entirely satisfied with the game, but atleast I got something finished :)

Thank you all for making this event so cool!

entries.title: Terminal Killer
entries.description:
Terminal Killer is a puzzle game where you implement and run a virus on an innocent man's computer in under 250 seconds. 

Try and beat the clock!

Flashing colors! Excitement! Oh, my!

No music or sound. I had a track, but it would probably hurt your ears. If you really want to hear it, the track's still in the source!

entries.title: The Enforcer
entries.description:
Enforcer is an action-platformer with 3D graphics and 2D gameplay where the player controls "The Enforcer", a super hero gifted with incrediblle strenght and far-from-average clumsiness.
In the game, he will try to stop super villains such as "THE JAYWALKER". By doing so, he will go through the level dodging obstacles, and destroy the city because of his strenght. Each time he jumps on a building, touches a car, or hits someone, he will cause death and desolation without even knowing it.

Each level starts with the police alert concerning the level's villain, including his description and characteristics. Then the player has to finish the level in a given time before the villain escape, finds him, and arrest him (by touching him). During the level, some of the destroyed objects will have a cost and/or a casualty number attached to it (it increments the total cost and casualties scores that will be displayed at the end of the game (whether it's a win or a game over). They also have a string attached to them that will be displayed in a fake news feed at the bottom of the screen during the game.

The overall scene is displayed as if it was filmed by a news channel helicopter. We can also see comments from random citizen, who never loose faith in their hero even if he kills and destroy everything.

entries.title: The Rat Lab Villain
entries.description: Just developed the first idea I had.

entries.title: The Viking Life
entries.description:
Finally finished for once, as I wasn't so crazy with the ideas, didn't have many for the theme...

Controls: W,A,S,D
Reload: R
Pillage: Space (Spam the space bar)

Note: Should work on all platforms (It is made in Java)
Requires: Java 7

entries.title: The Villainous Mr. ???
entries.description:
A mysterious villain has escaped from his 2D world and is now wreaking havoc on the peaceful inhabitants of this strange new 3D land!

Controls:
r - reset to checkpoint
a - move left
d - move right
w - jump
mouse - pick up/place enemies

Visuals and music by Chase Oros
Programming and level design by Andrew Fitzpatrick

entries.title: Villain Glance
entries.description:
VILLAIN GLANCE



Be the Villain.
Shoot your peers.
Be discreet.
Be quick.
They become suspicious.
They feel your guilt.
If you get caught red-handed they'll make you pay.


WASD to move.
Left button mouse to shoot.
R to restart.
M to back to menu.
X to mute/unmute.


Tips : 

  -The red ones are suspicious, they have a larger angle of view.
  -Global suspicion increase their rotation speed.
  -You turn dark with your guilt, and they tend to look at you.

entries.title: A pigeon's life: shitting on humanity
entries.description:
(made with Game Maker 6, compiled with Game Maker 8.1)

FUKUSHIMA, YEAR 2026.
AFTER THE ATOMIC DISASTER 15 YEARS AGO PIGEONS STARTED GROWING ABNORMALLY, THREATENING PEOPLE WITH THEIR HUGE SHITS.

YOU'RE A PIGEON. YOU HAVE TO PUT AN END TO HUMAN RACE

---

* Use the arrow keys to move, and the spacebar to shit.
* The more you shit, the more you get hungry, until you die.
* Women are the only ones that give you food. Kill them immediately after.
* Take the power-ups from the reactor for more powerful shits.

Have fun.

--- UPDATE --- 20/12/2012 (great date, by the way)
VERSION 1.1

I fixed the crashing bugs (all of them, I hope), therefore my entry is still valid for the compo.

I also added the sound effects and music I made, but as a POST compo feature: if you want, you can download and put them in the SAME game folder, but remember they're NOT part of my competition entry.

I appreciate your feedbacks and I'm waiting for more now that the game's working better :P

Peace!

entries.title: A Reason for Vengeance
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move, space to shoot a magic spell, enter to advance through dialogue/make menu choices.

There are a few unresolved bugs, due to social commitments that constrain me beyond the 48 hour time limit. You may occasionally need to hit ENTER twice in order to advance dialogue or a choice menu. Other than that there shouldn't be major issues. If there are, please let me know.

There are many ways to end the game, but for 100%ers there are 3 designer-directed endings. (As opposed to a player-directed ending, which is when you decide to stop playing of your own volition rather than because I send you back to the title screen.)

In order to see the truly villainous ending you will need to kill some innocents.

For me, this was about questioning what villainy really is. Does killing the people who killed your brother make you a villain? What about killing the people who were there to back them up? What about killing the others in their organization? What about killing a god? Where along that spectrum do you become a villain?

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Angry Angus from Outer Space!!!
entries.description:
Game is fully playable, but some features didn't get implemented... Oh well...
Scoring system works like this: 
5 points per ship you destroy. 
A LOT for destroying Earth.
You die, you get nothing.

Made in AS3 using Flixel, the link should work fine in your browser... I included the SWF file in a 7z file as well if you would rather download it.

EDIT: Just read at the bottom of the page that I can fix game breaking bugs such as this (I left out '.members' in one place..) so I have updated the swf with this change in it, and one that stopped the scrap from displaying all the graphics I made for it. There will still be issues if you destroy a lot of ships and don't collect the scrap though, because it never goes away if you don't.

RE: The frame rate dropping. I did not have any issues during development with the frame rate, but playing now I can see where it is coming from. So I can only assume that it was one of those additions I made in the last half an hour that didn't get proper testing. Seems that some sprites are not being removed from the render process when they should be. My apologies for this.
Edit: My assumption was correct, the explosion sprites were not actually being removed due to a last minute change. Fixed that locally, but I don't think I am allowed to update the version for judging.

entries.title: Bad Day as a Hero
entries.description:
Preliminary upload incase things go horrid. Early version of everything right now :)

First time, but it was fun and a huge learning experience.

Stuff used:
-Unity
-Photoshop
-SFXR

Controls implemented
-Left-Click
-Space
-'W' & 'A'

Enjoy :D

entries.title: Bad Santa
entries.description: Hi, guys! It's my first game, which I developed during 32-48 hours. You can read main story in game intro. Enjoy!

entries.title: Bah Humbug
entries.description:
You have been recruited by the Easter Bunny to destroy Christmas. You must go around Santa's grotto destroying everything, but the elves try and repair your damage.
WASD To move and Space to use items, pick up items and destroy items.

entries.title: BFG TD
entries.description:
BFG TD - Big Faul(yeah..) Goats Tower Defense

This game is a turn and team based online multiplayer tower defense game. And yes we are insane people to even try to do this in 72 hours :)
Most of the game is like ordinary TD's, but teams defend AND attack each other on each turn.
When your team is defending, you modify your attacking wave of faul goats.
When your team is attacking, you modify your defense towers.

The ultimate goal of the game is to destroy your opponents base.

--NOTES--
 * Non-Upgraded creeps(goats) are quite slow so don't spawn too many if you don't have the money to upgrade them. Or the round will be really long.
 * When you first login you need to wait for the current round to end before you see any action.

--CREDITS--
server: tmtowtdi
client & art: bms

PS: There has to be at least 2 players online for the game to start.
PPS: The server crashes every now and then :)

entries.title: DinoBurgers
entries.description:
First time entering the LD!

You are masterchef Pierre,the owner of the "DinoBurger" restaurants.
With your time-machine you can go back in time to hunt dinosaurs. This is a high value delicacy. But will the dinosaurs survive this slaughter?

Now with REAL dinosaur sounds!

entries.title: Field Report
entries.description:
A reverse Dating Sim made in Twine.

Collaboration between myself and my artist-in-crime Matthias Conrady.

Known Bug: Will prompt again for name if browser back button is used.

entries.title: Event Horizon
entries.description:
Play as the Ultimate Villain - a black hole!  In this fast-paced arcade game, a fleet of ships is sent to stop you before you suck all goodness out of the universe.  Through your cunning use of gravity, propulsive ion jets, teleportation, and powerups, destroy the ships by smashing asteroids into them.

Thanks for playing my game!  Don't forget to vote!

Made with Lua, Moonscript, and Love2D for MacOSX and Windows.

tips for windows users:
  -- you must extract the contents of the zip before playing
  -- you must not move the executable away from the folder it's extracted to (shortcuts are okay)

entries.title: Hostile Nebula
entries.description:
"Sometimes you have to be your own hero", someone says.
In videogames, however, it's quite the opposite: usually you're the hero, but sometimes you just gotta be the bad guy.

Your mission is to stop the 'nth' space hero, by sending him the right troops at the right time.
Pick the troops with your keyboard and place them by clicking on the grid with your mouse. And that's it. Hope you like it.

entries.title: Just Politics
entries.description:
This is our entry to LD25! Villiany? That sound like politics! So politics it is! Oh and patience on the link, the game should appear in a minute. If you see yourself waiting TOO much, a F5 will probably do the trick.


 -- Instructions --
WASD to move, MouseClick to suck money off those damn people!

 -- Common Troubleshooting --
Chrome has been reported to cause some problems with the screen size. If you notice that, try using Mozilla Firefox!

Team:
Lucas Mattos
Lucas Mello
Joao Guilherme Brant

entries.title: Lab's Lab
entries.description:
Requires XNA 4.0

Lab's Lab is game that encourages you to make you own maze and compete against others to run them as fast as possible.

Arrows to move while playing.
Left and right click to change tiles in the editor.
Escape takes you back to the title screen.
Just type in the title screen to change you nick.
Same in the editor to change the map's name.

You can check highscores in this web: http://205.185.123.227/ld/

Best times are recorded for each maze and displayed in the web.

entries.title: Life of the Death
entries.description:
Just run the start.bat in he zip or execute the jar with the commandline : "java -Djava.library.path=native -jar LifeOfTheDeath.jar"
It will get extended in the post-compo version.
The game explains itself, just try it!
I'll do my best to create a web version, too.

entries.title: Love Lines
entries.description:
Do you chose to stop love when it comes so close to fruition, or do you just look away despite your own tragic past!

Play on web for best experience.

Windows download for the .swf file if you want to run it out of the browser.

Arrow keys to move, double tap to dash.

Press/hold space to attack.

There are definitely some bugs I didn't get to squash before submitting, and they may inhibit your enjoyment of the game. Sorry, did my best! Just letting you know I am aware. I may link to a fixed post-compo vesion later.

(MILD SPOILER -- the lines represent when the two beings love one another, the closer they are to being together when you take them out, the more darkness you add to the world -- Also, there are two endings to this game)

entries.title: Raoul V. in You Are Ze Villain!
entries.description:
Welcome to Paris, 1914.

Step in the shoes of a disoriented man with a mission: to kill a certain person. But in order to do that, he will have to collect information from the pages of his notebook scattered around the block. Be ready to take some notes of your own, or try to keep all the information in your head!
Then, if you kill him, try to reach the border of the map and exit the city!

NEWS:

- Windows versions are both good to go! Sorry for the problems.

- I wrote a big-ass post-mortem : http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/17/raoul-v-sends-his-regards/

TECHNICAL:

A rare bug can put you in a problematic situation at the start. Just relaunch the game and it should be fine. Happened maybe 3 times out of the ~100 times I ran the game.

The controls are explained inside the game (and in the README.txt), but a bonus : You can skip dialogues by pressing "enter".

Have fun!

(Oh, and I do have goats in there somewhere... In a way...)

entries.title: Red Revenge
entries.description:
Meh 1st LD entry.

You play as a villain that was the best, until one day another villain destroyed the moon and spread influence to your henchman until you were the only one left.

The game starts with you regaining your pride by destroying the planet Magnus(the other villains HQ) to defeat him and become the ultimate villain of the universe.

Known Bugs:
-If your resources hit 5 and there's a crate touching you, the crate disappears and you do not gain any resource

-Plasma batteries, when activated, will consume all instead of just one

-Drones stack if left too long and ista-kills if touches you

-This is a Game Maker game, so it does not work on anything other than Windows, but WinE would work(no sound though)

(Note: The objective of the game is to collect enough resources to craft an item at the RIGHT SIDE of the level to advance to the next stage)

entries.title: Revenge of the goats
entries.description: You have 3 endings a good, a bad and sort of neutral.

entries.title: RobTheBank
entries.description:
The game is about four villains, who try to robe the bank.

Controls: WASD SPACE
          or arrows Z X

entries.title: Stomp goats and insult the princess
entries.description:
There is nothing more evil and villainous than stomping goats except insulting princesses. Now you can do both in the same time!

CONTROLS and INFO:
Left and right move you left and right
Up jumps (double jumping included)
Down deploys your deployable
Space swaps deployables

You get score based on killing goats and your bonus. Your bonus goes up the more insults you throw and the more goats you stop but resets if you touch the ground.

The bomb kills goats and blasts you away.
The sad cannon is sad, it doesn't do anything. But you can ride the bullets. A portable elevator if you will.

Score as many points as possible before the time runs out.

entries.title: The life of a Boss
entries.description:
If one of the links doesn't load, please try another!

You are a Boss. You have kidnapped a princess. Now the king has sent out all the heroes of the land to save her. You must not let this happen! 

Taking refuge in your very own evil dungeon, build a maze of lethal chambers with deadly traps and nasty minions to stop the heroes from getting to you. 

Each hero that dies in your dungeon will drop shiny gold for you. Keep in mind that different heroes have strengths and weaknesses against different types of hazards. Vary your chambers accordingly!

Team:
* Cem Eliyurekli - code
* John David Olovsson - code
* Simeon Atanasov - art and sound

Tech:
* Developed using Java and Slick2D.

Update history: 
1. Initial upload

entries.title: Villain Girl
entries.description:
You are the villain girl! You should kill everything good in different times. In the past kill mammoth and dino! In the present kill good animals but beware of skunks! They stink! In the future kill aliens!

Please test in Google Chrome :)

js + html5 (canvas) game

Developed by: Vitalia Solomina and Olga Konoreva
Design: Anastasia Sergienko

entries.title: Villainous
entries.description: Made in just under 2 days, as I have school tomorrow so need to go to bed. Villainous is about killing as many people as you can in the allowed time. The soldiers and archers will fight back though, so be careful! You can buy weapons and health potions in the shop for money gained by killing people. Good luck!

entries.title: We Are Promoted Toknight
entries.description:
Please be patient as it loads, because it's a 10 mB .jar! You know how long to wait depending on your connection speed :).

This morning, for the very last time, the king of Veldspar denied you a long overdue promotion. If he won't give you a promotion, then take it yourself! Rampage through his village, and massacre his peasants, and take his kingdom for yourself.

Controls:
     - Arrow keys to move left, right, and jump.
     - Z to slaughter

If you enjoyed playing, rate it and comment! I'd love to hear your feedback.

Also, a wild timelapse appears! Take this: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Mk06EhyrTN0

Oh, and if anyone's interested, somewhere in my sourcecode is a giant goat. Muahahaha...

entries.title: A Peril of Pauline's
entries.description:
Written in C++ using the SFML library, in Visual Studio 2010. The provided source package contains the VS2010 project file.

Inspired by old computer games, and a series of even older silent films.

Comment and criticisms appreciated.

Gluten-free!

UPDATE: Changed download link. Project itself is no different, but added a folder inside of the archive so extracting directly works properly.

entries.title: A True Story: The Villain
entries.description:
This is the utter truth about video-game villains... none ever succeed.












If you played the game and are stuck, here's a tip

You Lose. You're the villain. You never succeed.




The Real Story: I didn't have enough time. Not a good weekend. And I didn't really think that this was worthy of a goat. :(

entries.title: Attack of the Crimson Plumber
entries.description:
It's just another day minding your own business in your evil dungeon when a goodie-two-shoes plumber barges in and starts demanding some princess, and all your coins. Set off the traps to stop him and his two equally annoying twins before they blow up the bridge you happen to be standing on!

Created with Dart and HTML5 Canvas over three days.

entries.title: Babysmasher
entries.description:
After seeing the Theme i thought to myself: What is the most evil thing i can think of.. And Babysmasher was born. Im sorry people, its as bad as it sounds. The music is terrible and smashing babies is hardly something that should be amusing.. Anyway, try to beat the top highscore!

Peace, Gabe

entries.title: Burglar
entries.description:
You are a thief/burglar, and naturally you go around stealing from people and commiting crimes.

Controls:
Z: Interact, shoot
X: Use weapon (menace, hold before fire)
C: Switch current weapon/item
Arrows: Move


The game was made with GameMaker Studio, and as far as I know, it wont compile on the free version.

entries.title: Blood Money
entries.description:
Villainy does not come easy. It's not something that can be granted by chance or birth. It takes hard work. It takes a dedicated mind. It takes the blackest of hearts. The time is now. The villain. Is you.

If the game won't start then install the accompanying XNA 4.0 redist. It's the file named "xnafx40_redist.msi".

The controls are:
Arrow Keys: Move
Z/Y: Melee
X: Use skill
Space: Gather blood
A/S: Cycle between available skills
Tab: Learn new skills

We are planning to release a initial post compo that fixes the main issues. Follow us on twitter to get news about it or check this page

You can follow us on
https://twitter.com/haploidcheek
and
https://twitter.com/Udrian

or check out our homepage for other stuff we have made!
www.typedeaf.net
(Ok, I know that it is empty now. But save it for later!)

entries.title: Bustin' Out
entries.description:
A stealth game in which you play a convicted criminal who is tired of prison life and decides to break free. Luckily, all the guards have the kind of AI that you can program in the 10/12 hours you have free over the weekend.

- Includes Goats

entries.title: Class Master: Rise of the Slimes
entries.description:
Jam entry me and my friend made. I did all the programming and he did all the assests.

All in all, I think it turned out pretty well.

WASD to move, mouse to select buttons, Q to detonate fireballs (class ability button needs to be clicked first). It's worth noting the fireballs don't show damage numbers, but they do damage enemies. Run in to enemies to deal melee damage to them.

Change your class at-will to maximize your stats and usage of abilities! Collect items to increase your power, and show those slimes what you're made of!

****THIS GAME HAS ONLY BEEN TESTED ON WINDOWS, BUT SHOULD BE CROSS PLATFORM*****

Windows users: Run the .bat file to play
OSX/Linux users: Run with the following command: java -Djava.library.path=lib/ -jar build.jar





***************POST COMPO VERSION***************

So i've been working on the game a bit to get some of the features in that i wanted to get in last week during the jam, so for any who wish to play it, it can be downloaded here: 

https://dl.dropbox.com/u/11857495/postcompo.zip

PLEASE NOTE THAT THE POST COMPO VERSION IS NOT ALLOWED TO BE CONSIDERED IN THE VOTING. I am putting it here solely for those interested in seeing where it is going.


****UPDATED 12/31/2012****
Additions:

--Pressing space a game over restarts your character, carrying over unlocked classes and 1/10th of your base stats.
--New abilities on some classes.
--New classes, tier 1 and tier 2
--Classes are now "alignment" based. There are now good, evil and (unlockable) neutral classes, as well as second classes for each class.
--Added new "melee abilities" for some melee classes. They effectively strike (out of turn) in an area centered on the player.
--Class change screen
--Different ability types, ranging from class ability, cross class ability, passive abilities, and item abilities
--Enhanced UI
--Bug fixes
--Dungeon is now unlimited

To do:
--Finish the inventory system and add equip-able items.
--Flesh out class abilities (the bandit and thief are the only one that's had too much fleshing out done to it)
--Add more classes
--Add random events


***NOTE: THE INVENTORY SCREEN CURRENTLY DOESN'T WORK. IF YOU OPEN IT, THE ONLY WAY TO GET OUT OF IT IS TO EXIT THE GAME!

entries.title: Demon Quest
entries.description:
Demon Greg is about to get his demonic degree, but he has a last exam to pass...

We hope you will like this Point'n Click.

We still have some trouble with collision map, so click near your feets ;)

Puzzles come from Thotor's twisted mind, then if you d'ont find solution or you are stuck, just take a look on the walktrough aviable from the top of the site.

Known bugs:

Stuck? Just click on a door to get unstuck ;)

Credit 

Music: Mathieu Hallouin
Code: Thotor
Art: Carduus

entries.title: Evil Lair Construction Kit
entries.description:
Hate elves?  Sure we all do.  Now is your chance for revenge!

Design your very own Evil Lair.  Layout the rooms and hallways and set some treasure as bait.  Curious adventurers can't resist those shiny baubles.  Raise their hopes and then have your minions close in for the kill.   As if the look of terror on their little faces is not precious enough, they often carry a few coins in their pockets as a bonus.

More treasure will lure more and stronger adventurers such as:
   -the curious naive - not very filling
   -the quick elf - the minions are always fighting over the chewy ears, the little scamps
   -the hearty dwarf - delicious spread on warm toast
   -the mighty knight - err... he looks kind of tough

Set traps, raise the dead and generally be awful.


HTML5 game.  Have not tested in IE.

entries.title: Goatocalypse
entries.description:
This is a story of a simple man that just wants to take care of himself and his minions after the Goatocalypse.  Doesn't matter that he caused it.  But some hero has decided that his goat based technology needs to be stopped.  Good thing that this simple man has several weapons ready to use.  He just hopes that the hero doesn't defeat him and gain his weapons.  If that happens, there's always the next round with the next minion and the next weapon.

Note, there are no actual goats in the game, just the title.

entries.title: Interns From Mars!
entries.description:
STORY: (I'd put this in the game proper but I wanted to minimize text there)

You are an intrepid young student majoring in xenobiology at the Martian Institute of Technology.  Your job search has been going quite well- you've just been hired as a summer intern by the largest biomedical corporation in the Greater Olympus Mons area!  It's a very exciting opportunity.  Of course, since you're just an intern, you end up having to do most of the dirty work.  Today, you're tasked with heading out to a sleepy Terran suburb and collecting some live humans for testing.  You'd like to do more of the actual biomedical research, but hey, it's a foot in the door, right?  Maybe if you impress them, they'll take you on as a full-time employee, and you'll get do to some  real probing.  For now, one can only dream.

FEATURE WISHLIST: (stuff I'd do if I had more time - I might put these in a post-compo version)

- music/sound volume buttons
- illustrated instructions
- alter the AI so humans cannot stay underneath buildings too long
- keep track of the player's high score (per session; not any fancy server stuff)
- end the round early if the player has abducted all humans on the stage
- GOATS! (i.e. stuff that penalizes you if you abduct them instead of humans)
- buildings with different heights
- visual effect for the humans being "beamed up" by the mothership
- pendulum physics for the chain of humans connected to the ship
- not allowing humans to "walk in the air" when dropped
- special graphics for when humans are being abducted (that depict them hanging on or something)
- more art (e.g. "cover" art, background stuff like hills and clouds, custom preloader)
- non-default fonts/button graphics
- more music
- other things to hit (e.g. trees, birds)
- non-flat ground

Feel free to provide any constructive criticism or suggest anything else you'd like to see in a post-compo version!

entries.title: Jetpack Jackass
entries.description:
You just got a brand new Jetpack! Think of all the amazing things you could do with it! The places you could go! The sporting events you could disrupt...

Unfortunately I had to cut the story animations as I was fighting several unity add-on bugs in the last few hours of the compo. Just pretend that you are a supervillain who threatened to filibuster the superbowl and was not taken seriously. (So now you must go delay the game to keep your villain cred)

Watch out for the players! They seem harmless at first, but they gradually slow you down. If you succeed in your filibusterery you will get a nice jetpack speed boost which can make cruising around the island a bit more fun.

entries.title: Lets kill the king
entries.description:
This is actually my first plateform game... And I didn't prepared the compo, so yep, it's ugly and absolutely not perfect.

You have to go to the find a way out, and kill the King ( Actually looking like the others, juste not moving ) in the level 4th to finish the game.

I haven't tested it on something else than my computer, so I don't know if it works fine on everything.

And thanks to my ShinFubuki ( @shinfubuki )who made the sounds :)

Edit: Now you can shoot without instantly winning, and the instructions are correctly draw on the screen.

It seem that on some computers running windows 7, the game crashes after like 10 seconds, doing weird black glitches on the screen, if it does, run the .exe in winXP compatibility.

entries.title: MARTYR
entries.description:
This is a game about the sadistic and Vilain "video games player"

Keep it in mind : You can not pass a level if you haven't less than 30 HP

One more time: less 30 hp to pass the level "the red exit"

Lunch the game via: Index.html

Credit:
visuals:Yassir Kerbal
visuals:Oussama agazzoum
sound design:Florent Dumas
Game and level scrinpting: Ahmed Majdoubi

entries.title: Obamapology
entries.description:
Our game is about good plans backfiring on you, and who better to convey this than poor Obama who gets ridiculed for everything he tries to do / doesn't do. There's a constant nagbox telling you what you're doing wrong.

At the end, who will be re-elected? The world may never know.

READ THE README!

Note: This game was created for the LudumDare 48 Hour COMPO, not the Jam, but since we worked on a team, stole art and sound from various places, and did other kinds of assorted rulebends, I am forced to put it in the Jam. 

But keep in mind that this was created in under 48 hours.

entries.title: Prison Break!
entries.description:
John Redneck, mass serial killer, decides to break out of prison. He decides he wants to get out in style so he wants to kill a 100 guards and collect their caps as proof (so he can boast to his serial killer bros). Anyway, with infinite ammo he sets out through the holding cells, cafeteria and finally the courtyard to escape.

Controls:
Arrow Keys - Move
Down Arrow - Stand back
Z - Jump
X - Shoot

Made in Flash AS3 with Flashpunk library.

entries.title: Satan's Booger
entries.description:
***UPDATE***
Tweaked some difficulties as seen from comments.  Those jerks with the hearts are somewhat killable now.  Also, spikes show up sooner.  Lastly, you warp to the other side, so as to not stop your rampage ;) Thanks for the feedbacks! I made a separate link as a revise just in case my changes are considered illegal.

If you think the changes are fine under "MY GAME CRASHES, IS UNBEATABLE, OR I MADE A TYPO", then by all means play the updated one! :)

Requires the Unity 3D Web-Player.

In order to compile, it needs: Unity3D 3.5 (haven't tested on 4) (free/pro), NGUI and 2D Toolkit (place their source code in the Assets folder).

entries.title: Rise of S**tler (NSFW)
entries.description:
Not for the faint farted!

One of the bugs was left in intentionally, which is to do with the boss, we found it amusing and as such left it how it is.

(you can actually skip the cut-scene, but it only checks for inputs once per second: skip with esc or enter)

Controls:

Menu:

Arrow keys & enter

In-game:

Movement - Arrow keys
Shoot - Space key

s - mute sounds
m - mute music

Escape to skip cut-scene / dialog

entries.title: SDIORETSA
entries.description:
A game for Ludum Dare 25, entirely by Josh Douglass-Molloy.

The idea was that instead of playing as the ship in Asteroids, you play as chaotic space herself, lobbing asteroids at a heroic ship. The idea was beautiful. I let it down. I suppose that makes me the villain.

It was supposed to be one player with AI controlling the ship, but due to poor time management you'll actually want two people for this. 

Controls (Asteroids): Left mouse and drag to lob an asteroid - hold to increase size (reduces speed)

Controls(Ship): Cursor keys to move, Space to fire. 

Note: I know there are collision problems. I'm sorry.

entries.title: Stealth Slime
entries.description:
Submitted as a Jam entry because it wasn't finished in time for the compo. I believe it follows the compo rules otherwise.

This is my first HTML5/JavaScript (CoffeeScript, technically) game so there are a lot of known bugs.

* The music only plays in WebKit browsers (possibly only in Chrome.)
* The music freezes up semi-frequently, especially if you tab away from the game.
* Kills and deaths occur at oddly large distances (a square or two away.)
* The hero does not have a real pathfinding algorithm and will occasionally do things like walk right past you or go on alert repeatedly without moving. He compensates for this by walking through walls once in a while.

entries.title: The Heist
entries.description:
Hey all, I joined the event quite late and ended up missing the compo deadline, but I was able to finish for the Jam. :)

This is my first time using the Quest engine and also my first interactive fiction! As a result, I severely under estimated the time required to write an IF and plan out the plot. So the story is a bit dry and the ending anti-climatic.

entries.title: The Iron Warlord
entries.description: Subjugate people! Destroy things! Feed the tower!

entries.title: Zombie Salvation
entries.description:
You're leading the zombie apocalypse!

Controls:
* Clicking on bases selects them.
* With left shift + left click you can issue the creation of a zombie, which then waits in the base.
* By left clicking + holding left ctrl you can command a zombie to leave the base and walk to the point you clicked on.
* Left clicking a zombie selects it and by right-clicking you can command it to walk to the place you clicked on.

People gather in malls or hospitals to protect themselves from the zombie apocalypse (which you should think of as a "zombie salvation" (hence the name)). You should assimilate them by walking near them and thereby starting a fight, which hopefully results in a delicious meal for your zombies. The zombies are too dumb to engage in a fight themselves, so you have to to "push" them into their food. If people are confronted with too many zombies, they flee (and won't attack or counter-attack, so you should attack using groups/hordes of zombies), otherwise they might engage in a fight.
Your currency is Brains, which you need to create zombies and you earn by eating people. The maps are randomly generated, so every time playing should give you a different experience! (If any experience at all :D)

Have fun! (Please..)

entries.title: A trip along the railroad tracks
entries.description:
I figured for this LD I'd try and make something a little simpler so here you have A trip along the railroad tracks a game trying to re-create the memories an LCD game like we all grew up with.

You play a dastardly fiend that wants to have his vengeance on the world...or just on passers by. I hope you enjoy!

I hope to also be releasing a version for Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 in the close future after making sure to iron out any bugs that exist.

You can play with a variety of controls as the instructions state although I recommend using the mouse as then the avatar changes between his subimages which didn't manage to get completed on arrow/WASD.

Also sorry that there is no highscore table as well, I couldn't get it to work and it was causing other script to not work. But let me know your scores as it does get frantic and probably a bit too hard the further you get, I really want to go over it again to balance the timings.

Also my apologises that the .exe actually has to be installed now, I didn't realise Game Maker had changed its ways.

Created in Game Maker studio and tested mainly on Windows and a little testing in Internet Explorer 9. As usual if you find any bugs please let me know so I can try and fix them! :) Also for those with small screens my apologies for making it at such a large resolution, I did this because of my plans to port it over to other devices.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Artificial Incompetence
entries.description:
You've created a fleet of AI ships and soon you'll conquer the entire galaxy! The only problem is your AI is incompetent and prone to a few...malfunctions. Fix the malfunctions, destroy the "Good Guy Alliance" ship, and prove your dominance (Or lack thereof) to the entire galaxy!

Controls:
WASD or Arrows, Space, and the mouse: Used for various events.
M: Mute music

entries.title: Aliens and the End of the World
entries.description:
Pity the theme wasn't actually "The End of the World" but at least you get to be the villain trying to bring that about.

I kinda only half-finished this, because I got most of the way through and then got really over trying to balance the numbers, so I didn't get round to adding any sound (fail) and more visual effects. =/

Anyways you have abilities that you can use to give yourself extra income (which you get at the beginning of every turn), or reduce the stats of the enemy humans (the numbers along the top) which in turn makes your abilities more effective (the lower those numbers are).

Basically you win if you can successfully use either of the abilities that cost 200, and you lose if all of the human stats grow over 100. I realise this game is probably pretty confusing because of how numbers-based it is...oh well.

entries.title: CYBERQUEEN
entries.description:
textual interface protocols engaged

data systems compromised | data systems stabilized

power loss to oxygen garden

we are experiencing a minor delay

our transit to Waystation 12 is behind schedule

automated systems online | integration commencing | repairs complete

thank you for your patience

entries.title: Double DeConstruction
entries.description:
== Summary ==

A short little top-down shooter about some disgruntled construction workers, named Bobcat Jones and Matthew Steel, who decide to take their frustration out on the public, but the public fights back. While technically being a top-down shooter, at some points during gameplay it may feel like a shoot'em up game.


== Thoughts On Entry ==

This is the first LD game fully completed by our team, out of four jams, and we're all extremely happy. So please enjoy what we enjoyed making!


== Side Note ==

On a side note, on a scale of easy to hard, this is ranked near Nintendo hard to beat...sometimes. The thing is, the points you get from each enemy is typically different as well as what types of enemies spawn. For the long range character, standing back and firing from the top works as a sort-of way to cheat the system, although, sooner-than-later, an enemy will force you to have to change your pattern for a bit.


== Bugs ==

The bug that could crash the game was found and fixed, so enjoy!


== IGNORE ==

NOTE: There's a hard to track-down bug that I'm trying to find that can crash the game if you travel along the very bottom of the screen. I am fully aware of it and trying to fix it.

UPDATE TO NOTE: I managed to stop the crash, but, instead the character just disappears and you can't continue and have to refresh. I think I know the general area where the problem is, but I'm super tired, so I'm going to try and fix it in the morning.

entries.title: Final Days of the Victor
entries.description:
A short game about villainy, fortresses, and the the end of the world.

Written in Twine. Sounds recorded on a Zoom H4n and edited in Audacity.

entries.title: Goat Slaughterbox
entries.description: A sandbox for killing goats. Punch, throw or grind your way to happiness.

entries.title: Godio the Trickster
entries.description:
Second Ludum Dare.

If you ever wonder what to do, press "SPACE"

Since this is a HTML5 game, it seems you are better off trying it out with Chrome.
This is confirmed on my laptop where Firefox is choppy and without any sound...

I was not very happy with my entry last time, a lot of time was lost getting used to the language and libraries.
This time too, I wanted to get a feeling for another technology. And I ended up losing go much time in the same way. So here it is, as good and bad as it is :D

entries.title: Hench
entries.description:
Hench

Hench is a game played by the community.

Levels are procedurally generated but are the same for every player.

Everyone who plays a level contributes to that levels completion, and once a level is completed it is flagged and another level replaces that one soon after.

Time-lapse:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GgBAeD4T7a8

This game is dependent on the server, which I will keep up for a very long time, but this means it can have issues and might break at some point. If it does try to contact me and I'll do my best to fix it.

Controls:
Move: W, A, S, D
Shoot: Click
Talk: Enter/Return

If you would like to change the controls, download a version of Hench and change the input either in the dialog box before the game begins or in the config file.

Theme:
I found this theme quite difficult, narrative isn't one of my stronger traits and didn't know to convey the theme through gameplay. I started with an idea but soon got bogged down by the technical bits.

entries.title: hunt
entries.description:
i... i think it's away. we have to act fast.

this may be our only chance to lift the curse it's laid on this land.
find the gems. search *everywhere*. you know what to do.

it has to be stopped. we've all lost family to it.

god help us if it catches us in here.


-- CONTROLS --

LEFT / RIGHT - walk
UP           - enter door
UP / DOWN    - climb ladder
SPACE        - interact
DOWN         - call to ally
+ / -        - adjust volume
0            - mute

there are two endings. interact, experiment, see what happens.
don't be afraid to fail.
revel in the hunt.

inspired by the board game 'betrayal at the house on the hill'

note: contains blood 

12/17 - added a 1.5x zoomed swf, and some spoilers if you get stuck. enjoy!

entries.title: Ithyxsk
entries.description:
You are Ithyxsh, The Crimson Blight. A pitiful human has come to face you in your lair. Let him face his death.

Keys: [X] and [Z] to attack, [space] to switch between standing and flying.

Edit: added Windows a Linux 32-bit builds, and worked around engine bug causing crash at start.

entries.title: Kill a Citizen
entries.description:
As of this posting, at 13:01, -5:00GMT, this is a beta. It will improve.

You are the @ character. Step on the C to kill the citizen.
Make sure to hit the maximize button!

entries.title: Kill The Day!
entries.description:
History: You are a guy with no name, we only know that you are angry an you want to kill everything and a Demon helps you with that by giving you his Zombie army on the city! and your mission is to clear all the soldiers.

Here is my 4rd game ive made on this awesome competition n.n .... And it was quite complicated to make because i need to do a hard work on logical operations on the AI, the map editor i've build took me 1 day :( and so i end up with just one level for the game because i'm out of time. But this Ludum Dare help me a lot on how to build games, we can also say that I've learned from my mistakes. Its not the best game in the world but at least i tried and im happy, btw all your games are awesome guys :D 

To play you need have XNA 4.0 . and not all the computers are supported idk why :\ ...  Thanks for playing my game :) and sorry for the lac of content :( but hey I learned a lot :)

entries.title: Kill?
entries.description:
hello Ludum Dare, first time here, I'm going for a VERY small game... Since this is my second speedrun game (the first one was for the 7DFPS and was named Corpse Garden, and I learned a lot.) My concept is almost on the title... You are a villain... should you kill the victim?

I've rushed it fast! It's filthy, from graphics to code, but it's kind of finished in time. I'm using unity indie, by the way.

Oh, and there's an evil goat.

entries.title: Konkey Dong
entries.description:
Alright here's my First Ludum Dare Game - KONKEY DONG. You play as a well dressed ape throwing barrels at a familiar looking duo. Don't let these little guys save the girl at the top.

CONTROLS:
LEFT & RIGHT - MOVE
SPACE - THROW BARREL

PRESS ENTER to START GAME or THROW  A BARREL AT ONE DUDE AT THE BOTTOM

entries.title: Legacy of Hamelin
entries.description:
Made in 14 hours using FlashPunk.

You can access a level editor by pressing E. Press space in the editor to toggle the tile-picker.

Right-click -> copy to save your level.
Right-click -> paste to load a level.

entries.title: Lucifer's Stand
entries.description:
You are Lucifer, defending yourself against the Archangel Michael. Spawn your many minions, and send him back to heaven where he belongs.

Google Chrome is recommended.

entries.title: Reverse Gyruss
entries.description:
Didn't have the time to make this as nice I would have liked, but maybe it will inspire someone else to do something better.

It was primarily a study in combining the entity system architecture with PlayN.

entries.title: Seamonster Supper
entries.description:
I think I've really outdone myself, as well as everyone else who entered. Sorry folks, this one's in the bag.

Works best in Google Chrome / Chromium. Firefox is okay but sound sucks. I've heard it even works in IE10 but I don't have MSWindows to test it on.

Use enter to advance the dialog, and be patient, delays as long as 4 seconds are used for dramatic effect.

entries.title: The Plague
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move around.
Claim areas by holding space. You have to be near the center of a generated forest/village/sand-patch or castle to claim it.
Kill the good guys to convert them to minions.
Goal: flood the lands with stinking miasma and rotten bodies!
Make an army of minions too!
Evade the bears!

Sadly, no build-in winning conditions. Reach the goal above.

entries.title: Villain OS 8
entries.description:
One typical day right from the eyes of the villain: pet your cat, destroy the Earth, and laugh like a true evil genius. 

Control: Mouse

Your doomsday weapon is powered by your evil laugh, charge it before firing.

Unfortunately did not have time to make music, only some sounds.

entries.title: Who Got Your Goat? A Murder Mystery
entries.description:
+1 Goat!

In this game, you play the role of a detective who has just suffered the tragic loss of his best friend, a goat. You must figure out who has killed your goat, by interviewing a bunch of shady characters. Some of them will seem suspicious, but actually be innocent - only one is the villain!

Please note that every possible conversation option DOES tell you something.

entries.title: who wants to be a super villain
entries.description:
All stuff made in about 4 hours. Was short on time this weekend and the theme really didn't work for me.
Entry is HTML (no fancy canvas stuff) with HTML5-audio and flash-fallback.

Also contains a goat.

entries.title: X-Moon
entries.description:
Humans have been colonizing planets. It's time to stop them!

Take to your tank and destroy colonists to collect energy pods to charge a massive bomb. Detonate the bomb when it's fully charged to destroy the planet. Watch out, those pesky colonists are armed with some pretty advanced tech!

Controls:
W A S D - Move
Mouse - Aim and Shoot
E - Detonate bomb when it's charged

Press Enter to advance through screens. Press F1 to disable shaders during game. F3 to toggle fps during game.

Written in MoonScript, running on Love2d.
Music made in Renoise
Art made in GIMP

entries.title: 60 Second Bad Boy
entries.description:
>>>>>>>>>>>VERY IMPORTANT NOTE<<<<<<<<<
to see every level, play the separate training levels first!!! if your playing the WEB version, click on the "Play full screen" option just below where the game is placed on the megaswf page. it's SO MUCH SMOOTHER which is very much recommended! best results are from the download options though!


Wanna be the naughtiest kid in town? only got a minute spare?

No worry's! here is the game for you .... 

Twelve, five second upset'o'thon levels make up those crazy 60 uninterrupted seconds of frantic bad boy terrorizing!!
poke,steal,smash and stamp your way through to being the ULTIMATE BAD BOY kid in town!!!

>> SWF FLASH FILE FORMAT - only 1.8mb download! or play in web browser at : http://megaswf.com/file/2532049

>> includes training zone to practice beating any of the 12 levels. 80's 8bit level of difficuly!

>> old school arcade reflexs on the mouse required!

>> frantic chiptune sountrack!

Complete game design and asset creation by Matt Clarke

entries.title: Bad Driver! +1
entries.description:
This game is an homage to Noby Noby Boy where you get points for being a terrible driver.

I am a bad game designer and should feel bad :P

entries.title: Batty Bacteria!
entries.description:
This is the first time I've participated in Ludum Dare and I loved it. 

I worked on this alone and it was a lot harder than I thought it would be, but I'm really happy that I did it. Hopefully I'll do even better next time :)

In any case, in my game you play as bacteria trying to infect a body, while dodging antibodies who patrol the area.

entries.title: Boo!
entries.description:
Boo!
LD25
korri_vlg

Control:
  Move - A/D, sorry, no arrows
  Use - E
  "Boo!" - B
  "I need hugs=c" - H


Hey! This is my not so polished game. You are a ghost, and you hate peoples into youre castle. You need to kill them all by scrared them. 

Used: Python/Pygame, Spyder2 IDE, GIMP, Inkscape, Pyganim module
