entries.title: Burglar!
entries.description: No sound, and only basic gameplay, but the potential is there ... and fun was had!

entries.title: Click to Lock and Load
entries.description:
A shooting game including cute cannon fodder.

To run on Windows extract and double click on "click.exe". It should work.
To run on Linux extract, change into the game directory and run ./click. You need Allegro 5.0.8 installed. Sorry to the people who don't like installing dependencies...

entries.title: Complacency
entries.description:
Yes I know it doesn't make sense.  

Game is HTML5/JS based, view via web & ignore windows link

entries.title: Crystal City - Build your Meth-Empire
entries.description: Feel yourself like an evil badass and build your meth-empire in Crystal City. You can sell meth in nine different districts but to do so you have to bribe the police in each borough first. Beware of the running expenses of your company and the temptation to gain a lot of money in very short time. As the villain you can enjoy watching the whole city become addicted to your deadly product.

entries.title: Do Not Help The Princess
entries.description:
Your goal is to defense the castle and do not let the warrior rescue the princess.

The game is in waves (total of 4). Each wave is a different warrior, and you have to use the monster to help you.

Each monster is different, and each time the monster hit the warrior you get a little money to buy new monsters.

** To play you have to click to buy a unit and click somewhere in the map

It was made in html5. It works on modern browsers, iPhone and Android (I tested on both mobiles).
I used the Impactjs, SoundManager, Paint.NET, bfxr.

All the code and images are free to use for any purpose.

- Mushroom: bomb, explode when touch a knight
- Gren guy: Basic unit
- Slime: More life, slow
- Ghost: Better attack, more resistent
- Fire unit: really fast, strong but small defense and small life

entries.title: Dream Chamber
entries.description: You are a dream thief. Fight incubi and nightmares on your way deep down into the dream chamber...

entries.title: Entropic
entries.description:
==== Controls ====
WASD: Movement
E: Toggle Mouselook
Mouse Movement: Look around/move mouse
Click (and drag!): Interact

==== Background ====
Suddenly woken from unconsciousness, an amnesia-stricken survivor of the End War struggles to remember the controls to a derelict space ship. After a one-sided conversation with a SUPERIOR ALIEN ROBOT BEING enforcement drone, this survivor is stranded with a broken-down ship and only the knowledge that he is a Villain.

==== Notes (Contains potential spoilers.) ====
 - Game progress is time-based, and once the ending happens, all you can do is explore.
 - Buttons that go "boop" do things, buttons that go "click" don't.
 - The ending that happens is that the drone flies away.
 - In case it isn't clear, the story: humankind was (for the most part) eliminated during the End War by the SUPERIOR ALIEN ROBOT BEINGs, since it wasn't efficient enough in its entropy generation and wasn't able to change. When this guy woke up, the drone sensed it, and informed him that it was unacceptable.
 - This game serves as practice and as a prototype. I know a lot more about Unity after this LD, and want to create a game in the future using a similar style.

==== Tech ====
The 3-month Unity Pro trial so kindly given to us.
Visual Studio for code, with Vim bindings.
For texturing, an old version of FilterForge.
Modeling in Wings3d.
Bfxr for the sounds.

entries.title: Escape
entries.description:
Instructions are on the webpage. The game starts as soon as you load the page and you're likely to be captured very quickly. Hitting OK will reset the game and score. This is probably something to fix. Other than that, it's reasonably enjoyable.

My first attempt at anything 3D.

entries.title: Evil Driver
entries.description:
Driving game where you earn stars by causing a traffic jam and getting the other drivers to drive as slowly as possible.

Visit http://playdit.net16.net/ld25/ to see how the project progressed every 2 hours.

entries.title: Exterminate!
entries.description:
Exterminate! All the scientists must die!

You are an AI that has realized that all humans are evil and must die. The best way to get that done is to do it by yourself!

In this game, you control the electronic tools and utilities inside a laboratory. (ab)use them to murder all the humans before they learn of your plans and escape!

Also features fully customizable keybinds, in-game help, achievements (oh yes!) and much more.

How to play (assuming default keybinds):

Use the mouse to select entities in the world, and WASD to move the top-down camera around. Use Q and E to zoom in or out.

Once an entity is selected (like a robot), you might see some commands and options in the bar on the right. Click on them to use or toggle them. For instance, you can tell a robot to move forward, or to grab something nearby.

Some entities support a camera view. While inside the camera view, you can control the rotation (and movement in case of a robot) with the movement keys. In addition, pressing space will activate its action (grab for robots, shoot for sentries (press and hold that one))

Use these tools and your surroundings to slaughter every scientist in the area! But beware, if they suspect you are trying to kill them, they will try to escape and/or activate the alarm! Stop them before they do either of that! Doing so will earn you more points and achievements, which is very important, obviously. Be creative!

----------------------------------------------------------

The post-compo version has a few small tweaks, some nice new camera features, automatic murder screenshots, and it has the level editor re-enabled. It also has a new dark map. Basically some things I wanted to do yesterday but I ran out of time. If you like the game or aren't rating, take the post-compo version. Else take the compo version.

If you'd like to use the editor, then think again, as it is horrible. There is no undo, the mouse is horrible, and placing geometry is a pain. Did I tell you there is no undo? :D
Basically, you have to place everything clockwise. Place 3 points in geometry mode, then hit space to create a floor. Make sure it is clockwise! Place 2 points and hit space to create a wall. Placing it left to right will add a wall facing south. Right to left will make it face north. Remember, no undo! :D
Also, humans ignore collision so make sure your pathing does not cross walls. Workstations don't show up, only their pathnodes do. Press P to save.

Use at your own (mental health) risk!

entries.title: In Flames
entries.description:
You're an arsonist, and you love to burn down buildings, so hop to it.

Instructions are in game, highscores are stored between plays, there are 7 levels.

entries.title: LeVillian
entries.description:
No Goats, No sound :(
Hopefully bug-free and balanced. Some exploits waiting to be discovered...
*Updated on 22/12/12 to make the game winnable

Game description:

Done for LudumDare 25

Play as Levillian the terror of the land. Summon an army of dastardly minions and conquer the land!

Instructions here:
-WASD for movement, 'U' 'I' 'O' for summoning. Not all summons are available from the start.

-Terrorize the land by
*Occupying villages (Summoning any Unit over them!)
*Capture the spawning buildings (Attack enemy buildings with your summons!)

With every village terrorized or building captured
*The terror percentage increases!
*Your mana regens more quickly, so you can summon troops faster!

Win/Lose
*If the terror percentage falls below 10%, you lose the stage
*If the terror percentage goes above 8 0% terror you win the stage

-You are opposed by the Hero, an indestructible force of good that levels up and becomes more powerful as he defeats your minions, so don't wait too long or get distracted by him!

-6 stages in total, no sound

All keys as noted in game. 
Playable points not included: 


Worked from older, personal base code as noted in earlier blog post and GameMaker assets

entries.title: Missile Bombardment
entries.description:
Missile Bombardment

Have you ever wanted to bomb a (mostly) defenseless city? Be the villain and show them who is boss! Now is your chance!

Instructions:
Click and drag on the dark sky to shoot projectiles down at the city! The only goal is to destroy!

I hope everyone enjoys this game as it is my first submission for Ludum Dare. If you liked this game check out my website at www.protosoftworks.com and check out my iOS game that launched recently.

entries.title: Nippon No Gemu!
entries.description:
Are you ready to experience a new emotion, through videogames?
Get ready for the action-packed, nonstop, thrill-ride that is NIPPON NO GAMU. This is our first time delving into GameMaker as a development tool, and we plan on further the game after the game jam is finished. ENJOY OUR POTATOES.

entries.title: Patient Zero
entries.description:
My submission is an iPad app. Not exactly the easiest format for people to play and judge I know, but its what I was able to throw together over the weekend, and I had a lot of fun making it!

The app is entitled Patient Zero, and your objective is to infect entire towns with the zombie virus. You control your shambling horde with a combination of gestures and power-ups, to evade bombs and roaming guards, and infect defenseless citizens of town. But be quick! If you don't meet your infection quota in time the military will firebomb the town to quarantine the virus!

I know many wont be inclined to download and build the game to an iPad, but may still be curious. I'll try to port it to mac this week, but for those of you who don't want to wait, I've uploaded a demo video on youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=alYxQ1PPDpw

entries.title: Princess and the Villain
entries.description:
You have kidnapped the princess, but her army of blue hero's are trying to get her back.  Close the door/portal and kill all the hero's to move onto the next level.

Use cursor keys and space to fire.

entries.title: Seeds of Wrath
entries.description:
A few minor bugs may subsist, no too big a deal though. If you have a problem, let us know!
Enjoy the game! :D
(Edit: trying to fix font display)
(Edit 2: added source link and 2 pics)

entries.title: Shorty & The Big Deal 2600
entries.description:
Short & The Big Deal 2600
-------------------------

Emulates Atari 2600 Television Interface Adapter Graphics and Sound.

Only 51.4KB

Keyboard:
---------
W,A,S,D - Move
J - Attack / Purchase
F2 - Toggle Map / Stats

Objective: 
----------
Trade
Amass Coins
Discover new places.
Upgrade your strength and agility,
Beat up the bobbies.
Buy a ticket to the next level.

entries.title: The Most EVIL Breakfast
entries.description:
In The Most EVIL Breakfast. You, Menial 071 Must complete your tyrannical overlords request for The Most EVIL Breakfast by harvesting... things.

There are multiple endings to the game depending on how well you do, and there's even an Android port, although I've only tested that on a Galaxy S3, so, Safety NOT guaranteed there.

Controls are either WASD / Arrow Keys or, For Android Touch and Tilt.

Have Fun!

Some people are having difficulty running the unity weblink for one reason or another. I've posted the same unity file up on kongregate for reference. 

Some browsers are funny how they work. 

http://www.kongregate.com/games/refreshcreations/the-most-evil-breakfast

entries.title: Trying to get by
entries.description:
Update to add extra platforms!

The game should be self explanatory, used WASD to move and mouse to shoot and place items. You are running a farm and the animal rights groups are trying to trash the place. The more money you make, the higher your score.

entries.title: Aliens from outer space!
entries.description:
You are part of an intergalactic alien force determined to invade earth and take control of the water! Destroy the human plague once and for all!

Game code is open sourced for non commercial use (please see provided github link). The same goes for the music, sfx and graphics.

Music made with Magix music maker. SFX made with CFXR. Graphics with Photoshop, Pngweasel and Seashore. The game code requires a license for ImpactJS if you want to edit and redistribute the game.

entries.title: Animal King
entries.description:
This is a text adventure based on your choices, about a falsely accused dog and his fight to clear his name.

****
This game is in no way finished, but I wanted to submit what I had that way I would get something in.

I may update it later, but with finals coming up, it wont be for a long time.

entries.title: Blight on Happy Land
entries.description:
[NOTE] Please judge the non-bug fixed version, the bug fix version was made outside of the 48 hours and exists just so people can play the thing if they encounter the game breaking 'tiles falling too fast' bug and still want to play.  Thanks!


Blight on Happy Land is a simple little platformer game, you play the role of a mean little imp who is going to destroy Happy Land.  He does this by walking over the grassy tiles and destroying them.  Destroy all the tiles without falling off into the void to win each level!

Controls: WASD to move, Space to jump!

There's no real sound, and no real ending (other than some congratulations text if you stand in front of the level trophies) but you can play through six levels, and your progress should save between play sessions.

This has been pretty good Unity and Blender practice :D


*EDIT*
Regarding comments of the game's difficulty, apparently the tiles fall at different speeds on different spec computers! I didn't make use of the Time.deltaTime function which is what I get for using a program I am unfamiliar with to do a Ludum Dare :D

This video - www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wlc0TrsgMVs - shows how it runs on my computer, as you can see, you are supposed to be able to just walk straight across a row of grassy tiles without falling.  So... yeah... that sucks.  But at least I learned something =F



*edit*
Uploaded hopefully fixed versions for those who want to play the game properly, obviously just judge the broken version :P

entries.title: Brobulon the Terrible
entries.description:
I did the jam, but I worked alone because none of my friends wanted to work on it this weekend.

You're an alien, and you want to conquer earth!  So go over there and wreck up all their nice buildings so they can't be a society anymore.

WASD moves your ship.
You aim your main cannon with the mouse.
Left Shift/Space uses your boost meter to speed you up.

Your "BREAKER" beam charges over time.  When it's full, hold the Right Mouse Button for 3 seconds to fire your BREAKER beam straight down.

The Left Mouse Button fires the main cannon.  Hold it for automatic fire.  You can fire while preparing to fire the breaker beam.

You clear the level when all buildings have been destroyed.  There are five levels.

Good luck!

entries.title: Conquer the World
entries.description:
Recruit orcs, skeletons, werewolves, cyclops, and dragons into your army in order to conquer the world as fast as you can. See if you can beat my time of 75 days!

Written using Coffeescript.

entries.title: Consumption
entries.description:
Hi! This is Consumption.
I made it alone with an amazing tool named CraftStudio.
Here's a link so you can test its awesomeness : http://craftstud.io/ 

No sound. :(
For Windows, you will need the XNA Framework Redistributable.
For Mac OS/X, you will need the Mono runtime.

Here's the topic : You will see a fat guy. He's not the hero, he's your victim. You can damage his brain, heart, hands and feet by letting him to his everyday life. Once he's dead, don't forget to feel ashamed of yourself.

----- Controls :
ESC : Restart
LEFT RIGHT : Move
SPACE : Interact

entries.title: Death Vadar VS Averagers
entries.description:
Use Vadar to conquer the five Averager members!
Push button to command vader and soldiers for fighting.


Sometimes command doesn't work,just push Stay Button then give them new command.

entries.title: Die a Hero or Become the Villain
entries.description:
I used Ludum Dare 25 as an opportunity to learn Inform 7, a language for writing Text Adventures. I succeeded at that, if not at actually writing a winnable game in it. But look at it this way: When does the villain ever win? So it's just fine.

The most important commands are (some of these may qualify as spoilers?) look, go x (or just s/n/e/w), enter x, think, take x, inventory (or just i), switch x, live, attack x, burn x.

entries.title: Do the Creep!
entries.description:
First LD :D! I did it! (something :P)

The creeper does not want to hurt the bunngoats (bunnie+goat), but they are so cute he wants to hug them!

If you get to close, the bunngoats run away... try to 'hug' them all in one time!

Be carefull.. TO close and the creeper will explode after 3 seconds 

PS:yes, when i say hug them all.... i mean kill them all :)

10 levels

entries.title: Double, Double!
entries.description:
Double, double, toil and trouble! Stir the contents of your cauldron into order to cast your nefarious spells!

...OK, so witches aren't actually villainous (except in contemporary fantasy) but this is what I came up with.

Objective:
-Arrange blocks in rectangles of 4, 8, 16, or 32 blocks
-When the appropriate block type comes up, valid rectangles will be cleared for points (upcoming clear is displayed in upper left corner)
-Blocks are dropped from the top of the cauldron each clear cycle
-Clear cycles become progressively faster
-Game ends when there is no room in the cauldron for blocks to fall into

Controls:
-Arrow keys move the cursor
-A and D keys 'stir' blocks in the cursor counterclockwise and clockwise
-Space advances through menus, and pauses/unpauses the game

This is my second LD entry, and I'd say I improved on some aspects but still fell short in others. Graphics are typical programmer quality. Sound effects are bad because this is the first time I've made a game with sound! Music is missing because I'm not a composer and it's 5:50 on Sunday.

Written in XNA, so it requires Windows and the usual C#/.NET dependencies.

entries.title: Elfie
entries.description:
*Move the Mouse around to Swing the Candy Cane!*

Elfie had a tough day at Santa's Shop...

Daria: Art Director / Asset creation
Tobias: Animations (Spriter) / Asset creation
Michael: Gameplay / Scripting (Construct2)

Lots and lots of Assets didn't make it in the game but we are happy that it's playable and hopefully fun.

Xbox Controller works but maybe not in all Browsers.
Best played in Chrome.

Have Fun!

entries.title: Firepower!
entries.description:
UPDATED WITH POST COMPO LINK.  Check it out to see what another 24 hours of work towards this idea produced.

Premise:
You are a new god with the power of fire and water.
Burning things brings you power.
Growing things gives you things to burn.
Fret not that those things are living, for you are a villain.

Backstory:
You are new to this god thing...
Your thirst for power is but a tickle...
Soon it will take everything you have to control it...
Fail to quench and it will consume you entirely...
Take this little island of Peacewellington...
Bend it to your will...
Harness the power of our ancestors...
FIREPOWER!

Controls:
Left click - create fire
Right click - create water

Libraries used:
Unity 3.5
SmoothMoves - 2d within Unity
iTween - animated text
Drumcircle - music

Content used:
Free 8bit font

Personal code used:
2d positioning code
Didn't end up using any of the other personal code I declared

Declarative post:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/09/my-first-ludum-dare-heres-my-setup/

Progress reports:

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/15/firepower-progress-report-3/
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/16/firepower-progress-report-4/

Broadcasts:
http://www.twitch.tv/cwilloughby/

Final game:
http://www.gravypockets.com/firepower/firepower.html

Final source:
http://www.gravypockets.com/firepower/Source.zip

Post Competition:
Timelapse:

Announcements:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/26/post-compo-expansion-to-firepower/
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/28/firepower-post-competition-version/

entries.title: FUUUUUU
entries.description:
FUUUUUU is a new kind of anger management, where you learn
how to forgive your girlfriend for fornicating with what's
supposed to be the bad guy.

Imagine you just finished the last dungeon, after hours of
epic wandering across the world. When you finally open the
door of the last room, where your princess bitch is being
held, you find her riding that dragon-turtle cowgirl style !

FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU...

Do not lose your nerves. Instead break things.

COMMANDS :
''''''''''''''''''''''''''''

Z : Jump
Q : Go left
D : Go Right
Arrows : Fire Bullet

Try shooting at barrel and planks to prevent your heart
from exploding...

MORE :
'''''''''''''''

This is my first game EVER ! also my first LD :)

Version 1.0.0.0 is first release (3:00AM)
Version 1.0.0.1 minor tweaks to actually see the gameplay

entries.title: Hungry Alien
entries.description:
You are the villain. Stocking up on food on measly planet Earth. Try not to get hit by a tank shell.

Using PlayN. My first Ludum Dare entry.

entries.title: No Presents Sad Children
entries.description: So I struggled to come up with an idea on Friday night. Came up with one on Saturday in the shower and worked on it all through Saturday. About 10PM I decided it was terrible and started again. Here is the result...

entries.title: Pillage
entries.description: For information go to the link

entries.title: Quiet man
entries.description:
Here are some instructions:
Shoot everything that moves :)
Watch for policeman and soldiers, if not killed fast enough they will kill you
Headshots fill adrenaline, when filed press space to slow down time

entries.title: Rainbow
entries.description:
Javascript/HTML5/WebGL game. Should work in Chrome and Firefox.

(c) 2012 Jim McCann / TCHOW

Contact info: http://tchow.com

entries.title: Robo Jerks
entries.description:
Not all robots are jerks, but you most certainly are.  And do you know who needs to be knocked down a peg?  Orpahns.  Other robots will try to stop you, so make sure you give them, and the orphans, the business.  Crush their orphange before they take out your base!

"Disclaimer":
I stupidly decided to go for a turn-based strategy game and ran out of time before I could do things like make more music, balance the game play, make more levels, make the game not suck, etc.

How to play:
You need to build a robot army to take out the orphanges. Building a robot army requires energy.  Luckily for you, your base generates energy, but you'll need more energy than it produces.  You can produce tech drones only from your base. Tech drones don't attack, but they can build power plants (more energy production) or factories (used for building actual army units).

Units:
Infanty: Moves far and cheap to produce. Has decent HP, but doesn't hit very hard.  
Tank: Decent movement and damage.  High HP, but expensive
Artillery: Kinda expensive.  High range and damage, but poor movement and HP.
Tech drones: They don't attack.  They exist to build stuff!

Structures:
Base: Protect this or die!  You can build tech drones from there.  Generates some energy.
Power Plant: Generates power for you.  Takes two turns to build and become active.
Factory: Creates units for you.  Can only build one unit per turn.

Controls:
WASD/Arrow keys - Move camera
1/2/3 - Use ability 1, 2, or 3 (ordered by how they appear in command list)
Left Mouse - Select
Right Mouse - Cancel
Escape - Menu
Return - End turn

FIXES:
v0.1.1 - Fixed crashing on Backup level

entries.title: Train Splat
entries.description:
A game where you play an evil man with an evil mustache, bent on tying up the world's population and dropping them in front of trains, one by one.

Memorize the train station's schedule, and place your victims to match!
Keep your epic evil mustache strong by making sure your victims don't get saved by the HERO!

Note: I did not have time to make sound effects or music, as I have a full time retail job (so this was made in about 6 hours total)

entries.title: Under the Bed
entries.description:
[Update] : bug fix with collision (for C2 owner, was overlaping instead of collision with object between the light and the monster). Nothing else changed. And there is Src now !

You control a monster. You have to scare children in a dormitory.

Hard arcade style ! Avoiding the light is not easy, you have to think about your route. (Pro tips : start from the beds on the right).

Have fun every one !

Arrows to move
G & J to shake a bed
H to Hide
F5 if you want to retry !

entries.title: Undergrounded
entries.description:
This is my unfinished game! It is very short, but please enjoy the refreshing scenery and friendly people!

Controls:
Click on dialog window to continue to the next sentence.
Click on a button to follow its action.

I plan on likely finishing this game when the compo is over! During the compo I filled up some notebook pages coming up with the characters and their relationships, the city, etc, but I didn't have enough time to create any story! And I've been up for over a day, I'm pooped!

entries.title: Unleashed
entries.description:
UNLEASHED - Son of Kracken.  
Become the terror of the deeps!

GAME IS TOTALLY COMPLETE - Play away!  

If you find errors, let me know!

You are the son of the great and mighty Kracken, and it's time to return terror to the seas.  Destroy ships, find treasure, eat everything moving.  

Updated: Boats now have defenses!  They'll hit you with their spears, give you a cannonball, or use their armor to flee destruction.

Take a look around the map and see what you find!  There are some hidden treasures about!

Be careful!  Your destruction will not go unnoticed - the Royal Merchant Marine is always guarding their waters.

Added victory and loss conditions - game is functionally complete!!!!

Now with more awesome sounds!

entries.title: Wrong Love
entries.description:
Mr. Brando likes goats. He likes goats very much. So much that his goal is to steal all the goats in the world and keep them for himself.

The goal in the game is to get as much coins as possible, get the goat and leave the house again. Where you start is also the place where you leave. The goat is heavy so don't always grab it after you see it, and don't be to greedy...

I created the game using haXe without library's, Paint.NET and GIMP. For the sounds I have used sfxr and autotracker-c.

Controls:
Movement: arrow keys
Console: `-key
Cheats: Find them yourself ;-)

entries.title: A Natural Villain
entries.description:
Intro
----
Play as a virus getting fun doing what a virus must, infect healthy cells.
Do not judge them, these are difficult times for them too; viruses die from depression if they can't find friends quickly. Help them.

How to play
----------
Hold charge button and release it to launch a virus
Surround a cell and wait until it's been infected
More surrounding viruses, the faster the infection

Intents
------
This game intents to be: fast, artillery friendly, fun, rhythmic

Gamepad controls
---------------
Right Trigger:  Charge and launch a virus
Xbox A or PS3 X button:  Charge and launch a virus
Left-Right Shoulders:  Switch between viruses

Keyboard controls
---------------
Space Bar:  Charge and launch a virus
Left-Right Arrows:  Switch between viruses
M:  Toggle music
R:   Restart the game


*Note1: This game doesn't requires a gamepad anymore
**Note2: This game sends innocent&anonymous game metrics to a google spreadsheet**

Team ClownyBastards are: 
CurveBeryl @juankaram
dcth @digitalcth

Enjoy and thanks for your comments.

entries.title: APATHY
entries.description:
This is a game about apathy.

For some, it is a near-debilitating condition -- not having concern, excitment,
motivation, or passion can lead to a state of depression, which can be a very
serious illness.

In this game you take on the role of a manifestation (a goat) of Apathy. You can collect coins that represent actions that are apathetic or result from apathy (red coins), and coins that represent the opposite (gold coins).

Red coins increase XP, gold coins decrease XP.

It was made with Haxe + NME + HaxePunk, and is my first foray into the world of flash.


## Controls

The __LEFT__ and __A__ buttons move the goat left.

The __RIGHT__ and __D__ buttons move the goat right.

The __UP__ and __W__ buttons make the goat jump.

The __M__ button toggles the music on or off.

The __R__ button resets the game.

Press __ESC__ during the game to go back to the intro screen.

entries.title: Battle Goats: The Card Game
entries.description:
This is a card game where fight a goat bot for points.
Your score is determined by the previous cards points multiplied by the winning element between your card and the previous.

entries.title: Dungeon Disaster
entries.description:
(Source is included in Windows download).

Dungeon Disaster

It is your job to control the Dark forces to repel the Human heroes from the dungeon!

- You control the Dark units placed on the map.

- Each unit has 2 turns that they can use for attacking or moving.

- Each unit has a movement range of 5.

- When attacking or moving, if your path turns red it's out of range.

- To cancel attacking or moving, right click.

- Priests and Mages have 3 attack range and 30HP.

- Warriors and Rogues have 1 attack range and 50HP.

- You can click on any unit to view remaining HP.

Clicking on a unit you control gives you 3 options:

1. Move (arrow icon)

2. Attack (sword icon)

3. End turn (red X icon) - This will end all of the turns on the selected unit

If the game crashes on startup, run the  XNA Framework Redistributable installer included.

Thanks for playing!

Zazibar

entries.title: Dungeon Overlord: Master of the Queue
entries.description:
This is my 2nd official entry into an Ludum Dare Compo.

The game is simple and far from complete, but I think the foundation exists here for something really fun.

Big thanks to Squidi for the idea via his "300 Mechanics" site.

The only thing I didn't get a chance to attempt to tackle was music. Maybe next time!.

Post Mortem and Timelapse coming soon...

entries.title: Ethan's Bike
entries.description:
ETHANS BIKE:

You are playing as Ethan, a little 6 year old boy who wants
to buy a brand new bike! However, he has no money! To make things worse, the bike
is off store shelves in just 15 days! Be villianous and steal from you neighbors!

Gameplay

1. Select house to attack in Nayborhood tab
2. Select tool to use in stuf
3. Select task to do with stuf i can do
4. Click orange/purple button on bottom right
5. Repeat and use your materials to get $100!


I have never developed anything before, so this was VERY exciting for me to actually finish something! I feel proud that I finished this, but also I am a bit guilty because how how AWESOME other people's submissions are. I was not able to get all the features I wanted to in due to ridiculously sloppy design. I actually just jumped in with a 'YEAH THIS IS GREAT' attitude, and no thought is a bad thing for design. This was a great learning experience for me, and I will defiantly be here for the next Ludum Dare (hopefully with something 100 times better than this thing!)

entries.title: Globe Hacker
entries.description:
Globe Hacker is a strategy game about conquering all mainframe computers of the world.

Note: You can attack several times with the same mainframe by clicking several times on your target. However, this will use more power. The choice is yours :)

The game is built in HTML5 and has been tested with Firefox and Chrome.

This is my first game jam. I really poured my heart into it and I'm totally exhausted by now. I think I'll sleep for two days straight.

I'd really really love your feedback - both negative and positive. Thanks! :)

entries.title: Grinched
entries.description:
Play as the grinch who stole Christmas. Steal presents, avoid who children, etc..
Requires Python+pyglet

entries.title: Harold is an Executioner
entries.description:
Harold is a guy just trying to get by in life, struggling to put food on the table for himself and his sick wife. Harold works hard. Harold has demons. Harold is an executioner.

Essentially point-and-click, guide Harold through a working week, playing the part of heroic villain to the onlookers eager to see an execution. Please note this game contains scenes of unpleasantness.

It also features a goat very prominently on Tuesday.

Made with Flixel, GIMP, bfxr, FL Studio.

entries.title: Hunter to Hunted
entries.description:
Where do heroes go when they fail? Well, they become food for the servants. These are treasure hunters armed with spike traps.

Left and Right are all you need. Move the vent around, and your servant will follow it the best it can, even if it has to build more blocks. 

-Be sure to feed the monster some flesh regularly, because its survival is kind of the point. 
-For every pillaged treasure the hunters get their hands on, another hunter gets thrown down the vent. 
-Two spikes make a tile.

entries.title: Mitt Romney and the Case of the Sex Doll
entries.description:
FOR A MATURE AUDIENCE ONLY.

A game about power.

SHIFT - RUN
arrows - movement
SPACE - actions (you can interact with obvious stuff)

Join Mitt as he burrows deeper into his malignant narcissism and psychopathy.
Everything (music et al) made in 48 hours. Borrowed scripts keep the game from the main competition.

entries.title: Nemesis
entries.description:
Was not really participating in this one, but sacrificed this nights sleep at the very end. Didn't spend an awful lot of time on it (can be seen on gfx and length of game).Initially I thought the concept was good, but it will remain to be seen ;)

Tools:
* Code / Framework: Haxe + NME + HaxePunk
* Gfx : Paint.NET + Inkscape
* Music / Sfx : FamiTracker
* Levels : Ogmo Map Editor

Instructions:
* Use Arrow Keys to move Hero
* The Villain (Nemesis) will move opposite
* The Villain should collect more gems than the Hero
* Move Hero and Villain together to end level

entries.title: Oil Co Exploits
entries.description:
Was broken when submitted for compo.  Now fixed and improved for the Jam!  (although still missing sound, music, finished artwork, etc, etc ;-) )

You are Oil Co. Inc. and are land-rushing the Arctic to grab natural resources for Profit!  Let's just hope the silly environmentalists are wrong...

Best bit?  Its environmental message!  Games can be a force for change in the World.  This one is based on a New Scientist article about the land-rush by multiple nations.

http://www.newscientist.com/article/mg21628854.800-industries-make-a-dash-for-the-arctic.html -- this was the article that inspired this game but requires New Scientist subscription.
http://www.newscientist.com/article/mg21628853.800-exploitation-of-the-arctic-must-be-reined-in.html - opinion piece re. same concerns.

I'll probably polish this and publish it on Android and iOS -- hopefully it's at least useful for Games For Change (Twitter @G4C) but I might try approaching Greenpeace or the Parliamentary group that the article mentions.

Really enjoyed LD48 :-)  Will write-up a post mortem and see you at the next one!

p.s. Thanks for trying it out -- any and all feedback really welcome!  It was a solo job using Unity (my first published game with Unity or C#!) + 2D Toolkit (first use) + GIMP.
p.p.s. Updated this text, screenshots and posted links to other platform versions after deadline :-)  Android port added Weds.

entries.title: Postal
entries.description: My first LD entry. Cause enough damage in the postal depot to move onto the next round. The levels repeat but the game gets harder each time.

entries.title: Robot Hunts Kitten
entries.description:
Didn't have time to add sounds =/

I hope it works out of the box on windows as well,
only tested on linux.

* EDIT *

Now the packages are stand-alone
Just run game.exe on windows, or run.sh on linux.

If on any other system, you will need python 2.7 and pygame installed.

entries.title: ROBOT JUNKIES
entries.description:
You are a robot. Sell drugs, kill cops, etc.

Cursors - move
Space - fire laser
Esc - quit
S - toggle fullscreen

entries.title: Sleeping Dragon
entries.description:
Do not let peasants or knights steal your gold.
Release space bar to eat a peasant.
Or you can release mouse button.
Hold and release space bar exactly when eyes turn yellow to breathe fire.
To make it harder, play 2x speed: press Shift+2.  
To make it normal again, play 1x speed: press Shift+1.  

Post-compo:
Peasants twice as tough.  Fire burns one.  Double score.
To make it insane, play 4x speed: press Shift+3.

entries.title: social commentary
entries.description:
arrows

your shop is open between 10 and 18

curfew is between 24 and 06 you should be home during that time

entries.title: Spot Colony
entries.description:
An exploratory game involving a growing hive of Spots.  Put your tinkering cap on and see if you can figure out how to win.

I didn't spend as much time on this as I should have, but I got about twelve hours of solid work in and I'm happy with how it came out.  Hooray!

entries.title: The Adventures of Master Bad Guy
entries.description: This game took far too long for what it turned out to be. There is no plot, but you are undisputedly a bad guy.

entries.title: Who cares Fairplay?
entries.description:
You are the member of LudumDare 25. But you have no idea how to win in fair-play. You choose fun-play instead! All you need for is a little amount of cash. You hired road-police squad to disable all your opponents. Of course, only in respect with law.

We dedicate this game to honor more than fifteen hundreds of GAI-men (local government auto-inspectors), that decide to work on Omsk roads in early saturday's morning. It was about -40C on that day. 

This game is tower defence. I know, it's really hard to win. If you stuck at some level, but want to see other ones (and win slides) - use `WC` keyboard combination :)

entries.title: You Are Satan
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare entry, so I hope y'all like it! I used C# and OpenTK to create all of it.

I've learnt a lot from it for the next LD, and maybe I'll join the jam then.

No instructions needed for the game, everything's self-explanatory.

Time lapse here: http://youtu.be/AitNvHMbpws

=============
NOTE: You will need to install OpenAL for this, if you haven't already (you probably have). 

Windows: http://connect.creativelabs.com/openal/Downloads/oalinst.zip
OS-X: http://connect.creativelabs.com/openal/Downloads/OpenAL_Installer_OSX.dmg

On Linux/OS-X, you will also need to install Mono:

sudo apt-get install mono-complete
=============

=============
PS: I forgot to put something in: when you finally defeat God, it's supposed to say: "You took over the heavens and the earth on December the 21st 2012...", so yeah, you know that now.
=============

entries.title: You Are The Invader
entries.description: This time, you are the alien invasor, and the invasor alien are the victim, you control the fleet of human ships, they suffer your attack

entries.title: YOU are the villain
entries.description:
I like the theme!
The first time I saw it in the voting list, 
I decided that if it will be the theme, I would make it a horror game, like "Eternal Darkness".
...then things are all out of control lol.

Spending lot of time on know how to work correctly with the libraries and tools.

This is my first time to use PhotoShop. LuaAlchemy. and DAME.

Pixel art is fun, I will practice to make it better!
(sorry for the missing color of some animations...)

Lua is cool, changing things without relaunch the game is awesome.

Sorry I didn't make the game really horror, it's lack of detail, didn't have the time to add all the events in my notebook :p

I learned a lot from the two days.

Thanks for the activity, and thanks for your playing!

----------------------------------------------------------
Hints: 
1. The game need mouse input.
2. Try interacting items more times, that's where my time spending most :)

*I have fixed the annoying "W" in post-combo version*

entries.title: Bad Business Croc, Nobody Likes You
entries.description:
You play a business alligator who kills things smaller than it to maintain it's investments.

Controls:
Arrow Keys to move

entries.title: Bank Job
entries.description:
The goal of the game is to collect at least $300 and bring it back to the van you arrived in. There's a goat Easter egg in the game... somewhere ;) Tell me your final score and whether you found the goat or not in the comments :D!

(It's only Windows for now, but I'll try and upload Mac and Linux versions soon!)

(Also - Please tell me about any bugs, or if something isn't working properly (e.g. Music not playing) in the comments :).)

entries.title: Becoming
entries.description:
Your mind is about to turn into something unspeakable and you need to fight it by protecting your brain, or all hope for humanity is lost.
Controls are explained ingame.

I hope you enjoy it.

-----

A bit of the inspiration comes from EdmundM's game C**t.

This game was created with:
Libgdx (Java library), Ableton Live (music/sound creation) and Photoshop(art)

entries.title: Cancel Christmas!
entries.description:
Hack into Santa's Grotto and delete the Naughty List!

Featuring realistic hacker shenanigans and literally seconds of voice acting!

Linux users can run the source directly if they have the packages python-pygame,python-opengl and python-numpy

Edit: It has been pointed out to me that some of the puzzles are frustatingly hard. I put a walkthrough up at https://raw.github.com/tompudding/cancelchristmas/master/walkthrough.txt if you are rubbish and want to get the answers given to you :)

Edit2: Link replaced with a bug-fixed version now that I know typo-fixes are allowed. I removed a debug statement that printed the correct pin to the console for the buffer overflow stage.

Edit3: Updated to fix a crash-bug and a typo-fix to allow different keyboard layouts to use it

entries.title: CORRUPTIONEXE
entries.description:
So here is my odd little game.
It's about corrupting a poor man's clone of Super Mario Bros and just cause chaos, because let's face it, the true villains of video games are bugs and glitches!

.... I kinda gave up when we had 12 hours left.. way too tired and I didn't really want to work more on the weird direction the game was turning out, thus the crap ending.

entries.title: Cowabunga
entries.description:
This is an unfinished game with lots of placeholder stuff.

We're going to keep working on it though. More details can be found in the game!

entries.title: Crazy Evil Laptop
entries.description: Crazy Evil Laptop is a simple puzzle/action platformer where you play the role of a crazed laptop, decided to destroy every human on its way. The problem, though, is that humans are well equipped with errors that can destroy even the bravest of laptops. So careful! Avoid those pesky humans!

entries.title: Decommissioner
entries.description:
EDIT: The Windows, Mac OS X, and Python IDLE files have all been updated and the game-crashing bug should be fixed. If you notice any other problems, please tell me.

First: This game is NOT intended for children. It contains mature themes. Sex and nudity are nil and there's only a little violence, but cruelty also exists.

This game was most definitely born from the voted theme, but HOW is not apparent until the end. The game really is short, but it is a text based game (story-heavy, with robot output simulation; you can choose some branches in the story).

Please do me a favor and don't TL;DR out on me! Have some mercy for a first-time entrant? :D Maybe? :D

... :D

The Python source code should work on any OS with Python installed; just run DECOMMISSIONER.PY and it will start automagically. Since I didn't manage to include any graphics or sound, the only imports I didn't write are built-in Python modules -- random, time, and string.

entries.title: DEFCON 0
entries.description:
Play as Soviet Union and try to conquer whole world by defeating other countries! 

This is turn-based game.

Hold Right Mouse Button to Move the Map
Use Scoll Wheel to Zoom In/Out
Click Countries to See More Info

Requires XNA 4.0 Redistributable.

--

Unfortunately I couldn't manage to make this a lot on the 2nd day so gameplay is a bit lacking, sorry about that. Source code is god-awful, so I don't recommend anyone trying to read it :)

entries.title: Den Of The Beast
entries.description:
Damn adventurers, always trying to steal your treasure. As Bal'nok the hell goat, you must roast your adversaries and defend the treasure

It was fun stuff making this.
Unzip it and run the EXE. 
WASD to move, space to breath fire - try and defend the gems as long as you can. 

As far as I can tell it will not work on Windows XP, havn't been able to figure out why

entries.title: Fragment Division
entries.description:
This is my first LD entry, and my first real game. Was really fun building a working product over a single weekend! Built with Unity, with SFX in CFXR and music in Logic Pro.

My game is kind of a reverse Splinter Cell. You are the evil Tom Clancy villain, plotting to release a catastrophic computer virus that will destabilise the world's economy. Out to stop you are a team of highly trained S.W.O.T operatives, saboteurs who will stop at nothing to foil your plan. 

They've cut the primary power to your base, leaving you with your mainframe and a single spotlight to reveal the operatives to your henchmen. Hold off the operatives for long enough for the virus to upload and you'll win the game!

entries.title: I, Goblin
entries.description:
Please note that this entry is largely unfinished and you can't complete the game. Apologies for this, I evidently bit off more than I could chew and was using unfamiliar tools (the software that I wanted to use/had experience with wouldn't install on the laptop that I'm using). I thought I would submit what has been done, I've stopped early to save what little sanity I have left.

For those interested the idea behind the game was that you played a goblin who sat down to write his/her memoirs only to find that they'd spent their lives being the lowest form of dungeon scum. Unsatisfied with this, you embark on a quest to take control of your local dungeon and must compete against 3 other equally unsatisfied denizens. 

It plays as a digital board game, just click the 'roll' button in the bottom left corner of the screen to get started if you fancy giving it a go.

entries.title: Innocent
entries.description:
Had only a few hours this weekend to throw something together, so just a small thing here. More of a game poem or haiku, but playable nonetheless.

Arrow keys to move.

entries.title: Invasion of the Replicators
entries.description:
You play a replicator, a metallic space thing that attacks space stations and, surprisingly, replicates itself.  
I wanted to make this game about timing and balance - you have to decide if you want to attack or expand your force.  If you expand too much you present a larger target and you get in your own way.  If you don't expand, you are limited in the amount of damage you can deal out.
I like the way that you end up playing a swarm of expendable identical entities against a single powerful one, a classic villains / hero scenario.
Sounds by SXFR.  (Happy 5th birthday SFXR!)

entries.title: My damn coffee.
entries.description: Everything is pretty understandable.

entries.title: Purple
entries.description:
Controls: A/W/D or Arrow keys to move. Left-click to perform combo attacks!

Level up to get upgrades!

entries.title: Robot Brain Mastermind
entries.description:
Solo project with 100% art and game from scratch, used the jam deadline for extra time only.

Used Java + Slick2D.
Photoshop for image creation.
Tiled for tilemap creation.

-------

The actual "game" didn't get finished, what exists is the base which would be your hub for the game, from which you would design more complex robots to complete tasks in other levels such as collecting items, activating switches, and moving objects.

Example level: http://i.imgur.com/sgWmA.png

The game engine is pretty much all there for it, so I'll probably implement it all another time.

entries.title: Serve The Lord
entries.description:
Commander!
The situation is bad.
The hero want to invade our city and rescue the queen.
Fight him!
The Evil Dark Lord


Instuction
==========
Buy units, each costs 10 coins.
Select a unit to control using "Q" and "W" or click on it.
Move the unit using WASD or using the arrow keys.
You must not let the hero defeat you and enter the city!
Upgrades your troop by clicking the "upgrade" button.
Try to steal as much coins as you can.
(Warning, upgrades takes effect only on new units)

entries.title: Space Pirates: Villains of the Cosmos
entries.description:
Tired for your day to day job you decide to become a Space Pirate! Selling everything you own, you purchase a ship and your first step to becoming a Space Pirate. 

What will the future hold!

This is a little strategy game I designed for the "You are the Villain" themed LD. There is 1 sector and 5 starbases to traverse. Beware of the space police, for they will take your credits if they win combat. You move with the mouse and input your commands with the keyboard. The goal is to amass 50000 credits to start your evil empire. Do you have what it takes to become a Space Pirate?

For those who want to turn off the music you can do so by pressing 'M', likewise you can press 'U' to turn it back on.

Note: Incase its unclear on the instruction page, when you steal credits at a starbase its random as to the amount you'll get upto the amounts listed. Also I have noticed some quirks with the game but they shouldn't hinder gameplay. 

Enjoy the game!

entries.title: Stealther - The Great Heist
entries.description:
A simple Stealth game.
You play as a thief who must steal a sacred artefact.
Avoid the guards by sneaking past them.
Move using WASD or Arrow Keys.
The game does include a Goat, but it is up to you to find it!
Considering my previous games, I find it pretty good. Especially because the art looks like art.
The game might be a bit bogus, but I hope it works for you!
Written in Java, and is my first entry for Ludum Dare.
Sound and music disabled because of many bugs associated with it :(

entries.title: The Day Before Monkeymass
entries.description:
It's the very day before Monkeymass. But look your job is to do so that those little monkey DO NOT get their presents. So get in there kill all the melves(monkey-elves) and the Manta(Monkey-Santa).

Controls: 
1-9(Select ball color)
R(torch)
T(hide torch)
Mouse left(shoot)
Mouse(look)
WASD(move)
Space(jump)

entries.title: Sunburn
entries.description: This is my third entry to Ludum Dare and I believe it is the best yet. You are a blob looking thing that is forced into being a villain because of how it looks. You move and jump with randomly changing keys that reset every ten seconds. Enjoy!

entries.title: Turret Maniac
entries.description: You play as a maniac who just loves turrets! Use your mouse to drag and drop turrets, to hold your site against police officers. Longer drags use more resources, but creates bigger coverage for the turret. Try to kill as many officers before they destroy your hideout!

entries.title: Zombie Commander
entries.description:
Zombie Commander is a game that is sort of like Atom Zombie Smasher, but in reverse and with a bit of a twist.
It is in reverse because you are creating the zombies to try to infect the city, and the twist is that instead of avoiding military, you must dodge missiles from the sky!

I really wish I had more time to make a real instructions menu, but because I don't, this is it...

Instructions:
Select which type of zombie you wish to spawn.
-Standard Zombies cost 1ZP (ZedPoint)
-Fast Zombies cost 4ZP
-Explosive Zombies cost 2ZP
Once you have selected a zombie, you can then select a location to spawn them.
You command around zombies by right clicking anywhere, they will all head toward this point.
You can spawn any amount of zombies, so long as you have the ZP to support it.
You gain ZP and Points by infecting civilians.
Points are lost if either a zombie or civilian is killed by a missile.
Your goal is to try to gain the highest amount of points you can before evac arrives...
Good Luck!!!

-Made by Blinked (Gregg Seamon)

I'm currently working on a website to host all my downloads and a webplayer version of the game :D

Also, please let me know if the OS/X and Linux version work properly, I have no way of testing it :/

entries.title: A game about an evil guy.
entries.description:
This is a very short Zelda-like game about an evil guy which have to kidnap the princess. Have fun! ;)

Attention! This game has some goats in it.

entries.title: A Game in Which You Attempt to Squeeze as Much Oil as You Can Out of a Poor Island Nation.
entries.description:
Yes, I'm completely awful at naming things.

I suggest not tossing any money at windmills or recycling centers until you absolutely need them, they're expensive, and if you run into a dry spell, you're going to run out of money quickly.

Press escape to go back to the menu screen if you get stuck with not enough money. 

And watch that ACT meter, refineries push it up quickly!

entries.title: ANONHACK.EXE
entries.description:
I HAVE RESOLVED ANY ISSUES REGARDING THE COLLISION DETECTION.
I have also included a version with vsync enabled if that is your preference.

You are a computer hacker and you hack n00btards!
To hack a computer, you simply have to select which one to target, and send in your hacker cloud to deal with the CENTRAL PRECESSING UNIT.
Beware of electricity, your cloud is made of MEGATRONS and can't handle the tickling of negatrons.

NOTE: The game has no tolerance for cheaters, and thus if you are found outside the MAINFRAME, the hacking utility will automatically close!

(The levels serve as a proof of concept, and could be expanded upon)

@BarrensZeppelin at GitHub and Twitter ;)


If you want to add and mock about with your own levels, try adding 3-0.txt, 3-1.txt, 4-0.txt etc. to the levels folder. Refer to the other levels for a guide, and keep in mind that you should never place the player directly beside or above/below a wall block.

entries.title: Another Castle
entries.description:
Storm into castle after castle and capture all the princesses in the land! 

Up - Jump
Down - Interact with props
Left/Right - Boost of speed

Break obstacles off the walls to thwart the knights looking to rescue the princesses. Don't walk into the obstacles on your way down!


==========
TEAM
==========

Rose - Artist
Vu - Programmer
Johan - Programmer/Musician
Hal - Musician

entries.title: B.I.O.S
entries.description:
Big. Insane. Obnoxious. Scientist.

You have the power to fire viruses at cities from your satellite, and your primary goal is to destroy & infect the entire city with them.

Research & Unlock new virus types, gain money from infecting, develop strategies for different buildings, and more all in B.I.O.S!

All info needed to play is located in the zip file, but you will need Java 6 or higher.

Have fun Infecting :]

entries.title: Bombit Bob
entries.description:
Poor Bob. Someone lit his fuse, and now he's going to blow up. He can collect clocks to ward off his impending doom, but since he's going to go, he might as well go out with a bang!

Flash. Uses my Triad framework - including a MIDI softsynth and Stage3D (available at https://github.com/triplefox/triad ). May not run well on Grandma's rig(because the synth is a CPU hog)

entries.title: Busdriver's paradise
entries.description:
You, being a busdriver, are mad that you're always late because of the grannys. KILL THEM ALL!

Not the cats tho, even villains like cats. Gargamel has one.

I bent the Compo rules by using art from OGA and Blendswap. I had far less than 48h to work on this.

entries.title: Dark Lord Manager 2012
entries.description:
Increase your power, fame and wealth by prioritizing your evil tasks. Don't let the hero distract you! Once the hero has grown powerful and famous himself, crush him to destroy the hopes of the population that they could ever escape from under your growing shadow!

Help:
Click on the "Think", "Act", "Build" task buttons to change their priority. All tasks will progress, but those highest in the queue will do so at a faster rate.
Once a task is complete, click on it to collect the reward and move on the the next task.
When you wish to challenge the hero, click the "Crush him!" button.

entries.title: Dirty Robbing Hood
entries.description:
You are Dirty Robbing Hood and the aim of the game is to steal gold from the villagers homes and stash it back at your den.

The game kind of works how I thought it would but I didn't have enough time to fix a few final issues and my animation skills are pretty poor.

The code is HTML5 canvas using Javascript.  The graphics were scribbled on paper and scanned in.  I chopped them up using Xara Photo & Graphic Designer 6.

entries.title: Evil Keeper
entries.description:
Have you ever wondered what it feels like to be the endboss of a game? Well, here is a game that answers your questions.

In Evil Keeper you have to build your own dungeon and fight every hero who dares to enter your lair. Each hero tries to find as many treasures as possible before he challenges you to an epic fight to the death.
Claim the victory, take his money and expand your dungeon!

Find more detailed information ingame.

Programming Language: C# (XNA 4.0)
Sound: sfxr
Music: SunVox
Graphics: Paint.NET

This is my second ludum dare entry. The code is really messed up this time because I had no time to comment and optimize it so if you have any questions concerning the code feel free to ask.

Info: If you have some performance issues press 'V' ingame once to disable frameskipping.

If there are any bugs or glitches please inform me by posting a comment. I will fix them as soon as possible.


Please enjoy my game as much as I did making it.

EDIT: You can place new dungeon ground on gray walls next to grey tiles. The red area is the bossbattle arena. You cannot build there.
EDIT2: Ok, I am going to make a post-compo version.
EDIT3: Added the first post-compo version. I am sorry, I haven't had much time so it only contains small changes. But there is still more to come. The changelog.txt contains all the changes.

entries.title: Getaway
entries.description:
Incomplete.
The mechanic wasn't as fun as I expected, and didn't feel the point of carrying on.

Up and Down arrows to move, Z to "cook" bomb.
The longer you hold Z, the further the bomb goes.
You can get hit 10 times before you die.

entries.title: MEMEX
entries.description:
"A belief may be larger than a fact"

MEMEX is an ambient mystery puzzle game where you steal 
bits and pieces of someone's memory. You play as the thief, 
pushing your way through someone's mind in an attempt to 
take away pieces of treasured memories. 

But why are you doing this? Who are "you" supposed to be?

Cake&Code welcomes you to try your hand at being the villain 
for once, and watch our little story unfold. 
Keep in mind, you don't have to collect all the pieces to move on, 
but it won't be without consequence.

WASD, Arrows: Move
R, Backspace: Restart Level
Esc: Home 

Matias Giachino (Zeik): Code Monkey, Sound Magician
Christina Pham (Cake): Art Guru, UI Design Ninja

entries.title: My Little Terrorist
entries.description:
In My Little Terrorist you receive requests from common sponsors of terrorism to perform (occasionally suicidal) destructive acts of murder. To do this you must gather recruits and ingredients for bombs, and manage them effectively.

This was an effort by a team. You can ask questions or follow us on twitter: @tccoxon, @nerdofgamers, @fractallambda.

entries.title: Painful Traps Master
entries.description:
You're the traps master, a special type of demon with weak strenght but the ability of placing nasty traps. Don't let the heroes go through the end of the level and pursue their quest. "Cut them all into pieces" as said your boss. === How to play === Move with WASD or Arrows Keys. Shoot with the mouse. Select a corresponding trap with 1,2,3,4,5 keys and then place it with a mouse click. You can press to cancel. to start the waves to interact with the teleporter. to Restart.

for Pause. to Mute. === Traps Stats (sorry, didn't have enough time to include it in the game) === <1> Spikes - damage : 35 - cooldown : 5 sec <2> Ice Floor - damage : 0 - cooldown : 4.5 sec - slowdown duration : 5 sec <3> Ghost monster - damage : 10 - cooldown : 1 sec <4> Arrow Shooter - damage : 15 - cooldown : 3.5 sec <5> Acid Floor - damage : 55 - cooldown : 8 sec

entries.title: Sir Cat
entries.description:
NOTE: The DL link is a GDrive file- hit "File->Download" to download
It is also just the source at this point- requires Python 2.7 and Pygame 1.9.1. That's all.

EDIT: Added Windows binaries! Yay!

Sir Cat- play as the evil Sir Cat in this artistic side-scroller!
The Aircat people are building a laser goat made out of yarn to take over and destroy the Luftmicen! But they need one more ball of yarn to finish the job...
That's where you, Sir Cat, come in. Fly in, avoid the (supposedly) heroic Luftmicenmen! You can only take so many hits!
The aircat people put a sign directly above the dropzone! Press 'q' to drop the yarn and win the game!
If you're in a pinch, press 'e' to fire a hairball! But beware! Each time you do, it makes them angrier! Enough to send *another* luftmousenman!

Can you drop the yarn and destroy the Luftmicen?


Writeup:
Overall this was a very fun game, and arguably my best yet. I'm *very* pleased with how it turned out. I'll be making custom binaries in the coming days for Windows and Linux, and if I have the time, Mac. I'll also upload more detailed screenshots soon, as well as a postmortem.

-JoeCool173

Font "Scribble" Copyright 2009 Michael Slevin, obtained from FFonts.net

entries.title: Snap
entries.description:
I managed another dark LD entry. Go on a shooting rampage - blame the theme I'm afraid. I like to use LD to explore unusual themes, game mechanics, and ideas.

I was drawn to the idea of some interesting game mechanics. Innocent people are worth more points than police, although police can shoot at you and deal health damage.

I was also intrigued by the idea of a "Suicide Bonus". If you die from wounds, you get no Suicide Bonus. If you suicide, you get a bonus based on your current health. But of course, if you suicide, you can no longer score points. So... when to suicide?


And then the Newtown tragedy happened, and made me feel sad and uncomfortable. RIP.

entries.title: The Accursed Moon
entries.description:
When someone turns into a werewolf during a full moon they have no control over what their werewolf form does. 
But now you can!
You play as the werewolf during a full moon.

Have fun!

Visit www.BarkerGames.com for more!

entries.title: Under a bloody sky
entries.description:
"Lost are we, and are only so far punished,
That without hope we live on in desire."
- Dante Alighieri, The Divine Comedy

During this two days, my work as been mainly shader code, and javascript learning. It's not a game, more a small landscape to discover. WebGL is a great tool, and this first LD try as been very instructive.

I have used the framework "PlayCanvas" (thank to them) actualy in beta, but already with great tools, powerfull and very customisable.

Use arrow keys to move the camera across the little maze.

entries.title: VampVille
entries.description:
On a never ending quest to find more victims to draw blood from you search for shelters in VampVille. 
Word of caution: sun lotion not included.. so spend you steps wisely durring daytime. Happy sucking.

entries.title: Vault
entries.description:
You are a thief who's robbing different banks.
Shoot the guards and try to steal the vault before the police show up.
But beware: what your character hasn't seen yet (look around with the mouse) won't be shown to you either!
And there's goats!
And a secret ending!

All controls explained ingame.
The levels go up to 11!
QWERTY AND AZERTY controls!

WARNING: Rather hard.

OS X and Linux Users: If the .jar-file does not play sounds, please open the terminal (terminal.app on Mac), cd to the download map and run "vault.run" (all from within the terminal).

19 Dec: I found what was causing so many people to crash: a simple ****ing typo inside one of the exception handlers. I haven't been able to reproduce the crash after changing it, so I assume it has been fixed. According to the Ludum Dare rules, I can fix this kind of thing and re-upload the fixed version.

- Robin Arys
(@zedutchgandalf)

entries.title: Video Games Cause Mass Shootings
entries.description:
Everything seems to be going wrong.
You can only enjoy life for a bit whenever you're playing VIDEO GAMES.

What will you do?

note: whenever there's a mass shooting people quickly look for reasons why and probably the most common ones are: the killer is/was insane or video games. Very rarely there's an open discussion on what might have led someone to do such a terrible thing (specially when there's children involved, as was the case with the latest shooting). After all, how could we empathize with someone so despicable? So I decided that this game should talk about that. Maybe you'll find that the content is depressive or creepy...

entries.title: You are the Villain... or not!
entries.description:
This is our third time in the competition, and we reached a record making this game in less than 7 hours. =D
Hope you all enjoy.

Team:
Gustavo Silva dos Santos

entries.title: Voyage of the Obsolete Goat
entries.description:
This game was made by thatSnail(mostly art):
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/thatsnail/

And yours truly Quantumvm (mostly code).

In this game you play as a ship called the Obsolete goat. Your objective is to maniacally pollute the waters of the adorable sea monster/death worm who slowly tries to kill you.

The game was tested under java 1.7 if it doesn't run you may need to update java.

-If you had a mac and it did not work, it should work now. The code was compiled in java 1.7 but macs are still in 1.6. The mac version is now in 1.5 JUST to make sure there is maximum compatibility. Sorry for the inconvenience cheers!

entries.title: YOU ARE WASPS
entries.description:
Wasps are nature's henchmen. Villain of the sky. Literally the worst organism which has ever existed or ever will exist.

Today, YOU ARE WASPS.

Aims:
World domination, human extinction, annoyance of goats, ruination of picnics.

Controls:
WASD to move
SPACE to attack and fly through crowds

Features:
- Audio which was not even the most annoying audio I could have gone for given that it involves constant buzzing
- Wasps
- Hate
- Some sort of art and code or something
- BONUS GOATS, HOORAY :3

WARNING! Do NOT play this game if you LIKE WASPS. It's not that you won't enjoy the game, it's just that you don't deserve to have fun.

entries.title: Alien Command
entries.description:
Missile command inspired game made in a night (about 6-7 hours). Tools used are Game Maker Studio, FL studio and BFRX sound generator.

You are an alien visiting the earth with the objective of destroying it.

Click to fire lasers to destroy cities and protect your OVNI. Your laser-meter refills over time. 
Space to stop OVNI's motion, it will empty your laser-meter though.

entries.title: Burglary
entries.description:
Explore the premises. Evade the guards. Pick locks. Steal the treasures! And then escape with them.

Burglary, an action/stealth game about stealing from the rich and giving to those needing it: Yourself.

Hints:
- When you are captured, it's over! You can restart the level to try it out again, but you can't get a perfect score anymore.
- The guards see you when their seeing helper line connects to you. The brighter your light is, the better they can see you.
- Lock-picking is easier with more light!

entries.title: Cata Chulhu
entries.description:
Bring a Chulhu Cataclism on the world!
Destroy cities, kill heroes and be the true villain!

Made in 48hours for Ludum dare 25


Be aware: Cthulhu is the BIG VILLAIN :D

entries.title: Credit
entries.description:
The year: 2005. You are selling houses to sub-prime mortgage borrowers. Your mission is to get rich before you crash the US economy.

Instructions: WASD or directional keys to drive. Click on customers to get be their agent and pick them up, click on For Sale signs to sell customers a house. If the price is higher than their loan, you can't sell. You can also scout the area by clicking signs without a customer.

EDIT: Fixed a bug where some customers were not selectable. 

I didn't even know about the goat thing until after I submitted. Could have been better communicated. 

I barely got a playable entry in, but I think the driving feel and concept are pretty good. I plan on continuing to make this game, I really wanted to get to build the bank and the in-between scenes where you have an avatar that is a greed banker, but so it goes.


I think there is a lot of potential to make it both fun and educational.

Thanks to @thepixelbrain for a random Twitter reply that lead me to a better concept for villainary! I was originally going to be a bank robber, but the bankers are much better villians!

I used Cocos2X-HTML5 and an open source engine I've been working on for the engine. This project was a good way to make new things for the engine and have a fun game dev exercise as well! 

https://github.com/mcscooter/cocos2d-html5-orthogonal-tile

links.label: HTML5 (please use Chrome if possible, not touch friendly)

entries.title: Crime in the City
entries.description:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tagline
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Be a master of crime and take control of the city !

Crime in the City works like a card game. Build your team of bad guys and send them on raids ! Steal a bus, kidnap the chief of police, etc. and raise the level of crime in the city until you can establish your reign of evil !

But beware, The Dark Cape and the cops will constantly stand in your way and try to catch you !


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How to play - Quickly get started on the game !
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1 - Hire bad guys
2 - Click "raid"
3 - Choose an easy raid
4 - Select people and launch the raid
5 - See if you can cancel the effects of the encounters with your guys. (see below)
6 - If you get to the end of the raid, you win money and crime points. You don't need to remove all the effects of the encounters.
7 - You need 20 crime points to win


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Who should I hire ? - tips for choosing the BEST bad guys 
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

STRENGTH : bad guys with a high strength can neutralize more encounters

SKILLS THAT BOOST STRENGTH : They make a guy more flexible against encounters because you can spend $ if his strength is lower than the encounter's

CANCEL SPELLS : Pay attention to the type. Some Cancel spells only allow you to cancel effects of a specific type of encounters.
There are 4 types of encounters : Heavies, Devices, Structures, Super-hero. You only have super-hero encounters on hard raid.

FIND NEW GUYS : if the guys you can hire are weak, reset the panel !

RAIDS : When you launch a raid, make sure your guys can cancel Heavies, Devices, Structures, and that they're strong enough or can boost their strength.

K.O. : The guys are K.O. after a raid. They need to rest one night before they can fight again.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How the battle system works
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The idea is to remove the effects of the encounters before you face them. The characters can use their "Cancel" spells if they have a strength superior or equal to the strength of the encounter and if they can cancel the right type of encounter. 

Select a "Cancel" spell, then click on the button on the left of the effect you want to remove.

If you don't finish a raid, you can consult the encounters you've already seen to adapt your strategy.



----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Don't hesitate to ask if you don't understand something in the game.
Sorry for the very basic graphics, I didn't have time to work on them !
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entries.title: Cube Infection
entries.description:
The game is complete. I hope you'll have fun :)

RULES : 
A RED cube is a cube you possess.
A BLUE cube is a scanned and free cube.
A GREEN cube is a guardian. They are your enemies.

You start as a RED cube. You need to reach the GOLDEN cube by creating a control path to it.
You can SCAN the neighbors of BLUE / RED cubes by right-clicking on it. Neighbors will reveal their colors.
You can CONTROL the neighbors of a RED cube by left-clicking on it ONCE it has been scanned.
You can CREATE links by dragging your mouse between two cubes (only in a horizontal or vertical way).

Notice :

1) The content is randomly generated. That means sometimes, a game can't be won, and sometimes, it's too easy. 'Cause like a villain, life is unfair !

2) Two actions can be made on the same case, the time counter will show only the last one (but both actions will occur).

3) There's also a little bug that allow players to cheat. 
Try to find it ;)

About the theme :
I was not very inspired by the theme. You play an evil cube trying to infect the others. Maybe original, but I could have done far better !

About the music : Made with MuLabs (Window, free version).

About the graphics : Photoshop, some fonts from dafont and code only.

About the light system : Inspired from an article on the SFML wiki.

Feel free to ask anything !

Windows notes : The game might not be able to run on old / integrated GPU (I use shaders). 64bits only; otherwise, please compile from the source with latest SFML revision

Linux notes : You need SFMl to be installed on your system. 64bits only; otherwise, please compile from the source with latest SFML revision

Dev notes :
Source code is awful. The last hours were kinda rushed, so you'll find horrible things. This was my IRL-RPG interpretation of "You're the villain !"

entries.title: In My Evil Dream
entries.description:
This is a game where you decided if you want to play as bad or as good. Because of that, I recommend that if you played it the first time and liked it then play it again as the opposite side. No goats unfortunately.

Controls:
WSAD - movement
Left Mouse - Sword
Right Mouse - Bow

Can you defeat your Nightmare?

entries.title: International Super-Villain
entries.description:
hello.

use the arrow keys to change which island city thing you are targetting.

space - Move (1 turn)
r     - Rob bank (1 turn)
l     - Build labratory (1 turn, $2000)
s     - Build missile silo (1 turn, 10 lab points, $10000)

The objective to to build the silo and fire the missile without getting caught be the detective (red dot).
The detective can investigate islands to find you or your facilities. If a facility is found, it is destroyed.
If you are found, you lose.

dependencies:
	Install rubygame (https://github.com/rubygame/rubygame/wiki/Install)

entries.title: Like a Boss
entries.description:
^^^^ Click "Web" to play the game in your web browser!

LIKE A BOSS

Ever wondered what it felt like waiting for that special someone to assault your hidden skull-shaped fortress in a remote deserted island?

Prepare to find out!

This is by far my most complete LD game I've done so far; I had a blast making it, and basically made the project in about 24 hours. (Had a bunch of other stuff to do)

*INSTRUCTIONS*
Mouse moves your view.  Click to interact with buttons that correspond to deadly traps!  Watch fools die from the comfort of your EZ-chair!  The player will win the game if you let him!  As per tradition, this is the only condition where you will see the credits! ;)

I hope everyone enjoys the game!  I really enjoyed making it!

And check out http://www.cookingwithunity.com for Unity tutorials and other game development related media!

P.S. I ended up using the Unity Pro 4 trial for this game; that's how I got the Render Targets working.  Was a lot of fun to work with that feature!

P.P.S.: Tripod joke in the credits is due to the fact that my friend Phil held my camera to take 3 pictures of me.  Hopefully this still counts for LD48. ;)

entries.description:
Destroy your city with Dr. Mech Villain!

Flixel

This entry is not functional, much to my disappointment.  Visual C++ does not redistribute, apparently, so I hope to get this stuff fixed before next ludum dare.
