entries.title: EndNet - A Prisoner's Dilemma
entries.description:
This is a game designed to make everyone a villain, at least anyone who wants to win. It centers around the concept of the prisoner's dilemma where players, who have to interact to have a chance at winning, can also choose to backstab each other. In standard prisoner's dilemma fashion, if both play nice, both get out pretty OK. If both play mean, both lose. And if only one chooses to be mean, they make out really well.

This game is 100% multi-player with real humans and it is implemented as a server that can be connected to via telnet. There are tons of free telnet clients on the web including PuTTY and MushCLIENT. If you want to play, and you should, connect at

Address: endnet.publishingnothing.com
Port: 2025

Below are copies of the three important help document pages that explain the story, game play overview, and how contracts work. Check them out if you are not yet sold.

Also, a session doesn't take forever (so you can't just win by playing longer than anyone else). Once your character makes its first contract, it has one real world hour to make as much money as possible. Don't want to play for an hour? Don't worry, try it out anyways. 

My biggest fear is that there will not be enough players to really get this going so if you think this is interesting, please pass on the word so we can the evil villain empires rolling!

--[Help - Story]------
Money. Its all about the damn money. To make everything "fair" it was decided
in the year 2025 to make it so everyone had access to the trade markets. The
problem? You only get one shot. For one hour.

Everyone is given a preset amount of cash and once you start trading, you have
one hour to make as much money as you can. Whats going on behind the trades?
It doesn't matter any more. Its just a system.

Once the hour is up, you'll still be able to connect to the system but you can
no longer trade. No longer make more money. You failed? Whelp, your boned.

Don't fail.

--[Help - Game]------
The point of the game is to make money on contracts with a prisoner's dilemma
twist. Either or both of the players involved in a contract can choose to
backstab the other with the "evil" versions of the offer and accept commands.
If neither uses the evil version, both players profit. If both are evil, both
loose everything invested as well as the contract slot for its duration. And
if only one is evil, then they take all of the money for themselves. Whether
or not you got screwed is not known until the contract is complete.

Since you only have one hour to make as much money as you can, picking who you
make deals with and if you screw them over is paramount. To facilitate this
players can chat globally (say) and privately (tell) and can see info about
players (about).

To aid in this, a reputation system is in place. Each player starts with 10
reputation. When a contract completes, both players involved can rate the
contract interaction in the range of -3 to +3. This is applied to the other
player and is reflected on their public reputation where higher is better.

--[Help - Contracts]------
Contracts are how you make money. To create a contract, one player makes an
offer to another with the contract details. The other player can choose to
accept or reject the contract. Once accepted the contract lasts the specified
duration. Any one player can only have a maximum of 5 open contracts at a
time. The "offer" and "accept" have evil versions called "eviloffer" and
"evilaccept", the effects of which are described in "help game".

The parameters of the offer commands are:
  - offer <investment1> <player> <investment2> <duration>

investment1 - The investment of the offering player
player - The player you are making the offer to
investment2 - How much the other player is supposed to invest
duration - How long the contract lasts in minutes if accepted, max of 5

Profit multipliers increase with duration. At 1 minute, each player makes
back their investment plus the average of both investments and at 5 minutes
each makes back their investment plus 16x the average of their investments!

entries.title: Envious Farmer
entries.description:
I know this game is terrible >.< But I wanted to actually post something for the solo ludum dare for once. 

The idea is that you are a farmer that is very jealous of his neighbour, so he trains his sheep dog to kill sheep and sends it into the neighbouring fields..

entries.title: Escape Velocity
entries.description:
And here's my product of three hours of work.

This is a local multiplayer game, where two players engage in a duel of reactions and button mashing. One person needs to escape the castle, while the other tries to launch fireballs at them, slowing them down and maybe even stopping their attempt completly. Whoever gets farther, or is faster, wins the game.

Player 1's Tap Key is C, and the keys they need for the fireballs are Q W E R A S D and F. The controls for Player 2 are N for tapping and U I O P H J K and L for reactions.

Press the keys shown next to the fireballs to attack or defend. The escaping player needs to press the keys on the left of the ball, the defender the right ones.
If you are the escaping player, rapidly hit the Tap Key to speed up and destroy a few fireballs before they even enter the play area.

entries.title: Ghosting
entries.description:
A little exploration game, mouse to rotate camera, arrow keys / wasd to move the ghost.

I had a hard time figuring out this theme as I was reluctant to build in a set "good" and "bad" in the game, I built the ghost and then had a really hard time figuring out what I wanted the gameplay to be so instead built out a little world to explore.

I have to remind myself to keep things simple and get started on a strong foundation otherwise I can find myself stalled out with basic interaction but not much of a game.

Thanks for trying it!

entries.title: GLOBAL Heist
entries.description:
^^^DOWNLOAD, THEN EXTRACT^^^

If you get stuck or find a 'unable to finish' bug; Press Esc and re-open. Sorry.

Global Heist is a game about a cat-burgler, stealing gold around the world.
The amount of money you heist is determined on your stealth and speed.

- STORY -

Your name is James, and your greed is too great for you to contain.
You rush off to your friend who flies an airplane and he takes you to your next destination on Earth.
Your friend can only hold back the guards for a certain amount of time, so be quick! Dodge detection-lasers, Jump over pressure plates and sprint, to the large safe filled with gold, as fast as you can.

---------


CONTROLS:

C - Open Safe
Arrow keys - Move the player
Up arrow key - Jump
Esc - exit game any time

Comment your HIGHSCORES!!

bugs:
(some levels may be a bit laggy)


LEADERBOARDS - - - 
1. lur - 143million
2. Me - 83million
- - - - - - - - -

entries.title: HeartBreaker
entries.description:
You are a tough guy that never shows his feelings? Tired of getting hurt because you are always thinking with your heart? 

Then use your BRAIN and finish with all that mushy s***!

Take control of Dr.Brain, an evil cold minded moustache man and destroy all the cute hearts with your powerful laser. You will surely lost some neurons in the process, so not forget to collect them all!

Use or Arrow Keys to move, Down Arrow Key to jump higher and X Key to shoot.

Objectives:  
- Reach the end of the game and face the Heart King.
- Collect all the neurons to get a final surprise.

Features:
- Gameplay mechanics inspired in the great Cauldron II.
- 10 levels that will grant you a great challenge.
- Final Boss at the end of the game :).

**Note: We recommend you to use 800x600 resolution!

Credits: 
Isaac Giron - Programmer & Designer.
Carlos Diaz - Artist.
Jacobo Caceres - Music.

entries.title: Henchmen
entries.description: It's an iPad app where you drag a path for your henchmen to follow and get to the goal of the level. The game uses an Isometric view. You will have to use a variable number of henchmen to complete each level.

entries.title: Intergalactic Oil Baron Simulator 2012
entries.description:
Intergalactic Oil Baron Simulator 2012.

Ended up being more like Global Oil Sales Boringator 1985, but I digress. All the info you need is in the zip.

Sorry non-windows people, I couldn't figure out monogame quickly enough this time, so there's no linux/mac versions. Please don't hate me ;_;

Should probably add that it requires XNA 4, which you can get from microsofts site here: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=20914

entries.title: Knights of Uruk
entries.description:
EDIT: I've uploaded a post-compo version that fixes the glitchy graphics, and counts troop casualties correctly. Enjoy!

==================Original Submission======================

Its got a few issues, but I'm pretty happy with my entry for once! :D

I originally planned to make an rpg/strategy hybrid that was more focused on your evil general character, but time-constraints meant I had to cut it down to a short RTS game. I developed the game primarily to be played on Android 3.0+, but I've uploaded a webplayer version that you can control with the mouse.

To issue orders just click/tap on a unit and then click its destination.

Combat works in a kind of Rock-Paper-Scissors format:

Knights > Swordsmen > Pikemen > Knights...

Tested on Samsung Galaxy S3. If you're having trouble installing on Android, make sure you go into your phone settings and enable the installation of non-app store applications.

If I come back to it, the game probably could probably do with:

-Balancing
-Better AI
-Sprite drawing code that works

Anyway, hope you enjoy! :)

Notes
===========================
Made with Unity, Photoshop and Audacity
Music created in BeepBox (http://www.beepbox.co/)
Sounds created from freesounds.org samples

entries.title: Ludum Dare: The Musical
entries.description:
In order to play the part of the villain for the Ludum Dare Musical, you must sing the correct lines, or else something might just be dropped on your head. The correct line will both rhyme with the one before it and be suitably villainous.

Made using Unity, Inkscape, GIMP, Blender, Aria Maestosa and Audacity.

entries.title: Mechanical Menace
entries.description:
Lead a group of heartless robots on a quest to take over the world.  Caution: contains TANKS, ROBOTS, LASERS, and EXPLOSIONS.

Credits:
Daniel Grace and Justin Mullin: Programming, Design
Julia Grace and Joe Olson: Art, Sound Effects, Design

Written in Scala using the highly recommended LibGDX (http://code.google.com/p/libgdx/).

entries.title: REVERSE SLENDER
entries.description:
An Android app, based off the Slender game.

For anyone who is tired of being chased around by the Slenderman, be the villain and chase the player around!

To use this app, go on http://beta.appinventor.mit.edu/ and login with a Google account.
Go to "Invent", (and then "Projects" if it does not take you there automatically). 
Go to "More Actions" and select "Upload Source" (not keystore!)
Upload the file downloaded from the SECOND LINK (the "Android Source")
Click on the project (called LudumDare25) and open the "Blocks Editor"
Once it is loaded, click on "Connect to Device"
Select WiFi if you have an Android phone.
Open an emulator first if not.

Follow the instructions on the screen, and scare the living daylights out of the player!

If your screen is too small, you may need to scroll down to see the whole game.


NOTE: If you wish to directly download, use the first link. I have no idea how to run it, though.

entries.title: StickThief
entries.description:
Trailer/Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=idJX80iQW_o

You are a thief and you have to steal everything of some homes, by everything I mean everything except walls and windows.... and well people, the people that live in the house can't see you or you will lose and will have to try again

Rules:
* You have to pick everything including furniture (tables, chairs, etc...)
* If there is something on top of another object, you have to pick the object at top first
* After picking an object you won't be able to pick another object for a little while
* If you are on the watching zone/area of a resident you lose and you will have to start again

Instructions: 
* Arrow keys to move
* Control key to pick up an item

Notes: 
* On level selection screen, select the house you wan't to thief
* When you finish a level you will be taken back to home screen, just click on start and you will see the next level unlocked
* Flash build coming soon trough flascc but I'm a little worried about performance (actually is running now in flash, thanks to protonsdk, but I have to do some speed tests)

This has been created with proton sdk
"This product includes software from the Proton SDK developed by Seth A. Robinson ( www.rtsoft.com )"

entries.title: The Furry Fours vs. Goatie the EVIL Goat
entries.description:
You are a evil goat, punch rabbits to death and don't get stopped by the furry four, the local heroes.

Move with the arrowkeys, punch with space and block with down arrow.

Mac/linux? Install love from love2d.org and run the .love file.

entries.title: The Secret Plan
entries.description:
Unfortunately I didn't get this done I only got 2 of the 8 levels I had planned done:(, But their playable:)

To play un zip the file and double click on 
"The Secret Plan".exe

############ THE CONTROLS ############
Mouse Movement = Look around
Left Mouse = Shoot
Right Mouse = Iron Sights

############ Objective #############
Destroy the earth by completing the levels.

############ How to Play ############
Basically just shoot the targets.
If you look to the left you can see your score.

Made with blender.

Story:

You are the classic evil villain trying to destroy the earth. To succeed you have to kidnap a scientist to build you a super weapon. Along the way you have to steal uranium, and rocket fuel, while destroying earths defenses, and eventually the earth itself.  

Twitter: https://twitter.com/KevinJCorrigan

entries.title: The White Rabbit
entries.description:
"Do you remember the White Rabbit?"

Back again for my 5th consecutive Ludum Dare, but this time with my first ever game created with UNITY!

Not much gameplay here folks, but put on those headphones and enjoy the sights and sounds of an atmospheric trip down memory lane.

Use WASD to move

Space Bar to jump

Double click to hide mouse cursor

----------

Graphics created with Unity, Cinema 4d and Photoshop
Audio recorded and produced with Pro Tools

entries.title: U'39
entries.description:
U'39 is a robot that broke the Asimov's Laws.

Arrows to move
Z to run
X to fire

Sadly, my time is over, but the original script was:
________________________________________
Charpter 1
Follow

U'39 follows human orders blindly
until the end

________________________________________
Charpter 2
Sadness

U'39 starts to doubt and deviate

________________________________________
Charpter 3
Awakening

U'39 breakes Asimov's Laws and kill
his human

________________________________________
Charpter 4
Semantics

U'39 categorize the humans between
good and bad, killing the bad group

________________________________________
Charpter 5
Blur

U'39 realizes that nor good or bad
exists, and kill himself

entries.title: Villainous Dungeons
entries.description:
This game was made in 48 hours during the Ludum Dare 25 competition.

You are an evil wizard who wants to protect his treasure.
Sadly you are not a good enough wizard to give your guards a mind of their own.
Therefore you have to possess your guards to control them.

How to play:
Click on a guard to possess it.
Use the arrow keys or WASD to move whatever you are controlling.
Press X to attack
Kill all the heroes before they reach the treasure.
Press R to restart the level
Press M to mute

entries.title: You are LunchLady
entries.description:
Edith is the brand new Lunch Lady at Tweedsville Municipal.

Gather your collection of industrial food machines to create meals for the children.

"You are the Lunch Lady" currently more of a toy interface than an actual puzzle. I ran out of time to create interesting food machine layouts, but you can still move pieces around and see how high you can score.

entries.title: You naughty beast!
entries.description:
=======
Please try the post-compo Christmas edition after you tried the compo one.
It's easier, has more sounds, updated graphics, eating and drinking and is what I intended to do (and much more fun I think). 
========

This evil little cow has doomed the earth!

Or maybe not? 

There are instructions in the intro, but its a bit of a Chinese jugler kind of game: you have to balance defending the trees, growing the trees, eating and drinking for the growing (in the post compo one). It can get pretty hectic and I meant it to be that way (only not as much as in the compo version).

The best way to start is to defend a single tree or trees close to another. Trees keep on sucking Co2 from the air, the larger the tree the more they absorb C02.
Hint: you can charge the birds out of the game, before they land, but don't miss: the charge can not be interrupted. 

Controls are all over the place in the compo edition: 
Left and Right for moving,  'P' for Peeing, 'S' for Pooing, and 'C' for Charging (as in Charge!).

In the post-compo Christmas Edition:
Left and Right for moving, UP for Peeing, DOWN for Pooing, and 'C' for Charging (as in Charge!).
You can use 'X' for eating and 'Z'for drinking, but only in the Christmas Edition.

There is a score, but sadly the winning condition is only in the Post-compo.

Oh yeah: you have to defend the trees from enemies, not plants (typo).

entries.title: A Villain is YOU!
entries.description:
The game also runs in Wine on Linux, Just download the Windows package and wrap it.

A Villain is YOU! is a reverse-tower defense, pitting you and your minions against the holy empire.  You must destroy the Holy Capital before the Hero of Prophecy is born, and inevitably buries you!

Corrupt the world with your endless supply of EVIL POWER and turn powerful spells against your foe.

The light has existed for far too long, and it's time the Vile Citadel had its day!

---------------------------------------------------------- 

Please read the instructions, as due to time constraints there is no tutorial in game.

INSTRUCTIONS ARE AVAILABLE ON THIS PAGE BELOW THE SWF
http://laguz.us/games-archive/villain-you

----------------------------------------------------------

I HIGHLY suggest downloading either the Windows or OSX desktop versions as there can be performance issues with the SWF.

entries.title: A Villain Project
entries.description:
You need to catch humans by trap.
Controls are simple - only left mouse button.
There is a tutorial in game, so I'll not write here too much.

P.S. You need .Net 4.0 to play!

entries.title: Blue Idiot
entries.description: You are the red guy.  You are cleverer, stronger, richer, and a snappier dresser than the blue guy...  but you will still probably lose this race.

entries.title: BUTCHER
entries.description:
BUTCHER is a an arcade game where you are the BUTCHER,
slash victims with your knives for points, but avoid the cops or your murdering days will be over!

Controls: arrow keys & spacebar.

In total I probably only worked on this game 8-9 hours due to a terribly busy weekend. I still wanted to get it "playable", and in that regard I consider it succesful :D

I would've had some rpg'ish ideas for this, but there simply wasn't any time implement anything apart from the basic gameplay.

Tools used: 

ImpactJS
Paint.net
Audacity

entries.title: Christmas Caper
entries.description:
Unity Web Player Game

Models created in Blender, Vertex Colors used instead of textures.
Bfxr for sound effects.
EnergyXT for the music, I tried to make it sound a little sinister.

Controls:  Left/Right to move, Forward to move faster, space to jump and double double jump.

entries.title: Comrade Santa
entries.description:
Yepp. I did it again. Couldn't get anywhere with my first idea, so I restarted at the last hours. The player sprite was literally made in the last 60 seconds.

Sorry for the wonky camera. I had a better setup while I was working on it, but that was copy pasted from the forums so I had to remove it and I didn't have time to make my own.

Controls:

R: Restart current level.
Move: Arrowkeys.
Shoot: X.
Jump: Space.
Change weapon: 1 and 2.


Warning: May contain traces of goat.

entries.title: Deadland
entries.description: You play the role of an evil purple blob, who has made it his aim in life to corrupt the world with his disease, which he has dubbed Deadland.

entries.title: Doggie Destroyer
entries.description:
BACKSTORY:
You are the most villainous dog ever. And all you want to do is pee on stuff. 
Do it!

GAMEPLAY:
Click and hold your mouse where you want the dog to go to. Once close to fire hydrant, he'll pee on it. Score a bunch of points by not getting wet from the hydrant while you are peeing.

ABOUT:
This is an HTML5 game I made with Cocos2d-HTML5. It's the first time I used the platform. Other tools used: Audacity, Inkscape, CocosBuilder.

Tested on OSX 10.6.8, 10.8.2; Firefox 17.1, Chrome 23.0.1271.97

BUGS/THINGS I WANTED TO DO/ETC:
* Sound seems to only work in Chrome.
* A little bit laggy (especially due to sound effect- see no sound version below).
* Collision detection is a little off.
* Dog can also remain 100% on the hydrant (collision detection doesn't stop you from moving).
* The dog only pees in one direction.
* The hydrants continuously spin, but you get hurt regardless if the water is facing you or not when you pee.
* No end game condition (you can have negative health).
* No way to mute sound effects / only 1 sound effect.
* No music.
* Only fire hydrants (no other entities to pee on).

OVERALL:
* I liked it a lot. If you read any of my blog posts, you'll see I had a major meltdown. In fact, on the first day, the only thing I had done was the different sprites in Inkscape. Everything I had to start from scratch... so I'm pretty pleased where I ended up, all things considered.

entries.title: Escape From Prison Planet
entries.description:
STORY

In the year 2130, the Galactic Police began transporting all prisoners to the
first planet, designed as a prison with no way out.

Even Prison Planet 1 was not enough to contain the galaxy's most cunning villain.

After starting a riot, you have slipped aboard Prison Transporter 1 after a fresh
delivery of in-mates, now you must get as far away from PP! as you can, or die trying!

Controls:

W - Move up
S - Move down
A - Speed up
D - Slow down

SPACE - Activate shield

Mouse - Aim
Left - Fire guns
Right - Fire missile.

Gameplay:

 - Avoid Asteroids, use missiles to destroy them
 - Destroy enemy spacecraft using your guns.
 - Steal cargo dropped by destroyed enemy spacecraft:
   - [S] Shields - Recharges your shields.
   - [M] Missiles - Recharges your missile launchers.
   - [H] Hull Repair - Repairs damage to your hull.
   - [B] Bomb - AVOID, this cargo is boobytrapped.

Gameplay Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GVgqcm7ygKo&feature=youtu.be

entries.title: Evil Death Robots Vs Bunnies
entries.description:
=== THOSE CUTE BUNNIES MUST DIIIIIEEEE!!!!111 ===

* Play as a hoarde of evil death robots!
* Blast any bunny that looks at you the wrong way!
* Turn based strategy, watch out for the lethal BUNNYBOT!!

----------------

- Apols in advance that there aren't in-game instructions. Basically, click nearby your unit to move and shoot. If you can't move or shoot, click "next unit". This might not always work depending on the random layout of the little houses that you can't walk on ;) Long story short - we ran out of time. Thanks for playing anyway, comments hugely appreciated

----------------

HOW TO PLAY

- Use the mouse to move then shoot with your units
- Click 'next unit' if there's nothing in range to shoot
- Terminate bunnies with extreme prejudice!

----------------

Created in 48 hours by Jim and Dave for Ludum Dare 25 "You are the Villain"

Timelapses and postmortems to follow

Thanks for playing, we truly appreciate your feedback!

www.superfluidgames.com

entries.title: Gaben
entries.description:
Make sure you have sound on!
Way too ambitious , rookie mistake.Only my second game and first LD48.
 Was supposed to be a frantic sidescroller race against time where you play Gabe Newell on a quest to stop the release of HL3 , not much of it eventuated.
There is no ending but you will probably get a laugh out of playing a "level" or 2 .
Avoid paparazzi and fanboys , they slow you.
Collecting money , eating babies , drinking StarFux coffee = good

Controls -
W , A ,S ,D space, left mouse right mouse and E(lolol)

entries.title: Goat SLAYER
entries.description:
Hello! 
Firstly just wanted to say that Ludum dare is AWESOME!

This was my first game I have EVER finished :D
I used Game maker 8.0 light version and for the song I used FL.Studio :D

Please Play my game :D

entries.title: Goatstar
entries.description:
Goatstar is a reverse bullet hell shmup, where you play the boss and face against the absolutely most terrible bullet hell players the world has known.  That is to say, the AI is kinda bad, but it makes up for it with infinite lives.  Rack up kills until you die!

Written in python with pyglet.  I was so rusty... need to code more, need time to code more.  So terrible.

Usual tools, sfxr, renoise, NI massive & damage, notepad++

It's python, so in theory it should work on any platform by running via source as long as you have pyglet installed.  I haven't tested it, sorry about that.  

http://www.pyglet.org

http://www.digitalcheeseplate.com

entries.title: Horrible Horace
entries.description:
Horrible Horace is hungry for power despite a bad hangover. Help him conquer the kingdom of Hibblesworth.

Find a sword and some treasure. Kill or Corrupt The People. Kill Everything Cute. Wait for a Hero to turn up... and defeat him. Avoid Monsters.

2D roguelike (kinda) with a ZX Speccy Aesthetic.

You can either download the platform independent Java build, or run as a Web Applet.

NOTE: When game is over (either you die or you win), it says "PRESS ENTER" but nothing will happen.  Just restart the program completely if you want to play again :-)

See the full play guide on my compo blog, or go to http://tinyurl.com/boh8wat

Enjoy!

entries.title: I Wana Be The Villain
entries.description:
I Wana Be The Villain!

This was originally going to be my entry for the main contest but I let real-life have too much time.
It's my first game using Java so I'm proud of myself despite there being a few bugs.

The game hopefully runs on all platforms, I haven't tested it on anything other than Windows.

Update:
Finished work early, did some extra work on the game.

entries.title: Ino und Rakete
entries.description: This was made in a hurry since I should have actually been working on my Master's thesis. I spent 9 hours coding this game and I needed most of the time to improve the AI of the "good" character so that the game doesn't get too easy. Unfortunately the game crashed several times, and I found out it was not my fault, but there's apparently some nasty bug in the text-output routine that is based on some code snippet from the NeHe website. So I decided to do a workaround and just output a bitmap indicating that you're in a hurry when the countdown reaches 30 seconds. Originally I planned to display number of current level, number of lives of the "good" character and clock. If anybody manages to find out what's wrong with the text-output routine, I'd be very grateful. Otherwise I'll search for another one for my future productions.

entries.title: Minion #4
entries.description:
Not bad for my first attempt and the first game I ever made with Crafty.js. I probably wasted the first 12 hours just trying to think of a theme. I also had decided to sleep and not work myself up over this so, I probably got in between 8 - 10 hours each day I was working on this. Oh, I also retaught myself how to play piano, sampled my son for monster sounds, and cursed myself for only having FLStudio and Audacity installed. They got the job done, but compared to some of the audio tools I've used in the past they are pretty terrible.

I was however pretty impressed with the Gimp and although I can't say the textures were fantastic, it held up much better than I had expected. 

I'm happy with my progress, but very disappointed that I hadn't created a level large enough to kill my i7 until I started working on level 3 and decided I should actually make it challenging. I don't think I would have been able
to diagnose what was causing issues with crafty in the time needed anyways. 

Seems like most web based engines choke when you use are large number of block assets (mine are 16x16) which is one of the reasons I had ended up steering away from Three.js. Hopefully, I can figure out what I'm doing wrong before I attempt another one of these, or otherwise I might have to switch back to Java or .Net to keep things playable.

Finally, this project has made me realize how much I miss doing this sort of work, and how good I could be at it if I got the time. I haven't done any serious recording in 6 years, nor have I done any serious image manipulation either. I just wish I knew of some better free tools as I've been out of the game so long I don't even know what is worth paying for and at $500+ for most serious packages, I can't afford to buy a second rate solution.

entries.title: RoboChicken Pooper
entries.description:
Didn't get to finish this one like I had hoped for, but learned a lot while making it! You are a pooping chicken. Get to the exit...

I used haxe to make the game. Thanks to deepnight for letting me use his library for getting my game running quickly. I'm a new haxe user, and so far, it's pretty cool! 

MOVE WITH ARROWS KEYS. POO WITH SPACE BAR.

entries.title: Sebastian
entries.description:
Sebastian 

Use the WSAD keys to control Sebastian a Hulking Rock Golem,

Kill and destroy as much as you can but beware... Heroes are 
coming...

Face the evolution of mankind and gain powerful abilities
- Press Space to stun puny humans with a shockwave;
- Press F or Mouse click to shoot fireballs
- Press E to fire a powerful Beam that decimates everything
- Press F to summon an Acid Rain that kills all humans
- Press Q to teleport yourself and destroy faster

Have some fun and hope you enjoy ;)

entries.title: Snowman's Revenge
entries.description:
Game was not finished in time, but here's how much we got done.

Coding done in Notepad++ and VS web 2010 Express.
Graphics made in paint and GIMP.

HAWK0987654321 and thegreenfish

entries.title: Space villains
entries.description:
= Description
A simple canvas based strategy game. You'll have to choose the best upgrades for your aliens to beat as many of these hero ships as you can.

= Too simple?
This game is very feature minimalistic (no menus or sounds). I was unprepared since this is my first LD.

= Problems
Anything wrong? I tested this game in the latest Chromium and Firefox versions. So if your browser can't run this game, please try one of these. But first, try reloading.

Is the screen too big for your browser window? Resize the window a few pixels should fix it.

= Future
Maybe I will implement more features and fix bugs after the voting.

entries.title: The Corrupt
entries.description: You are a corrupt entrepreneur. The mafia wants a cut on your contracts. Convince other actors so that they help you in your schemes and get as much money as you can!

entries.title: The Day Before
entries.description:
What happens before the hero saves the princess?
How does the villian always succeed? 

its time for you to be the villian and try to take the princess yourself.

Original:

Arrow Keys - Left/Right
CTRL - Shoot
Space - Jump

Alternate Controls:

Arrow Keys - Left/Right
Up Arrow- Jump
Space - Shoot


I used:

Code:AS3,FlashDevelop,Flixel.
Pixel Art:GIMP.

this is the first game i ever uploaded and also the first pixel art ive ever made.this game is not finished and i had to drop the project because of the time limit.but i think its still enjoyable.

entries.title: The Great Summoning
entries.description:
A rhythm game where you summon Satan and a few others.

Not particularly fun but give it go anyway! :P

XNA required to just run the executable.
I'll also include an installer option but I know people hate those. :)

entries.title: A Night in Arkham
entries.description:
A Night in Arkham is a text-based game where you take control of a previously unconscious guy that doesn't know anything about what's happening around.

What should you do?

I've take the +1 Goats optional theme as well.

The game takes place around 1940 and lots of hp lovecrafts references are inside too.

I hope you enjoy it. :3

entries.title: Bad Guy Boot Camp
entries.description:
Apologies if this entry is a bit gloomy. A thing happened last week that made me not-so-much want to be the villain, but in the light of all the associated rage, I decided to approach it rather from the point of understanding who the villain is. 

"This Ludum Dare entry is ham-fisted and lacks subtlety!" - Roger Ebert

entries.title: Captain Torrent
entries.description:
Meet Ulfgar Torrent - captain of real pirate ship of media age. His crimes are the most horrible crimes of a modern times - copyright violations. If you produce music, make films or create video games (yes, even for Ludum Dare) he will find you and he will take your creation off you not paying any single piastra. Beware!

Instructions:
- Shoot cannonballs with a left mouse button.
- Shoot at enemy's cannonballs to avoid the damge.

entries.title: Dig Dastardly
entries.description:
Dig a tunnel from your hideout to the bank, steal the loot and carry it back again! Head back and forth between the Bank and your hideout to gather more. 

Watch out for hidden bombs and the police invading your tunnel. Gold you collect from the bank won't be added to your score until you reach your hideout. Bombs and Ladders restock when you return home.

Team
-----
Luke Holland (@luke161) - Code
Chris Cox (@paperCaves) - Art & Music

Controls 
-------
Move - Arrow keys/WASD
Dig - Space (dig direction set with Move controls)
Plant bomb - E
Create Ladder - Q

Made as a part of the Preloaded LD48 game jam in London. Our first Ludum Dare entry and my first ever game jam. Had a great time participating, I'm sure we'll be doing more in the future! Built with Unity 3.5. Hope you enjoy :)

entries.title: Evil is Sometimes Rendered Unconscious
entries.description:
[CONTROLS]
E - Interact
Q - Close Menu
WASD - Move
Mouse Axis - Look Around

The webplayer contains lower quality graphics. Recommended old machines, but for the full experience please download. All files are zipped executables (no installer necessary).

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: Fetch Quest
entries.description:
You are the villain, and villains never win. So that's not your goal. You must build a huge investment portfolio so that by the time the hero takes you down, you will have enough to retire in style. Pillage and tax cities, and remember to make regular contributions to your 401k! All the while, the pesky hero is going to be trying to get in your way, so bury some "treasure" in the nearby mountains to waste his time. He won't know any better, but it will give you the time you need.

The controls are... MOUSE1 to select baddies, the fortress, and to issue orders.

If you are on OSX or Ubunutu, you too can play! Download the 'Love' file, and then go to https://love2d.org/ and download the appropriate binaries to run it with.

Unfortunately love-webplayer can't cope with my script, so there will be no Web version.

No sound, didn't have time, sorry. :)

entries.title: Guardian Angel Devil
entries.description:
You are an imp trying to gain more cred with the demons by finding an evil orb that will make you powerful. The only problem is that the only one who can retrieve the orb is the "Chosen One". You find him outside the dungeon and pretend to help him get the orb.

This entry uses XNA but I used JSIL to convert it to javascript. It works in firefox or chrome. IE wouldn't load it at all and safari and opera had issues. There have been reports of Firefox being choppy with particles on the screen so if in doubt, use chrome.

This is a jam entry only because I ran out of time for the compo. All code and content was made by me during the 72 jam hours.

Tips:
You will need to fight Blake at the end to take the orb from him so don't let him get too powerful.
Also keep some extra equipment cards around for new allies at the end.
You can get rid of equipment cards you don't want, (Like extra copper short swords) by giving them to Blake. He will only equip items that are better than what he has.
Conversely, if Blake has a steel shield he may have a hard time hitting anything because he won't replace it with any swords in the game (bug). So try to keep him with two swords rather than giving him any shields.
The imp can't attack but he can block so he can get in the way of any nasties trying to get at Blake.

Used:
Visual Studio - IDE
C# - code
XNA - code
JSIL - conversion to javascript
Photoshop - graphics
BFXR - sound effects
Audacity - sound effects
Autotracker - music
Tiled - tile maps

entries.title: Horizon
entries.description:
Call it divine intervention, call it a message from the gods, call it anything you want.

Call it a hunch.

Something tells you what you've been looking for is here. After all these years, you can practically taste it on your tongue.

The air is cold and bitter, the attitudes of your men moreso.

Normally marching for as long as you have been would make you want to set up camp, but not today. Your men might want to stop, but that doesn't matter. They're all too afraid of you to say anything.

The snow crunches beneath your feet.

You are close.

entries.title: Kitten Hater
entries.description:
A story about boy who hates all good things.
And primarily kittens!

Retro platformer with 4 fun levels and a bit of humor.

controls:
space, up, z - jump
x - switch world
(*cheat*) p - complete current level

entries.title: Land of the Weebums
entries.description:
Dare to terrorize innocent, bumbling weebums!

I've added a post-compo version that has some bug fixes, but it's liable to also have random weird features as I try different things.

Tools used: Blender 2.65, Unity, Photoshop, Sculptris, Meshlab, Audacity

Mirror for web player: http://nratcliff.com/l48/25/shared/vrav/ld25_4.html

entries.title: Memories From Darkness
entries.description:
In a playable state. We had too high ambition and ended up only having 1/4 of planned features. Also, those dialogue boxes were supposed to have some cut scene animations in between, but since we're running out of time, so yeah...

It's a 2D platformer game, a story about Brett who had lost his memory and met John, whom they planned to stop the evil scientist... or the other way around... Wanna know why is this story made for the theme 'You are the villain'? Keep reading the dialogues to find out...

This game is made in Game Maker 8.0 Pro and Game Maker 8.1 Lite for level designing. I used a platformer engine and dialogue box engine to speed up the process, but still couldn't achieve that with our game's high ambition... But anyway, it is still playable with a lot of missing features. We're planning to finish this game in the future for release.

P.S.: Our second Ludum Dare Jam, first time to actually finished a playable game.

entries.title: Mug for Drugs
entries.description:
Real-time Dopewars/Drugwars style game.

Controls: Arrow keys for movement. Esc to pause. Z and X to interact with NPCs*.
Objective: Pay off your loan by dealing and mugging. Avoid the police!
Tips: Helping old grannies will reduce your notoriety.

*You use Z and X to interact with the NPCs. You can't interact with them all straight away. The only thing you can do at the start is to mug one of the old ladies.

As you gain more money and resources you should be able to interact with more of the NPCs. Other "shop" items/interactions are displayed at the top-left as they become available.

The main gameplay is playing the buy/sell prices of one dealer against another to reach the loan price before the time runs out or you get killed by the police.

entries.title: Pirate Scum
entries.description:
You're the navigator in a pirate crew. Try to collect as much treasure (gold) and beat your highscore, as possible under your beloved captain's strict orders!

A and D to rotate ship, and W to move forward. You can use S to weirdly go backwards. Press Space to shoot cannonballs from the left middle of the ship. Use this to destroy the village far west in the map, or destroy Navy ships. (Note: Navy ships can't be destroyed because of a bug...)

Known bugs:
#1 - when you destroy a Navy ship, the ship won't disappear.
#2 - there are some places where you can sail on land without ruining your ship.

entries.title: REC - The game
entries.description:
The "Last Second", is a team of 3 Game Design Students from the Anhembi Morumbi University, Brazil. We love to highlight the fun in games, and this makes us more willing to create new concepts.


A "Last Second", somos um grupo de 3 estudantes de Game Design pela universidade Anhembi Morumbi, prezamos pela criacao de jogos por diversao e para desafiar a cada instante nossas habilidades criativas.

entries.title: Revenge of the Hero
entries.description: Hrm. This one didn't really turn out very well, as I didn't get to spend the time on it I would have liked. I still think the concept has potential, even if the execution is rather lacking.

entries.title: Rhythm Apocalypse
entries.description:
You are the harbinger of the rhythm apocalypse! Shoot lasers at earth in time with the music to cause it some damage, but watch out, the earth isn't defenseless!

Collaborate to destroy the earth! You can invite someone else to join you to help make sweet harmonies!


--- INSTRUCTIONS ---

Mouse to rotate around the planet, move the mouse further away from the middle to rotate faster. Use the mouse buttons or any key to hit notes!

Game not finished, see post mortem.

-- NOTES --

Hosted on nodejitsu. If something goes wrong with the game, please tell me with a comment on the post-mortem!

Runs sub-optimally in Firefox, which might mess with timings. Use Google Chrome for the best experience!

Server Software requires node.js and the module faye-websocket.

entries.title: Runner of a viod
entries.description:
There is a void runner over there.
He got tired of the bad things and he went to jump on the roofs.
Just run and try to get over 50k.

Soryy, I don't finished all things, what I actually want to do. It's my first game for LD and first game with LWJGL.

If you have some problems like:
"Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: ben : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0" 
then you must install latest JRE:
http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

entries.title: Subjugated
entries.description:
You have bee Subjugated, crammed into a pirate spaceship and now must serve your pirate overlords, hijacking cargo vessels or your oxygen supply will be severed.

Controls 
Roll Q-E
Pitch W-S
Yaw A-D
Guns LMB
Thrust RMB
Missiles SPACE

Note the yellow nebular does it look like a goat to you?

Added Flash player thanks to Unity 4 pro LD license.

Going to continue working on this but via the Kongregate version here - http://www.kongregate.com/games/Arowx/subjugated - updates coming soon!

entries.title: Susie's Xmas Hit List
entries.description:
Susie is the Villain. Susie is pissed Santa got her the wrong doll last year. So, this year she's going to take it out on Santa and his reindeer. Susie has a Snowball Bazooka, which is capability of shooting large snowballs high into the air. These are capable of breaking Santa's reindeer free from their magic (invisible) harness.  One reindeer at-a-time, Susie is going to bring Santa down.

Santa isn't going to let down all the children just for one spoiled brat. Santa is willing (for the good of all children) to sacrifice some of his presents in an attempt to stop Susie from ruining Christmas.

Reality is also working against Susie, since she can only fire a Snowball if there is enough snow at her current spot. Each snowball will use the snow at that spot, and eventually Susie will be forced to move to another position if she wants to continue shooting snowballs.

Arrow keys move Susie left/right. SPACE shoots a snowball. Avoid falling reindeer and gifts.

Sadly, there is no sound.

entries.title: The Great Train Robbery
entries.description:
Ah balls. Instead of concentrating on one thing and making it decent I did 3 things poorly.

Didn't get around to making sounds, or "gameplay".

I recommend making your own 'CHOOO CHOOO' noises throughout.

entries.title: The Greatest Relic Identify Expert
entries.description:
[INTRODUCTION]
Red dragon is strong, dangrous, evil, and always collecting treasures.
However... How do they live in peacetime?

[HOW TO PLAY]
Clik to fire a fireball.
Try to destroy all the pieces of fake treasure in the time limit.
Make COMBOs to get higher score!

entries.title: The Worse of Two Evils
entries.description:
The Worse of Two Evils lets you have a bit of a wander around in the shoes of two very 'evil' jobs; the Traffic Warden and the Telemarketer.

Of course these jobs aren't evil, but some people would like to think they are.

Very simple game, just mouse useage. Made in GameMaker Studio, with Paint for graphics and audacity for sound.

I'm aware there's a bug where the first choice is chosen without you being able to read it, unfortunately its 1am and I'm not going to fix it!


Wanted to be part of the competition, unfortunately this is the first LD in a while that isn't part of it.

entries.title: You are the boss
entries.description:
The game is simple:
You are an evil boss that kidnapped a princess and turned her into a goat,
now heroes are trying to save her,
obviously you should kill them..

You are faster and have a gun..
but they can sprint and head bang you, so you better avoid them.

The rest you can find in the game.

My personal high score - 11;

The game was written for ludum dare 25 in 48 hours.

About the source:
one of the most ugliest I ever wrote, for you eyes and brain safety you better not read it..

entries.title: 6 Sided Evil Constructions
entries.description:
Could only work on this for a single day (the Monday after the compo). So it's really basic (read, crap :p) and not nearly complete. Mostly based on The Codex of Alchemical Engineering by Zacatronic Industries but with hex grid and it *was* going to be able to produce vehicles with whatever configurations you choose to construct (in a day of coding! HA!)

Anyway, was fun for the 16 or so on-off hours I could work on it!

Also it's buggy as f--k, it's 2am atm and I don't care. Also (also) had no time for any theme integration... you are supposed to be an evil dude constructing evil machines (was going to be able to weld all the bits together and everything... but this is now for another day)

p.s: 
Progress Vid 1 (6 hours in) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xoZcZ73IJYw

progress Vid 2 (16 hours in) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QekO2jwqu4U

entries.title: A small village
entries.description:
This is my first entry ! 
Classic FPS control, space to jump, shift to run.
You play as a character who can only shoot brick, in his quest to make trouble !

All was made in 48h, with javascript, unity, flash for design, a little bit of photoshop, and some music tools !

Let me know what you liked/disliked !

Edit: sorry about the Door Keeper, i wanted him to drop a key but instead you just have to deal with a lot of his clones and try to kill the good one ! When you'll kill him, a door will open...

entries.title: Abrupt Salvation
entries.description:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

NEW WALKTHROUGH VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7irz_R2vLu0

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Princess does not deserve to live anymore. Does she?"

Have fun and don't hesitate to feedback! Thanks :)

entries.title: Bandits
entries.description: Sadly, after spending way to much time on an algorithm to make the bandits find their path somewhere (which didn't end up working), the game can not be finished. But, since we did get a decent engine working and random worlds I thought we should submit it anyway to see what you guys think...

entries.title: Cat Killing Spree
entries.description:
Not much fun, I gave up hope on the game a long time ago. I had more plans but I just don't feel like finishing it.

Drag with mouse to select allies, right click to spawn allies, 2-4 to select allies on hot bar, WASD to move screen, middle click to move allies.

Kill cats than the final boss to become a villain.

entries.title: Crime Worm
entries.description:
.. I had a nice project which fitted the theme beautifully but the time limit struck me, which resulted in this thing (this was made in an hour)

It's a pretty standard worm game where you gather points and watch out for walls and stuff and go through 5 levels. It gets pretty hard fast. It has also it's own soundtrack (be afraid).

How does this fit the theme? Well, you are a worm who... steals... money. Yeah

entries.title: DieCubesDie
entries.description: A game in which you must kill maze solving cubes.

entries.title: Driver
entries.description:
Yet another old fashioned game in C.

You are the Villain and you must escape the police. o/

I actually didn't have much time and it was my first time with ncurses library...

But I hope you'll have fun ! ;D

entries.title: Goat Murderer
entries.description:
So this is my game, you must kill goats and farmers and survive for 3 minutes.

You can stay at the base.. and win, but that is not fun.

Hope you like it.

The instructions are in the main menu.

Timelapse: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P8eeN_8e--I

EDIT: Added link to timelapse.

entries.title: Lair Defense
entries.description:
You're a wizard who wants nothing more than to be left well enough alone.  Unfortunately, the Tax Bureau has sent an army of collection agents after you.

It's up to you to fight them off!

Should be playable on any Android phone or tablet running Froyo (2.2) or later.  May crash on some devices.

Note: this app requires absolutely no special permission flags to run.  HOWEVER!  Feel free to manually send me your geographical location, contact list, browser history, and text message/call logs if you want the full "Free to Play" experience

entries.title: Life Buster
entries.description:
JAVA 6 OR HIGHER REQUIRED (for any version)

Anybody who read my posts knows I wanted to make a game about goats. Demonic goats. Well not really. But: They could dig! :D

That however, was long time ago (just some hours actually), and because I need to submit ANYTHING, take this piece of ****.

It even has sound & music! (If the sound is working for you)
You can toggle that with F5 and F6.

I won't explain anything about the game here. Start & read. Or read the comments. Or ask me (for example by commenting). ^^

Use P or pause key to... guess what.

Oh, end the game anytime with F10. It was a developer cheat, which I forgot to remove.

SUBMITTED VERY CLOSE TO DEADLINE!

entries.title: Mansion Massacre
entries.description:
SUMMARY

Over the course of two days we developed this title. It is more of an alpha, but it is quite ambitious and we had a lot of fun doing it!

DIRECTIONS:

Move: A,S,W,D
Pickup Item: Stand near and item and left-click on it
Use items: Click an item in your inventory while near a victim
Reset Game: Walk to the front door and click the Menu button

NOTES:

- The game WILL BE UPDATED, so please check back for improvements to gameplay and visuals
- If you get caught, refresh your web page. We'll be addressing that soon

TEAM

Doug Wheeler (Art) & Dave Norris (Tech)

entries.title: Pinball Bounder!
entries.description:
Help the evil bounder scare babies and torment old people, whilst avoiding the angry mob. Press space to start the game. To move, position your mouse on the screen and click and he'll move towards the mouse (and bounce off the walls).

Made with Scratch (programming); Texture Processor & Tile Studio (graphics); Caustic (audio) - I only ended up spending 8 hours on it & once again I would have liked to make it more polished, including making the graphics more interesting & create a few changing maps.

I realised there are a couple of bugs :-( , but it's still playable. Bugs include: (1) Collision detection isn't 100% accurate (2) Sometimes you can get trapped in an endless loop if you're caught by the angry mob and the game never ends.

entries.title: Reclaimed Empire
entries.description:
This game is incomplete. You can interact with Transport ships and destroy things. There is no opposition unfortunately.

In Reclaimed Empire you play as a race called the Gat'ax who abandoned their vast galactic empire for centuries. In that time other races claimed it for their own. Decimate cities by instilling fear into the population or by destroying the shield beacons and bombard it from space. Well, you can't bombard or instill fear yet but that was the plan!

You command Cortex Transport ships which store smaller fighters. Deploy your fighters and select what types of targets they should focus on.

The original concept had more types of targets to focus on including enemy fighters, factories that produce fighters, and defensive turrets. I also wanted to let the player configure their own transports with different ships. There was going to be a resource system that determined how many ships you could build that would cary over from planet to planet.

entries.title: Spawner
entries.description:
Tutorial: Get into the game screen, and then just press and hold "3" to spawn the chasers.  You will get 10 - 11 kills.

Note: Very bad feedback.  When you kill the player's ship, I restart all your minions to zero.  But I did put in the code that give your gold back to you.

entries.title: Subterranean Farm Maniac
entries.description:
Requirements
This game requires a graphics card supporting OpenGL2. It also requires Java 6 or later installed. LWJGL does not working on OS X with Java7, sorry about that.

The Cavern
The cavern is a happy place, there is food for almost everyone since the mushroom farms are abundant. There are no wars, famines, conquests or death. Well, there is death, but no tradegy, the peoples of the cavern die happy after a full life.

You are the villian
You are the villian, specifically, you are "Famine". You loath the people of the cavern. You want to make them suffer and die of starvation.

You gain points when people die of starvation, you loose points when they die happy.

Game play
When you look at a mushroom farm you can make it burn with left clicking your mouse. Which causes the village to harvest less food, which makes them starve.
When you look at the village you can send them a goat as gift by left clicking with your mouse. Which makes them have more to eat. Which makes them have children. Which makes more of them.... more that can starve.
You can fly around using 'a','s','d','w'.

Visit the project page at http://code.google.com/p/subterraneanfarmmaniac/

entries.title: SUPER KRUPA WORLD
entries.description:
*UPDATE*
HTML5 is up and running again.

*UPDATE*
I'm sorry. My server was shut down for hosting a game. Apparently that's against their ToS.
Windows only for now, but no longer an installer.

*GAME DESCRIPTION*
Control Krupa to stop the old man from getting to the axe.
There is no win condition. Score until you lose.

entries.title: The Amazing Weregoat Burglar
entries.description:
So this was my first Ludum Dare.
I worked on Game Maker, and because I am not very good in programation, there is a lot of bugs, hihi.
But I've tried to minimize them as much as I could.
I hope you will enjoy it blblb :B


Timelapse : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z35fJWe74tA&feature=youtu.be

Music Source : "A call to action", by Tigger888.
http://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/482246

entries.title: The Cards Never Lie
entries.description: The Cards Never Lie is a mystery predicated by lies and sustained by them.  Solve the crime using your fake psychic powers and some old-fashioned snooping.

entries.title: The Villain
entries.description: So this is my 72 hour game making jam... This game might not be that good and probably pretty laggy... But it is a game! I had no time to make a good menu so it looks awful... If you don't know how to look around in the menu, you press up and down arrow keys or W and S.

entries.title: This Is How It Ends
entries.description:
Solo jam entry due to extenuating social obligations. Have they no respect for the iron embrace of Ludum Dare Compo? =)

So, this is a story game. Just want to put that out there to begin with.
Also, the web version requires Unity plugin.

"This Is How It Ends" features you, the villain, standing in the ruins of a world you have just finished destroying with your seventh act of destruction. You have the chance to journey back in time through each scene, watching the scenery revert to its state before each catastrophe. Re-discover your motives to realize how destroying the world could seem like the right choice. Read letters from those affected by you, and affecting you. And piece by piece, the outrageous ending becomes the natural conclusion. But if you venture too far, you risk being consumed by the darkness which taints your life.

If you encounter any bugs, please e-mail me at [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ .

Thanks for playing!

*edit* *possible spoilers*

1. To make progress, check both computer terminals and the letters. You can then walk into the "memory" and go back in time.
2. You can decide to stay in an era by disabling the doomsday device and resisting the pull of memory. I didn't have time to give each era a proper ending in this situation, but if people ask for it, I'll do it post-compo.
3. There is a tragic ending if you go far enough. If it disturbs you, I'm sorry.
4. I added stat tracking post-compo. No other changes were made, so I used the same link. Consider this "full disclosure." =)
5. There is sound in the first stage... but apparently only if you have nice speakers. It's all bass, apparently. :{

entries.title: Unwavering Evil
entries.description:
This is a game where you must kill hordes of brave marines who are trying to save the world from your unwavering evil. Use your telekinesis, spontaneous explosions, and lighting powers to annihilate them!

Controls:
WASD - Move
Hold Space - Lightning
Left click on object and drag - telekinesis
Right click - spawn spontaneous explosion

Telekinesis and spontaneous explosions drain your mana.

entries.title: Villain on a train
entries.description:
My first ever Ludum Dare entry!

VILLAIN ON A TRAIN!

Randomised train mischief simulator.

Story:
You are a villain on a train, causing mischief! Try to decide what action will be most villainous or otherwise useful as you explore the cars. When you are done (visited all cars) you will be awarded a title depending on your performance. Good luck!

Instructions are available in game, but here there are too:

Use LEFT and RIGHT to pick a train car, then ENTER to go in and take an action. Train cars are random each game and the length of the train can vary.

Your goal is to increase your Villain Points (VP) whilst not getting busted by keeping a low profile (ALERT < 100), not dying by keep healthy (HP > 0)and maybe get rich trying (GP)! Clearing all cars will end the game and give you a rating.

Made in flash with flixel
Voiced by my wife

entries.title: Witching Game
entries.description:
A sandbox game about a homicidal witch, terrorizing a small village. You will start plagues or get burnt at the stake. You will look at an awesome scarecrow that does nothing and steal goats for the amazing magic power. 


Note: to steal a goat, cast "Steal" spell on it.

Note: to cast plague, select a person or animal as a target.


Native Windows build that doesn't require Java to be installed was added, it's a recommended version for windows users. Note that it includes some minor post-compo fixes (no new features). Native non-fixed compo version will be added shortly.

entries.title: AI Rampage
entries.description:
This is a Silverlight 5, Out-of-Browser (update: now also Windows desktop!) game in which you (as the villain) are an AI that has gone quite mad, and starts killing all the crew on the space station that it oversees.

There's a tutorial to explain the gameplay, but in quick summary - left click to select, right click to give orders, WASD to scroll. Don't get spotted murdering people or doing anything suspicious, or the crew will shut you down. In Windows, hit Esc to exit.

Enjoy!

(Please note - the path finding is a bit slow over long distances, so if you click further that 7-8 squares away, especially near the end, the game might take a minute to work out the path)

entries.title: Bret
entries.description:
Click to shoot!

---
Update: Added Win/Mac and android ports! iOS coming soon! :)

entries.title: Demon King Goes For a Ride
entries.description:
Pretty incomplete, but playable. Definitely ran out of time on this one. 

A game for LD25! Pretty incomplete.

Play here:

http://polm.github.com/ld25/game.html

The Demon King has taken his flying castle out to kill everyone! Unfortunately, the villagers have their own protectors...

Controls:

Z: Drop a bomb P: Pause

When you destroy a house in a village, the altar in the village will start glowing and the villagers will begin to summon their guardian. If the guardian appears the only way to stop it is to the destroy the altar.

To win, destroy all the houses and trees.

Stay evil! -POLM

entries.title: Dracula Super Goat Hunter
entries.description:
C and SDL + SDL_ttf.

Controls: Arrow keys to move. Jump with Z, space or uparrow. X to scare goats.

Tools used: SciTe, GIMP, gdb, SunVox and Audacity.

dungeon, and can be picked up

adventurer.

already in that room.

-Adventurers pick up gold.
-Adventurers drop gold on death.
-Adventurers get slightly stronger
if they have more gold.
-The Epic Hero is stronger than
you are.

entries.title: Earthmageddon
entries.description:
GitHub repository available at https://github.com/calzoneman/ludumdare25

The Windows release was built with a pygame2exe script from http://www.pygame.org/wiki/Pygame2exe

All other releases are Python source files.

Earthmageddon was created and tested with Python 2.7.  See
http://www.python.org for information on downloading and installing Python.
Most *nix distributions have python in their package repositories.

Earthmageddon was built with the Pygame library.  For information on
installing this library, see http://www.pygame.org/news.html

To run Earthmageddon, either run the executable ./destroy.py (assuming
/usr/bin/env python evaluates to your Python 2 executable), or run
python destroy.py.

The object of the game is to destroy the world.  Shooting at the world will
destroy chunks of it.  When all chunks are destroyed, the game is over and
you win.  Every several seconds, the world will regenerate a layer past your
deepest hit.  Enemies will spawn (red triangles) and shoot at you.  Avoid
their bullets, or else you'll lose health and die.  Colliding with an enemy
will kill the enemy and inflict 5 damage on yourself.  You have 2 lives,
each with 20 health (bullets do 1 damage each).  Enemies have 5 health.  If
you die, you will respawn after 3 seconds.

To move, use WASD.  Click the left mouse button to fire.  Click and hold
to fire repeatedly.  The direction of the emitted bullets is decided by
the position of the mouse cursor relative to your character (the UFO).

Please report bugs to [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

entries.title: Evil-01: Missile Assault Vessel
entries.description:
In Evil-01: Missile Assault Vessel you are attacking a planet to claim what remains as your own.  

On a side  note his is my first Ludum Dare and any feedback would be appreciated.

Thank you for considering playing my game.

entries.title: Evile, inc
entries.description:
A fun little bullet-hell / tower-defense game.

I guess I should add that you play the game with the mouse, clicking on buttons to spawn ships to attack the hero ship. Press SPACE to pause/unpause (although sometimes flash seems to lose focus, so if keyboard input isn't working, just click in the flash player again). Also you can use 1-5 as hotkeys to launch respective ships.

Clicking on one of your ships brings up the upgrade menu. You can spend money to increase your ships' abilities. You can also access the Customize Loadout menu before each level to customize the default loadout for each ship, so you you don't have to pause the game and add perks to each ship that you launch. Be warned that changing the default loadout of a ship makes each instance of that ship more expensive to produce!

All combat is done for you, so you can focus on resource management. I tried to add a lot of variety to the ships, upgrades, and perks to keep gameplay interesting and allow for a modicum of divergent play.

Unfortunately I didn't get to add audio, which really hurts the game's appeal. Anyways, I hope you enjoy!

entries.title: Stubbs & Staircase
entries.description:
Stubbs is a villain all the way from the soles of his shoes to the tiny bald spot on his scalp. But he was redeemed shortly before dying and God has shown mercy on him. 

With this gift he is still too stubborn to simply accept it and faces troubles that he gives himself in order to keep his gold with him in heaven. Battle off birds, bacon-wings, flying goats, and other oddities produced by the twisted desires of Stubb's soul.

Climb clouds and sling that gold like you mean it!

entries.title: Tetris God
entries.description:
Goal: 
Make the Tetris bot lose the game by carefully planning which block it will face next!

How to start the game:
Unzip, start "main.exe"

How to play: 
Mouse/Keyboard - click on the block type which is to be played next. The counter next to the block type shows the remaining number of blocks of this class.

Penalties:
When you forget to choose a block, you lose a life.
When the bot clears a line, you lose a life.
You start out with 15 lives.

entries.title: Holly Jolly Pyromaniac
entries.description:
From the makers of the 2011 smash hit, Holiday Havoc, comes another classic Christmas title boasting retro pixel art, catchy chiptune tracks, and shockingly addictive gameplay! Underground Pixel is proud to present... Holly Jolly Pyromaniac!

Some of Santa's elves are planning to revolt... and rather than have a calm and rational conversation with them about it, he'd rather play the role of a villain this year and blow their houses up with explosives! Traitorous elves live in green houses, and loyal elves live in purple ones. Don't take out your own forces! Compete with your friends on the leaderboards! Who will claim the #1 spot for themselves?

This game has it all! Panicking elves, a deranged Santa Claus, and GOATS, and this game can now be all yours for the low, low price of FREE. So play now! Now. Do it now. Are you playing yet? Why not? Stop reading this message. PLAY IT NOW!!!

entries.title: It Should be a Crime!
entries.description:
It Should be a Crime is a rhythm stealth game about queue cutting. As the villainous queue barger, you must get to the end of the queue in a very limited amount of time, whilst being careful not to overly annoy those behind you, and to not be spotted outside the line by the queue matron.

The windows .exe is not an installer. For now, Mac users are recommended the .love version. You have to install Love2D (found at love2d.org), but if you're into indie games you probably should have that installed anyway.

entries.title: Minions
entries.description: In this game, you are a villain and you must construct a missile before the super-hero gets to you. To finish the missile you need the help of your minions. As they are really lazy you need to hit them without killing them.

entries.title: Neurovirus
entries.description:
Requires python 2.6 / pygame 1.9.1 . Apparently python 3.0 does not work with pygame (at least on a Mac).  first time using pygame, so idk for sure

The game itself is sort of just a strange interactive art piece, since I ran out of time to make any actual way to win or lose.  Press TAB to change between types of virus/robot/organism thingies and click to place them on the screen.  Just place a couple and wait for about 15 minutes, and you should start seeing some strange patterns. Don't place too many because it may cause the program to crash.  Don't leave it running forever either, because eventually it will crash because there is no limit on how many creatures can be created.  Spits out a little debugging info to the console.  Music was made in SunVox, sprites made in SpriteSomething for ipad, program coded in MacVim. 


Edit: Added some additional screenshots, but I can't upload them for some reason, so they are here:
http://www.markadkinshastings.com/?p=44

entries.title: Nosferatu

Retro game (ZX Spectrum feeling).
You are the Count Orlok a.k.a Nosferatu; you can change your appearance, your size and your speed if you walk on the little red skulls.

Arrow keys to move
X to start/skip the texts.

entries.title: Overlord
entries.description:
A small real-time strategy written with HTML5, Javascript, and Playcraft.js framework.

Plot:

You're the evil Overlord, and you should expand your possessions. You can build new estates, but you have to keep your level eye on your buildings and units to make them work.

How to play:

1) Build mines to get gold, wells to get mana
2) Build graveyards and mud to train skeletons and mutants
3) Hover your mouse over the graveyards and mud to start training soldiers
4) Hover your mouse over the skeletons and mutants to embolden them
5) Build enough units to destroy enemy castle

Have fun :)

entries.title: Princess Keeper
entries.description:
Rise towers, imprison princesses, watch knights trying to destabilize your protective custody. Be a REAL VILLAIN, don't let them succeed!

Ah, yes, some of those knights try to disguise themselves. Don't let them fool you. Maybe they're real goats, who knows. Anyways, keep your focus and your prisoner.

EDIT: The game takes a while to load, please be patient. You might have to refresh for it to start. Also IE doesn't want to play my lovely tunes so that's it: no sound for you, IE!.

entries.title: Pirate Guy
entries.description: Pirate Guy is a game where you shoot friendly airships for points! Even though you may get points, it gets harder as you go.

entries.title: Revenge Bear
entries.description:
REVENGE BEAR has had enough. Men with beards have been trying to prove their masculinity by attacking him with their fists for the longest time. Show them who is the boss by taking over their camp.

I made this game because I feel that bears take a lot of beatings in indie-gaming, so I decided to unleash the feral madness. 

Controls:

< >    -  Move                                                 
Space -  Attack
Ctrl    -  Unleash the special feral AOE attack

Edit: Thanks to @zenmumbler who was faster at porting the game to MacOs than myself! Amazing!

@dekdev (Twitter)
pathtothesky.com

entries.title: SIRTET
entries.description:
Long story short: please rate after watching the gameplay video!

SIRTET is a derivative of tetris where you are the villain.
Instead of trying to stack pieces neatly in order to clear lines you must try and give the AI the worst piece possible to make it fill the board and "lose the game".

The biggest twist is that SIRTET isn't played on a PC - it runs on a DIY console made of an Arduino Mega 2560, a button, a piezo speaker and a NOKIA 5110 LCD screen. Feels just like the handheld consoles of the 90's. The poor thing only has 256KB of storage, 8KB of RAM and a 16MHz processor.

One of the reasons I have submitted to the jam is that (almost)no one will be able to play this because of the hardware required. For that reason I humbly ask you to rate this game based on the gameplay video. Please forgive the shaky camera and glitchy screen. The glitches are due to a low quality rubber contact between LCD and PCB, it's not my code's fault. And yeah, I suck at this game XD

Instructions to assemble the hardware are included with the source, along with all Arduino libraries needed. If you do play it I'd love to have some feedback :)

The controls are simple: press the button to cycle through the pieces.

BTW I did finish in 48h - I even show my clock on the video for the sake of honor.

entries.title: Tourist Trap
entries.description:
Requires Java for the download or the browser version.  As always, downloading the jar seems to be a better experience than running the applet.  The window can be resized but I'd recommend playing with the default size.

Look out for signs, they will guide you.  You needn't read the following instructions (unless you get stuck):

Move         : Left/Right
Hide         : Z
Jump         : Space
Toggle Music : M
Next Level   : Enter

You can hide from the tourists by pressing 'Z'.  Whilst you're hiding you can't move.  If a tourist catches you in his view while you're not hiding you will have to start the level over.

entries.title: Tripe Traps
entries.description:
Hi everybody !

It's my first time to participate at Ludume Dare (And sorry for my english).

I present you "Tripe Traps". It's a very simple game whose aim is to crush with traps the little white hero who moves from left to right. Use 1, 2 and 3 buttons to use them and press S button to play/replay the game.

That's all ! You have 3 hearts and you lose one if the hero manages to go to the right of the screen. Even if you crush him, like all heroes of video games worldwide, he respawn on the left screen (with his vicious 1UP).

Last think, be a good villain, make the best score and enjoy :)

entries.title: Wandering ViIllain
entries.description:
Wander the procedurally generated countryside killing cylinders and burning trees.

To run:
Download, extract, and open the WanderingVillain file

If you have performance issues run it in the smallest window size or disable outlines.

If you have a Mac or a Linux machine and are able to compile a love game for it, I would appreciate the help.

entries.title: Weapons of Mass Construction
entries.description:
**MADE A FEW QUICK CHANGES TO LEVELS FOR LESS OP AND MORE MINDBOGGLING STUFF, PLAY "FIXED" VERSION FOR THESE CHANGES***

Also, make sure to read the post-mortem! http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/19/weapons-of-mass-construction-a-post-mortem/

You are a malevolent god who wants to stop all good guys in the world.

The good guys have gotten lazy and have created a robot to do the work for them: the Heroic Emulated Redeemer Object (or H.E.R.O. for short.) They have mass-produced them and sent them out through teleporters to save Princess Goat. Your goal is to STOP THE ROBOTS FROM SAVING THE DAY!

(Btw, the problem I needed to fix is that I gave myself 999 of each item for testing purposes and forgot to change it back on one of the levels, so it goes)

Tools used:
GameMaker
SFXR
GraphicsGale Free
Paint.NET
LabChirp

PROTIP: Make sure and let H.E.R.O. run through the level without obstructions before you try and solve so you know what path he'll take!

This is also the first game I've ever completed so yay.
