entries.title: You Villain
entries.description:
It's a text adventure story. I'm making it in Twine. You're a villain in a fairyland world. Make a difference in that world by being terrible.

Warning: This is pretty much not for kids at all. I hold no responsibly to how you feel after playing this Twine game. Seriously.

EDIT/UPDATE: I am currently working on a longer, more detailed, and hopefully better version of "You Villain."  Stay tune if you wanna feel like a villain ;)

entries.title: Agents
entries.description:
---------------------------------------
--  Bug fixes  ---------------------
---------------------------------------

I investigated the "crash on load" bugs reported, and have posted what I hope is a fix for at least some devices.  

There is also a fix for Jellybean devices, which had faulty voice recognition (it would just die out). 

---------------------------------------
-- DEVICES THAT I HAVE SEEN FUNCTION --
---------------------------------------

Droid 3 (The phone in the video, and my primary test device)
Transformer TF101 (The original Transformer)
Samsung Galaxy SIII (I think that was the model)
Transformer TF101
Transformer Prime TF201
Nexus 7


Some older devices with particularly limited resources will have problems with playing multiple audio streams simultaneously.



------------------------
Just to get you started

"Move to", "Head to", or "Go to" all move agents around.  So for example, tell Agent 1 to "Go to the Sewer" to get started.  Similarly, Agent 2 can "Go to the main hall."

Other phrases such as "What do you have," "What do you see" and "Where are you" will yield answers.

If an agent has an item, they can "Use" it (such as "Use the Noise Maker")

------------------------

You are the commander for two field agents, tasked with espoinage and sabotage of a weapons facility.  Call your agents, listen to them describe their surroundings, then speak into your phone to tell them what to do.  You can tell them to move to a location, ask them what they have, tell them to use an item, and tell them to search the area.  I have uploaded a gameplay video.  Will host on google play shortly.


* This was built and tested on a DROID 3.  

* I have seen it in action on a Samsung Galaxy S III and it worked, though the recognition was a bit rougher than on the Droid 3


----- Environmental Consideration ------

Some things that I think interfere with the voice recognition:

 * If you are in a room with music that has lyrics, those lyrics will screw up your commands to the agents
 
 * If you speak English with a heavy accent, my code might not understand what the device sends along to it

------------------------------------

entries.title: Battleship Texas
entries.description:
Yeah I didn't have a lot of good gameplay ideas for this theme so I just kinda went nuts with it. The game is really short, and entirely controlled with the mouse.

All characters appearing in this work are fictitious. Any resemblance to real persons, living or dead, is purely coincidental.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texas_Secession_Movement
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rick_Perry
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Big_Tex

entries.title: Boxy Computer Virus
entries.description:
You are a Computer Virus in a Tron-like world, survive against all the Anti-Virus programs and collect their Data to develop or repair yourself.
Esc, P, M or Pause to open Menu.

Features:
 - Boxes (you and enemies)
 - Spheres (bullets and "data"(loot))
 - skill tree
 - changing wireframe terrain
 - All HTML + Javascript (using WebGL)
 - Shittiest and shortest background music loop ever XD

Have fun and leave a comment

Browser-Support:

 - Best in Google Chrome
 - loosely tested in Firefox(a little bit laggy)
 - no idea of Safari, it is not available for windows in current version
 - not hippster enough for Opera
 - IE does not support WebGL

"Source - xhtml" links to the game without a website around it, so do not be alarmed, it will run, too.

Did a little performance improvement for FF on Wednesday, because this is somehow cross-plattform to me.

entries.title: Genghis
entries.description:
This is not a finished game. But I'm uploading it for many reasons.

1. It's nearly finished. I just drew a blank when it came to making the AI, while I've done it before. I've never done it for an RTS.

2. There's some wonderfully interesting code in there.

3. I want to have entered every LD I can.

I'm not happy with myself, though. I really wanted to have a more playable game, but hopefully I'll learn to work on gameplay *before* prettiness.

Instructions:

Well the end goal isn't programmed, but you have to kill all the Green dudes (and the white dudes).

You can place Red dudes by selecting them on the screen, and clicking/tapping. There are different kinds of red dudes, but they all look the same, because I suck at art.

There's an Android version too. I'm only uploading the .apk, because I'm too embarressed to submit to the market.

I'll be working on this maybe as a jam game too, and possibly as a small project on the side.

This will not run on lower end android devices, but you're welcome to try!

entries.title: GLORPLAX III
entries.description:
DESCRIPTION:
GLORPLAX III is a destructor, a professional destroyer of worlds.  Help him guide his Doomsday Drone deep enough into the planet's crust, so he can explode it and cause massive damage.

Unfortunately for GLORPLAX, there's a 1 second delay between when he presses a button, and when his drone reacts...  Will you be able to help him reach his goal?

CONTROLS:
Space = Jump
Left Arrow Key = Go Left
Right Arrow Key = Go Right
Esc = Quit
F4 = Toggle Fullscreen
F9 = Take Screenshot

DESIGNER'S NOTE:
I would love to know how far you get!
There's a really nice ending scene for those who make it!
Please leave a comment if you've played/rated.
I'll try to play the games of everyone who comments.

entries.title: Golden Goat
entries.description:
Golden Goat

My final version of the Game. A lot of learning and nearly dropping from the compo. Would have loved to add some more features like security-cameras and laser-sensors.
Includes a basic level. Instrunctions for creating own levels will follow in a later blogpost.
		
Break into the National Museum and take the Holy "Golden Goat".
But watch out and dont get catched by the guard. 
		
-- Instructions--
Aim with mouse and leftklick of hit space to give move command.
Yout can move the camera around by using WASD.
When close to the tressure you can pick it up.
You then have to go to the green exit marker.
Beware, game will close when reaching exit.
        	

Requires at least Java5. Unzip and start with Golden_Goat.jar.
If your are not able to run Executable Jars you can start by using followin comand in Shell:

	java -jar Golden_Goat.jar

Will try to put a Webversion online soon.

entries.title: Grave Robin
entries.description: You run around trying to dig up graves in hopes to put your old...dead pal Bonehead back together!

entries.title: Hero Must Die
entries.description:
Stop the side-scroller hero from rescuing the princess!
The "player" is an AI that uses neural networks trained with the Neuro-Evolution of Augmenting Toplogies (NEAT) algorithm: http://en.sfml-dev.org/forums/index.php?topic=9897.0

You need to have the VS2010 redistributable package installed to run the game.

Select the items you want to use to prevent the player from making it to the princess, place them appropriately, and then hit "play" so that the AI can try to beat the level. If it finds a solution before it reaches 100%, you lose! 

EDIT: I had to perform a post-compo bug fix, since the screen just turned black for some people, making it unplayable. It should work now.

links.label: Post Compo (4 new items, 7 more challenging levels!)

entries.title: KillTheHomelesses
entries.description:
You are a villain without feelings who kills homelesses.
But beware of the rats they can kill you.

You move with the arrows.
You hit with the sword using the (A) key.

All music ,sprites and code were done by me.

This game was made using Game Maker 7.0 Pro.
The sound effects were made using bfxr.
And the music using Fruity Loops 10.

entries.title: Knight Wrecker
entries.description:
!!!IMPORTANT!!!
If you start the game, and you found yourself dropping thru the floor, just reload the game.
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Watch out for tomorrow's portmortem!

This was my first LD, and I really enjoyed it. I hope you like my game, as this is my first completed game. The feeling when you are playing with your complete game is invalueable. Looking forward to the next Ludum Dare!

entries.title: Legacy Of Llama
entries.description:
You are a spacevillain... uhm.. of the long lost Llama tribe. The evil horde of Cubes/Cones/Odd shaped rocks/Torusrings have eaten your kin. Take revenge with the invisible laser of DOOOOM.

Anyhoo, compiled with minimum API 11 (Android 3.0 if I remember correctly).

entries.title: Let them live
entries.description: The goal of the game is to let its characters live. Can you manage to do it?

entries.title: Mad Professor
entries.description:
You play as a Mad Professor. After he made the discovery of his life, he turned into pure evil (because of paranoia) and stole all the materials. Help him to get rid of annoying scientists, who yearn to get the formula.

Run up to the barrels to fill the bottle with poison (top left icon). Use it to destroy your enemies.

Controls:
Arrow keys
Z - shoot downwards
X - shoot forward
Key 0 - mute

Headphones recommended.

Tools:
Graphics & Animation: Inkscape, GIMP, Anime Studio Pro 9
Sounds & Music: Guitar Pro, sfxr, Garage Band for iPad, Audacity
Language: Monkey
Framework: Flixel for Monkey  http://devolonter.github.com/flixel-monkey/  

Art & animation - @AhNinniah 
Code & music - @devolonter

entries.title: Master Abductor
entries.description:
You play as the most evil abductor who take princesses wherever you can find'em, and keep them for yourself. Watch out for the watchmen for they are forever on duty and their blinding search-light burns like the very fire from hell itself.

Move left(A) and right(D) and jump on (SPACE). If you wish to hang in a ceiling lamp you hold down (W) while intersecting with it.
Try and finish the two levels and have some fun :)

Note: the background image is not painted by me, so I have to thank sambees @ deviantart. (http://sambees.deviantart.com/art/Starry-Sky-Stock-102324102)

entries.title: Planet Xulub
entries.description: This is my first Ludum Dare, and I'm vary happy that it exists. I have learned so much from the project, and had fun too. I only wish I could have been better prepared that I could have gone even further. And thanks for checking me out here. Take care!

entries.title: Prophecy of the Villain
entries.description:
This is a top-down RPG-style pixelated game. I can't say much more here without giving away the story, but that's all you need to know before you play it, really. Help is included in-game.
I didn't finish the game in time, so it's incomplete, but all that's missing is a couple of chunks of the storyline, so it's completely playable, but very, very small. I might upload a complete version later.

And, oh, yes, it does have a goat in it. :)

entries.title: Reverse_Shmup
entries.description:
You have the hero cornered, with just 3 lives left! Place fighters and battleships to finish him!

Note: I had a game breaking bug in the last minute, so the .exe is an older working version of the source code (the version of the source code that matches that .exe is gone).

entries.title: Shadow Of The Bosses
entries.description:
Create and program bosses, then fight endless waves of what other people create as the hero. 

In editor mode, place a core first, then place things attached to the core. Click the gear to add actions, click components to change their action timelines. Once you've named and branded your robot, it will start showing up in other peoples games.

entries.title: Spare Pieces
entries.description:
Credits: 
- Programming: Erik Jansson (@CaffeineViking)
- Art: Sara Mena (@sara_coisa)

Intro: 
You are an alien, and like all aliens your goal is to take over the small planet called Earth. Unfortunately, your ship had a few loose pieces (lol). 

Leaving you, defenseless and unable to accomplish your evil task. You must find these pieces, gather matter from shops/banks/goats and then make Earth yours!

Controls: 
- Move: up, down, left and right arrow keys
- Disguise: Z key
- Menu: up, down to navigate and Z to select

F.A.Q: 
# What do I do?: reach the alien space ship piece at the end of every level. It's the blueish metal thingie
# How does the disguise work?: when you press the Z key it will activate (unless it's in cool down) a short disguise that lasts only a fraction of a second. It only works on the green enemies
# Green cop: walks randomly, will ignore you if you are disguised
# Sniper: does not move, changes his aim once in a while. Disguise doesn't work on him
# Arrowman: jumps over any obstacle, will always follow you. Disguise also doesn't work on him
# Where are the goats?: everywhere

entries.title: Super Goatling Poacher 2013
entries.description:
I'm not unhappy with what I made, but I'm afraid I ran out of time and it's just the one level :(

I will add more post-compo!

entries.title: Sword Beats Vampire
entries.description:
A Survival Game about a vampire who is thirsty for blood. Suck as much blood as you can from the villagers  before the sun comes up but watch out for the guards. Use stealth to avoid them and see how much points you can get!
JAM Entry

UP/DOWN/SPACE - NAVIGATE MENU

entries.title: Trolls: Where the Sun Don't Shine
entries.description:
NOTE: There is no-preloader for the game. The game will be a blank white box until it loads. Just bear with it, it doesn't take too long :)

You are a troll. This particular troll will turn to stone in sunlight. The sun is powered by flowers and the damn things just keep on growing! 

Stomp those plants and stop the sun from waking up!

Use the arrow keys to move and jump.
P is Pause.
M is Mute.

Tip: If you get rid of all the currently blooming flowers the sun's power will decrease.

Time lapse on the way!

Created in ActionScript3 with FlashPunk.
Sounds from Sfxr, danosongs.com and freesound.org

entries.title: Unhappy Holidays!
entries.description:
Run to the right, kill zombies, get to the next level (3 in total). The theme makes sense if you finish and get to the end screen.

Christmas is in danger! Santa's Elves have been turned into Zombies and they must be defeated or there will be no Christmas this year!

Zombie Elves drop magic presents that give good boys and girls what they want and Santa wants ammo!

CONTROLS:

<- ->: Move
C: Weapon
X: Fire

entries.title: You ARE The Villain
entries.description:
Thank you for playing my game!

Arrow keys or numbers to select answers
Space or enter inputs them.

This was modified to port to Windows after the deadline, but no source was changed. The original Windows link is now included in Source. The only change is a bugfix related to porting.

entries.title: 3radicat3
entries.description:
Sentient life has been detected on the planet Sol III. In accordance with the Eternal Doctrine, this sentient life must be entirely eradicated to prevent possible future threat to our race, purely an act of pre-emptive defense.

I only had a few hours to work on this, but at least I finished something! Hopefully I didn't just predict the events of next Friday, but you never know.

Instructions:
1, 2, 3 : fire missiles from launchers 1, 2, or 3
Mouse pointer : aim missiles
Left click on one of your missiles : cause it to split into two missiles. Both missiles will turn dark and will not be able to be split again.

entries.title: Almighty Pillage
entries.description:
"the so-called Troll Hunter is, in fact, a troll himself. A cannibal troll, to be precise."

Incomplete but:

You are the "Original Poster", defend your post and contain the Trolls! 

Contain the trolls by encircling them with your Yellow brick road of Rebuttals using your mouse! 

Move your post with WASD keys

entries.title: Asterion's House
entries.description:
Play Asterion (The MINAUTOR)
You found yourself chilling out in the core of your unhomely big house.
Until some people try to take you down, try to Escape!

instructions : take the knights from behind, 
follow their Ariadne's thread to escape, 
use arrow keys to move.

This is really a sandBox version, no sound, and actually submitted 1 min before the count down!
This is the first game i made, and i ran into countless problems, tilemap errors but the experience was great!

Thanks for playing it!



Made with flixel. Use arrow keys to move.

entries.title: Black Knight Blockade
entries.description:
You are the feared Black Knight. You are in charge of a small passage in the
dark wood and you decide who's allowed to pass: no one!

Unfortunately there are quite a few pesky peasants out trying to cross the
bridge to do some of their daily bidding, something you shall not endorse.

Keep the peasants from crossing, but watch your rage, as you might get angry
enough causing your head to explode in anger. You don't want your head explode,
do you?

Every killed peasant will lower your anger, while every escaped peasant will
raise your rage. If your rage exceeds your rage meter, you're going to explode
and the game is lost. Use your attack key to restart the game.

Keyboard Controls:

Walk left: Cursor left, A
Walk right: Cursor right, D
Walk up: Cursor up, W
Walk down: Cursor down, S
Sword thrust: Space, Return

entries.title: Break In
entries.description:
In this game you play someone with a nasty penchant for building an army of goats with lasers. However the plans for the goat laser experiment are stolen and taken to the "Top Secret HQ". You must break in and steal the plans back. Be careful though as someone may have enacted the plans and there may be some goat guards waiting for you. 

Game is written in HTML5 and Javascript exclusively. Should be able to run straight from the desktop. Unfortunately you will need to have an internet connection at launch because it relies on JQuery from the Google reps. 

Please enjoy the game and let me know what you think. It's not finished but it should be both playable and winnable too :) filtoid

Source Code with Revision History (SVN repo) is available from: https://subversion.assembla.com/svn/filtdoid-ludum-dare-25/

If you have any problems getting hold of this then please let me know.

------------------------------------------------------------
UPDATE 10:58 18/12/12 - I've uploaded a version with a couple of bug fixes ->
player.js - ln 276 - Added a fix for the bug where if you die the picks don't respawn - it was because the player never dropped them
StartRoomTriggers.js - ln 12 & 24 - When opening the lift door it was possible that one would open on top of the player and the player would then become stuck
------------------------------------------------------------
From reading the rules on the front page these bug fixes are allowed - if not then let me know and I will revert.

entries.title: Carnage
entries.description:
Play as a demon and bring death and destruction to a small village. Cause as much carnage as you can before the timer runs out.

Kill the king for a large point bonus, and destroy buildings to recover your health.

I haven't tested the OS/X or Linux builds, so I can't promise they will work.

entries.title: Christmas Clicker 2
entries.description:
Broken as hell. Made as a semi joke to the horrible original I made before I knew how to program. This one is almost as bad.

Will fix bugs if people want me too. Doubt there will be many requests for that however.

Sorry for not finishing it.

entries.title: Devon
entries.description:
The assets don't look very good and there are only two levels.

You can tell it's unfinished, but I had fun making it :D

Story (Didn't have time to add a screen with this):
You're a teenager called Devon who dislikes beautiful and cute things, so you went in a quest to kill all the cute slimes, infect the earth and get some gold in the process.

NOTE: I've created the game in windows, but since it's java I suppose it can run on other operating systems (didn't use any libraries) therefore the Windows build should run on Linux and OS/X

TIME-LAPSE: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bObm9GRUA6A

entries.title: Evil Chopper
entries.description:
A 3D shoot'em up made with Three.js, webgl, html5, javascript, Tiled, jQuery, bfxr and soundmanager 2 (uses flash when no html audio is available).

Steer with arrows or ASDW
Shoot with Z, C, B
Drop bombs with X, V, N

Should also work on touch devices nowadays. The screen controls have three buttons: shoot+bomb, shoot, bomb

The post-jam version supports multiplayer and gamepads (Chrome only) :)
The best way to play the game is with a gamepad :)

Don't forget to pick up the powerups :). All objects emit powerups when they die, like in the real world.

The music was constructed with my music generator (soon available for everyone :) )

All those realistic helicopters and other objects were made in code.

Works best in Chrome and Firefox with webgl.
Tested in other browsers as well (mobile also) but without webgl. Looks crappy but "works".

If you get performance problems, you can try this:
* Make sure that webGL is enabled or use a browser that supports it without special options
* Make the browser window smaller
* "Zoom in" with the browser (I mean for example Ctrl and +)

entries.title: Evil Robot of Doom Crushes Innocent Town due to Parliamentary Disagreement
entries.description:
EVIL ROBOT OF DOOM CRUSHES INNOCENT TOWN DUE TO PARLIAMENTARY DISAGREEMENT

Control the robot of the mad local member of parliament hellbent on destroying his neighbouring town after they sent him an insulting letter regarding his parliamentary decisions.

Comes with GameJolt highscores! Create an account on http://gamejolt.com to submit yours now! DO IT

Created with Game Maker 8.1 in approximately 20 hours.
All content was created by myself.

entries.title: fibre rayon
entries.description:
i made a game in twine about a thief who wants an idol.
please refrain using the back button, because that's not in the GRIM SPIRIT of the game!

entries.title: Lands of Taerrael
entries.description:
Html5 Multiplayer RPG.

Tested in Chrome and Firefox.

Features:
- Multiplayer
- Chat
- 5 types of enemies
- Signs
- Map editor for moderators (please ask if you want the password).
- Unlock areas by gaining experience level

I'm looking for an artist to create games with. My email: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

entries.title: Minions
entries.description:
Try to take over the world by conquering three castles. Get zombies, giants, dragons, and even goats to join your army of destruction.

To Play:
Click on an adjacent node to try and move there.  Empty nodes are random encounters. You can visit them as many times as you want.

Note:
The Ok button on the Win/Lose screen does nothing. You just have to close the program.

entries.title: One Armed Invader
entries.description:
[The entire game is played with the space bar and the mouse]
[If your screen is too small, scroll down, the top of the screen is just some fancy graphics]

You are the mighty (and feared) commander of an alien ship who stumble upon earth.

You need to assign your crew members to different work teams, and try to match the symbols to get what you want.

Multiple things can happen; depending on which symbols you matched.



-----------
Tools Used
-----------
FlashDevelop - flixel
Inkscape - gimp
bfxr - audacity

"24" seasons 1 & 2
And not a single drop of coffee :)

-----------
Misc
-----------
For every LD I participated , I tried to focus on a very specific aspect of my game. This time, I focused on the graphics, which I have absolutly NO experience with. So if you like the look of my game, you can thank that guy >> http://2dgameartforprogrammers.blogspot.fr/

I might change the swf after the deadline if I find some typos or grammaticals errors, but I apart from that, I consider that game complete, polished, and pretty much balanced.

I hope you enjoy the ride as an alien commander!

entries.title: Red Roses
entries.description:
This is Jam Entry, since it is using elements from an older unfinished LD entry. 

You get most of the story from the game itself. It's really up to interpretation what the game is saying, but I took the theme of being "the villain" and used it in an ironic way. 

The controls are simple and straight forward. You move with the arrows and stomp with the space bar.

I really want to know what you think of this little experiment. 

It's Windows EXE only, so sorry for everyone else. The java version just won't work properly. I'll still try and work on it for the future.

entries.title: STOP Hero Quest
entries.description: An RTS like game where you play the villain who tries to stop the hero (who is playing an RPG) from getting loot and destroying your base.

entries.title: The Dragon's Treasure
entries.description: Kill the heroes that come to get the trasure from you!!

entries.title: The Kidnapper
entries.description: The source is found at https://bitbucket.org/ZwodahS/ld25

entries.title: The Path of Evil
entries.description:
Concept
GTA-like game with enphasis on building a gang with minions, and crazy gadget to increase you charisma

Story
Your mother wanted you to be an engineer, but your only desire is to be evil, unspeakably evil.
So you begin your career as a villain: you know that you have to be sophisticated, elegant, cultured. And also you need an evil plan to destroy the entire city.
But first of all, you need money to buy things.

Features:

procedural generated city
rob banks and kill citizens
buy ridiculous clothes to increase charisma
increase charisma to get more minions
cute pixel-art graphic

Notes:
unfortunately we were not able to fix all the bugs in time, and the game is pretty buggy, please be patient, we will work to a post-compo bugs free version.

entries.title: The Professionals
entries.description:
Well this one was a bit too much to handle. I wanted to recreate the bank scene from the movie Heat, but I ran out of time to make a proper game. I did, however, learn some valuable lessons.

So there isn't much to do, except perhaps get the feel of where I was going with it. Better luck next time I guess =)

I'm attaching the mockup I made in beginning among the screenshots if anyone is interested.

entries.title: The Tim Thomery Extravaganza!!!
entries.description:
Play as the villain Tom Thomery. Try to kidnap the Damsel and get her to the train tracks, just in time for the train!

As the villain you start off going right to left, and changes once you kidnap the Damsel. 

I used Unity, and Photoshop for everything. 
Controls are space to jump and wasd or arrows to move.
I didn't have enough time to make any music, but decided that a silent move worked in with the theme.
Although a Saloon piano would be nice. 

This is my first entry into Ludum Dare, I hope you all enjoy my game!!!

entries.title: Treasure Defender
entries.description:
Treasure Defender is a tower-defense-based puzzle game, where precise and strategic placement of towers means the difference between success and failure. Features:

-8 Levels!

-An entire song!

-SFXR sounds!

-Custom level support (notepad)!

If you're brave enough to try and make your own levels, feel free to share them in the comments below!

NEW! Solutions to every level are available here: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/37624951/LD25/solutions.html

entries.title: Villain's base management
entries.description:
The game have lot of button, square stuff with a text or icon inside clickable with the mouse/trackball/touchpad (tons of compatibility). No need to use your keyboard.
Put your volume on, there is some soundFX to make ambiant.

The game is about a villain (you) planning to rules the world. You start with a base of 5 rooms : barrack to recruit, science to receive science notification sometimes, bossroom to check your progression, workshop to build stuff, and com-sat to select mission and send your minions on it.

because of LD48, the game is not perfect. But i'm in time and that's good :)

Thanks all for playing pleaaaaaase (i made a broadcast, but only one guy was coming :'( )

entries.title: Virus
entries.description:
First Ludum Dare for me, and it was very hard..uff.
Ok here is Virus, a game without goal, without end, and I...I really don't know what is Virus, maybe a virus simulator, but is sure that it is really messed up. You are a virus(really uh?), and your goal is to survive, infecting humans (turning them into zombies) and avoiding spray antibiotics. Spread yourself!

Arrow Keys : move

Enjoy!!

entries.title: Bandits
entries.description:
Description:
A group of people is wondering around in the forrest. Your task is to trick the innocent people into traps by rotating the road signs. If you kill everyone you win. If someone escapes the forrest, you lose.

Controles:
- Rotate signs by clicking on them.
- Restart the level by restarting the game.

Credits:
Kalle Kvarnfors - Programmer
Hampus Aberg - Artist
Erik 	Orjehag - Programmer

entries.title: Beach, Please!
entries.description:
Beach, Please! - Extreme Tourist Management Simulation

A jam entry made with CraftStudio by 10 people for Ludum Dare #25.

Windows: You'll need the XNA Framework Redistributable (link is up there)
Mac: You'll need the Mono runtime (link is up there)

Our awesome and handsome team members: rosalie, Canardu57, Xael, pixelboy, bilou84, Mattht, Kettch, elisee, DarkBren, Lion, Toinane and Ether. (And thanks to all our supporters / spectators! :))

You can get CraftStudio, the cooperative game-making platform at http://craftstud.io/

We spent the first 24h working on another game which we gave up on and then started this one. Hope you like it and thanks for playing/rating!

Oh and you can find me on Twitter at @craftstudiodev

Video playthrough: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FDBNsYddt-A

entries.title: Bugler
entries.description: A short and really bad game made in the last hour of the jam.

entries.title: Champion of Corruption
entries.description:
This game is supposed to be a simple casual strategy game not unlike minesweeper and desktop dungeons. Simply place monster cards to lure/trap the hero and corrupt lands to weaken the hero and gain access to more powerful monsters.
Due to time constraints the game has been made much simpler (and less user friendly) than it was originally going to be, plus it has a bunch of errors, but it is still somewhat entertaining to play a couple times.

entries.title: devil guy
entries.description: This is a small prototype-ish thing I made within the first 12 hours. I quit working on it because I couldn't settle on a way to expand upon what I had so far. I'm submitting it for the Jam because the deadline for the Compo slipped my mind yesterday. It's nowhere near finished, but I made it for Ludum Dare, so I figured I may as well submit it. Thanks for playing.

entries.title: Gardener Showdown
entries.description:
READ THIS TO GET THIS GAME WORKING!!!:
To play this game you need to press play and then reload the browser. Then the game will work as it should. (I have a weird bug where the first time the game state loads the buttons width and height properties are set to 0 meaning that they are only clickable on their upper-leftmost pixel.)

That time has come again. Every year the town has a competition to see who can grow the largest carrot. 
Your neighbor always wins somehow but this time will be different, this time you will win by any means neccisary.
There are two gardens growing carrots next to eachother. Your carrots will grow at a much slower rate than your 
neightbors, so you must sabatoge your neighbors feild by putting rabbits in it, spraying them with chemicals, 
and transplanting weeds.

weeds slow the rate of growth a little
chemicals slow the rate of growth a lot
the rabbit eats a whole carrot

get coins by promptly taking care of your plants

Click the icons to your right that correspond to what the carrots need and then click the correct carrot to accelerate it's growth and earn money. Buy sabotages and put them in your neighbors garden to slow his plants growth. weeds cost 10, chemicals cost 20, and the rabbit costs 30.

entries.title: Liar's Lair
entries.description:
I had a lot on this weekend, so I could only put together the rules for a card-game. Core to the game play are partial-information and outright deceit, as far as I know it's a unique game.

There's no computer-based implementation of this, but you can play it with your (human) friends and a (human) referee if you want to.  The "Rules and Printable Assets" link will point you to the repository for the rules document and the images. You should be able to download them all as a zip file from there (look for the button entitled "ZIP").

If you do play it, let me know how well it works for you and if you have any refinements or suggestions, or if anything in the rules is unclear. Over Christmas I'm going to try to put together a browser version and a node.js server (hopefully also hosted in the browser), so any feedback on the rules/balance will be very much appreciated.

entries.title: Lord Evil's Daring Escape
entries.description:
This game is an epic story about an evil lord trying to escape the forces of justice. Unfortunately, all his mechanized death traps are standing between him and the rocketship to freedom.

This was originally intended for the 48 hour compo, but slipped as it turned out to be a bit more work than anticipated. If people like it, it might become a "real" game in the future. :-)

While there are no actual goats in the game, there might be some in the main character's lineage.

Controls:
 * Arrows: Menu navigation and movement
 * Z: Action/jump

How to play:
 * Install Love2D from here: https://love2d.org/
 * Double click .love file
 * Have fun :D

Tools used:
 * Love2D as game engine
 * Emacs for making love
 * Base code in terms of menu, tilemap drawing and sprite animation (declared beforehand)
 * Grafx2 for drawing graphics
 * Sfxr for making sounds

Source code:
 * https://github.com/cryovat/ludum-dare-25 (BSD)

Blog posts:
 * http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/14/another-player-joins-the-fray/ (announcement)
 * http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/16/game-jam-for-the-vat/ 
 * http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/17/lord-evils-daring-escape/ (release)

entries.title: Monster Babies
entries.description:
Hey, you ever dreamed of stalking your prey, slinking in the shadows, and feasting on human flesh? Sure you have, everyone has. Now have you ever dreamed you were doing all those things as a *tiny monster baby*? Heck no, but now you can live out that dream you never had with MONSTER BABIES!

or rather, later you can. Unfortunately, MONSTER BABIES has hit a bit of a snag; in the final hours of making this neato 3D-styled stealth-platformer, our programmer was forced by his parents to head out for the night. Rest assured our team has tried as hard as it can to get this thing out the door by deadline, but unfortunately it might not quite be in the cards.

However, we're going to be running on the logic of making up for lost time, and our programmer is going to move that hour his parents bedgrudged him to tommorow, so we can get the game in a playable state for you guys. Evolution! Gravity-bending! Sadism! Torment! All these things and more are available when MONSTER BABIES goes up very, very, very soon!

Edit: It's up now! Play it you fools

entries.title: Nature's Villain
entries.description:
Controls
******** 
Select Units with LMB, click on tile/enemy/base to attack/move.
Enter: Finish your turn.

Requirements
************
You need Java to run this. On windows simply double clicking the jar should do. On linux/mac you can run it via CLI (java -jar NaturesVillain.jar).

HTML5 port is coming tomorrow/tonight!

Goal of the game
******************
Your goal is the beat Nature by means of killing all their units or by capturing their bases. Alternatively, you also have the option to "bleed" your enemy out by capturing bases and defending them.  If you capture an enemy base (the little wells/oasis in the forests), you receive an extra unit.

The first party to reach 0, or lose all units, loses the game.

The game is turn-based. That means you move all your units, finish your turn (press Enter), wait for the enemy's move and then it's back to you. 

If you get stuck, try a few different strategies. The game should be relatively easy to beat.

Theme
*******
Unfortunately I didn't have enough time to fully develop the theme. But the basic idea is, that we as humans are Nature's Villain. So because of all the damage we do to our planet.. the planet is fighting back :)

I wanted to work this out a bit more, by making the player taint the map by moving around and taking over bases.

Keep earth green.

Created with
**************
Code: Libgdx
Music: Reaper
Sfx: bfxr
Pixels: GIMP
A*: Adapted from (http://www.cokeandcode.com/index.html?page=tutorials/tilemap2)

entries.title: Poacher
entries.description:
UPDATE: My game didn't work for the most people here, thank you very much for letting me now!
I originally made game in MonoGame which seems to be the source of all the failures, today I just rebuilt the game in XNA (Source code is the same) and it seems to be working!

If it won't work for someone please let me know as soon as possible on my twitter @kulhajs ;)

Hi guys!

I finally finished my first LudumDare main event!
Game doesn't contains all features I expected, but that's only because I switched to MonoGame from XNA few days ago and it quite doesn't support everything.

Anyway, in my game you're poacher and you have to kill all goats on farms! You start with your bare hands but later you can buy some weapons in local gunshop.

Controls:
- Arrow keys: move
- Space: attack, enter/leave shop

links.label: Windows (XNA - QuickPlay) If you already have XNA

entries.title: Puny Heroes
entries.description:
Build and manage a dungeon, and protect yourself from the puny heroes! This is a dungeon-defense game in which you play as the boss of the dungeon. Build units in the different rooms of your dungeon, and don't let the hero get to your lair!

Instructions:
There are two stages to the game, the planning stage and the attack stage.
During the planning stage, click on rooms to create/upgrade your baddies. Each build/upgrade costs 100 gold, which you gain by killing adventurers.
During the attack stage, the hero will storm your dungeon and attempt to kill you! Oh no! Luckily, your faithful minions will sacrifice their own lives to protect you.

Purple Heart = Minion Health
White Heart = Hero Health
Red Heart = Boss Health
Gold = Gold
LV = Level

Good luck!

Edit edit: Ok there are still some bugs. Just pretend they don't exist :D

entries.title: PushTheHeroBack
entries.description:
I know this game has nothing to offer,but it looked so much different in my head So much better.
Well I learned from my mistakes and next time i will make an awesome game,but now i feel like shit.
Controls:
Arrows:Go right,Go left,Jump

entries.title: Soulless Robot Rampage
entries.description:
Play as Dr. Udon's Soulless Giant Robot as you rampage all the way around the world, crushing ever larger towns, cities and metropolises. Metrololi? Metropoles? I'm going with metropoles.

Use the arrow keys to move and jump, 1-4 keys to activate abilities, and generally click around and rock out. Enjoy!

entries.title: Speedrun
entries.description:
How to play
----------
  - Tap/hold space bar to accelerate, release to slow down (no brakes!)
  - Arrow up/down to steer


About
-----
This is my first LD entry! It was a lot of fun, even though I had to skip out about 10 hours early. Hence, the lack of a menu/nice start. :(

The premise of the game is simple ... outrun the cops. Don't hit too many cars, though, or else your car is going to go up in smoke!

The "source" version is playable if you have Love2D installed on your system. To view source, rename to .zip and extract.

Special thanks to 'enginemusic' on Freesound for the Ferrari engine sample. :)
http://www.freesound.org/people/enginemusic/sounds/43484/

entries.title: The Anti-Santa
entries.description: merry christmas

entries.title: The Crown Jewels Job
entries.description:
We wanted to make something that our young kids could play, so the game is deliberately tame and safe, even if the theme is that the baddie is a goodie somehow...

WARNING: includes goats

A few features and lots of polish did not make the deadline.  We had to turn off spiders because they could float up the vertical shafts and go in the sky, and the guards are rather simple.  Oh for an extra day!

Its a 2D platform game WITHOUT TILES.  Please take a look at our level editor and try and see how the engine works.  Most of the artwork are true 3D meshes, with a bit of parallax scrolling for the backgrounds.  All the floors and walls are defined using free-form lines.  We built the whole engine from scratch for this LD, and despite the glitches we're super pleased and relieved to have got such a big project mostly working in the time limit!

We are particularly pleased with the level editor - you can play with that too, although we've disabled 'save to server' mode.  We developed the game with a built-in git repo on the server, so everyone could add artwork and levels and so on without having to email everything to a central integrator person and wait for contributions to be uploaded.

The background music uses the old-fashioned audio API, but the sound effects - for jumping, collecting coins, getting hurt etc - use the new HTML5 audio API, which your browser may not support.

Team:
Mr War (Wombatica) - gorgeous art, level design
Will - coding
Virgo - generously helped e.g. added the guard patrol logic

background music is "Sneaky Snitch", free by Kevin MacLeod

entries.title: The Game Where You Don't Wrestle Bears
entries.description: A small puzzle game made using Game Maker 8.1

entries.title: the Visitor
entries.description:
In 'the Visitor' you take control of an alien that has secretly invaded a spaceship.

Nobody is suspicious of you because you managed to steal a spacesuit.

Your mission is simple, cut the oxygen supply of the spaceship and watch everyone die!!
But beware, humans are radioactive for you and the spaceship weapons have sensed an intruder.

Are you a bad enough alien? Prove it!

entries.title: Valkyrie
entries.description:
VALKYRIE

made by Mike MacDee (at yahoo dot com)

A simple shooty game with heavy emphasis on story. The language is abrasive at times, so if that's not your thing, best skip this one.

-UPDATE 3-
HA! Collision problems fixed...I think...

-UPDATE 2-
Lan can change direction faster between shots -- she shouldn't get stuck facing the wrong direction now.
Arrow indicators point to the exit on each map.

-UPDATE-
Alternate control scheme for crappy keyboards.
Bullets don't go through enemies at point blank.

------------

CONTROLS
ARROWS = move
Z = use weapon
X = change weapon
C = kick
SPACE = advance text
ENTER = skip scene
F4 = screen mode
ESC = quit


ALT CONTROLS
IJKL = move
A = use weapon
S = change weapon
D = kick

------------

YOUR MISSION

Ragnarok terrorists sieze the Bifrost Media Center while Artemis Dane -- commander of the Valkyrie Guard and indirect ruler of the nation -- is giving a public address. You are Atalanta Regin (Lan for short), a former Amazon Force commando-turned-Valkyrie who is tasked with the Commander's rescue. Make your way to the broadcasting studio, kill the terrorist leader, and get Commander Dane out alive!

The trouble is -- thanks largely to the resurgence of a long-forgotten childhood memory -- you're not so sure which side is the right one anymore.

------------

entries.title: Vet
entries.description:
My cat is kind of old, and recently had to go to the vet several times for checkups and a tooth removal which gave me this idea.

You play as all pets' arch-nemesis, the vet. Get the kitten and bring to the table for its checkup!

WAD to move.

Jam Entry because I referenced a lot of undeclared code, and copied some stuff.

Made using FlashDevelop, Ogmo, and Graphics Gale Free.

End music is "Music to Delight" by Kevin MacLeod: http://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/index.html?isrc=USUAN1200023

entries.title: Victor Grozny
entries.description:
*******
UPDATE - AAAAAAAARGH!!! Just click-drag up/down the knobs to rotate them. Sorry, I didn't realise people were trying to do fancy sexy things like circle them... just click drag up/down it'll make life a bit easier for you! ;______;
*******

You are Victor Grozny, absolute ruler, absolute tyrant and absolutely NOT in the mood to allow insurgents to take over your rightful place as ruler.

Monitor the communications of the enemy with your "insurgent compass", track their signals, let them talk for a few seconds and then the Inquisitor will take care of them. 

But be quick! The more buildings fall to the influence of the enemy, the sooner your reign of terror will be at an end!

Engine: Unity, C# Scripting
Music & FX: Cubase, Synapse Audio DUNE, NI Kontakt
Art: Photoshop CS6, Blender

UPDATE - Linux (x86 and x86_64 versions now available!)

entries.title: Werewolf!
entries.description:
You are the werewolf in town, but your neighbours don't know it yet.

During the day you must hide the evidences (change clothes, wash blood, remove claw markings in houses).

When the night comes, you must eat a human.

 -You win if you kill all the villagers.
 -You lose if  a villager is 100% sure you are the werewolf.
 -How to play:
   -Arrow keys to move, space to interact.
   -You can change clothes in houses (interact with the door).
   -You remove blood and claw markings by interactuacting with them when you are over it during the day.
   -You eat villagers by interactuacting with them during the night.

-------------

48 hour compo entry: The game was rushed and I've been unable to test it. Also, there are some features unavailable, as wash the blood from yourself or day and night light cycle...

-------------

12/17/2012 update: Today I finally tested the game and found that the villagers never went right! That was because the Random.Range(int, int) last argument is exclusive. I also found why you couldn't wash the blood from yourself or why day and night look didn't change at all: the problem was fast copy&paste to meet the deadline so I forget to change some variables, shame on me >_<

There is a villager whose walking up animation doesn't work right. I'll look into it...

I added a version with the bug fixes that isn't still my initial idea but it's closer than the compo entry.

entries.title: Bacteria
entries.description:
Your Body is infected by an evil Bacteria, how long can you survive until you are consumed by evil and become the Villain?
Klick and drag Cells onto each other. Bacterias are bad. If five or more Bacterias posses your body, you will become the Villain!

entries.title: BIOMINT
entries.description:
You play a mining giant who just want to earn a living. To earn this living, you send out probes around the globe (sprinkle them around - but watch it, they cost a bit) which detect the presence of valuable minerals. They will grow in size when they pass a vein.

You now know where you should blow up the earth - don't be stingy with the explosives (they're not so expensive). You'll need a fair bit to get to the core. With luck, you'll to uncover the red goodness.

Once you have unearthed some treasure, deploy a mine (careful, it's a bit pricy all this digging) to retrieve the goods and earn your coin while tilling the earth bare!

[UPDATE: I spent a bit of time after the comp tweaking things in the "improved" version: you're punished by your shareholders if you blow up non-mineral-producing earth, you can mine the ocean now with (expensive) oil rigs, and I added some polar ice caps... just for fun]

entries.title: Car Chase
entries.description:
You and two friends are bank robbers who just successfully robbed a bank. However, cops are chasing you down, and you have no option than to steal a car and shake them off.

Avoid the traffic and shake the cops off by letting them crash in other cars or by shooting them with your gun. You have just a few bullets left though, so pick your targets wisely...

entries.title: City Rat
entries.description:
City Rat.
  Play a mutated city rat with an appetite for human flesh! Chomp down on civilians while steering clear of officer's of Human Law!
Controls:Arrow Keys
Made with FlashPunk

entries.title: Cure 48
entries.description:
Earth is ravaged by a terrible plague, and the only cure lies on a distant planet. Your job is to harvest as much of the cure as possible and return to Earth safely.

BE A HERO!

SAVE THE WORLD!

FOUR HIDDEN MEDALS TO UNLOCK
THREE POSSIBLE RANKS TO EARN

---------
Controls (Windows version)
---------

Up, Down, Left, Right - Movement
Z - Attack
ESC - Exit Game
F4 - Toggle Full-Screen

---------

Post-mortem / analysis:

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/20/cure-48-post-mortem-and-theme-analysis/

entries.title: Dance Man
entries.description:
Dance Man features all you ever wanted in a game: sex and dance. You play the villain, an ugly hairy man who disrupts a broadway musical.

Q and E control the arms.
A and D control the legs.
S for duck.
Arrow keys to move around.

Have fun!

Tip: Go straight to the Dance Off with SPACE at menu screen.

entries.title: Eat A Goat!
entries.description:
Controls: Arrow Keys to move

Based on a previous game I created for the Pirate Kart.

This is my Jam account. I won't be using this account to play and rate other games. My Compo account and my Compo entry is at http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-25/?action=preview&uid=4925

entries.title: Fleeced
entries.description: Move with the directional keys or wasd.

entries.title: GiTA
entries.description:
Chaos and mayhem in the city!

Genre: Arcade/stealth

=== Background ===
Move the villain around there and kill as many citizens as possible without being caught by the police.

Use your knife, do the job and get the money. Hide in the surroundings if things turn bad!

Try to no get caught, though. If nobody sees you killing anyone you are in shape to go. Otherwise, time to run...

=== Controls ===
*W/A/S/D: Move the villain
*Spacebar: Stab with your knife

=== Some notes ===
The AI is what makes this game fun. If you kill a citizen and nobody sees you, the police won't come. If a random citizen sees the corpse, he will be alerted, but won't recognize you. And if he recognizes you, he will remember you for the rest of the game.
Try to be observant with the surroundings and you will enjoy it more! : D

entries.title: Green War
entries.description:
Both a lumberjack simulator and a hippie murdering simulator! Two games in one!

You are a savvy businessman/evil villain/tree hater, and you have need of a car park. However, there's a rainforest in the way, along with a bunch of hippies.

Slay the hippies, chop down the trees, and make space for your car park!


Compatibility notes: This is a HTML5/javascript game, using a smattering of JQuery. This means you'll need a HTML5 compatible browser (Chrome, Firefox, new IE versions(?)), and an internet connection (to include JQuery, I didn't want to bundle it).

I am aware of a couple of odd issues with the score bar wandering off, but I've been unable to replicate this. I think it's tied to something in Windows 8.

Also, I can't quite get dropbox to play nice with a simple HTML link, so it's all been dumped into a zip file. Sorry about that.

entries.title: HitBit
entries.description:
That is not what I had in mind at the begenning.
Too much bugs, too much time spent to find them (and fail).
So I decided to make this one, and it's about a nasty bug that eats my game bits.

Oh, and sorry for the home-made sounds.

entries.title: Infected
entries.description:
I planned on submitting this to the competition rather than the jam, but it took way longer than i thought. I had to cut a lot of features out of it to get this demo ready in time, but i'm very happy with how it turned out! 

Really looking forward to your reviews! :)
It was a wonderful event, can't wait for the next one.

I'm a bit afraid that this will run terrible on a lot of computers, but i didn't have much time optimizing. 

If the Unity Webplayer gives you trouble with chrome, please try a different browser.

Game and Graphics made by myself.
Music from http://freemusicarchive.org
SFX from http://www.bfxr.net/

entries.title: Munching Mower
entries.description:
Play as a lawnmower murdering the grass around it.  But watch out for the trees, they will end your rampage!  

Also includes a goat mode where the trees are no match for your munching power.

entries.title: Mr Pickpocket
entries.description:
Do you have what it takes to be a super-duper pick pocket person?

WASD to move around
Steal wallets by dragging from point A to point B

Drag outside the lines and you'll get caught.
If you lose your mark with your hand still in his pocket, you'll get caught.

Get caught by the police and it's game over!

Post compo version includes sound and some bug fixes / game tweaks.

entries.title: Not Space Invaders
entries.description:
Not Space Invaders is a game very much like the good old Space Invaders, but where the player is the villain. Thus, you play as the aliens and try to destroy the humans preventing the invasion.

Choose one of the invaders using the arrow keys and press [Space] to shoot!

- For Windows users, there's a click-and-run executable.
- GNU/Linux users should install love2d from their package manager ('apt-get install love' if you're running Ubuntu) and then run the .love file.
- For Mac OS X there's a .zip with a .app they can easily double-click to run inside it.

entries.title: Splendorman
entries.description:
Is a big file, I appoligies, I couldn't package it any other way.

Simply chase down the bugger who's grabbing all those notes!
You can teleport using your mouse and move (slowly) using the arrow keys. ESCAPE IS NOT A PAUSE BUTTON!! It exits the game, so you've been warned!!

So I didn't have much time to play test this (it was down the the wire), so it's not very fun. I've included now a post competition version that both improves gameplay and graphics.

entries.title: The Quite Annoying League
entries.description:
Being annoying is easy. It's accessible to everyone. 
Being quite annoying on the other hand is a real challenge. 
You need to strongly bother your victims, but just not enough to allow them to reproach you anything.
Only those who can maintain this perfect balance might be admitted in the Quite Annoying League! 
Those are the worse villains! 

-------------------------------------------------------

I took the train just before working on my game...it was quite inspiring. 


I know the recurrent ending scenes could be quite annoying but eh...I might want to join the league. 


Disclaimer : I did all the audio except the train background sound which is from freesound.org. I'm not sure it is allowed so...take it in consideration while rating the Audio category.

entries.title: The Villain Complex
entries.description:
The Villain Complex is a game about a guy who gets called in the middle of the night to hear that someone kidnapped his wife. He then proceeds to try and rescue her. In the mean time he keeps finding telephones that spark conversations between the man and the kidnapper.

The rest of the story involves a mirror and guns... Lots of guns!

The Villain Complex is a side scrolling platformer shooter, with a gun creation tool embedded.

The reason this turned into a jam game is because the whole system was simply too much to be implemented in 48 hours!

Have fun! ^^

Edit: For the Windows and OS/X builds: To see the game's font you have to install the visitor1.ttf font file.

entries.title: tinyAdventures - Top down Pokemon inspired adventure game!
entries.description:
Pokemon style adventure game.

Features:

Mouse driven menu
Soundtrack
MAP EDITOR, Create and save new maps, share with friends
Multiple levels can be added and run through

--------

Aim of the game, get from the start to the finish, however i've not completed more than one level, the user themselves must design them at this point! 

IF ANYONE WOULD LIKE TO HELP ADD A FEW MAPS, GO INTO THE 'mapEdit' FOLDER AND YOU CAN EDIT THE MAP MANUALLY OR USE THE IN GAME EDITOR, THEN SIMPLY SEND IT TO ME.

entries.title: Universal Destroyer.jar
entries.description:
post entry?
in the post entry i fixed a bug that prevented the game from being played twice(without exit)
i also made scrap give you more heath
ludum allows minor fixes to the game so are these qualifiable? (if not just vote on the first link)
this is my first ludum dare entry
the goal of the game is to follow the planets(the way you ship is facing(pointed end)) you get points for killing ships when you get to the end of the planets you have to kill the boss (with red heath) to destroy everything

run the game:
download file and unzip
run jar
enjoy :)

controls:
mouse to aim
w to move towards mouse
s to move away from mouse
escape to pause

links.label: any os with java 6 or greater

entries.title: YOU ARE EVIL!!
entries.description:
In YOU ARE EVIL!! well... the title says it all... You are all the evil in the world combined into one being of huge power.
After being defeated by the human race you found yourself on an island inhabited by beings of pure good, therefore you can only take one action: DESTROY THE ISLAND!!!

entries.title: You are the Blob - The Alexgator
entries.description:
Although I didn't complete all of the features that I had planned, and the game came out pretty poorly overall, I had a ton of fun in my first Ludum Dare!

Also, this was my first time using Unity, so I kind of made it all up as I went along..

You are a menacing Red Blob, that has to destroy villages and absorb the red people in order to continue living.Reach the end of the game to win. (The game quitting means you have won) (It also means you have lost). (I didn't have time for fancy GUI)

Anyway, enjoy, and don't take it too seriously,

Alex Daley

entries.title: Zombies vs. Survivors TAKE OVER THE CITY
entries.description:
*UPDATE* HAHA so I last minute nerfed the humans so it's a pretty easy game. If you want to make it harder, try making the humans win =) Let's just say it's a social commentary about the inevitable zombie victory and that zombies are really really hard to control. Really deep, I know. <3 Steve

A zombie outbreak as occurred! Can you control the Zombies and bring total destruction on the human race?

- Infect humans and turn them to bolster your undead ranks
- Swarm local police officers
- Use pitiful civilians as human shields and munch on the brains of your enemies!

I was too busy this weekend to compete in the 48 hour compo, so I did this all on Monday when I should have been working :D

Enjoy! <3
Steve Bushman

Made with Flash/Flex/Flixel/Flixel Power Tools/Gimp/Sfxr

Rule bending: Some sounds taken from another of my 48-hour projects, and some skeleton code as well.

entries.title: Accusational Accusationing
entries.description: Arrow keys + x

entries.title: BOTWALK
entries.description: Didn't have time to make music or to add all the different types of buildings/vehicles/enemies that I wanted, but it's pretty playable. Instructions are on the site.

entries.title: Christmas Jeer
entries.description:
Description:
In Christmas Jeer you play the role of the hideous Baron Von Awful in his quest to ruin Christmas for all the little boys and girls the world over (or at the least, in one particular city).  
Race against the goody two-shoes Santa Claus himself as he spreads all that joy and love across the town, it's enough to make a Baron sick...

Controls:
WASD to move the Baron, well its more of a dastardly saunter.
Space-bar to fling insults at those snot-nosed brats, all warm and cosy in their homes...
To play the game, just double click on the .exe file within the .rar, the Baron will do the rest.

Authors Notes:
I made this game in C++ using allegro and whilst it's not the best looking game, nor does it play very well, I feel it turned out okay and I learnt more of allegro along the way.
Hope you enjoy!

EDIT:
Currently having a few problems with running the release version, for some reason it doesn't add up the players score properly any more.  Also the Baron flings far too many insults at a time now.  I'm working on it!
Currently I've posted the links to both versions until I get around to fixing the problem.

links.label: Windows (This mode works if you have Visual Studio on your computer)

entries.title: Conquest Of The Mayans
entries.description:
In the Gregorian Calendar, the date is the 21st December 2012. In the Mayan Long Count, the date is 13.0.0.0.0, and it is time for the Mayan Hordes to emerge from their slumber and bring an end to civilization as we know it.

And it's up to you to lead the Mayan Hordes, beset upon all sides by modern diseases, the Resistance, shoddy stonemasonry, and the occasional meteorite.

-

Yes, maybe I was a little too enamored of the End Of The World theme. But I've been meaning to make a globe-view end-of-the-world game (a la Pandemic, Fate Of The World, Defcon et al) for a while now, and I thought, why not. At least this way you get to extend your villanous schemes across whole continents.

Starts off nice and easy, unless the random number generator hates you. But don't get too complacent, the fun really begins once you've got a few more pyramids built.

This game was put together in 48 hours, but it was the *wrong* 48 hours (Sunday-Monday), so it's a Jam entry. And my sound card's been playing up, so you'll have to make do with a Silent Edition (sorry). 

And yeah, I apologise for the lack of post-apocalyptic goats.

Enjoy.

--- Instructions ---

Okay, so a few people have asked for a more detailed description of what you're meant to be doing. 

You are the leader of the Mayan Horde. Your aim is to subjugate the people of Earth, and to build six pyramids across the world.

At the bottom of the screen, you'll see some statistics. These tell you how much Logistics points you have, and how serious the various threats to your Mayan Horde are.

Over time, different events will happen - these events will generally be an outbreak of disease among your forces, an act of the Resistance against you, or a threat to your Mayan stonemasonry. You can choose either to Take Action, which will cost you one Logistics point, or to do nothing. If you have no Logistics points, then the Take Action button will do nothing.

Most of the time ,taking action will stop things from getting any worse, while doing nothing has a chance that things will escalate.

As disease spreads / Resistance increases / stonemasonry gets more shoddy, the number of events happening increases. At the start of the game, you'll probably have enough Logistics points to take care of everything (I never did get that difficulty curve quite how I'd like it). As the game goes on, you'll have to start making tougher and tougher choices about where your energy is best spent.

Every so often, you'll have a chance to build new pyramids. Each pyramid increases the range of your dominion, and also gain you a few more Logistics points, but also increases the number of Events you'll have to cope with, so choose carefully.

Left click selects, right click rotates the camera. The time controls at the top are Pause / 1x / 3x / 10x speed.

entries.title: Considered Harmful
entries.description:
Written in C++ with the c standard library. My first text adventure game. There are no dependencies, so play around with the source to your heart's content, compile it for whatever you want. Oh, and if anyone asks, I did not tell you that programming like this is okay.

You play the Marshal of Darkness as he escapes from his own dungeon, committing acts of villainy to procede, against the heroes and his own treacherous minions.

He does not like fair fights, but backstabbing and murdering helpless people is his idea of a good time.

Hints for the perplexed:
-movement is always in the four cardinal compass directions (or 'down', in one specific case). The exits from a room are listed in the room description. So, to follow a 'passage to the east', type 'move east'.

-This game has a lot of hints built into it. The 'look' command is your tool here. It will give you not only visual info but also your character's insight. Also, some items can only be seen this way

-There is one place very early on where you must wait to obtain an item. Type in a couple of junk commands to pass time.

-It is possible to use weapons in such a way that will later come back to bite you. All weapons are limited use, so be careful.

entries.title: End Boss

Written in C# with XNA 

Aren't bullet hell bosses the coolest thing ever!? Well why can't you ever PLAY ONE!? NOW YOU CAN! OMG!

(Controls on gamepad is: left thumbstick to move. X, A, B to shoot and Y to defend.)


Bro tip: Don't let the player get power-ups! 

Also, fuck, totally missed out on the goat thing.. :c

entries.title: ROTTEN ROBBER
entries.description:

I hope you enjoy testing at least a little bit, this is the first game I ever do solo, and I've only known OOP for a couple months, so if you look at the source and find it to be lacking in some ways, I welcome your comments on what I should have done differently. And I plain and simple didn't have time to even touch the art, so let's say the "UI" - ahem - is fairly feng shui.

entries.title: Sin Regne Enbre
entries.description:
The first level has you playing as Sin Regne, a demon with a powerful pressure field around him that causes the ground to crumble away at his feet. The second level features Enbre, a demon who's gotta be careful about setting things on fire whenever he stays in one place. 

The keys: 
* I for a punch, though the punches are admittedly too weak to damage a boss because Regne's power has yet to grow from destruction. 
* For Regne, O to intensify the downward pressure and break the field underneath you faster.
* For both Enbre and Regne, press left or right twice to dash, which can be combined with hitting the spacebar to jump to cross larger gaps. 
* For Regne, hold P and then hold space to climb, and for Enbre, hold O and then hold space to climb.

Programming, Level Design: Roberto H., Ben G. (C# + XNA)
Sound, Level Design: Aaron W. (Ableton)
Pretty pictures: Jordan F. (Paint.NET)

We know there's quite a bit left to be improved, and we're all very new at this, but that's all the more reason why we'd love it if you gave our submission a try and helped us to make this game even better! 'You are the villain' without regretting embarrassment, Ludum Dare!

entries.title: Somso
entries.description:
IMPORTANT : There *is* audio, but only with Chrome or Chromium! See below.

In order for this game to fit the theme "You Are The Villain", please just picture yourself (the red sphere) as a very bad person, whereas your enemies are the heroes that represent the goodness, the good and the great, otherwise nothing will really make you feel like a "villain" more than in any other game.

It's ok, you can rate 0 on "Theme". I made this game in less than 20 hours, after starting over three times. I wasn't satisfied with my previous ideas, this one seemed at least interesting to me.

I know this isn't finished. The only end is when you get tired of the FPS getting lower and lower as you complete phases. There isn't any real challenge either, as you have infinite "lives." I failed at adding goats as well, they may replace the blue balls in the post-compo version though.

You will have to play with Chrome or Chromium in order for the audio to be working, because other browsers don't support the Web Audio API yet. I would greatly appreciate it if you don't rate 0 in Audio just because you don't hear any audio. The sound is important for other categories as well, so I thank you very much if you make an effort to play in Chrome (assumimg you're not a regular user, that's cool if you are). :)

Anyway, please play, rate and comment my game, and I will check and rate and comment yours! Thanks :)

PS: Please don't look at the code too much. Some parts really are awful programming.

-- 2012-12-19: Fixed a bug where the ball would get stuck when starting too close from the border. Fixed preloading of images as well. (Still lagging under Firefox)

entries.title: You Are the Machine!
entries.description:
This is my first LD48 entry. It's pretty generic in idea and execution, but it's done! 

I usually collaborate as an artist/UI designer. This is the first game that I've coded all on my own. As such, I spent the vast majority of the time just getting it to function. 

That said, if there's something to be improved that you'd think would be obvious, especially if it's related to programming and/or performance, let me know.

Things I know could have been better: sound design, level design (I planned on doing power-ups & different starting patterns for bricks, but didn't have time to implement them), balancing.

I hope to eventually clean this up and upload it somewhere like Kongregate, so comments about what level you achieved, whether you thought the timers or brick allotments were too much/little, et cetera are greatly appreciated.

Made in Flixel with graphics in Photoshop CS5 and sounds from sfxr.

KNOWN BUGS: updated 12/16 17:05 - game overs triggered at higher levels sometimes kick you back to the play screen. If this happens, refresh. (Sorry!)

entries.title: Dragon Boss
entries.description:
Hey there!  I'm Zanzlanz and this is my second Ludum Dare entry, "Dragon Boss." :D

__________________________________ TL;DR _________________________________
Read this if you don't feel like reading the rest:
Move with arrow keys, use shift to breath fire, and space to pick up animals. Avoid arrows. Collect items until you win. I had fun and loved talking to my live stream viewers. There are goats, and they are yummy.

__________________________________ INFO __________________________________
Wow you went passed the TL;DR.  Thank you :)

So the whole game is based off of you being a dragon.  You main goal is to become a boss.  In order to become a boss, you can terrorize the giant village filled with archers, cows, and GOATS.

I created all music, graphics, (most of) the code (I submitted an ugly engine before it started), and sound effects in the allotted time of 48 hours.  The art is actually made up of 13 colors, total, so I think that's a cool feature!  My live stream adds up to over 17 hours of video.  

________________________________ CONTROLS _______________________________
- WAD or arrow keys to move.  Keep tapping up (or W) to fly.
- Shift: Hold down shift to breath fire.  Fire can burn down houses or catch people/livestock on fire.
- Space: When there is a person or livestock under you, press space to pick it up.  Press space again to drop it.  If they take fall damage, they die and give you goodies.

______________________________ WIN CONDITION _____________________________
Simply, if you're completely leveled up, you win.
You can be leveled up in speed, flight, and flame.  The highest level for each category is 10!

________________________________ ENTITIES _______________________________
All entities can be picked up and thrown on the ground.  They all drop meat, hearts, and 2 experience orbs.
- Archers: They're the villagers.  They all have bows and arrows because they are paranoid.  They'll squat before they shoot an arrow at you.  So watch out :D
- Cows and goats: They're just there because they're yummy.

____________________________ DRAGON PROPERTIES ___________________________
On the display is health, hunger, experience, and your power (speed, flight, and flame).
- Health: If it goes to 0, you die.
- Hunger: Decreases over time.  Determines how fast your stamina replenishes.
- Stamina: It's how much energy you have to do things, such as fly and breath fire.  It will automatically increase over time.  It will decrease if you use up your strength.
- Exp: Every 200 exp, you gain power in one of the 3 categories (speed, flight, and flame).

_______________________________ TIME LAPSE _______________________________
I livestreamed this whole thing (including me write this D:), and I was able to make it into a timelapse!  See the links at the top for the video.
I must give a huge shout out to the people who watched my live stream.  There were awesome to chat with, and it was nice meeting new friends.

___________________________ POST-COMPO GAME ______________________________
I am working on finishing the game that will fix bugs, improve graphics, and add REALLY COOL features.
I'll post it on Ludum Dare when I'm done, of course. One of the new features is the dragon will grow over time.  It works great and is cool too x)

Regarding the controls (arrows to move, thassit): they're a bit funky, but again, I'm basing them off the movement in the video. Which is seeming increasingly arbitrary.

There are exactly TEN levels.

I apologise for the tenth.

entries.title: Recluster
entries.description:
How to play:
Click the Build Dungeon button on the left side, above the monster. On this screen, make sure that there is an entrance, an exit, and rooms connecting all of the treasures. The heroes must be able to get through to the end. Press the Start Game button, unpause it by pressing the Pause toggle button, and watch as nothing interesting happens. I'm not even sure why I made the game start paused, really.

I knew early on that I had taken on something a bit too much for three days. It's my first Ludum Dare entry, and my artist's first time doing game art. I knew I couldn't make blog posts without making it impossible to complete. The game is entirely JavaScript/Canvas, using no libraries or engines, and all code was written during the competition period aside from a snippet of unused audio code.

That said, it isn't done. It "plays" in the sense that the game will finish. Combat is supposed to be present, but isn't. You make a dungeon, then just watch as the hero party walks through it from treasure room to treasure room, then finally to your lair where you would normally fight them.

I'm very proud of what we accomplished, even if there is still a lot of work left to do. Development will continue. The code is not obfuscated. The Windows link will download a .zip file containing all assets for "playing" standalone, but it will run in Chrome. Firefox and IE10 are also supported, but have a small image tiling error.

The submitted version may have a number of compatibility glitches, including an odd problem with playing the game in a tall (as opposed to wide) window that somehow made it in.

License: source provided and not obfuscated, feel free to learn from it, but don't steal the game. All art assets (including those provided but not present in the game) are licensed as Creative Commons BY-NC-SA http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/

entries.title: RPS Battle

EDIT: I changed the control Scheme so that it's more accessible to people w/o numpads.

                        ****NOTE****
Some users are reporting that AVG & Avast are reporting my entry as malware. I just recently updated the build to take care of that issue.

entries.title: Conquering Oneself
entries.description:
(Updated on December 18th, 2012; for judging, please use the original version (first three links).)

Conquering Oneself is a puzzle/RPG game where you have to defeat your most dreadful enemy: yourself.

After every fight, your used attacks are stored, and in the next battle, you have to fight a stronger version of yourself who uses the exact same attacks you used last battle. As you fight more battles, you grow stronger and more difficult to defeat, but so do 'you'.



Controls:
Up/Down - Browse through menus
Enter - Select item in menus
F - Toggle fullscreen mode
PgUp/PgDown - Scroll through analysis/high score list



The high score list can also be viewed inside a browser:
http://vdzserver.org/php/co/scores.php


Conquering Oneself is a Windows-only game using .NET 4 and XNA Framework 4. If you don't have those or are not sure, pick the large download. Alternatively, you can download them here:

.NET Framework 4: https://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851
XNA Framework 4: https://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=20914



This game is public domain. Feel free to do whatever you want with it.

entries.title: Dr. Vile in The Greater Good
entries.description:
Dr. Vile, the most despised mad scientist in the world, has one mission in life: become #1. He'll do whatever it takes to win the respect and adoration of every person on Earth - even if he has to KILL EVERY PERSON ON EARTH.

Take Dr. Vile and his AI companion, Lexe, on a quest to build the most powerful Death Ray mankind has ever seen. Will Dr. Vile use it for good or will the villain always be the villain?

INSTRUCTIONS:

- Use the arrow keys to move Dr. Vile.
- Press X to swing your bat (perfect weapon for an evil genius, eh?). Your bat can bash objects - such as trees, cars, TVs, and more - that will break into the parts you need to complete the Death Ray. Use your bat to break the skulls of any pesky townspeople, too! 
- Press C to use your Stun Gun. This will temporarily stun townspeople (probably why it's called a Stun Gun). It does have a cooldown period, though! 
- Press SPACE BAR to open/close the Inventory menu and see what parts you need to complete the Death Ray. This also pauses the game.
- Try not to die or you'll have to start over! Collect Apples and Leftover Steak to regain health.

"Dr. Vile in The Greater Good" is Green Pixel's first Ludum Dare submission! We're used to creating months-long projects so we're amazed at what can be done in 72 hours! We hope you enjoy playing our game as much as we enjoyed making it! :D

Congratulations to everyone who participated! Whether you completed what you wanted to complete or not, you have much more now than what you had 72 hours ago!

We may continue working on adding features to "Dr. Vile in the Greater Good" so please send us your feedback and follow us on Twitter (@GreenPixelDev) to stay updated!

Happy gaming! :D
