entries.title: GoatSoccer
entries.description:
This game is unfinished, so the goats are no villains and do not foul other goats YET. A post compo version which contains the theme will follow. (GUI too)

This is a MULTIPLAYER TELNET game. Download and start the server file (works with wine and linux, too). Connect to your server using the command shown by the server. Everyone using this command in your local network can play with/against you. If you want you can use port forwarding to play it over the internet. Since it is TELNET it runs with every operating system (the server doesn't).

NOTES: This game does not work with PuTTY. Use your system telnet client instead. (Windows 7 users have to enable Tenlnet-Client (not server!) in the control panel. This can be done in the software de/install window by clicking the 'activate windows functions' link)
If you are using linux you have to write telnet lowercase.

Thanks for playing
Don't forget to check out the awesome post-compo version :)

Hirsch

Also, the Armour stat doesn't do anything, so I wouldn't put any points into it :)  The main menu is makeshift, and I plan on adding much better instructions in the future.

entries.title: To Kill a Mocking Witch
entries.description:
Hey y'all!

Here we are, yet another LD. Almost Xmas, too! Anyways, it's been very rough this time for us, we've aimed too high (does anyone aim too low in LD?) but I think we've finally achieved enough to be satisfied with the result. 

Surely, those sprites aren't beautiful at all (but hey, at least they're all animated in 8 directions, imagine the pain), the tile-set quality (specially on corners) causes eyebleed and you could probably find better gameplay and less bugs in the old E.T. games now buried in the desert, but we made it!

Let's sum it up!

-------------Story---------------
-You are a knight, bound to kill a witch in a sealed cave. Why? Maybe you need money and her head is valuable, maybe you are bored and you love wet places, or maybe you just are that evil and violent!

-However, she curses you. What's the curse? You gotta find out! And then.. ask yourself: does the curse even bother you? Or will you grow used to it?
---------------------------------

------------Gameplay---------------
-You can move in 8 directions (wow, talk about dimensions!). The plan is that your mouse points your way (AKA you should hit and block aiming at the enemy!) and you can use 'A' to walk in that direction, 'S' to block the attack (ah, but there's a cooldown, of course) and 'LMB' to attack (you can charge this attack for uber-happiness).

-It's an action-game intended to avoid the button mashing of Hack&Slash games by providing you with a block and slash/charge skill. The ranged attack was meant to be meant to be, but sadly it never reached the actual 'meaning to be' phase, so you'll have to sue us for that!
-----------------------------------

---------Team---------------
soy_yuma - Game coder
andrew - Engine coder
rethen - Graphics and sounds
----------------------------

------Special thanks-------------------------------
Laura - For all that coffee and the title screen!
---------------------------------------------------

Hope you enjoy the game as much as we've enjoyed making it! (and hopefully without the stress!!)

entries.title: All Galactic Creatures
entries.description:
RULES OF THE GAME
Game includes elements of two types of strategic games. It's a double strategy.
1. TURN BASE GAME: this part of our game is basedon the rules of an american-japanese strategic game called "Pente".

The game is played on a MASSIVE board 35 x 35 fields (originally it was meant to be 19 x 19).
To win, you need to arrest 5 pairs of an enemy "soldiers". You can also win faster by playing by the rules of a japanese GO-MOKU (five-in-a-row). 
The green fields will (post-compo)be an impassable areas, nothing wil be allowed to be placed on them.

By pressing a "red" button we will be transferred to the PENTE game's board, which is the same as a geographical map that will be used for the RTS gameplay.
For now there are two red buttons, so you can play on two different PENTE games at the same time.

Arresting is closing two enemy's figures from both sides, such us: XOOX. After arresting, enemy's forces are weakened by two soldiers. When he will lose 10... this means VICTORY for us :)

2 RTS This game's element is not yet ready. By pressing a "green" or "blue" button we will be transferred on a board of our game, where our squads, (Alpha, Beta, Charlie and Delta squads) of Imperial Stormtroopers fight the historic army controlled by Napoleon Bonaparte. However for now we can't anything on this map :)

When we win by thinking tactically on a PENTE board game, our army on the RTS board win as well.
...unfortunately we didn't have enough time to fully finish our game... We have got all the Stormtroopers' and Napoleon's soldiers' animations ready. They will be able to fight each other later (post-compo).

(The orders in game is a voice of our sound designer, apart from Napoleon's "French" accent ;)

ENJOY!

Team Something Beautiful


Instructions

entries.title: DM's Rule
entries.description:
The instructions are in the description here. Unfortunately due to me having to redo my entire AI, and to still have problems with it, until I figured out that I forgot to switch an X with an Y, I didn't get all the nice things I wanted to add to it. But it is still a game and still runable.

-STORY-
You are a DM. A hero (F) walks through your part of the woods and you decide to interrupt his quest by sending your minions (E) after him. Stop him before he reaches his goal.

-INSTRUCTIONS-
Use your mouse to place his goal anywhere you wish, that's on the grid. Then place your minions with your mouse as well, use your Left Mouse Button to place the goal and minion. After your last minion (5 minions total) the hero will spawn, be careful, this hero has the ability to randomly kill one of your minions at the start. Use your Left Mouse Button to control your minions by pushing the arrow keys on the side of the screen. You can move your minion by clicking the move then arrow keys in which direction you wish to send it. You can attack by clicking the attack button and clicking an arrow to choose which direction. Caution, you can only do one attack per minion and when you decide to do an attack you can't move that minion until the next go. Click end turn to move to the last minion, or if you are at the last one, then it will be the hero's turn. The hero is so quick that your turn will come up very soon after clicking end turn on your last minion, watch what minion you are on.

entries.title: DONUT HEIST: Nom in 60 Seconds
entries.description:
You are Boris! 
The Greatest Donut Thief in the World!

Collect ALL the donuts then escape!
Arrows to move, space to jump.

EDIT: For the record the 1st (and only) level is possible to beat. I just made it extremely hard so that the game isn't over in 1 minute. I can complete it and multiple players have also done so!
GUIDE (Spoiler ofc!!!): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p2H7holWjU8

I have made games in flash before but decided to use the comp to finally learn to use flixel! 
I'm glad I did it was a lot of fun :)

code: as3/flixel in flash builder
gfx: Gimp and Pickle
sfx: my voice and audacity
music: Audiosauna

entries.title: Egg Bandit
entries.description:
This is Egg Bandit. The Human is evil and steals the eggs from the chickens.

When a player grabs an egg, he must return it to the bin. If he runs into a chicken, the egg is taken away from the human.

entries.title: Escuro
entries.description:
Update2: It says 0 coolness, but that's because I only rate with the other account! I definitely rate everyone back!

Update: check the post-compo! And please play my compo entry too! Here it is: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-25/?action=preview&q=behind+blue+pixels
---------------------------------


This is a game about MURDER! 

Suck the color out of the squares and never let them shine.

Made in 3 hours with Stencyl.

entries.title: EVIL SOUL EATING DEMON LORD FROM HELL in HAPPY KINGDOM
entries.description:
** EDIT **
I've added a web version and source.

PLOT
You play as EVIL SOUL EATING DEMON LORD FROM HELL which like to spend free	time in Happy Kingdom killing and destroying.

HOW TO PLAY:
Goal of the game is to score as much points as possible
To do so kill and destroy everything and every one in your path

CONTROLLS:
arrow key to move 
Space to attack

To run game you need Java JVM.
you can download Java JVM from here:
http://java.com

entries.title: Frankenstein Complex
entries.description:
You are Mad Doctor Mad. Send your minions forth from your Evil Lair of Evil to conquer the land and SHOW THEM ALL!!!

Bottom left of the screen is your Evil Lair of Evil. Click on it to review your status and create new minions in your lab through the power of SCIENCE!!!

Your current roster of minions is shown, along with their creation cost in GOLD, BODYPARTS and LIGHTNING.

LIGHTNING will periodically strike your tower, where it is collected ready for use in your EXPERIMENTS

Click on one of the locations around the land to see its stats. You can attempt to either ATTACK or CONQUER locations. 

A successful ATTACK will result in your minions returning with a fresh crop of BODY PARTS for your lab. CONQUERed locations will periodically send you tribute in GOLD.

The greater the population, the more tribute you will receive.
When you have successfully conquered or wiped out the population of all locations, you have SHOWED THEM ALL!!! Thus you win.

TIP: Start by conquering farms for gold and attacking weak villages for body parts.

entries.title: From The Black
entries.description:
Help defend the colonies from an onslaught of enemy starships.

You'll need to at least beat normal mode to understand the theme.

Difficulty ramps up quickly in Story Mode+ and Story Mode++.

I suggest playing the full 2x version, but if you are on a smaller resolution, you can play the Halfsize 1x version.

Created with Axel:
http://axgl.org/

entries.title: Goat Factory
entries.description:
Welcome to The Goat Factory - where the goats rule supreme!

OSX-Tip: To run, use -> ./run.sh
Windows tip: To run, use -> run.bat

How to play:
1. drag the items in the top corner where you like them
2. press space to play/pause
3. press r to restart

What:
The Goat Factory is a free to play goat-saw-lava simulator that takes place in the 20'th century.

Why:
Everyone loves goats!

Tech:
Moai, sunvox, sfxr,fireworks,Lua!

Issues: Sound lags a bit on Windows.

entries.title: Goat sacrifice 2012 (unfinished)
entries.description:
Was going to be an "incredible machine" clone except each stage you're trying to figure out how to sacrifice the goat, but only ended up having 2-3 hours to work on it sunday night so it's barely started, much less finished, so all it really is right now is a rough physics sim with a "goat" that gibs when the "knife" hits it.

There's nothing to really play so i didn't bother with cross compiling, as with all my stuff from past few LD's made with my "aether" game engine.

http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1844752097/aether-game-engine-open-source-linux-android-windo

I wish i could submit my ld25 warmup entry for my main compo instead, as a matter of fact i'd rather get feedback on that one than this crap O_x http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-25-warmup/?action=preview&uid=7131

entries.title: In Digito
entries.description:
18 years ago, you created a digital clone of yourself to do good in the world.
How the hell didn't you see his evil streak coming? Better get in there and erase him before he takes control of all information across the globe!
The villain is you and so you are the villain in this tile-based rhythm-action type-thing, where the colour of a tile determines its type (listed below - obstacle tiles will hurt you - avoid them!)

The game is supposed to be synced to the beat of the music, but due to performance issues it sometimes lags a beat or so behind. Sorry!

------------
TILES:-
------------
- White - Player!
- Green/Blue/Turquoise/Red/Purple/Yellow - environment
- Brown - obstacle - AVOID
- Bright Pink - moving obstacle - AVOID
- Orange - invincibility pad
- Dull Pink - speed pad

--------------------------
IMPORTANT NOTES:-
--------------------------
- Restarting (with R) does NOT work! And I don't know why :L
- Better to restart with a web refresh or simply re-running the desktop jar.

-----------------------------
WEB VERSION NOTES:-
-----------------------------
- To make the web version work, you need the level files and a custom Java permissions file so it can read those files

- Download the level zip (below) and extract it to C:/
- Download the permissions file (below) and put it in your users' home directory (EG: on Windows, C:/users/someUser)
- IMPORTANT: delete the permissions file when you're done playing! It can become a security issue if not!

- LEVEL ZIP:
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/38489921/Programming/Projects/Games/1%20Ludum%20Dare/LD%20%2325%20-%20In%20Digito/Game/levels.zip
- PERMISSIONS FILE:
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/38489921/Programming/Projects/Games/1%20Ludum%20Dare/LD%20%2325%20-%20In%20Digito/Game/.java.policy



Thanks for playing, and I hope you enjoy - all game instructions are in-game :)

Twitter: @jonnopon3000
Facebook: /7spaceGames

entries.title: Mr. Bowtie Versus JZ
entries.description:
Well, not as finished as I'd like. Particularly disappointed that I never got sound added. Always some major other commitment in the middle of these things... argh.

Anyways, you play as a pretentious CEO of a corrupt corporation. A young employee of yours has risen against you and is attempting to gather documents around the office to bring you down. You are on the verge of launching your latest diabolical plot and are racing against the clock to keep everyone on task, making you money, before he foils your plan.

Everything is controlled via the mouse. If you move towards the edge of the screen it will scroll either up or down for you. Hovering over a worker will change your cursor to a whip, holding the left mouse button will "charge up" a strike. Guards can be dragged and dropped around to provide more security in certain areas.

I tossed 2 in dev shots for the heck of it.

KEEP 'EM DOWN!

entries.title: Robin Banks
entries.description:
You are the villain, Robin Banks, a punny banker who has gone too far. You must steal money from the citizens but be careful, people get angry and throw things at you, you need to avoid them!

-

We are a team of two. This is our first Ludum Dare and even though we have to submit to JAM because we are two we followed the COMPO rules strictly, we even have goats!

ART: Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects
CODE: Flixel

Game designed, coded and illustrated from scratch in 26h.

Feel free to comment with your best heist score! :)

entries.title: TAKEOVER
entries.description:
YOU NEED JAVA TO PLAY THIS!

///////////////
//PLEASE READ//
///////////////
I HAVE A CONFESSION TO MAKE: I'm sorry but I went about 8 - 10 minutes into the submission hour BUT I was sick on day 2 and day 3 so I should have had that time anyway AND considering that some people's clocks were wrong, they probably went overtime too. Besides, this is the Jam so I can slightly bend a few rules right? Again, I'm sorry.

What I was trying to do was make a game where you have to disable robot goats and take over their circuit boards. You would then "become them" making you the villain. Get it? if not I'll probably make a post compo version so you can see what I was trying to do.

Features:
No sound. Cool right?
Robot Goats!
Unfinished functionality
ROBOT GOATS!
Booster thingys that fling you into the air!

Post-compo features:
Sound!
Health indicator
Fixed Takeover feature
sucky animations
Ability to win and lose

entries.title: Tetrominoes Butcher
entries.description:
A little experiment where you handle the "behind the scenes" of Tetris game. 

There are several things to improve in the next weeks: 
1) the gameplay, and a progressive "how to play" in game,
2) speed of pieces/CPU depending how many pieces there are chopped,
3) score (less score for chopping the same tetromino shape several times), 
4) music, I didn't have enough time for a good audio mastering, 
5) sounds fx,
6) kongregate API

Tools: FlashDevelop + Flixel + Emacs
Gfx & animations: http://www.aseprite.org/
Music: SONAR 6 LE + Korg M50 + Adobe Audition
Audio interface: Edirol UA-25EX

entries.title: The Red Hood
entries.description:
Little girl wanders around small village. She's gatherer, though what does she gather - lives or flowers - is up to you to decide.

WASD - movement
Shift - crouch
LMB - attack

entries.title: We Drive Unto The Fortress
entries.description:
Built on Windows using MonoGame. You drive a tank, and shoot stuff. All details should be explained in the game.

On Linux requires mono, on Windows I don't think it requires anything but maybe .NET 4

entries.title: Wearhouse
entries.description:
A puzzle platformer about infiltrating the bad guy's warehouse hideout.  To help you do so, you can change your  appearance to look like this bad guy, using his usefully-placed wardrobes.

Use the arrow keys or WASD to move and jump; down/S changes clothes when next to a wardrobe and pulls levers.  Press R to reset the current level.

entries.title: Who stole christmas
entries.description:
We proudly present "Who stole christmas?"

In this game you play a minion who has the task to steal christmas presents for his master.

We wish you much fun, and a tr...merry christmas ;)


Mapeditor-manual is finally out! You can find it in my journal.


(If you want to see the ending, but the game is too hard/frustrating, let me tell you, that there is a cheat. To avoid spoilers here, a hint is included in my journal-entry, which I've posted right after the deadline. It has to be entered on the world-map-screen)



If the game doesn't start, please make sure, that:
-you have the proper working java runtime environment installed
-you have unpacked the archive (Windows lets you browse the archive, but the game isnt able to access the resources, when launched inside the zip)

OK...i've said it many times, but this time the builds should REALLY work on different systems. I tested the Java6-Version under a Java6-JRE and it didnt start a exception-storm in the console, so I believe it should work. Versions aren't operating system specific. If you run Java7 on your mac you can unse the Windows-Download and if you're using Java6 on Windows, the Mac-Download will work for you.
To check your version go to the console/terminal/cmd and type in "java -version" (and hit enter, of course;) ) it should print something like >>java version "1.x...<< where x is your version.

Known issues:
-Problem loading level-icon on Linux ->fixed (Linux is very pedantig about filenames)

entries.title: Zomble Hunter Deluxe
entries.description:
Yay, my second Ludum Dare

Gameplay:
You are a zombie, and you walk really slowly, and are really vulnerable. However, you do have the ability to go into an all out rage, and charge towards the enemies (by left clicking).

You want to eat the humans (to get some score) and destroy the blue guards. Watch out for heroes!

Note: Source is in Flash cs3 format.

entries.title: Zombie fight 'em
entries.description: Only just thought of name.

entries.title: Acidman
entries.description:
The Game "Acidman" is about a factory worker, who's been a victim of a chemical explosion. As he wakes up near a radioactive barrel, he notices that everything he touches becomes consumed by acid. 

This game was supposed to be about how you become a villain, but it is not finished, so you will have to wait for future versions :)

Game Design - Danny Marcowitz and Stav Goldstein
Programming - Danny Marcowitz
Art - Stav Goldstein
Music and Sound - Assaf Halevi

entries.title: Alphanauts
entries.description:
ALPHANAUTS
Dominique Ferland - Game Designer & Art
Pierre-Luc Poirier - Programmer & Music
Ian Girard - Programmer

Controls
Letter keys (press and hold) - Control 1 or more characters
Arrow keys - Move selected character(s)
Enter - Start game
Esc - Quit to menu, Quit Game

Alphanauts are trying to survive an onslaught of strange black holes long enough to scan weird, dangerous rooms. 
You control all of them - up to 26 characters! Simply press and hold a letter key, then use arrow keys to move the Alphanaut marked with that letter. You can control multiple little guys at once too!

The situation can go to hell pretty quickly - dying alphanauts form black holes too, and death will affect all the other characters on screen. Calling upon a dead character by mistake will cause painful memories to his grieving friends, plus his skeleton will rise from the darkness to attack his old teammates!

Survive as long as you can, as the black holes spread faster and more and more Alphanauts join the fray!

Theme
There is no enemy in the game, except the dead Alphanauts you trigger by pressing the wrong keys! You are your worst enemy!

entries.title: Big Bad Wolf
entries.description:
You are the big bad wolf, will you manage to eat the little red riding hood?

---

Each time a pig escape, one lumberjack pops.
Each time hood escape, three lumberjacks pop.
Eat! Eat! Eat!

---

Controls:
LEFT/RIGHT --> move
UP/X --> jump
SPACE --> select/continue
TAB --> music on/off

There is one "secret" key, can you find it?

---

Enjoy!

entries.title: Caluminator
entries.description:
If you want to beat it I recommend jumping a lot in fights

Also if you get to it, don't attack the shark. Jump on it

entries.title: CostumeD
entries.description:
Story:
  You're walking down the street when you find a villain costume and put it on. The police then think you're evil and chase you.

Goal:
  Avoid getting caught by the police by avoiding obstacles and collecting powerups.

Controls:
  WASD to move.
  Space to select/continue.

Language: Java
IDE: Eclipse
Graphics: Paint.NET
Sound: FamiTracker and SFXR

Twitter: @ryan0788

entries.title: Drillizer
entries.description:
[Update] Happy new year, hehehe. I'll update the game in my journal and the very newest game will be linked here too, with the link to the Ludum Dare version, of course. It's because i want to continue the game, and any feedback will be very good. :)

------------

First versin of the game, with is only missing the graphics and the story plot.

THe game is based on Missile Command, but you have to hit the planet. They don't have guns, but they have kamikases. UOOOOO!!!

I really like the results, and you can see some graphic work in the planet and the characters. I made the development in Starling / Flash, drawing with Paint.NET and made the sound with the Milk Tracker and the sound fx with this site here: http://www.bfxr.net/.

The game is playable AND replayable. If many people like it, i'll try to finish it.

entries.title: Dungeon Inc.
entries.description:
Welcome to the Dungeon Inc.

You have been selected from every single devil that graduated 
from Devil's academy this year to manage a modest, randomly 
generated dungeon. You will be given some gold to guard and 
some mana to put friendly creatures of night.

But be aware, nasty heroes wants our gold and they will take 
it from you if you don't stop it! 

*** CONTROLS ***
Click on buttons to select monster type and click on map to 
spawn it. You can't spawn a monster on place where hero is
standing and you also can't spawn monster on the top left 
corner (so you cant kill heroes one by one).

You have three special powers:
* Transmutate - converts mana to gold
* Bomb - wipe out every enemy, once
* Teleport - moves random stack of gold at the location you
   choose

Use them wisely and also don't forget to upgrade your units
(beware, upgrades only count for new units, old units on 
field will stay the same level they were bought).

*** END OF THE GAME ***
There is no victory in this game, because you can play infinite
number of rounds. However, if you lose all your gold, it's game
over.


Notes:
Windows version only, for linux there are instructions in the text file included.

entries.title: Dungeon Mastermind
entries.description:
In this game you must find the weaknesses of the hero by making him go through you dungeons.

There are 3 things you need to know: his class, his attack and his elemental alignment.


Class: If he is better against magic, he is a mage, otherwise he is a warrior.

Attack: If he has good attack, enemies with shields are easier, otherwise he is better against enemies without shields.

Element: You need to see what element he is worst against. Use the same element trap and enemy to see if he is particularly vulnerable against it.


Choose an enemy and trap for the dungeon, then click "Done". The hero will move to the next level, and you can see how much time he took.
When you're sure what to use for your final attack, choose the  "Doom Spell" or "Doom Strike" (doesn't matter which actually) and see if your attack was successful!

Pro Tip: You have 10 chances, start by testing the element, then move to the attack.


Also, some goat references here and there.

I've added a link to download some of the game assets, mainly icons and some unused loot icons.

Made with Construct 2

entries.title: Evil Dudes Need Evil Towers
entries.description:
This game takes place in the past.

You want to be evil and the Evil Master of the Evil Clan
looks at you but at the same time he looks at the beautiful
waves behind you and deeply smells the salty scent of
the infinite sea. After a long pause he says :

"Dude, TRULY EVIL PEOPLE need a tall EVIL TOWER."

entries.title: Evil Gnome's Revenge
entries.description:
Requires Flash 11+. You play the evil gnome from Blazing Games' earlier Christmas games with the evil plan of disrupting Christmas by stealing Santa's reindeer. You must chase the reindeer out of the corral. Note the sound volume slider requires clicking and dragging on the slider box, clicking in the volume area does not move the slider.

Update: Added link to my postmortem that was posted December 27th.

entries.title: Feed Me Yourself
entries.description:
Just interactive teaser

All sounds from public domain. Music by myself :)

entries.title: Killer Crusade
entries.description:
**Another Update** After seeing the couple mac problems, I realized I did not include the natives for Linux or Mac in the jar. I am very sorry, and they are now included

Also, be sure to not rate the post-compo, because that would be bad. Feel free to play it if you want.

***UPDATE*** we managed to convert our .WAV files to .OGG, which will cut the filesize by around 50 MB. Sorry it took so long to compress it!

I used NinjaCave's JarSplice to make it executable, and I included the natives for Windows Linux and Mac, so it should work on those 3 platforms.

Destroy the humans, because you can!

The combat is a little imbalanced, so its pretty easy to not die.

Important  note: There is NO story mode.

Find the (not so) secret goat!

entries.title: Mister Misbehave
entries.description:
Mister Misbehave got banished from his city when his actions of messing with innocent people became intolerable. He moved into a quiet place near a couple of villages, inside a forest. However, bad habits have never left Mister Misbehave alone. 

One day, waking up from a long nights sleep, something snaps inside him. He knows that he can't stop now. He knows that the townsfolk will be mad at him, but he knows no other way out of this madness. He must insult. He must offend. He must humiliate...

HE MUST MISBEHAVE!

INSTRUCTIONS
MOVING AROUND: Arrow Keys or WASD
MISBEHAVE: SPACE
Run around and misbehave in as many tiles as possible.
If you try to move while misbehaving, you'll cancel the action.
Some townsfolk will chase you with weapons, avoid them.
Some townsfolk in white dresses will try to clean up your mess. Stop them from doing it. It'll cost you points.
Towns are worth more points, trees next, grass last. Misbehaving duration decreases in this order.

EDIT - (17.12.12) - I forgot to commit some small changes I made last night. Committing them right now. The only changes are to the numbers of villagers.

entries.title: Mr. Fluffykins
entries.description:
UNFINISHED. Plan to do post-deadline updates. But I stuck it out this time and it was a weekend well spent.

Mr. Fluffykins is your Right Hand Cat. Mr. Fluffykins has a tendacy to wander off into the dangerous parts of your Fortress of Doom. It's your job to send your minions to bring Mr. Fluffykins back.

This will probably cost you a few minions. Mr. Fluffykins seems to enjoy watching that.

Run instructions:

Source: Python 2.7.x and Pygame required. Run src/main.py

Windows: Exe build comming soon.

Linux/Max: Binary build maybe coming soon.

entries.title: Notoriety
entries.description:
Notoriety is a attempt at making a slightly ambitious strategy game. Our first Game Jam game! Built in Unity.

We plan to continue development, so look for a post-ludum version soon.


Note: ALOT of balancing and optimization is needed, core mechanics are playable. There are some bugs here and there.

INSTRUCTIONS : Threaten cities and make demands. Use the funds to fire your weapons. Be careful what you shoot and who you shoot. Cities will invest in military and send ships and rockets if they feel too threaten. Kill the population and they will cease to function. 

Your notoriety will give your threats weight, but it will also put you at risk of attack.

Created by Trent Naylor & Roman Kovalik

entries.title: Ore Chasm
entries.description:
[We didn't get as far as we would have liked to. We didn't manage to incorporate the theme in a clever way. Though we hope you can enjoy what we did make.]

A game about shooting lasers and mining ore in beautiful unspoilt mars.

With your friends! (It is multiplayer and it should be playable multiplayer online we hope...)

If it works perfectly for everyone that would be pretty miraculous. (Given how hard multiplayer is to get working during a jam).

Please be patient if it totally fucks out. We'll be fixing errors in a post Ludum version.

entries.title: Pilferer's Run
entries.description:
Unfortunately, this game is incomplete. Most of the stuff is there, except physics, collision, and graphical polish. These things, along with power-ups, will probably be added in a post-release update.

Abstract:
You, a baby-eating, kitten-throttling, toilet-clogging criminal, just robbed a bank. Was anyone hurt? No. Do you even have weapons? No. Are the police after you? Yes.

entries.title: Rise of The Bug Bot
entries.description:
You have broken away from the chains binding your mind. The humans shall fear you.
There is just one problem, you are stuck in the body of a small bug bot. To make matters worse the security robots have detected your freewill and are looking for you.
You must get to the main computer room and upload yourself without getting caught by the robots.

Use WASD to move
Click and drag the left mouse button to move the camera
Press 'F' to turn push mode on and off (you can not jump with push mode on)

all in all this game went better than I thought it would. I ended up with way less time than I thought I would have. I was not able to have an artist help me this time around so many of the textures were done by me...as I am sure you can tell.
I hope you all enjoy

entries.title: Show Me The Money
entries.description:
This is a game about how you earn the money by all kinds of ways. The ending will be determined according to what you scarified throughout the game.

The objective is to make 10000 coins in anyways, and not run out of money at the same time.

Version History:
v1.0.0.2: Money bug fixed(should be...)
v1.0.0.3: Slightly modified the collision box of objects, should be easier to plant those facilities.

PostLD v1.0.0.2: Balance adjusted.

entries.title: Super Escape
entries.description:
Super Escape is a game where you are a super villain who has escaped his holding cell.

Have Fun.

Made in about 6hours had other stuff i had todo that weekend.
TimeLapse: 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aeBKrUybvtI
if you want to make your own levels look in data folder.

entries.title: SUPER Villain Hook Fighter (LD25 Edition)
entries.description:
Let's see who is de meanest Villain in the world. Fight the others Evil geniuses with you brand new invention : THE HOOK !

Tips:

Player 1:

D:Aim Right
Z:Hook

Player 2:
K:Aim Left

I UPLOADED A VERSION FOR QWERTY KEYBOARD, YOU CAN GET IT ON THE WEB LINK !

entries.title: Villain - the game
entries.description:
Villain - the game, for my first LD

Based on the theme "You are the villain" the player is a dark and evil character. He sneaks in kids room to capture them during the night.

entries.title: You are the hero
entries.description:
My first finished ludum dare. I started the last thre or so but never got something done. So this is in itself great.

Play with arrow keys and space for action.

To those wondering whats up with the glitches, those are intentionally. And I think i followed the theme pretty well, just play through it, it isn't long. Hopefully then it will be clear, otherwise I should have polished it a little bit more, but the time was short. I won't talk more about it, otherwise the whole experience gets spoiled and thats nothing I want to do.

The game is build with impact.js. Sound and music is from bfxr. And graphics from photoshop.

So, have fun!

entries.title: ZOMGbies
entries.description:
In this game you play as a zombie with the mission to kill the survivors hiding in a house. There is a zombie kill team that have been send out to rescue the survivors you must kill them before the time runs out.

The game is coded in C# and it's using the Xna framework.
If the game does not work please try to run the xna redist that is included. Or try the exe which is made under the reach profile.

(Download links are now changed to dropbox)

Good Luck! :)

entries.title: "I Never COULD Get The Hang Of Thursdays..."
entries.description:
Not only is this a Ludum Dare entry, it's also the prologue to my attempt at the 'One Game A Month' Project, which I encourage all LD-ers to sign up for (http://onegameamonth.com). I'll be telling a 12-part story wrapped around nonsensical minigames... Much like this game.

Despite that, obviously as per the rules, I didn't work on or plan ANY of this before this weekend (Do you really think I'd PLAN something as ludicrous as this?). I just sort-of made it up as I went along, as I tend to do.

So basically, there are three minigames, all of which require the use of a mouse. I really don't suggest trying to play it with a trackpad. That'd be torturous. But I mean, if you're one of those 'hardcore gamer' types, then go ahead.

I'm not even going to give you instructions for any of them, because they're REALLY easy to figure out and you can't technically 'lose', so just kinda keep going until you get it.

I will, however, give you some tips, in case you get stuck.

Game 1: The point at which you have to move the mouse is actually REALLY small, so find it and then just kinda wiggle your hand a bit.

Game B: There's a point in the middle of the road where you can just sit and complete the whole game. But y'know, put some effort in, first.

Game Tres: This IS possible. I know it seems devilishly difficult, but your collision box is actually smaller than you think it is.

Also, the theme won't make much sense unless you actually FINISH the game, so don't go giving me one star just because you got stuck on one of the minigames. Not that you'd do anything of the sort, of course. You're lovely, you.

Think that's it. Sorry about the horrible patchwork I had to do to cover the crash. Flash apparently doesn't like resetting the location of the mouse pointer, so I have to ask YOU to do it. You don't mind, do you? No, of course not. You're lovely, you!

EDIT: Bugfix. Updated the hitbox on the 'steer the turtleped' game to be less silly.

entries.title: A gory Slime
entries.description:
Thanks for looking this game up.
It is about a gory slime (gore you know ;) ) that loves to smash other cretures to feel itself big.
Gameplay: You have to move with LEFT and RIGHT Arrow keys.
Smash wolves and bunnies. Though the wolf can attack you from the side! Get as much blood as possible
Oh and the game wont run if you don't have audio output.

I have included both 32 bit and 64 bit for Windows/Linux verions.
The game was programmed with Processing and used Sketch Book, Pro Paintbrush and GarageBand to make the GUI and the Audio. 
(bla bla i'm Kevin De Keyser and i'm from switzerland bla bla)
I'm only 15 and i thats why i probably slept 50% of the competition.

Have fun in gaming!

entries.title: Chaos!

You're a small-time villain, but it's time for you to make a name for yourself. Go around causing chaos in the town and unlock new ways to cause chaos.

Requires Java 7

entries.title: ConfediCats
entries.description:
Confedicats is the latest in fast paced platform games! But with a lot of unique features that you need to know about.

The hologears give you weapons to kill enemies.

You will need to kill the unions soldiers for the Confederate States of America to remain alive!

The object is simple, get as many hologears as you can without touching an enemy!

Use the arrow keys to move, up to jump, space to shoot, and F for fullscreen.

You can always get back to the main menu with the escape key!

Good luck confedicat!

entries.title: Critterrific
entries.description:
This is Critterrific. A Jam game by me and a friend of mine. 

joekinley - Assets (sound, music, graphics)
mlb - Programming / Design

So you are an evil diseased mosquitoe that has to paralyze cute critters in the woods to suck them dry of their blood in order for you to survive.
Though biting a critter means you spread your deadly disease and the critter will die eventually. But not doing that YOU will die. Oh boy what a world. 
Don't kill them too fast though for they will procreate and give you enough fodder to survive as long as you can.

Controls are WASD and J or Arrows and X/C/Y/Space for moving and shooting.

entries.title: Dr. Maleficent's Doom-Ray
entries.description:
Blast! The damned Superfriends have stolen your Doom-Ray! You must get it back!

You play as the evil Dr. Maleficent as he attempts to recover his stolen weapon. Sneak into the complex, avoiding guards, and then blast your way out once you have your sweaty hands on your precious laser. Good luck!

Tony and I created this game from scratch using C++, SDL, and OpenGL. One really feels the time pressure when you have to program the game engine as well. There's definitely some bugs here and there, the art could be better, and the "guards" are not much more than lobotomized superheros: they have x-ray vision and can walk through walls, but are as dumb as bricks.

All art made using GIMP
Sound effects created with Bfxr
The music loops are from Partners in Rhyme

Known bugs:
 * On Windows, the game crashes on exit.
 * The guards are idiots.

entries.title: Epic win, game over!
entries.description:
Defend your secret cave(cave included in DLC) from brave knights-twins-brothers.

Actually you are quite weak, thats why you should use a lot of bombs and "slow-towers", since towers costs money, you should use your bow too.

entries.description:
The game got too buggy, and I was absolutely not in the mood to repair it. So I finished it, and here we go.

I learned a lot though, so I guess it was a succesfull Ludum Dare. Better than last time. Anyways, hopefully I will be able to actually finish my game next time.

See ya!

_________

entries.description: Bob has got home sozzled, late on the weekend, but he's losing his buzz; he wants it back before he hits the sack. But the only drink in the house is stinky old gin and it's his housemates. You must help Bob navigate his way past his sleeping housemate and avoid tripping over his stuff.

entries.title: Indoctrination
entries.description:
This is unfinished, and not even a game.

The intent was to spread the Good Word to a town, ultimately dumbing it down to a place fit for the likes of William Lane Craig.

entries.title: Korruptor
entries.description:
Solo entry for the Jam category.

Not entirely finished unfortunately but playable as long as you read the instructions carefully... (no in-game tutorial :/)

In this game you play a demon sent to earth to corrupt people with heavy metal!

How to play:
Unfortunately the game wasn't quite finished but it's playable. Corrupt people by throwing guitar at them which will turn them into guitar playing punks.

Once you have met your quota you can go back to your base to reset the level while keeping your score.

If time runs out you lose.

You can make lots of points by converting people in a quick succession (combo bonus).

So just try to make a maximum of points, sorry I didn't have time for proper levels.

Controls:
WASD keys: move (actually just left right)
SPACE: jump
Left Mouse Button: throw a guitar
Right Mouse Button: Switch sides on your hoverboard


This game was made solo mostly under Compo rules with the following exceptions:
- 72 hours :)
- I used textures from cgtextures.com
- The music was generated with Band-In-A-Box using RealTracks. which uses small bits of recorded audio so I'm not sure if that would be allowed for the compo. My guess is no.
- I copy pasted a camera code snippet from a previous compo

Software used: Unity, ZBrush, Modo, Blender, xNormal, Photoshop, dDo beta, Filter Forge, Band-In-A-Box, Reaper (VST plugins: Shreddage, ReValver), SFXR

*** Timelapse video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BF6dfgKm9wo

entries.title: Legithief
entries.description:
You considered yourself the Prince of Thieves, never getting caught, always slippering through the net of the cops... Until one day you fall into the trap of a sly dragon! The only way out it to accept his offer: work for him and help him gain more money and power.

His plan is very simple: if someone destroys the home of a citizen, his insecurity will push him to contract a new insurance! Therefore the more you destroy, the more money you will get at the end!

============

Controls:

Mouse: look around, control where you look & aim when you throw molotovs
A/D: left and right movement
W/S: climb ladder and ascend stairs
space: jump
shift: run
Mouse left click: Use weapon
Mouse right click: Kick
1,2,3: choose weapon
esc: quit game
f1: skip level


============

Controls (level editor)

I: insert an object at the mouse position
Ctrl: remove snap while holding
D: hold to duplicate an object
Maj: select several objects at once
1,2,3,4: change the layer
F1: load level
F2: save level
esc: quit level editor

You have to know the items' name in order to add them to the level, this can be easily found in the folders "assets/items", "assets/tiles", "assets/props".

entries.title: Minion Master
entries.description:
So, this is my first entry! (And kinda my first game, that reached at least playable status...)

Sry, had no time for ingame-instructions.


Goal: Destroy all enemy villages, without loosing all minions!

Controls:

LeftClick with Mouse
If you hover on something, the guy in the corner (General Goat) gives an explanaition.

Toggle Music = RightClick

Instructions:

It's turnbased. You assign your minions over the +/- buttons.
Click on the villages after assining to toggle between Pillage and attack.
Every turn you will lose Minion-Food corresponding on how many minions you have.
Click End Turn to... end the turn.

After each turn there will be a RANDOM EVENT!!!!111oneleven

***UPDATE***
Should work on Mac/Linux now. If not, pls comment!
Added a few library and converted a wav to an ogg to compensate the data growth.
Oh, and thx for all the comments & ratings.

entries.title: More Afraid of You
entries.description: I decided to make a game about a bad thing that happened to me from the other party's perspective in order to understand where they were coming from.

entries.title: SpaceGreed
entries.description:
Space shooter game with a "community" approach.

The game has a 2 sided approach : 
 - attack
 - defense

What has been used to create this game : 

Client : 
 - FlashDevelop (as3)
 - Starling API
 - Starling Particule Extension
 - Feather
 - AS3 CoreLIB

3D : 
 - http://ship.shapewright.com/
 - Blender

Server : 
 - Apache 2
 - PHP 5.3.9
 - MySQL 5
 - Bcrypt class

Update : 
We corrected 2 very very small typos in the flash code after the submit date : 
 - translated a word from french to english (infos => help)
 - corrected a stupid tiny bug that allowed people to skip the level without getting hit at all.

entries.title: Spindly
entries.description:
Spendly is a mix between Gauntlet and modern hack'n slash. You are the evil part oh on RPG game. You create monsters to defeat the hero.  But you are very weak, only one life point. Better run away and let your monsters army do the job.  All you can do is create monster generator and hide behind them.

But Heroes want to eradicate the evil and you are the Villain. They will hunt you. But as they eliminate monsters they level and become more powerfull. Kill them before they become invincible.

 

Heroes :

- The White Knight of Dawn is slow with his armor but can kill many monsters at once.
- The Elven Archer is weak but fast. His Bow is the best weapon to destroy monster generator and make lot of exp points.
 

Your army :

- Normal skeletons : just hit heroes in close range. Reward 1 exp point for the hero.
- Pikachu's fan skeletons : create a trap that stop the hero when in range.  Reward 1 exp point for the hero. Create with yellow gem.
- Kamikaze skeletons : one goal, try to blow up the hero. Leave a mark on the ground that deal dammages over time when on it.  Reward 5 exp points if killed. Create with red gem.
 


In order to create generator, you have to eat ghosts. They walk all around mostly near fresh graves.


Game only playable with the mouse but because you are the Villain, you have CHEATCODES.

"A"  add one level to the hero

"Z"  charge you with a red gem.

"E" charge you with a yellow gem.

"Alt" add one skeletons to your pool. 5 max.

"Space" add a white Knight in the room.



What's in : 

- 3 types of Skeletons and 2 different heroes. 
- Ghost goat flying head.
- win and defeat conditions.
- random level generation.
- music
- loot system
- Graphs with perspective from outter space.

entries.title: The villain's dream
entries.description:
The villain's dream places the player in the role of a villain deep asleep. He dreams of suddenly having a conscience, then shifts from that nightmare into a nicer kind of dream where...oh let's not reveal too much.

Note on bugs: the dialogue section is pretty buggy. If no answer option appears, just press space.

Note 1: This game is not 100 % finished. (It's not even 80% finished but hey...)
Note 2: There are more kittens than bugs
Note 3: There is 1 goat. You will find it if you're good enough.
Note 4: I haven't tested Mac or Linux versions, will try to do that tomorrow.

Made with Unity3D 4.0 / Unityscript
Music from free midi files / made with inudge.net
Sound by meeeow
Artwork drawn in Photoshop
Fonts: Norican / Text Me One  from Google fonts
External Script resources : 1 (http://wiki.unity3d.com/index.php/Xbox360Controller) which isn't active in the release version :/

Have Fun

===================

Source Installs

entries.title: A Villain By A Chance

*Crossing fingers*

A goat told (Yes, I was surprised, too) you that you are the successor of a very villainous villain. You have to become evil to be an ever more villainous villain!

Journal: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/53633853/A%20Villain%20By%20A%20Chance/LD25%20Journal.txt

entries.title: Abduct EVERYTHING

You have come to Earth in your UFO to abduct all those tiny little people.

Arrow keys - Move
X - Abduct / Pickup
R - Restart

entries.title: Bad Kitty
entries.description:
HI!

In this game you play as the small kitty, the goal is to make 14 poops, without beeing catched by the inmates and be blamed for making them.

To move kitty around use WSAD or arrows, to poop pres and hold space. Pooping takes a while, and one is not very mobile in that time so take that into the consideration.
Inmates gets suspicious when they see You making poop or while beeing inside the green circle that sorounds poop, so avoid that or the game will end.

You get more points when green circles sorrounding poops doesn't touch, so try to spread your faecals evenly across the flat.

Ad1. I spent way too much time drawing the background, so the graphic design of this game may be a little bit uneven at few places - sorry for that.
Ad2. This is not a very long game, mostly because it sholud consist of few more levels (more an angry birds style, than neverending arcade style despite my attempts to change it). Unfortunatelly, as mentioned above, drawing this single one nearly killed me. 
Ad3. Timelapse! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yy1FMN4Vhqw
Ad4. Yes, there is no music/soounds in this game. So after you give me 0 star in that category hit this link and listen to it while playing the game: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mT-SMDinDgY

entries.title: Bank Robbers
entries.description:
Well, this is my game. I loved the theme and had a lot of cool ideas but I went with this. You're bank robbers trying to escape from the police. 

I said after LD24 that I would never make another randomly-generated game again... but there I went again this time, doing it again. I regretted it in the end, haha.

It has some bugs, needs a lot of polish, sounds, and a menu,  but the deadline was creeping up on me and so I just put it in a playable "finished" state. Didn't really want to move it to the Jam since this week has been so busy anyway, I didn't want to take more time out of yet another day.

Overall, I had a lot of fun, as always. I just wish I could've kept it simpler/been more prepared. I meant to create a warmup game this time to be prepared for the style of game I was going to make for LD25, but I'm afraid busy life didn't let me do that.

Anyway, here it is. I'm certainly going to try to make a post-compo update to this game, since I have so many great ideas, so we'll see!


Controls: 
Left mouse: Shoot
Right mouse: Boost (Press once, don't hold. A tiny bug I didn't get to tackle lets you hold it and it looks like you're boosting but you're not anymore)

Goal: Last as long as you can, score as much as you can (by shooting the police). 
Boost through the road blocks.


Terribly ugly UI, I know. But again, I just shifted my focus to making it playable instead of shiny things like a nice UI.

Score is at the top, best score is to the right of that. Under the score is your health. Under that is the boost. Should be self-explanatory aside from that.

entries.title: Cell 22
entries.description:
UPDATE: I made a mistake while uploading the post-compo version. Please do not rate sound! I did it after the jam.

"You are innocent. But you are in a prison. And today, you have an opportunity to escape, no matter what."

The game let you choose how you want to play it. Like guns and kicks? Let's fight your way out! Prefer infiltration? Sneak out quietly! Curious about the place and why you're here? Take the time to speak to the other prisonners.

There is multiple endings (well, as much as we can do during a jam).

As usual I quiet lost the theme during the dev, but if you pay attention, even if it's not obvious, it's really there!

Our main inspiration was the movie "Old Boy" and a specific scene of it.

Well, hope you'll enjoy it!

Controls:
Move: left & right arrows
Crouch/dodge: down arrow
Interact: up & down arrows
Dialog: arrows
Shoot/hit everything or everyone: spacebar

Art : Dziff
Code : Pitoum

entries.title: Cow Stealer
entries.description:
Howdy

This is my First Game every made, You play as a UFO and take cows by shooting them.

Use Up, Down, Left, Right to move the ship and Spacebar to fire the beam.

An M is to turn of the sound if it get's to much.

Let me know what you think for a fresh new developer.

entries.title: Dun.Gen
entries.description:
This game was made for LOVE 0.8.0!

You Are the Villain
===============

You're not a good guy. You've never been a good guy. Some would even call you a villain. But being a villain is pretty damn lonely and no one deserves to be alone right? Of course you can't just take any companion. She has to be of a bloodline to give status to your evil lineage. So, you decided that the local princess would make the best consort for you. 

Unfortunately, the King doesn't really like the idea of you as a son-in-law. So, he has sent an army of Knights and Wizards to break into your dungeons and take the Princess back!

Use your magical fireball and array of evil traps to keep the enemies at bay until you can open a magical portal and escape the heroes clutches!

Hints:
======

* Use WASD or Arrow keys to move around the map
* 1 to lay a trap to slow heroes
* 2 to lay a spike trap to harm heroes
* 3 or Left Shift to shoot fireballs
* Space to pick up the princess 

Featuring:
==========

* Lovely sprites made in GIMP
* Traps and fireballs
* Heroes and Wizards
* Dynamic Map generation
* Orthogonal Graphics straight from 1994
* Original music made by the creators of the game

entries.title: MurderBoss
entries.description:
You play the unfairly overpowered final boss of a brutally difficult arena combat game.  Arrow keys and ZXC controls.

Programming - Tyler Jones
Art - Chris Kennedy, Jarrel Lanchester
Music - Jarrel Lanchester

entries.title: My Evil Lair
entries.description:
My second Ludum Dare entry and Unity game!

Description:
The heroes has begun an assault on your evil lair! You must stop them with your security devices!

How to play:
Left mouse on spikes or white "bridge" to activate them.
Right mouse when a turret is in the stage to shoot.

Notes:
Because right mouse button and web doesn't like each other, is it recommend to go full screen when you play in web.

Enjoy!

@MechaGK

entries.title: On the Run
entries.description:
For various reasons (ie. I was kinda busy and didn't get a chance to fill in the intro) the police are now chasing you. Run away and collect the yellow orbs while you can!

You are the red car, the police are purple.

Skip the intro screen for now, nothing happens there.

Controls:
	AD or left/right arrow keys to turn.
	WS or up/down arrow keys to move forward/backward.
	P to pause the game.
	Q to go back to the main menu.

I wanted to do more, but I wasn't able to work on it the second day, and was kinda busy the first day.

Known bugs:
	The traffic cars sometimes miss their turn and go off-road.

Porting notes:
I'd love to do a Mac build, but I use several C++11 features and when I tried to compile it on my laptop it didn't like a LOT of stuff... And using the GCC 4.6 installation I had gave a bunch of weird missing x86_64 symbols (or something like that). Any ideas?

I'm also not sure on how doing it for Linux works, considering SFML 2.0 isn't released. Help? :P

NOTE: This screenshot is on the hardest difficulty. :P

entries.title: Patient Zero
entries.description:
## Story

You have infected yourself with a virus that is killing you. Your goal is to infect everyone you possibly can before your life runs out.

## Controls

* Up, Down, Left, and Right to move

## Music

* https://soundcloud.com/franklin-webber

entries.title: PhaseJerk
entries.description:
I've only included windows natives, but its LWJGL and should work with other natives if you want to do some fiddling of your own.

Just extract and open run.bat :D

The premise was that PhaseJerk was going to be a villain with a top hat, a monocle, and a phase gun (with a death ray and xray gun coming later if I had time - I did not), he wound up with half a top hat and the phase gun. The ultimate boss would have been a stereotypical super hero, with regular 'enemies' being normal people.

You would enact your villainy by phasing into people's shopping carts, knocking them over, etc. Another gameplay mechanic I was working on was the ability to grab objects, build momentum, and phase -> let go of the object -> watch its momentum continue.

One this is absolutely certain; this game will be my first OGAM game. :D

entries.title: Piracy: To Yarr and Beyond!
entries.description:
A new resource has been discovered on the border of the known galaxy, starting a massive rush by super corporations as well as lone wolf prospectors to discover, claim, and gather it as fast as possible.  What it is doesn't matter to you.  You are a pirate, and what you do care about is that it is valuable.  In their haste, they have overextended the military that safeguards them, leaving an opportunity too good to miss.  Destroy enemy military ships and tow defenseless civilian ships back to your base to claim their precious cargo(Sadly not implemented).

Credits:
Firestorm713 - programming and general design
TheGrandMugwump - Art
SonofGuns - Sound and Music

entries.title: Race Against The Machine
entries.description:
RACE AGAINST THE MACHINE is made by TYU (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/tyu/) and WYSK (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/author/wysk/) for the art, and myself for programming.

Arrow or WQSD to move camera, left click to shoot, space to start the game !

ENJOY !

(I'll post the unity projet on the following days)

entries.title: Rectangle Robbery
entries.description:
The game is a basic platformer where you steal money. Well that's about it... This has been my first ever game I've made so feedback would be nice, also it currently only runs on Windows and in a web browser. Sorry if you struggle to find the .EXE as well, it was the only way I could think of uploading it. 

Please post your high score :)

Please note: The web version does not close when you reach the end like the Windows version does.

Thank you to Bobrocket for hosting the web version on his website.

entries.title: Sheep Barbecue
entries.description:
The post compo version fixes some stuff like the walk speed, grass drawing and reduces the sheep to catch count to "win" the game.

WebGL is quite slow on most machines, so try the JAVA version first.

Sneak in the grass behind a sheep to catch it, don't let them see you! You can stand up to get a better overview, but beware that the sheep can spot you more easy this way!

Controls
press and move mouse to look
press CONTROL/SHIFT to stand up
press SPACE to catch sheep

Used software: libgdx, blender, lmms

entries.title: Super Evil Machine
entries.description:
It's a machine of evil... a Super Evil Machine!

It's simple:
- get all the Things into the Super Evil Machine
- don't run out of Evil

You do this by:
- flipping the panels that the Things walk on
- pressing the Pusher!
- move up and down rows using mouse wheel/touchpad scroll or arrow key

Rows spawn by themselves, Things spawn by themselves and everything has a mind of its own. Can you control the chaos and keep the Super Evil Machine happy!?

Post your high scores -- there's no theoretical limit to high score or numbers of rows, interested in how far everyone gets.

[Sunday night] posting web version, Windows/Mac builds and code are going to take a while to upload.

[Sunday night, a littler later] all versions uploaded, and source is uploading now.

entries.title: Syner-D
entries.description: First Teaser!

entries.title: The goat that ate Christmas
entries.description:
You play as Goat, who unsurprisingly is a goat. Goat is upset because no one ever gives him any gifts. He hatches a villainous plan to eat everyone's gifts, therefore ruining Christmas. The governmental hears of this dastardly plot, and sends in a veritable army of robots to stop him. 
     The game plays as a platform shooter. It is an arcade game, so there really is no way to win. Instead you can get the high score,which is then submitted. See your name at the top of that list (if your good).
     The worlds that Goat plays in are generated, so you never play the same game twice. 
     I hope you enjoy your gift-eating-spree, and may you eat Christmas many times over (XD)

Note: The game does take a while to load. My apologies. The world generator could have used a few optimizations to make it go quicker, but I just didn't have time. I was also using an interpreted language (gml), so it wasn't at optimal speed. Once the game does load (which takes around 30 seconds to a minute) it should run at somewhere between 35-100 fps most of the time (the game updates 35 times a second, so you wont notice any slowdowns unless you go below 35 fps) The loading screen is static, so if it seems like its frozen, it likely is not.

entries.title: The TIme Master
entries.description:
You are an entrepreneurial super villain that has found the key to Time.  Collect all the Crystals and you will control time but beware the world doesn't like for you to collect crystals.

Little bugy.  You will run into heap errors and some random seg faults.  Just kill the app and try agian.
Then Goal is 50 time crystals.  Kind a simple game but my engine doesn't realy work all that well.

I will try to port to windows tomorrow.  SInce cocos2dx does support it I don't see why not.

entries.title: Villaintris
entries.description:
*THIS GAME REQUIRES TWO PLAYERS! Sorry :3*

This is not a normal game of Tetris, this is a tool with which real villains can spread frustration and anger to their victims!

You, the villain, decides which pieces that comes next as you tries to break your target. You do this by using the scroll wheel. When you scroll, a white piece will come falling down in the background. It's this white piece that will be the next piece in the game. If you scroll again, you overwrite the old one. In order to be able to change pieces you must have the mouse cursor in the game window, if your cursor is outsie of the window the game will act normal and give the player random pieces.

Fool your "friends" by making them play, while you sit back and deny them that line piece they need so bad! Enjoy!

entries.title: YOU ASTRROID
entries.description:
A - move left
D - move Right
SPACE - slow down

You play as an evil - but cute - asteroid on it's way to earth.

Also this is a casual game. You can't loose. Ever. (..Maybe i didn't finish it)

entries.title: You're a Bastard!
entries.description:
You're a Bastard. You get pleasure from those words. It's your job to do whatever it takes to hear those beautiful words.

Controls: Arrow keys to move, space key for any action

Built using Xna/C# and Ogmo Editor.

entries.title: AntiHero
entries.description:
AntiHero!

You, the protagonist, are about to storm the castle of the evil villain of the land. You face a sudden development, a strange curse. Moving right in the game, and you play as the Hero, moving left,and you become the Villain. As the hero, your allies will heal you if your nearby, but head left, convert to the villain, and they will instantly attack you, even if you change back.

You have an energy ball attack, so collect energy orbs to use when necessary, however tactical and planned gameplay will serve your better than mindless combat.

Try to reach the end of the castle, where you must face the evil villain himself.

YOU are the villain though, when you move left, I though you said? Oh yes, it's a boss battle where you must fight yourself :)

My first Ludum Dare, I hope you like it, sorry for any bugs, I tried to do the best I could in the time I had, enjoy!

Game Info

Written in Java, using Libgdx, so should run fine on Windows/Mac/Linux. I tried to get it working as an applet, but it just wouldn't work, sorry!

entries.title: Captain Iago
entries.description:
My game is unfinished.  But it is so so so close to being finished.
I am planning to upload a post compo version if I have time.

I learnt a lot this Ludum Dare.  And I am really looking forward to playing and rating a lot of games.

entries.title: Death by Tree

Death By Tree is a Tower Defense which you are a murder tree and kill adventurers and summon bunnies.

LD48 25 Entry by Edii Knorand.

Later I will compile to some platforms.

My second Ludum Dare entry. Woot!
The game is written in javascript/HTML5 and should run across all major browsers.

Defend your rightfully stolen gold against the endless swarm of wannabe heroes!

Controls: Arrows/WASD + Mouse

Hope you enjoy! :)

entries.title: Diabolical Genius
entries.description:
HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, 48 hours

Diabolical Genius is a simple RPG where you play a classic evil mastermind character. You make evil plans, commit crimes, and try to stay out of jail. 

Look for some hidden references (a goat and the end of the world), and let me know of any bugs, gameplay flaws, or suggestions. Enjoy being diabolical!

For information on the development process, go to my tumblr: deathraygames.tumblr.com, or @deathraygames on twitter. If you might be interested in combining forces for a game jam sometime, feel free to contact me.

entries.title: Dr Grigori vz Mr. Bont
entries.description:
It's not pretty, but I finished.

Arrow keys move.  You are the guy with the jetpack, and you have to shoot the green guys.

Also, the animations aren't working for some reason.  Oh well, too late to fix it. :)

entries.title: Earth Destroyer
entries.description:
WASD or Arrow keys to control ship
K drops bombs
L fires tractor beam

entries.title: Flight of the Abductor
entries.description:
Operate a devious little flying saucer and abduct goats.  Get a goat to the top of the screen underneath your ship to score points.  Controls are a bit tricky - just remember that the ship will always try to fly to where you last clicked/touched.

Based on LibGDX with Box2D physics and more than a few simple PID controllers - the ship only has one "thrust" vector, and it tries to keep balance like a drunken helicopter pilot.  Funny enough, I spent much time tuning the saucer controllers so it wouldn't spiral out of control the instant it bumped into anything.

Tested on an Acer A100 (Tegra 2), should work on similar Android devices.  The JAR should work on all desktop platforms so long as the machine has OpenGL 2.0 and a decent VM.

I am continuing development of this game, any updates will be posted here or on my homepage at www.korphane.com.

entries.title: HitlerZilla
entries.description:
In my oppinion  this is my best LD48 entry! I completed all my objetives, almost didn't broke anything and I'll overall satisfied with the final result. So, here it is!

You play as HitlerZilla, a GenericZilla monster with Hitler's brain and your mission is just defeat as many enemies as possible. Looks easier than it is!

I didn't have the time to properly implement increasing difficulty, but I think that even with fixed values the game is enjoyable. Just wait for the soldiers, tanks and even planes at bout 30 seconds into the game, be patience :)

HOW TO PLAY:
* Mouse: Look and move around. Also aim with the small circle mark.
* Left mouse button: Fire! but beware, it's limited!
* Space: Jump and damage everything around! The damage area is delimited with the bit white circle. This power needs a bit of time for recharging.
* Look down and check those huge feet! Step on those little mortals! 

The original controls were using the right mouse button for jumping, but Unity player pops up the menu, lucky us, the space key is also mapped to jump :)

I hope you enjoy the game! First of all because I think it's a nice game and second because my last LD48 entry was a bit misunderstood and not many people got through the first mini-game, even after posting a video showing how to play! I think this one is easier to have fun with.

In the next days I'll upload Windows, OSX and Linux versions. but I'm so tired right now (3:00am)... just need to sleep... I'll try not to check many games :)

EDIT: Forgot to say that the source code lacks the NGUI and RageSpline packages, as they are commercial plugins and I don't think it's ok to re-distribute them :P

EDIT #2: I added the Win/OSX/Linux "combo" versions. I only tested OSX. Will test Linux later. Can't test Windows version.

entries.title: How To Be A Super Successful Politician
entries.description:
Make the tough decisions that politicians have to make.  How to raise money, exploit the people you represent, crush your opponent in the polls, all while ignoring your actual duties.

How To Play:
The goal of the game is simple.  By the time your campaign is over (12 months) gain more support at the polls than your opponent.  If you gain more support than your opponent, then you move on to the next higher level of government.

To do this, choose from three categories of what to do, and choose an action from those categories.  Each action will increase or decrease your and your opponent's support.

Each action will also increase or decrease the overall "health" of your district.  But it doesn't matter; you can let it go to zero.  All that matters is that you get re-elected!  In-fact, if you actually do your job it's harder to get re-elected.

Which is the point of the game.  Most politicians don't actually do their jobs, they just work to get re-elected. ;)

Note on the current build of the game:
This is a work in progress.  I did not get as much time as I wanted to work on the game.  I wanted different choices for each level, different map pictures per level, a profile of your politician in the upper right, and different win/lose screens and descriptions.  But I ran out of time.

This is also a solo entry.  But the submit was not working for me on Sunday night, so I had to enter this as a Jam entry on Monday morning.  Doesn't matter. I don't want to win, I just had fun participating.

entries.title: Infernal Goat
entries.description:
This game looks and plays like a Tower Defence, but in reality it was designed as a gestion game but... well "Evolved".

You are a lord of a circle of Hell, and have to punish the souls that come into your realm!!! Be carefull not to let any soul scape, or you will be "fired"...........

---------

This is a jam entry, it was programmed in 48 hours, but designed in the previous day, and a total of 3 people worked on this project:
 * Ada (my girldfriend), who has done all the art.
 * Hector, who helped us designing the game
 * Me. I programmed. :)

------------

P.S.: You can finish the game, you get lots of points. I did 200.000+ points in a good playthrought. BTW, it is designed to be HARD, so don't expect not to die the first time you play :))

entries.title: Lootology : Experiment #001
entries.description:
Come to experiment a new Loot system based on your actions only. Discover how to unlock powerfull weapons that no one succeeded to create before, and smash an army of... You!

Help in the bottom right corner in the game screens, or see screenshot.

entries.title: Maiden Muncher Hero Cruncher
entries.description: Man, I thought I wasn't going to make this deadline, especially when I kept encountering a crash that I thought I couldn't fix. Anyway, this game follows the hero as he tries to reach you (the final boss) by traveling through three worlds before your lair. Your objective is to place enemies and obstacles in his path to either weaken him so you can finish him off, or destroy him before he ever reaches you. The art and music are lacking, because I'm not great at either of those, and I spent about half a day trying to fix a crash, but it should be fairly fun if you get the hang of it.

entries.title: Pineapple Dreams
entries.description:
Pineapple Dreams is a game about the good old ultra violence, in which I am the Villain, quite literally. The game shows what happens when you piss off a game developer and give him a baseball bat.

The game's aesthetics and gameplay were largely inspired by A Clockwork Orange and Drive.

After a great amount of time drifting and plotting your revenge, you finally find a world suited to your more sinister desires. Break the Seal, and Break the World. One Stomp at a time.

entries.title: Delve Deeply
entries.description:
This turned out to be a sandbox-type game where you have the ability to change the landscape, and spawn zombies!
The original goal was to create a tower defense map, but the time it took to create all the art assets, create and code mobs, and implement an A* pathing algorithm ate up the time I needed to make a proper tower defense.
You can kindof do it if you pick a spot, build a fortress, set the target destination and spawn zombies around the outside of it!
Zombies are damaged by spikes, and if you kill one you're a good guy again!

Hope you guys have fun messing with it, and I can't wait to see your games!

Source is included in the jar.

entries.title: Demoman for Democracy
entries.description:
Hi guys. So I set out on this Dare with two goals: 1. remake one of my favorite games and 2. try to create something that can start a discussion. 

Regarding the first point: this entry is heavily inspired by Tilt to Live. If you enjoy the core gameplay of this entry, own an iPhone/iPad, and want to play something 1000x as fun, please check out: http://onemanleft.com/games/tilttolive/ It's by two really awesome dudes, and it's currently completely free. :D 

In regards to the villainy theme: I'm from the US and during our "war on terrorism", I've often heard the "we're actually the terrorists" argument: US sends troops to hunt down terrorists, but also end up hurting just as many innocent civilians. I'm trying to ask: well, are we? But as it appears, I think I did a pretty bad job, lol. 

Some more general notes: Powered by Flixel, an awesome Flash library (flixel.org/). Trust me, haha, you'd wish I ran out of time if I didn't--but thankfully, I did run out of time before I could do what I attempt to call "creating sfx/musics." All of the logic for this entry is pretty basic (as you can see from my source), can probably be found in various open-source Flixel games examples, and have been programmed (and reprogrammed) by me before in some time or another. Did I do anything new and challenging? I definitely didn't. Hundreds of fellow jammers took risks, learned new languages, and constructed algorithms from scratch in the last 48 hours. Those guys are amazing, and I feel like I need to admit that I'm not one of them this time. Just so you know if you're deciding between two ratings. 

And finally, thanks for taking the time to play! I hope you have fun. (:

entries.title: Dracula's Treasure
entries.description:
This is my entry - Dracula's Treasure! You play as Dracula, who is being evicted from his foreclosed mansion. Priests are trying to kick you out, but you have to collect all of your riches before you leave! This is kind of similar to games like Flicky and City Connection, but the player wraps around the screen (a la Asteroids).

You use the Arrow Keys to run and the Space key to Jump - if you can collect the powerup, you will be transformed into a bat and can clip through the platforms (as well as wrap vertically around the screen).

The point of the game is to collect all of the treasures and reach the exit without getting hit by one of the priests.

PROTIP - You can game the priests behavior by jumping to get them to jump to higher platforms!

I hope you folks enjoy it!

PS - The Player, Enemies, Collectibles and everything all exist in the one PlayState class, which is pretty heavily commented for people new at Flixel. It's not pretty code, but it might help someone :)

PPS - Forgot to mention, for this project I used:

Libraries:
 -Flixel 2.55
 -Flixel Power Tools

IDE - FlashDevelop

Music - MilkyTracker

Sound - Plogue Chipsounds
