entries.title: Micro Mob
entries.description:
Micro Mob is a crime simulator for the PC and Mac.

You play as the Mob. You goal is to occupy every square of the city. 

The screen is split in two - the GUI on the left and the City on the right. 

On the left hand side is the GUI which is split into "You" and "The Fuzz" (police). The Fuzz is controlled by the computer AI. 

Under each heading you have two stats to pay attention to; "Gangsters" and "Fresh Blood". Gangsters is the total number of gangsters you have available to distribute to the city squares. Fresh Blood is the number of new gangsters you will receive (every 15 seconds). 

The Fuzz have the same stats but with different terminology. This gives you an insight into how they are doing. 

On the right hand side is the City. The city is divided into 25 squares/zones. A zone can have 1 of 4 states. 

1) Neutral - indicated by the general peaceful appearance of the tile 
2) Occupied by the Fuzz - indicated by the police cars 
3) Occupied by you, the Mob - indicated by a black car, dead bodies, and no pedestrians 
4) Fighting - indicated by the presence of both you and the fuzz and a general state of chaos. 

If you hover over any zone, a badge will be displayed with a number on it. This is the defence value of that zone. To occupy it, you must have enough Gangsters. Click the zone to occupy it. Your number of gangsters will be reduced by the value. 

Additionally, the badge that is displayed when you hover over a zone will help you identify it (orange is neutral, blue is controlled by the fuzz, red is controlled by you, blue and red split down the middle is a fight) 

The Zones all behave a little differently when you try to Occupy them. Lets look at that. 

1) Neutral - trying to occupy this will result in immediate occupation. 
2) Occupied by you - trying to occupy this will remove any gansters already in the sapce and return them to you "Gangsters" count for redistribution. 
3) Occupied by the fuzz - trying to occupy this will result in a fight. Your gangsters will decrement and the zone will change to a fight scene. After 5 seconds the fight will be resolved and you'll either be awarded the zone or the fuzz will. 

Occupy more zones to increase your "Fresh Blood". This in turn will award you more gangsters every 15 seconds. 

-------- Installation ----------

PC Users: Extract the folder anywhere on your computer and double click the run.bat file

Mac Users: Extract the folder. Open a terminal and change to the extracted folder directory. Type ./run.sh

Enjoy the game and I look forward to your feedback :)

entries.title: My First Ping Pong Massacre
entries.description:
The name My First Ping Pong Massacre was randomly generated by the Video Game Name Generator, http://videogamena.me/. It fit the theme and the game surprisingly well. It's very loosely related to ping pong, but very much about a massacre.

Can you find the hidden enemies? It takes cunning and superior firepower to find their dwellings. The only way to tell how successful you were is to count the bodies after the attack, when you're out of ammuniton.

War has never been this fun.

Thanks for everyones feedback! The post-compo version now shows the kills in the game so it's easier to know what you're doing. I'll add audio too. http://pingpong.librador.com

entries.title: My Little World Domination Simulator
entries.description:
So, you've decided your hand at taking over the world without falling into the traps earlier villains have failed at.

All you need to play is either a wheel mouse or a normal two-button mouse and a keyboard, I guess you could make do with a pair of loose up and down arrow keys but that's up to you.

Controls:
Left click and drag minions (They look like hardhats) to perform nefarious acts, dropping a minion on an objective will send him/her out there do your evil bidding.

Right/middle click and drag the world to move your view, due to budget cuts we couldn't afford to stuff the entire world into your screen at once so this'll have to do.

Scroll wheel/up and down keys will let you zoom in and out of the world, to better track your domination.

Escape will bring up the menu if you're in-game and also acts as an abort button if you get cold feet when seeing the menacing main menu.

entries.title: President VS Eevol
entries.description:
Welcome to President VS Eevol!

This is a simple stealth game made by the OmniaRing Team. You are the evil Eevol, and your mission is to kill the President of Goodland in his home in order to retrieve a precious goat.
However, your evil and dangerous antics will be opposed by the President's guard robots. Be stealthy and all will be well. Get hit three times and you must restart the level!

Get the key to unlock the door to the next level.

CONTROLS:

WASD - Movement
K - Drop bomb, activate bomb
L - Dash

Thanks for playing!

Contact @SunShiranui on twitter - http://twitter.com/SunShiranui

entries.title: Rive Gauche
entries.description:
UPDATE: Mac port made by mcc! (more in the comments)

Do you know how much money a pickpocket makes per day in the parisian Metro? Do you think it's an easy job?

All those tourists stunned by the vastness of the city of light, just waiting to be robbed. Dodge the cops and find the most vulnerable crowd, but hurry, summer's coming to an end! HAVE FUN! :D


The game was written in C++ using GLFW, OpenAL and FreeType. All content made with SFXR and Audacity. Music and some SFX taken from freesound.org (all public domain).


Vista upwards. All DLLs are inside the package, but in case it doesn't work try installing 'vcredist_x86.exe' from here: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=30679

CONTROLS: Left click to choose your direction. Clicking on empty space makes you stop. Hold right mouse button to zoom-out.

entries.title: Sabotage
entries.description:
A mean person is trying to blow up a power plant.
That mean person is you.
Avoid security systems and guards.
Move with the arrow keys.

Game made with Stencyl
Graphics made with GIMP
Sound Effects made with SFXR

+1 Goat
NOTE: This game has notably loud soud effects. Please turn your volume down.

entries.title: Space Restaurant
entries.description:
Story line is in the intro of the game, Play play play!

Arrow keys + Left mouse + Right mouse.

Works on Windows,
Works under Wine (linux)

cheers
- @Cellusious

(Used 1 hour on the game)

entries.title: Super Goon
entries.description:
Experience a day in the life of a goon. An art game with a "deep message."

Notes:
-This is my first LD entry ever.
-I can't actually make games.. yet.
-I work full time on Saturdays and Sundays (and Mondays).

entries.title: THE CONDEMNED
entries.description:
Direction keys to look.
Mouse to interact.

Yes, these controls are awkward & frustrating. Thank you to everyone who has taken the time to point that out. (20/12)

Thank you for playing.

entries.title: The last X-MAS
entries.description:
This is my first LD and first game I've ever finished.

It's a VERY VERY hard game to beat, but I hope you enjoy it!



The objective of the game is to finish the 3 levels as fast as possible, with as many points as possible.
You can get points by killing the goblins (shoot or jump on them).
At the end of the first and last level is a boss, after killing the last boss, you finished the game.

Not really a You are the Villain theme, but the last boss is SANTA!...

If the sound doesn't work, you can try the source.

entries.title: The Mimic Virus
entries.description:
Managed to throw something together in the little time I had available.

You are a virus in the blood stream.  Your host's life is always decreasing and you must infect and swap bodies with another host to stay alive.

Constantly infect and swap life with antibodies and try to survive as long as you can.

entries.title: The Unforgiven Wanderers
entries.description:
While this game doesn't entirely fit the theme, I feel it still fits under the broad scope of the competition due to the fact that the player has the option of being evil (which has its own benefits and drawbacks).

In this game, the main objective is to travel across America and deal with survivors. I give the player a number of choices for each possible encounter, along with a way of leveling up and trading items. There are helpful survivors as well as evil bandits that demand items in exchange for your life.

I've tried to make this as entertaining as possible, while also staying true to the original idea. This is inspired by The Walking Dead, Project Zomboid and The Road. Enjoy!

Note: This game was created using Construct 2 and is best played in an updated browser such as Google Chrome.

entries.title: TYRANOFORCE
entries.description:
***About the game

TYRANOFORCE is about the last tyranosaurus coming back to earth in 25XX AD to get the planet back to dinosaurs. However, an intrepid hero is after you. Send your countless minions after him in a reversed bullet hell shoot 'em up style game. 

To win, destroy the Hero until he runs out of lives. Hurry up, because he'll finish the level after a minute !

***How to play

Left or right to move the minion spawner

Hold space to spawn minion ships. The longer you hold it, the stronger the ship you spawn ( for a total of 4 different ships). 

Learn the strength and weaknesses of each ship and swarm the hero till he gets the Game Over he deserves.

*** Extra Notes

The project was ambitious and we couldn't get all the stuff we wanted. Originally we planned that after a minute or so, the player would reach the villain for a final, traditional boss battle. The goal being to reduce his number of lives as much as possible during the level to make the boss fight easier to win for the villain. 

We also wanted to add power ups for the Hero ship: a shield and stronger weapons to make the game more challenging as the level went on. 

We thought of a reversed score system where your goal is to make the Hero have the lowest high score possible by killing him fast enough or by spawning ships he's not able to destroy.

And sadly, the game lacks musics.

***Credits:

Code: Xewlupus
Art: Blob

entries.title: Vampyr (Incomplete)
entries.description:
I played around with a few ideas for the theme of 'villains,' but kept coming back to Vampires. The game was supposed to be a game where you play a vampire in 19th Century England, feeding off the populace and dodging the authorities and other entities that were out to rid you from society. Unfortunately, this weekend was pretty busy so I wasn't able to spend as much time working on the project as I would have liked.

There's not much to the game, but you can run around as a vampire and bite the people that walk around the streets.

Shift gives you super speed, and using space next to targets will let you bite them.

I had a lot of fun with this project, and learned a lot this time around (especially in regards to the animation pipeline with blender/unity). I will be continuing this project, though probably at a slightly slower pace.

entries.title: Villains of Milk and Madness
entries.description:
You are Duck Bill, an evil duckbill, mistreated by humanity, out to seek revenge by destroying earth's milk supplies. You need to complete objectives to win the game.

Interact with tiles, accumulating your wealth and strike a crushing blow against earth's milk industry. Steal milk from houses, get money by robbing banks, regenerate at hospitals, increase damage at fight club and work out by increasing your toughness at the gym.

Controls are simple: 

Arrow keys - look around the map
WASD - move
space - interact with current tile
O - see current objective
M - minimap

Important Objectives that will lead you to winning the game:
Get a car - there's a single car dealership on the map. Gotta look for it.
Find a vaporizer base - one on a map, look for it.
Destroy farms - 3 farms total.
Destroy factories - 2 factories total.

Learned java from TheCherno (http://www.youtube.com/user/TheChernoProject) <- check out his tutorials, he's pretty cool.

Font used: bitstream vera, http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/list/style/Monospaced

The game requires Java Runtime Environment. (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jre7-downloads-1880261.html)

Best wishes, Vladimir

entries.title: War'Asaal
entries.description:
Current state of the game makes it more of a sandbox.

Worked on the engine and graphics a lot more than on anything else. Note to self : Prepare the basic engine before the actual competition next time. Also stick to minimal graphics until I am sure that I'll have enough time to create more eye-candy!

Feel free to check the game out anyways. It has some music that is better than I expected it to be, and same goes with the sprites :).

#### Controlls: ####

Arrow keys - movement.
1, 2, 3, 4 - spell hotkeys.
spacebar - cast selected spell.
m - mute music.

#### Changelog ####

v1.01
-Fixed physics beeing really slow for some people.
-Now works on Windows XP.

entries.title: Apocolypse Virus
entries.description:
Story: You control a computer virus and you have to kill all defenses to launch the nukes.

Arrow keys to move and z to shoot.

entries.title: Cavernous
entries.description:
Defend your dungeon from infinite adventurers. Use WASD or the arrow keys to move around, 1-3 to select abilities, and Space to perform actions.

Didn't have time to put in all the stuff I intended to (inc. goats); may add more to this later.

The Linux version requires SDL 1.2 as well as SDL_Image and SDL_Mixer. 32-bit and Windows versions should be up soon.

entries.title: Bad Puppy
entries.description:
NEWS:  OS X Build is now available through the Mirror site.

You are a bad puppy.  Being that you are a puppy, all you can manage to do is bark at people.  So, bark at them.  Bark, bark, bark!  The more you bark at people, the more points you get.  Get all the points!  But if people pet you, you can't be mean.  Don't let them pet you!  Bark!  Bark, Bad Puppy!

Controls: Arrow keys to run, Z to bark.  Alt+F4 to exit. 

You get points if you bark at the people.  You lose meanness if a person pets you. 

Build with Game Maker Studio, graphics done with Paint.net, GM sprite editor, sounds with Audacity, bfxr.

This game was originally conceptualized as "Puppy Hitler".  Puppy Hitler is canceled.  Here's why: 

http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2012/12/15/puppy-hitler-offensive-to-some-people/

Post-compo enhancements:

1. Bonus pickup system
2. You can press Esc to exit game at any time.
3. Multi-colored sweaters.
4. Some added variety to the barking.
5. Female persons.
6. Person skin color now has variety.

entries.title: Dark Witch
entries.description:
== Story ==
Being a villain is not easy. You are constantly pursued by so-called heroes who wants to kill you. 
That's the story of the Dark Witch, a young lady whose only desire is to destroy the planet. She is almost at her goal, only 2 mn left before the target explodes... unless she is interrupted by a group of heroes.
Don't let them stop you.

== Rules ==
- Try to survive until the planet explodes
- Don't let the heroes army kill you

Mouse control
- Click on enemies to kills them

Extra keyboard controls
- Move the camera with A and D (qwerty keyboard)
- S button do the same as a click (but you still need to point a enemy with your mouse)


- Knights need 1 click to be killed
- Magicians need 2 clicks
- White magicians need 4 clicks
- If you summon the dragon, it will destroy every spawned enemies
(I'm sorry for the lack of damage feedback, time was running out :( )

== Tools ==
- Engine : Unity3D with 2d toolkit
- Graphics : Photoshop, Paint Tool SAI
- Sounds : No sounds in the LD version, CFXR in the post-compo


== PostCompo Update ==
I continued to work on the game even after the end of the week end. Here are the modifications/upgrades.

December 2012, 19th
- Added user feedback when you attack a monster (the sprite becomes red)
- Added animations for the dark witch and the heroes
- The dragon summon button requires 24 dead to be activated. The button is placed next to the witch and doesn't disappear.
- Added some texts at the bottom for the mood
- Added sound effects

- Change the score system : it counts the number of dead instead of an obscure point system
- Change the game duration to 1 mn instead of 2
- Change the spawning algorithm
- Change the white magician life to 3 instead of 4

- Remove the scrolling with keyboard. 
- The player can always use the S key with the mouse click.

December 2012, 21st
- Added BGM
- Added "Knight Only Mode" and "Timeless Mode"

entries.title: Demons in Dungeons
entries.description:
A few notes:
Bugs have a maximal building range of 5 tiles. It's a bit hard to see, but the build goes more transparent when it can't be built there, sorry. You can also only build on floor tiles.
There are three resources, you get all of them by killing enemies either through traps or fighting. 
Souls are for spawning monsters, bones are for building traps and buildings and blood is for research in the Blood Bath.
Check out the Help button to learn what the buildings do.
Units mainly only differ in health/speed/damage, but ninjas and buttermouses do not activate traps.
If you get stuck, try changing your tactics.
Use spike traps in small corridors where you can predict where people go, place poison traps close to your heart to continously harm people attacking it. Piston traps are very effective if humans have to walk by a lava pool.

How to run:
Extract the archive to an empty folder and then simply doubleclick the .jar file.
On a console:
java -Djava.library.path=./ -jar DemonsInDungeons.jar
Make sure to have at least JRE 1.6 installed!
Note: I can't test the linux and mac archives, so please tell me if it doesn't work correctly and I will fix it. In any case, the Webstart version should always work.

Warning: Does not include goats! Well, maybe a mutated goat or something.

Story:
While humanity was doing fun stuff that included laughing and singing and happyness, the evil forces of the abyss have been working to destroy the world. With their immense power they managed to open up portals to the overworld, allowing them to destroy everything and turn the planet into a living hell. Humans didn't really like that and probably got offended by it, that might be why they're now bravely entering those portals attacking YOUR realm. You're the right hand of the guy who leads all the destruction. Make sure to keep the dungeons safe. Place traps and kill everyone. Summon monsters and kill everyone. You can also do both, at the same time, which is rather convenient for your job. Just make sure that your dungeon does not get destroyed. Each dungeon has a pulsating "Dungeon's Heart" which keeps the dungeon alive. Take care of it and your master will be very proud of you. That's all.

Controls:
The controls are mostly based on the mouse and very simple.
Left click selects, right click performs an action. You can also left click and drag to select more than one unit.
Double clicking a specific type of unit will select all units of that type in a certain range.
Alternatively, you can use the arrow keys to navigate in menues or move the camera around.

entries.title: Die Block
entries.description:
Mechanics & Background:
You are the villan and have the ability to malform the world. Every level has at least one moving block. This block with go in one direction till it hits an obstacle taller than it, in which case it changes direction. You are trying to lead the blocks to their death in a block of opposing color (red <> blue).

Controls:
Shift + Mouse Down: pickup grey blocks
Mouse Down: put down grey blocks
Page Refresh: reload level

Notice:
You can only remove blocks if there is not a removable block above. You can only add blocks if there is a non moving block bellow.

Hope you enjoy.

P.S. You can click the screen to skip the title.

If you get stuck, here is a gameplay video with the solutions. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dJ5Iw2uHfBk.

entries.title: Epic Rampage
entries.description:
You are a huge, angry, and seriously pissed off monster. Go to town and destroy entire cities, before going down in a blaze of glory.

by Sander Verbeek aka. sanderman

entries.title: Princessss

You have to kidnap the princess and bring her to your lair which is on a long boring road which we'll skip so we'll actually start at the castle gates. Slay all who stand in your way and go get them!

Instructions:
Mouse click and hold to move around / pick stuff up / attack.
If you have a shield, shift to use it. While blocking you can't attack.

The biggest villain in all existence. Mankind. Destroy all in your way and evolve untill you face the reality you have created. You may take an important decision.

*Runner game.

entries.title: The Exterminator
entries.description:
I had a friend do the audio, I came into the jam with the maze generator in a janky form and with the nape physics engine. The game should end and give you the chance to play a new level after you kill everything but this is a bit glitchy and sometimes seems to not notice everything is gone. If this is the case and you want to try a new map just refresh the page.

*****IF YOUR GAME IS LAGGING*****
Hit the - key to reduce particles

*****IF YOUR GAME IS NOT LAGGING ENOUGH*****
Hit the + key for more particles

entries.title: Slaughter
entries.description:
My humble entry, Slaughter.  It can be played with:

Keyboard and mouse:  A and D for left and right, W to jump.  Mouse click to shoot in that direction from player.

Joystick: Left analog moves left and right, push up to jump.  Right analog auto-shoots in the direction you push the stick.  Unfortunately, the web version only works for joysticks with the same axes as the XBox 360 joypad.  The Windows version has rebindable keys.

This game is short and simple.  If I had more time, I could add more levels, weapons, enemies, pickups, etc.  Not to mention art.

entries.title: The Mute King
entries.description:
Get your queen some flowers on her birthday before sunrise. Stay clear of the villagers, they don't agree with the whole idea.

Use W,A,S,D and Space to move around, use mouse gestures to experiment with spells/actions.

Get to the queen before the villagers stop you!

EDIT : Changed Windows download to an alternate link to Dropbox, for those who are having issues viewing it online.

entries.title: Ticket Inspector 3001
entries.description:
You play a ticket inspector for the tram company of linz; 
a villain so boring that there's a high risk of  spontaneously falling asleep during the game. 




Game controls: left/up/right/down to navigate. space to talk to people. numbers 1,2... to chose during conversations. 
OS: Any, as long as you have java 1.6+ installed
How to run: Unpack the zip file, double click ticket_inspector_3001.jar


Note: the game is in a really quite broken state. you can do the basic task of fining people, 
but some dialoges will end abruptly or not make much sense.

entries.title: Tower Lord
entries.description:
"I have had it with these motherfucking heroes in my motherfucking tower!"
- Tower Lord

entries.title: Trashock Alpha
entries.description:
We were quite in a rush in order to achieve our goal, and ultimately, we didn't. So please enjoy this alpha-version and expect a post-compo further development!

Here's the readme (included with the game too):

Trashock Alpha

Made for Ludum Dare #25 Jam.


How to play:

Controls:

Select the item from the main menu.

You can switch between music styles by clicking the "Music" item.

Click or press SPACE/ENTER to fast forward/skip the text. Press ESC to skip all the text.

In-game press ESC to return back to the main menu.

Use arrows or WASD to move your unit. Move mouse to aim.

Mouse Wheel - cycle through weapons.
Keyboard buttons 1, 2, 3 - switch to specific weapon.
Left Mouse Button - shoot with selected weapon.
Right Mouse Button - shoot with all available weapons.

Save game with F5 and load with F6 or from the main menu.
Switch screen mode with F4.

Gameplay:

Watch your hit points, heat level and ammo.

1. If your hit points get under 1, you explode.

2. When you overheat (beyond 100%), you lose hit points. The more is the overheat, the more you get damage. If you move, you produce more heat and slow down the recovery.

Your heat level is raised by your shots, and by receiving enemy shots.

3. When you have no more ammo, it's almost as if you already lost.

HP and ammo cannot be replenished. Coolness is regained automatically.

Your mission is to destroy the enemies and evacuate to your start point - the center of the map.


Authors:

Programming: HD408
Spriting: Yuuri
Music: Mr. RK

Tools used:

Engine: Game Maker 8.0 Lite
Graphics: GM built-in sprite editor, and I forgot to ask Yuuri
Music: FL Studio
Sound: sfxr

17.12.2012

entries.title: Villain Game
entries.description:
I used Gimp to make the images. The font that I used is called Visitor. It was obtained from: http://www.dafont.com/visitor.font and I have provided the license for the font in my submission.

The libraries that I used for producing this game can be found here: Libgdx (http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/) and Gwt2Swf (http://code.google.com/p/gwt2swf/).

links.label: Windows, Linux, And Source All in One

entries.title: Alien Invasion
entries.description:
You're in command of a proud space fleet around a small noisy planet that keeps broadcasting aliens are slimy, disgusting and naked. How dare they?! Time to let this earthlings pay!

All of this was made sunday. Got almost no time this weekend. So graphics sucks and the game play is probably very much out of balance. Should be good for a quick play anyway.

Things I'd like to have implemented:
* Better graphics, background, explosions, fx.
* Different levels, decrease number of UFO's.
* Speech bubbles.
* Different weapons.

Instructions:
Click or tap to make the saucer accelerate towards the mouse cursor or finger. Hold down to give more thrust. Click/tap shortly to give only a little. Either try to find an orbit which is just fast enough to escape the missiles from earth while you shoot your lasers. Or try passing earth fast and close while doing fly-by-shooting. Turn around beyond missile range and repeat.

entries.title: Earth Destroyer
entries.description:
I made this game in about 9 hours of coding. The last day I was unable to work on the project until submission hour. So it was submitted 25 seconds before the end of it.

The game is simple and bad and has a big problem. I also didn't have time to add in scoring. 

To play you hit the button labeled "key" on the upper righthand side. The game is very intuitive. Also just to note, you can only attack once the last attack is finished.

Thanks for playing,
Static

PS please vote and comment if you play

entries.title: Evil Dragon
entries.description:
**Post your score in the comments! Let's see who's the true bad guy :D No lying though!**

AAAAND here it is! Get as many points as you can in this evil arcade game.

Backstory: You, Kraorga, awake once every thousand years and rain havoc upon the world. But now, the humans believe they can slay you: show them no mercy!

If I had had more time, I would have added sounds, more good guys trying to slay the evil dragon, added more than just cosmetic diversity between weapons (that's right, they don't do anything differently xD) and maybe polished it up a little, but oh well. Oh, and I would have included a goat, of course!

Have fun and Ludum Dare forever!

entries.title: Evil Goat
entries.description:
How To Play?
------------
Use Arrows to move Evil Goat
Kill all childrens to finish the level

About the Minimum
------------
If anyone beats the minimum could you tell me :) thanks :)

Inspired by
------------
Escape Goat by MagicalTimeBeans

Finish the game to know the relation between both games (this and Escape Goat)

entries.title: Flash Simulator 2013
entries.description:
Welcome to the best and most exciting simulator yet! The game is not complete as I'd like, it's in a "sandbox" state right now but it's my final submission. I'm still happy with the result. Have fun.

Controls :

Movement : A and D
Jump : Spacebar
Use skills : J, K and L
Spawn young girl : Left click
Spawn XP orb : Right click
Spawn rock : Z
Zoom and unzoom : Numpad +/- and Numpad 0 to reset view

tk2d has been removed from the assets in sources, because it's a paid asset for Unity. You will need to import it yourself if you want to use the sources.

Author : Hapistorique (Twitter @Hapistorique)

This is my first game ever published ;)

entries.title: For the love of the king
entries.description:
You are the king, and you hate the paupers who want to take your money, so you kill them.
For this, you have the wall, for each level you have one bow.
But if they still arrive at the river (you have to take them by silly laws...), they enter in city and become pauper but they give you some money :).
Each pauper on the city eats, if you have less than 1 "Stock", you lose.
Producer produce Stock (5 per 1), you can transform a Pauper to Producer (clik on the producer rectangle :o)).
Nobles give money for each pauper you kill.
Sometime (often) a hero come, if he arrive at the city, he will kill half noble and half producer 


ps : bug on chrome/IE at the end, works on opera/firefox

entries.title: Hench for Life: Rags to "Riches"
entries.description: Nothing too complicated here, hire henchmen, send them to do stuff, make money.

entries.title: How the Thuglife Stole Christmas
entries.description:
Well, it definitely did not get finished at all. We hoped to add enemies and harder platforming, but time was not on our side.

Story: You are a rouge Christmas elf who wants to steal back all the presents.

Controls:
WASD or Arrows to move
Down or S to go down chimney.
Walk over a tree to get the presents(They aren't awarded until you leave back up the chimney)

entries.title: I will always love you... do I?
entries.description:
Can you save a love story?

You're trying to get your girlfriend back.
In your journal, you will encounter lots of good or bad memories between you.

If you lost all your love or rage too much. you give up.
If you reach the end with loves, maybe you can get her back?

Thanks for playing my first LD game :)

TL;DR: dodge heart-breaking blocks with left&right arrow

*Work best on Google Chrome&Firefox
*Performance might be stable after few reloads

Thanks http://www.nosoapradio.us/ for awesome music

entries.title: Loan Shark
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare submission!
It's incomplete, playable, but not winnable or losable.
Regardless I hope you enjoy it!

You play a shark.
This shark once ate a human loan shark who the mafia had given some concrete shoes and a dinner date with the fishies.
At the same time he was hit by a powerful beam of gamma radiation from Saturn, and that, combined with the toxic waste leaking from near by canisters mutated the shark so he could breath and move on land, and an insatiable lust for giving out high interest loans to suckers.

So how to play:
Go around town and talk to people who want loans. Agree the terms and give them the money.
Avoid letting the suckers repay their loans to early, to get more money out of them. But be careful! If you leave it to loan they won't have the money to repay, so they'll try to run! Hunt them down and kill them, but in your rage you'll ruin half the money in their pockets and you won't get a full repayment!

Controls: 
Move shark:
W,A,S,D
Camera zoom: scroll wheel
Interface: Mouse and left click.
Fullscreen: F4
Change screen resolution: F3

Written in C# and XNA
Requires .Net 4.0 and XNA 4.0 redistributes

Work done:
All programming: Sam (Skiddings)
Custom art: housemate John
The rest of the area: OpenGameArt.net
-Sam

Written in C# with XNA. Requires XNA 4.0 redist (included) and .NET 4 installed. Windows only.

Wishlist:
Sound!
Particles and gore
Police
Map objects
Converting to monogame

I hope to continue working on it after the Jam, I think this could become a great little game :)

Thanks
- Sam

entries.title: My Kingdom for a Line Block
entries.description:
A game for two players on one computer!

Race for lines before the other player can betray you.

entries.title: Parasite Quest
Power Grab
entries.description: In this game, you play as a villain who wants more power, and thus steals artifacts. This attracts more enemies. Thus, in a sense of gameplay, you are your own enemy as you summon your own enemies. So, if a level is too hard, maybe you should consider not taking so many artifacts.

entries.title: PsyGoat
entries.description:
My game is a platformer about an evil goat with telekinetic powers, your goal is to escape from a high-security prison for animal super-villains.  The first level is a really quick tutorial, so just follow the instructions in-game for controls. [EDIT: There is a Typo Which says to use W and A to move.  Ignore that, it's A and D.]

The gameplay is basically run and jump, but you use the mouse for your 5 super-powers; 
    1. Telekinetic Guns
    2. Laser Eyes
    3. Stop Time
    4. Shield
    5. Explosions!

--------------------------------------------------

This was my second LD I had real fun making the game, I did run out of time, so it is a very short game and there is absolutely no challenge at all.  You can play it all the way to the end though, so just try it out and have fun with the powers.  I was going to do more with the theme too, there were going to be other super-villain animals as boss battles, but I think that was a bit ambitious.
Thanks for reading, hope you all enjoy it.

entries.title: Sleight of Hand
entries.description:
You are the villain:

You and your loyal kobold minion rob the poor people of Ludum.

Distract the curious victim on the left with your charm and skills while your Minion performs some sneaky sleights of hand.

Use the mouse to follow the path of the diamond in order to keep the victim distracted. Meanwhile use your other hand to type in the words at the top to perform the criminal act.

entries.title: Swann's Game
entries.description:
Hi.

I started this game 24hours ago, i slept, and i didn't work a lot so... it's pretty hard to understand, pretty ugly, maybe buggy, but i kind of like it anyway :).

There's only a Windows version (sorry mac users).

The goal is to avoid fire, there is fire EVERYWHERE.

The biggest problem is your fire cursor and the fact that it record all your movements to create a fireball on the same path !

Pretty hard to explain, but i hope you'll have some fun with it. (Hard version is the funniest version, but i think you should start with the easy mode to understand the gameplay)

ZQSD to move (if azerty keyboard) and mouse + clic is all controls you need to know !

Have fun !

entries.title: The Banker
entries.description:
The Banker: An Atrocity in Three Parts.

Made in C++ from scratch under strict LD48 rules, just started a day late.

Instructions:
WASD/Arrows to move
Space to interact.

To interact with people, you first have to talk to your boss.
Linux:
Requires libSFML2

Windows:
Should work straight out of the box - please say if it doesn't!

entries.title: The Butler Did It
entries.description:
Yet again, I have failed to produce a complete game :(

The intention was to have a game where you play the butler to a rich obnoxious family, and you must kill them all one at a time and steal the family fortune without getting caught.

I was aiming for something like a simplified Hitman crossed with the 16 bit Home Alone game. You would walk around the house gathering items, and then find creative ways to kill the 3 family members, such as poisoning the food, dropping chandeliers on people, and electrocuting them in the bath.

As it stands, it is a game where you play a butler and walk around a house doing nothing. Enjoy.

WASD to move around, space to interact with stuff (doors).

entries.title: The Legend of Destiny
entries.description:
A HTML5 arcade game with IMPACT 1.20

NO SOUND for Safari and smart-phones.

entries.title: The Twist
entries.description:
This is a game of Moustache Twirling.

You must twirl your moustache(by clicking and dragging) around the coins that appear on the screen.  Avoid the police, as they will cut your precious Mo.

Chain coins in consecutive loops to earn combo bonuses.

Android version has some multitouch issues I will fix eventually- but I thought I'd upload it anyway :) (Only tested on a Nexus7, so - be warned!)

--18/12/2012 Update--
Just added a new version (see 'Updated (Web)') I tried to keep the changes as few as possible.  Fixed two things. 
1) Changed the looping algorithm, so you should now find it easier to loop around coins
and
2) Changed the timer, so it should now end the game at the correct time, instead of 2/3 seconds after the music ends.

I've also uploaded a gameplay video (From the compo version)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m4IAWbp30xE

entries.title: Untitled
entries.description:
A and D to move, spacebar to jump.

Mac users: if it crashes and you are using Lion, or it works and you're not using Lion, please say.

Windows 8 users: I don't think SFML supports you yet. Sorry!

If you want a code::blocks or Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 Express project to go with the source, I can provide. But it is very easy to create those things just by following the corresponding SFML 2.0 tutorial, adding all the sources, and putting the stuff from the distributable in the working directory. The Xcode project is a little harder to construct. Again, ask if you want it.

entries.title: VillianLike
entries.description:
VillainLike is a simple game with a simple premise; to build a dungeon to defend yourself from pesky invaders. It's a simple tower defense game mixed in with some randomly generated elements. The game may seem difficult at first, as it requires you to understand the hero's AI and how to syngergise your towers.

- Made with RPG Maker VX Ace (not required to play obviously)
- Arrow Keys to move cursor, Z to place objects
- I can't into sound

Edit: Url is fixed, sorry for the inconvenience.

entries.title: You are the (NOIR) Villain
entries.description:
Controls:
 F => Flashlight toggle
 W => Forward
 Mouse => Look around
 E => PLANT THE BOMB (only within target area)
 Space => Bounce

NOTE: Try not to use the flashlight too much! ;)

entries.title: You are the Evil Overlord
entries.description:
POSTCOMPO V1 RELEASED
Postmortem: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2013/01/06/post-compo-release-and-post-mortem/

---

You are the Evil Overlord, trying to complete your evil plans to activate the doomsday device. To do that, you just need to secure an Object of Great Importance and perform a Ritual of Great Importance.

But wait! A Hero is here to stop you! Luckily you have a sizeable supply of minions, along with two trusty associates, Igor and Dmitri. Not to forget your cute (but deadly) pet goat!

You control your troops by shouting them orders (keyboard keys 1,2,3). You want to hinder the Hero just the right amount - too little and he disrupts your plans, too much and you accidentally kill him, spoiling all the fun of having him witness your great victory!

This is the first game I have ever completed. I am so happy to have taken part in this for the first time! I'm excited to be part of future LD's.

For some reason my pixel art got all compressed around the end of dev. I don't know why. Anyways.. it still looks more or less the same ;)

entries.title: A day in the life of the Minotaur
entries.description:
The entry:
==========

The game is far from finished, but I really wanted to deliver after 48 hours. Last LD I couldn't so I had to submit for the jam.

I wanted to make a game with a gameplay that I wasn't used to (a board game) as last entries were platform games. So, I'm happy because I think I made a good skeleton for board games.

Things I couln't implement were: a combat mini game, a shop and different clasess of enemies.

I will deliver an out of competition Android version, as well.


The story:
==========

All days are the same for Asterion, The Minotaur: The kind people of Crete send you a virgin to sacrifice, and warriors show up to fight you.
You have to find the virgin at the end of the corridors of the Laberynth.


How to play:
===========
Each level is gererated randomly.
You move over the board throwing a dice.
Press "Move" to throw the dice (1 to 12). You lose one point of energy when you throw the dice.
When you find a bifurcation you have to choose the way you want to go.
There are four different elements in the board:
Gold: just for fun.
Warriors: you fight him (lose health) and get energy eating their hearts.
Potions: you get health.
Virgin: the goal of each board. You get energy eating her.

You lose when you run out of health or energy.

When you are not moving, you can move the board around dragging it to see areas out of the screen. When you press "move" the board will correct its position

Made with:
=========
Haxe
HaxeNME
FlashDevelop
SFXR
ChordPulse
Audacity
GXSCC
Paint.net
Notepad++


Updates:
=======

Changedr URLS to http://goo.gl to have stats.

entries.title: A Maze Game
entries.description:
Read the README for controls, and bit of background to the game.

EDIT: It's just today dawned on me that although I've been around the Ludum Dare scene for quite a while now, I've never seen what it's like behind the submission process. Hence the lack of updates til just now.

Anyways, for those of you who don't follow me on Twitter, this game was made in approx 10-12 hours. And I also created a Jam entry (http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-25/?action=preview&uid=19372). So two entries for my first Ludum Dare! Woo!

entries.title: Alien Rampage
entries.description:
Help the ignorant earthlings evacuate their planet, whether they like it or not!

Control you UFO using the arrow keys and use spacebar to turn on you tractor beam. Collect as many of the earthlings as you can, and level the city, just to make sure: Nobody gets left behind!

Tip: People in panic evacuate buildings much faster!

We tried to put the player in the awkward situation, where it is not clear what to do, and quite frankly everything you choose makes you the villain. You can boringly hover, and pick up one human after the other, but isn't it tempting to shake skyscrapers and make people flee in panic? On the other hand, you can try to level the city as fast as possible, which is cool, but then you have nowhere to hide from the missiles. Therefor the game also doesn't have a win screen, because you have to decide for yourself if a 365/1 score is great or 42/120 is better. Anyway, you will remain the villain.

entries.title: Asteroids Backwards
entries.description:
Sadly, we were unable to finish the game, but considering this is our first Ludum Dare (defnitely not our last), and our first attempt at a game, it was a great experience! Original Music!

Grab the asteroids and fling them at the ship. 

Note: Currently does not work on tablet

entries.title: Cyborg Spider Infestation
entries.description:
Cyborg Spider Infestation was inspired by grafix in an ad of a game called "Tower of Babel" in March 1990 "The one" magazine. Never played the game but I liked the ad, so here goes. Whew, I was ready to give up only after few hours. I guess the idea was too much for 48h.

You control a herd of cyborg spiders. Destroy buildings and enemy vehicles for raw materials and build more cyborgs.

entries.title: Doc's Heist Starring Snuggles the Cat
entries.description:
Doc's Great Heist: Starring Snuggles the Cat

Play as Doc and Snuggles, his pet cat, to steal all the gold on each level. Gameplay involves utilizing all of Doc's tools and Snuggle's ability to reach high places. Move crates, pull switches, freeze unsuspecting civilians, teleport around, and most of all steal gold.

The compo version features 6 levels, and takes about 15-20 minutes to complete. 

WASD to move; Space to interact with objects; 1 2 and 3 switch gadgets; and the mouse is used for Doc's tools. Pressing Z will toggle control between Doc and Snuggles.

To run the LOVE version, you have to install the LOVE framework, linked below.

To run on Linux or Mac, you will need to install the LOVE framework, and use the LOVE distribution.

Powered by the LOVE framework: http://love2d.org/

Created for Ludum Dare 25: You Are The Villain
http://www.ludumdare.com

Libraries:
Zoetrope: http://libzoetrope.org/
TESound: https://love2d.org/wiki/TEsound

Tools used for development of code and assets:
GIMP: http://www.gimp.org/
LMMS: http://lmms.sourceforge.net/
Audacity: http://audacity.sourceforge.net/
sfxr: http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html
Tiled: http://www.mapeditor.org/
Programmer's Notepad: http://www.pnotepad.org/

Thanks to my friends for keeping me honest and motivated.
A very special thanks to the viewers on my livestream cheering me on and their support throughout the weekend.

entries.title: Doctor Spandex
entries.description:
HOW TO PLAY

Press UP to toggle down/up stairs(this will disable the floor above the stair)
Press DOWN to crouch(crouch behind the furniture to become invisible)
Press "S" to jump
Press "A" to attack(attack the buttons to destroy them)
Press "W" to throw the Sound Emitter
Press "D" to shoot
Press "Shift" to run

To complete the level, you must collect all the RED spandex and return to the starting point.

Credits

Cassio Eduardo - Programmer
Markus Hanka - Artist
Tuan Le - Artist
Lars Dobbertin-king - Composer

entries.title: Don't Look At Me
entries.description:
Personal remake of Terry Cavanagh's "Don't look back" but changing a bit its history.

Sorry for the inconveniences but there's no ending though I'm very intrigued about the concept of a game without endings or goals. Anyway, I'll take the needed time to improve the game and plot as well (and try to imagine an ending)

entries.title: Goblin Fortress
entries.description:
Build and manage your own goblin settlement! Goblins are the perfect starting point for your nefarious empire: They eat, they sleep, occasionally they do some work... Wait, let's not focus on that!

Your goblins can:
* Dig holes!
* Build ramshackle huts!
* Breed delicious goats!
* Butcher delicious goats!
* Eat delicious goats!
* Sleep!

Your goats can:
* Eat!
* Sleep!
* Wander aimlessly!
* Be carried off by hungry goblins!

This was an attempt at a Dwarf Fortress-style management game. I'd wanted you to be able to send marauding goblins to pillage nearby villages, but that was more than I had time for. Whoops!

entries.title: Infidel
entries.description:
Loot all the gold in the temple, but don't let the guards catch you! Use the shadows. Put out torches to create paths.

TURN INVERT Y OFF in the Pause menu if you don't like it!

No goats, sorry :(

As usual, it's not quite finished. The guards are somewhat reminiscent of Daleks and the temple is a lot smaller than I imagined it. Unity's dynamic shadows are a bit hard on the GPU too, apologies if your machine struggles with it...

entries.title: MoonRise
entries.description:
** Use WASD or arrow keys to walk/turn the vampire. Mouse controls where your head is looking/aiming at and this aim is NOT for where you are going (think of a tank and its cannon - the tank have its own direction other than cannon direction). This allows to walk and cast spells sideways. Yeah, strange, I will change it in post compo version. Hold shift to strafe instead of turning. Hold left mouse button over book to research spells (takes time and blood). Use left mouse button for attack humans with claws and right button (hold) to draw blood. Read tutorial at start for more details.

You are an immortal vampire. 
You recently found a magical book with powerful spells and your mission is to learn them all. This will require a lot of energy (blood) taken from the village folk at valley bellow your castle. Tension is growing and many humans now wants to burn your castle down.

entries.title: Mr. Cylinder
entries.description:
Mr. Cylinder - one of my first games ever made. Game is unfinished cause the size of idea and not having good game programming skills (7 hours and still very buggy collisions) but I've learned many things by that. 

Story is about Mr. Cylinder - a game programmer. His girlfriend leaves him and goes to man called Lord. Cylinder thinks that Lord is Villain which kidnapped Derpina - Cylinders girlfriend. He goes to Lords house (with axe), destroys the door and kills bodyguards to save Derpina. But he don't know who really is a villain.

Wanted to make this funny story with voice acting but that was too much to make this in 48 hours for me.

You can play the unfinished windows version (its very short).

controls:
arrows - moving
space - attack

entries.title: Multigon: A story about an unloved mesh.
entries.description:
You are a multigon, a mesh created by multiple polygons. You live in a land of perfect cirles that think you are a monster. So show them how monstrous monster you are and stab them with your sharp angles! 
First Ludum Dare, yay!

Notes:
Just extract and launch ldgame.exe (I forgot to change a name).
The game doesn't repeat, after game over you have to turn it off.
It's also endless :P

FIX NOTE:
I've fixed that strange bug and game should works also on ATI cards. Thank you spacechase0 for clue.

entries.title: Neutral Balance
entries.description:
In this game you have to be Good and Evil. To earn points with the good side, you have to be evil on the other.

You need Java Version 7 and OpenGL to start this game.
Fixed the bug, where an exception was thrown if no 16:9 DisplayMode was found.

entries.title: Onus
entries.description:
Alrighty! Another entry done!

The "art" took longer than I wanted to get to be something reasonable, and a friend introducing me to FTL this weekend didn't help at all. So this is not what I initially envisioned, but the next best thing (something playable). But it's done enough for me to see with a bit of effort I might like it! Also there's really no more time to work on it so, up it goes.

Onus is sort of me being angry at the world and grr mad mad. As you do things "correctly" (the way the game implies it should be done), you punish yourself later on. I don't want to spoil it any more, so I'll leave it at that.

wsad to move around, x to interact with things. Pay attention to the text at the bottom of the window!

Written in Java using LWJGL and Paul Lamb's sound system. It should work on pretty much all platforms, and if it doesn't please let me know.

entries.title: Plunder!
entries.description:
Solo project (started Saturday).

UPDATE:

Just added a Windows executable version. I've only opened it on the machine that has LOVE installed already, so I cannot verify that it is working correctly, but I've followed what their website suggests, so it should work.

I had a Linux binary up there, but I hadn't read about needing to create the various packaging information, so it wouldn't have worked without you going out and installing the LOVE package from your package manager anyways. So Linux users, you guys just get the Source link. OS X users are in the same boat.

I might see about porting it to the experimental WebGL stuff (since I didn't really use too much fancy stuff), but that's a big "might" at the moment.

entries.title: PsychoTherapist
entries.description: PsychoTherapist is a game where you play a hypnotherapist trying to drive the voices from your head into your patient. Time yourself to the metronome, and spin the watch to match the chaotic patterns as long as you can.

entries.title: Return Dear Leader
entries.description:
You are an alien, sent to prepare the Earth for the coming invasion, and to liberate your long-lost leader from the clutches of the deceitful humans. 

Credits:

Adam Frisby -- Programming Director
Jess Lebow -- Design Director
Aubrey Fry -- Audio Director

Due to a lack of 3D artists on the team, we used a fair amount of licensed 3rd party assets.

entries.title: The Darkness
entries.description:
Stuff to know about this game

1. Theme connection isn't obvious until the end, so be sure to stick around. It is there, I promise.
2. There are two endings! After getting one, getting the other shouldn't be too hard...
3. Let me know if it's too laggy. I think I cleared it up, but you never know.

This game was way too ambitious. I totally overscoped. Oh well.

entries.title: Those Pesky Rogues
entries.description:
A reverse Rogue-Like, you must stop an Adventurer from infiltrating your Dungeon!

Made in Unity using iTween, NGUI and my Skeletor frame-work.

Control the view-port with Arrow Keys or WASD to find the Rogue. Click on the Idols to spawn a "skeleton".. 

It's only one level so far, with no sound, and pretty basic (horrible) graphics.

There are a few small bugs with the AI as well, but nothing that breaks it (that I know of...)

UPDATE: I've fixed the graphics glitches in the Web Version, and "Ported" it to that platform! Pesky Rogues, now with More Accessibility!

entries.title: Tiny Sorceress
entries.description:
You are the wicked nemesorceress Damnatia Malefacula. In the wake of the king's death, you have kidnapped the rightful heiress to the throne in an attempt to seize power in her stead. Now prevent one foolhardy peasant from rescuing her with the help of your flawless deathtraps, and, if those fail, your flawed backup deathtraps. And, of course, at the worst you can draw on your incredibly deadly spells. You'll make short work of him!

Left and right keys: Move.
Up or Z or Space: Perform actions.

entries.title: Troll ball
entries.description:
You are the ball from pong, go troll the players!


Controls:
Space - Troll the players


Tools:
Processingjs
Audacity
Gimp

entries.title: Villain Simulator 2000
entries.description:
==WARNING: GAME CONTAINS CONTENT UNSUITABLE FOR MINORS==



Ever wanted to be a movie villain? Now it's your chance with the "Villain Simulator 2000". Play four of your favorite movie villains in this daring Simulator about murder, madness and minigames!


"Villain Simulator 2000" was created in JAVA using the Slick2D libraries. It takes less then 5 minutes to play and finish the game so go and give it a try :)

So far download only, Webstart will hopefully follow.
Tell me if the OS/X version works!


Some people have given me low votes because I did not create all the sound files myself. First of let me make clear that all sound files not created by me have been published in the Creative Commons License and are freely available to anyone, just as a drum loop or a font. If I had a proper mic I would have recorded the screams by myself but as it is, I don't have one so I used ones available for free. It still took me hours to edit and mix all the sounds but if you still think that it's not okay to use those sounds only give the Sound a bad rating, not the whole game.

entries.title: Ambush Predator 7: Angry Angler
entries.description:
When the theme was first announced, my thoughts drifted to what we normally consider "villainous" creatures -- crocodiles, angler fish, sharks... after reading up a little on angler fish, I got the idea to make you "shake" your bioluminescent bacteria to hunt other fish.

*Move with WASD (angler fish are slow)
*Take a bite with the spacebar
*Shake your mouse to shake your bioluminescent bacteria and attract fish.
*Shake too much and they'll see your ugly face and run away (watch for the exclamation point).
*Fish above you are attracted to your light. Fish below you are repulsed.
*Eat fish to get bigger.
*Eat too big of a fish and you will explode.
*Get big enough and you will rule the ocean forever.


=====================

I'd hoped to do a giant squid boss fight at the end, but ran out of time.
I was literally adding the game over state as time expired, so you may not be able to actually "beat" the game.

entries.title: A Light To Kill By
entries.description:
A 'Myst' style game about an assassin who needs to kill a target, from a lighthouse... 

You play as an assassin who is down on his luck and needs to make this kill count.

Made using Java.

NOTE: If you get stuck try finding and using the screwdriver first.

entries.title: Atomic Creep Spawner!!
entries.description:
A hero wants to steal your money, destroy your doors, and probably, VANDALIZE EVERYTHING in your brand new dungeon.

Yes, he does that, so you hate him, he hates you, YOU WANT HIM DEAD.

Invoke minions before he rampages everything in your dungeon!

Protect your precious ORBS OF TRUE EVILNESS!

entries.title: Bag a Bride
entries.description:
This is my first LD, first game jam, first time making pixel graphics, first time making music

Game was made using Cocos2d-html5


HOW TO PLAY:

Click and drag the protagonist in opposite direction to throw
kidnap brides at their wedding with a bag
throwing power depend on drag distance


IF THE GAME LAGS
1, try google chrome
2, close other cpu demanding program/web page

entries.title: Death Star
entries.description:
Please use Chrome or Safari Browsers

* Firefox fixes in the works

entries.title: Drive-over
entries.description:
You drive a truck in a city.

The game contains relatively authentic audio, a hilarious rendering engine and things you can drive over without any sensible reason.

Controls:
Up: Throttle
Left/right: turn

entries.title: Gameageddon
entries.description:
Please have pity on me - for reasons explained in the Readme, I only had half a day on this game. That doesn't mean don't give poor ratings if they are deserved, just that you should actually press the 'P' button to look at my limited pixel art.

Anyways, here's a taster of what the plot *should* have been -

'They locked you away here years ago. No food, no water - just 6 game machines. But a wise man once said life is fun and games. They locked you away here once for trying to end all life - but maybe with the machines here you can find the secret to all games, and use this secret to destroy all games, and therefore fun and life itself. Only then will you finally be free of this digital prison. Good Luck.'

It's a Jar file, and should run on any computer. If it doesn't, tell me. And yes, I should be shot for this atrocity (only joking, please don't kill me!)

entries.title: Invasion
entries.description:
The aim was an RTS space game where you invade or destroy planets based off the LD25 theme "You are are Villain".
I didn't get everything I wanted in, but definitely enough to make a game that's not too boring hopefully.
This is my first submission, however I had so much fun I am definitely entering next time.
I used OpenGl through LWJGL and Java.

Source code is public domain as well. Have fun with it.

Timelapse of it being created

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=deYo40eB9JI

entries.title: Jelly Hunt
entries.description: This is my first entry ever, and it's a very simple game. You slay cute and innocent balls of jelly called Jellypuffies and collect their jelly to throw in special signs that increase your score, while avoiding strong, invincible and orange jelly creatures called Jellycops.

entries.title: Ladron!
entries.description:
Ladron! was made by @davix1228 (http://twitter.com/davix1228) and @rukbotto (http://twitter.com/rukbotto) and it's our first game ever.

It's very simplistic and a bit difficult but we came up with something playable despite knowing nothing about creating videogames.

This game was made using:

- HaxePunk + NME.
- Pixen.
- Pixelmator.
- Sublime Text 2.

entries.title: Little Death Adventure
entries.description:
Hi, Here is our little death adventure.

You can find the source code at github. We don't really know why but the game is way faster on chrome that firefox and way faster on standalone than nav.

We hope you'll enjoy it !

Blackmagic & Gyhyom & Matthal

entries.title: Lumberjack
entries.description:
***** IMPORTANT INFO IF YOU'RE HAVING TROUBLE *****

- You have to jump in the air using the left mouse button.
- Click once to jump off the ground and then again to cut (you can only cut where there is a cut mark, and you must be situated over the mark to cut.)
- Cutting a cut mark makes you jump higher still, so to get to the top you have to bounce between the cut marks all in a row, without touching the ground.
- Jump and cut are assigned to the same button because having a key for jump and a key for cut (Which is essentially a jump move too) becomes VERY confusing. Just think of LMB as being a jump button, and the cut marks are points where you can jump again in the air.

Hope that helps! 

***** "IT DOESN'T FIT THE THEME" *****
For anyone who thinks this game doesn't follow the theme, you have to reach the end to find out why it does (It's a very silly reveal, but it certainly fits! - we were going to have lots more on this stroy throughout the game, like endangered animals falling out of the trees, but we only got time to put something at the very end.) 

Lumberjack is a game where you cut down trees by throwing your big axes and jumping from tree to tree, flailing madly. Be careful not to fall or you'll have to start again! 

This is a hastily put together game under the worst of conditions. And somehow we managed to actually complete it! Well, no sound yet, and the prize at the end took about 3 minutes to conjure together. But you're missing the point, THERE'S A PRIZE AT THE END!

Also featuring impressive 3D Graphics, rendered in a 2D style. It the future of gaming, of the past! Today!

Enjoy!

entries.title: Money Manager
entries.description:
Money Manager is the concept of being a crime money manager selecting jobs and agents for high risk.

The bare basics have been done, not as much as I would like but I really like the concept and want to return to it in the future moving to a server system with content generation from big data online.

I didn't get much done as this was built with a chromebook on the floor on my empty flat I moved into on friday night huddled in a blanket next to the heater. You really don't need much to make games ^_^

entries.title: Nosferatu Lurks
entries.description:
You play Nosferatu, the oddly-square vampire. Your aim is to kill all the enemies in the level. The enemies only have flashlights to defend themselves! Don't let them shine their lights on you, or you'll die.

This is my first ever Ludum Dare - and, thus, the first game I've ever seen to completion (since I was about 13).

CONTROLS:
(WASD)/(ZQSD)/(IJKL)/Arrow keys to move
Space to pounce

entries.title: Rise of Evil
entries.description:
Here's oldtopman's latest entry! Another textmode geinus, this one sacrifices gameplay and almost everything else for a humorous adventure through a villain in training. Don't forget the game's marvelous text-sfx and text-music that are certain to earn oldtopman a place on the Grammys next year.

(Also, goats)

On a slightly less jovial tone, thanks for checking out the game! I developed it in about 25 hours (late start) and went on to add every feature that was originally planned (after the first scaling-back).
Rise of Evil was written in C++ with the GNU ncurses. It was also built with my personal ncurses menu library that can be found here: http://github.com/oldtopman/ncurses-menu

Git access to the private server is available on request.
Windows build made with mxe - http://mxe.cc/

entries.title: TerraForma
entries.description:
Note: I just put up a post-compo Linux version. I have not tested it so please let me know if it does not work.

This is a "destroy the planets" puzzle game where you use terraforming technology of your civilization to destroy the worlds which have inferior lifeforms on them. The fun is trying to do it in as few moves as possible.

Controls:
Mouse: to select a block of land
Left button: Terraform land down
<Left Ctrl>: Orbit Land mass
MouseWheel: Zoom in/out

Eliminate all land blocks by turning them all into Deep Lava and watching them fall off the plane.

Notes:
1) There are a few rules when terra-forming that you must abide by and for the most part when you try to do something wrong, the game will tell you.
2) Some land types affect others when they are terraformed. Discovering these interaction rules is part of the game and can lead to a lower move score.
3) There is a restart button. If you are stuck, don't be afraid to use it
4) There are several boards, I have only played the first 3 so the others are as of yet untested...

Block Types in order from highest to lowest:

City   <- Cannot destroy these directly. They must be surrounded by lava.
Forest
Grass
Dirt
Water  <- <hint> water and lava interact with each other
Rock
Lava
Deep Lava <- get all blocks to become this to advance to next level

**Post-compo version has online scoring and orbit control is now done by holding the left mouse button.

entries.title: THE BUTCHER
entries.description:
You are the butcher.

It's sad, but you have to kill all those innocent chicken.
You have to. Someone has to do it, so that people don't have to kill the chicken themselves.
Which makes you a killer.
You are a bad person.
Because you kill innocent chicken...

Use your mouse to drag a line across the screen, and you will cut anything that is marked. But don't cut the vegetables! Because they don't BLEED...

-----------------------------

hehehe, that aside, background of this game is that I like to annoy some of my friends who are vegetarians :D. People who eat meat are bad, but can you kill a digital chicken? Even if it looks so stupid? I allow it!

*PS* : I'm having trouble uploading the source code on my google site, no idea why, and I will try again tomorrow. For now, it's a sendspace link. Bear with it please :/

entries.title: The last game before the end of the world
entries.description:
Hi.
This is my second LudumDare. 
In "The last game before the end of the world" you must help the Doctor BadGuy to reach the hearth of the univers. You should stay aways from the Meteor and pick up the lost cargo. 

Use the arrow to move and rotate the spaceship and space to shoot laser !

The game is not 100% finish, I had many setback but I hope you'll like it. 

Finaly thank to whole community. Especialy the french Community on #LudumDare-fr . 

Dont forget that you're awesome !

entries.title: The villain's Rules !
entries.description:
A bunch of highschool cliches entered your lair and your delectable duty as a villain is to slaughter them all, but you must always abide by ... THE VILLAIN'S RULES !

HOW TO PLAY
 
- Drop and drag items to the center of the room (except for the brick wall used to block doors)
- Some items will attract one or more characters, some will disperse them, other will kill them
- Items activated once dropped: wall, writing, money, beer, screams (help me ! Bouh !)
- Items you need to activate by clicking on them afterwards, if the conditions are right (see rules): pikes, bed, Cthulhu, Jack-in-the-box, goat

Engine: Unity

Alexandre Lautie (programmer)
Zimra (artist)

entries.title: The Villain's View
entries.description: I just had a couple of hours and wanted to see if I can get a Jump&Run going from the Villain's point of view. Also tried to envision how that tower might look like from the inside, as a Villain's life probably gets pretty boring. Have Fun!

entries.title: Virus Infestation
entries.description:
I created the game in about 15 hrs with Game Maker: Studio Pro.

Controls:
 -WSAD/Arrows - Move
 -Left Click - Shoot
 -Q - Place virus spawner - 30bits cost
 -Space - Replicate self - 10bits cost
 -Space - Re-instantiate when fragmented(red zone) - 50 cost

entries.title: *Radio Silence*
entries.description:
[W,A,S,D OR Arrow Keys to move. Headphones recommended.]

In the sky I saw a shooting star,
and wondered, as I watched it burn,
if maybe it wasn't just rock and sand.

Perhaps, I mused, it was a visitor
from another world: a future friend, or
even enemy from another land.

entries.title: AGENT 08
entries.description: A short game, hopefully I will add more levels later. But hey, it's complete and playable! First LD48! My computer crashed so it took me an extra couple of minutes. Made with GM8.1 Lite.

entries.title: ARM: Alien Research Mission
entries.description:
Flight, unethical experiments and wanton destruction.

It's A.R.M., the Alien Research Mission for purely peaceful purposes.*

**** Controls ****
* Up propels you in the direction of the top of the UFO, like a helicopter.
* Left and Right rotate you left and right. Once you start rotating, you need to thrust the other direction to slow down. Go easy until you get the hang of it. 

**** Tips ****
* Fly your UFO around and level up by reaching the end of the level without crashing or earning too much notoriety. Each human left alive increases your notoriety. (Humans on screen when the level ends don't count.)
* Destroy buildings for bonus villainy.
* If you can't figure out how to gargle a frotz, just try something random.
* If you go off the left or right edges of the screen, the game will nudge you back on. If you go off the top, don't panic! You'll come back down...eventually.
* Low and slow is the easiest way to cause maximum chaos.
* If I had another 10 minutes, there'd be goats.

I've provided an .app version for OSX and an .exe version for Windows. Unzip the file and run. On other platforms, you should be able to run the JAR by double clicking.

If you only play games on the web, make a big fuss and I'll see if I can figure out the GWT backend for libgdx.

entries.title: Aximilator
entries.description:
Story:
The Aximilator has crossed between dimensions into a parallel universe full of peace loving light ships. Someone needs to wipe that smug look off their triangles. Launch your targeting bomb bots and destroy these lazy good for nothings.

Development:
Had a nice relaxed jam. Planned on more features, as you'll see in the options. Spent the first 40 hours making nothing but the interface. Then another good chuck of time into nothing but the particle effects. Objectives, gameplay, and enemy types need more attention. Next time.

Hope you like it and thanks for playing!

entries.title: Conquer The Kingdom
entries.description:
Hey, DaGamesta here!  This is me and WojWork's first Ludam Dare Jam, as well as our first ever completed game coincidentally.  I'm the programmer, and he was the game designer/artist.  There are still some errors in this game as it is, but we hope to polish it up and re-release it without any known issues.  In the meantime, enjoy!  And here's a message from WojWorks:

Wreck havoc as a villain making his way to become the evil ruler of a medieval kingdom!

Z-jump
X-attack

arrow keys-move/fly

f4-fullscreen

esc-exit game

sound effect credit goes to these guys over at soundbible.com:
Brandino480
Stephan Schutze
Mike Koenig


We've learned a-lot this time around, but here's what I know I couldn't get to fixing:

-Knights occassionally move oddly on contact with the ground, nothing big.
-Villagers with pitchforks aren't affected by fire on the ground.

This game was programmed with:
-C++
-Visual Studio 2010
-Allegro 5.0.5 
-A general game engine engine made to go with Allegro programmed by me beforehand.

Note: I will not be porting this game to Linux/Mac ATM, it's' not worth the trouble I've realized it is.  I've learned my lesson, though, and Next Ludum Dare I will be working with Java!

A Post Mortem has been made, albeit not with many changes.  Essentially it's just the following changes:

-You can now properly close the window by clicking the "X" button.
-You can now mute the game by pressing the M key.
-The sounds have been re-balanced a bit in terms of volume.
-The Knights no longer have any collision errors with the ground.
-Villagers and the hero are now properly affected by fire on the ground.
-Villagers now face left initially like they're supposed to.
-A fire sound plays with the regular shooting sound when you have the ultimate weapon.

Sadly I didn't see much room for actually expanding this into a longer game, especially in the world outside of the Ludum Dare and its theme as an excuse for what the game is.  Would probably be good as a Flash/Java game, but... I don't really feel like porting into another language entirely just for that purpose.

So I'll leave it at this, if you aren't voting please be sure to play the post-mortem, it is error-free and pretty much what we'd intended the game to be in the first place.

entries.title: Damsels
entries.description:
You play the role of a villain who has to take damsels from the back of his van, cross busy highways, and place the damsels on the train tracks, to be hit by
oncoming trains.

Author: RexSpaceman
Email: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Instructions:
W = Move Up
