Avoid being hit by the train or cars. Pick up damsels from your white van, and carry them to the train track to deposit them for their untimely demise.

Good Luck. Have Fun.

entries.title: Escape
entries.description:
A dungeon crawler game with no artwork, sound effects or music, but lots of ray-casting, lighting, visibility and collision detection.

In other words, programmer heaven combined with programmer art!

There are 13 levels in total, and some of them are fiendishly difficult. Each level also adds to the story line.

Note that you need to have Microsoft Silverlight 4 or newer installed. This game works on Windows and Mac OS X. It does not work on Linux (the port of Silverlight to Linux, called Moonlight, only supports Silverlight 2).

entries.title: Executive Zombie
entries.description:
Hello Mr. Executive Zombraaaaaaaaiiiiiiiinnnnnnnnsssss..... *drools*

Executive zombie is a goofy little RTS where YOU are the Executive of Big Brain Corp.

Sadly... times have gotten rough, and you need to re-purpose the interns. Collect their brains, build your work force, and help drone the day one neuron at a time.

entries.title: Happily Ever After
entries.description:
This is a pretty slow game (especially later), and more story focused (if you can call it a story). 
It's definately not for everyone, but maybe you'd like to take a break from all the 'action-y' games and listen to a story.
I hope you enjoy it, and I apologize for any bugs! (I can't reupload a fixed version right? D:)

entries.title: Hide 'n' Seek
entries.description: This game is to kill everyone that there is (except yourself of course). To kill press space and to climb ladders and hide press W or S. To move press A or D. You can change number of "enemies",floors, width, hide places in the option. Hide bodies inside closets by pressing up. Was hopping to get more done but I've actually learnt a lot from this. Thanks Ludum Dare for this competition. Hope you like my game. This is also my first entry FYI.

entries.title: Lucky Luddite
entries.description: In 1811 Ned Ludd was on his way to destroy some machines when a time portal appeared...

entries.title: Namcap: Reverse Pacman
entries.description:
"It's a simple plan. We kill the pac-man."

The roles are reversed! In this game, you are the bad guy, controlling the ghosts in the game of Pacman. Which side is harder to play with?

Use the directional keys or ASDW to control the ghosts. Press 1-4 to change which ghost you control. Don't let Pacman eat all pellets!


Please let me know your high score when you comment!


KNOWN ISSUES:

* Many commenters complained about ghost selection (hard to know which ghost corresponds to which key). Post-compo version will feature a better ghost selection scheme inspired in the suggestions. Thank you!
* Pacman's AI is dumb. It will get stuck sometimes when it can't find a path to its desired coin. It completely ignores pellets. Still, it should give you a nice challenge.
* I had no time to implement increasing difficulty. So the game does NOT get more difficult as you kill Pacman.
* Someone reported a crash when pathfinding. I was not able to reproduce it.


CREDITS:
* Software: Java with Slick2d, programmed with Eclipse
* Graphics: Inkscape and The GIMP
* Fonts: "Joystix" font from the "Game Font Database": http://www.thealmightyguru.com/GameFonts/Series-Retro.html
* Sounds: Bfxr
* Music: Autotracker (I wanted to use darwin tunes, but couldn't get my computer to listen to it)

entries.title: Necrusio and his Machine
entries.description: Macabre shooter made for the Ludum Dare 25 compo. Kill cops just to kidnap civilians and torture them in your machine. You need the blood of innocent people. SOURCE CODE INCLUDED ON THE WINDOWS ARCHIVE

entries.title: Oh noes! The goverment!(placeglder)
entries.description: Oh noes! The goverment found your enemy base! Defend yourself from the goverment by upgrading turrets.

entries.title: Robbert
entries.description:
Our first LD entry, and first release to the world! :)

Your name is Robbert - and your goal is to rob the bank that is the building across the alley from your apartment, in a puzzle-adventure style with multiple stages. 

Only halfway finished, this is more of a buggy demo than anything. Original plan was for more stages and lots of other cool stuff. Some things are rushed, and there are quite some bugs.

If you're having trouble with the item combination; First pick up the items in the rooms using spacebar, then click the items in the inventory to select them, all 5 items must be clicked in a certain order. Hint: The glock comes first, and the bullet comes last.

Once you've built the final item, you can press space to use it at a certain location on the rooftop.

If you make it to the second stage, you will have trouble walking into horizontal path ways as well - we apologize, we were not able to fix this in time, but are planning to fix it for the post-jam version.

Music is currently bugged and only plays once as well. :(

We didn't get around to adding sound effects.

Full version was planned to have 6 stages with different mechanics and puzzles to solve, and that is what we will do if we keep working on it past this jam as planned. Look forward to it!


Known Bugs/Issues:

-Music doesn't loop correctly.
-Squeezing through doorways and corridors can be quite difficult. Hitting corners sometimes causes you to glitch out as well.
-Some objects can be walked underneath.
-Rats don't animate properly and will stay still when they're near the player.
-Didn't manage to put sound effects in. :(
-Text doesn't display quite properly.

entries.title: Shining Farce
entries.description:
A VERY basic roguelike.
Didn't have time for sound or music and it's light on content too but I think it'll have life beyond the compo to allow me to add in some of the more adventurous/exciting ideas that didn't make it.
The most glaring (technical) issue I know of is the lack of line of sight blocking ranged attacks.
I'd also planned to have a much more interesting level/dungeon but alas time was against me.

entries.title: TEK45
entries.description: UNFINSHED! source code and executable included.

entries.title: Test Subject Gamma
entries.description:
I missed the memo about goats, but there is a goat in the Gynasium if that's how you like to work out.

>> Your time as a Villain has come
>> Make Money
>> Kill People
>> Begin Researching Project Gamma

Enjoy!

entries.title: The Filthy Coward
entries.description:
The about a filthy coward guy in the street. Hey try to bother people by his vulgar behavior. We can see all that from street security screen;

You can control the player (arrows or WSAD ), you can use both (Z and X ) to make your actions. Bother lots of people & fill your rude counter as fast as possible before cops catch you.

Enjoy 10 levels getting harder and full of excitement and funny situations;

To be able to finish the game before time, i didn't implement the achievement system which i started working on . It is pretty funny ho have an achievement called "The Golden Asshole" or "Master of Psycho" :)

Sound track by : DanJRio, from the blog :
free-soundtrack.blogspot.com/

If you like the game you can enjoy all my games, currently i publish new free game each 10 days in my site here :
http://10daysgame.wordpress.com/

entries.title: The Thief
entries.description:
You are a thief who is running from the cops to the escape vehicle. But your buddy will only take you along if you bring enough money. You can pick up Donuts and throw them at the cop to slow him down.
The more you carry the slower you are able to run!


Note:
- Volume Warning - Sounds are not normalized
- [M] turns of the Music.
- Controls are in [About] (in-game) or on the Webpage

Controls: 
Movement: WASD or Arrow Keys
Steal: CTRL
Throw Donuts: ENTER

entries.title: Tower Attack
entries.description:
Tower Attack is a reverse Tower Defense game. You are the villain attacking the Tower, or at least trying to make it through. 

 You spend money buying creatures and earn money by every step they take. 
The more time that goes by the quicker and more powerful the guns become.

entries.title: Villain Tower Defender
entries.description:
Villain Tower Defender is a simple game of protect the tower, however you are not protecting it from being destroyed. Oh no your protecting it from the Heroes who want to come and repair it! Armed with your bullet firing, bomb dropping helicopter you set out to defend the havoc you have caused! 

Hire two different types of "henchmen" to help you in your goal to last as many waves as possible, both types have different weapons and different health levels.

With online highscores you can easily play with your friends online, this game was made in just 24hours for Ludum Dare 25.

Online ScoreBoard: http://gmscoreboard.com/villaintowerdefender
Help image: http://eliteware.co.uk/LD25/screen_8.png

entries.title: We Meet Again, Mr. Mond!
entries.description:
Final scene. The Good Guy gets in your secret lair, but your henchmen catch and beat him up! His gun lies on the floor and he's weak, so it's your moment of glory! Explain him your evil plans!

But take care: we all know that the Good Guy will try to sneak on you. Keep an eye on him! 

Complete your speech, build drama! Then throw him into a bottomless pit. 

---

Quite a weird idea I came up with for this Ludum Dare, and more a prototype than a game. No sounds, no decent art, and almost no game, here. Just some silly version of a game I used to play as a kid, some kind of variation of Hide&Seek. For some reason, it made sense when thinking about it :D

entries.title: Purple Fingers
entries.description: Special thanks to Fabio Picchi (<3), Lucas Senna (happy birthday!) and Pedro Camara (my cellmate, also, see his entry: http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-25/?action=preview&uid=11981).

entries.title: Renegade Theologian
entries.description:
"Renegade Theologian"
 Collect (steal!) the 8 books.  Avoid the guardian angel.  Look to the sky.

Best played full screen in a dim environment with speakers or headphones.

Completed solo in 48hours using Unity 4, Blender, Photoshop, Ableton Live and a Piano.  However I just realised I can not submit to the 48 owing to a piece of code I am not permitted to redistribute.   Maybe next time.  Was a great learning experience!

OSX tested on Snow Leopard 10.6.8.
Windows tested on Windows 7 64bit.
Web tested on OSX & win7 chrome Unity Player.

entries.title: The Devil's Handiwork
entries.description:
When God creates a perfect world and decides it needs a little more evil, who does he call? Play in your HTML5-capable browser. Controls are given on the page, but basically use your mouse + arrows to scroll.

Chrome performs better for me than Firefox. If you're having any trouble, please switch, okay?

If it still crashes or takes a long time to load a level, you can try the "no zoom" version above (you can still zoom out but not in), which will cut back significantly on the memory consumption and load time.

entries.title: Thievery
entries.description:
Kane the thief needs your help to relieve dozens of innocent and unsuspecting victims of their hard-earned cash.

He's up against some stiff competition, with an array of armoured guards on patrol - and those guards aren't against a bit of good old-fashioned biffo.  They've even brought in their pet dogs for assistance.

Use daggers sparingly - Kane can't carry many, and throwing them at guards tends to make them cross.

You can loot houses when near the door, or pick the pockets of guards who haven't spotted you yet.
----------------------------------------------------------
* Fixed versions *

Some people have had problems running the game because of it not finding the AVBin library, though it's packaged alongside the executable.  I've built a "fixed" version, which hopefully might improve things, though I can't be sure as I couldn't reproduce the original problem on any of the three machines I tried.  This version should at least allow you to run it without sound if the problem comes up.  I also tweaked a couple of numbers to fix some tiny mistakes, but it's virtually identical to the submitted version.
----------------------------------------------------------
I'm pretty happy with the way this turned out.  There were very few roadblocks, so every spare hour went into more features - and there was plenty more I could do there.  I did manage to get a goat in, after a fashion, for those of you who get that far.  Some things could've used a bit more tuning - e.g. one guard gets stuck on his path, and maybe the alert distance should've been a little higher - but overall I think it's a pretty good result.  I'm not utterly destroyed after the 48 hours, thanks to a few breaks here and there, which helps too :)

Thanks as always to Greasemonkey for Autotracker and Increpare for Bfxr.  A bit of simple sound can go a long way.

To run the 'source' version, you'll need to have Python and Pyglet installed.  If you're on Windows or Linux, hopefully the builds will work for you without hassle.

Also, by the way, I forgot to write on the control list that 'P' pauses the game.

Hope you enjoy having a mess around with it :)

entries.title: Train Villain
entries.description:
It's Pipe Dream but with train tracks and goats.  You are the villain, so you want to hit all the goats before crashing the train.

It is a playable prototype, but I did not allocate enough time this weekend.  I would have liked to:

-animate the train sprite properly
-add sounds
-have a "win" condition to advance to next level (and increase difficulty)

Thanks for checking it out!  Leave a comment, and I'll play your entry if I can on my Mac!

entries.title: Vivi, the Greatest Villain
entries.description:
This is the first game I ever made and this is my first Ludum Dare! I'm really excited I did it.

Unfortunately, I did not get to implement some basic stuff, such as music, combat, dialogs, and story stuff, since I wasted time polishing graphics and code, when I didn't really have to. I also spent quite some time trying to make things work. I was really down when it occurred to me that I wont be able to create music for this game, since it's mostly a puzzle game/ exploration game.

Nevertheless, his has been a great learning experience for me, and i'm really looking forward to future Ludum Dare competitions!

About the game:
You play as "Vivi" (character inspired by Final Fantasy 9).
You have 3 Objectives, which are really simple to get done, due to the lack of combat/death.

Keys:
WASD to move.
E to pick up an item.
Q to drop an item.

That's all I guess, would love some feedback on your experience playing the game.
Keep in mind this is my first game ever made!
Thanks for playing! <3
